title: Amazing Hotel!
text: Beautiful hotel and amazing customer service at the front desk. Maria was especially helpful with getting us situated for an early check-in after my parents flew in on a red-eye and were exhausted. Thank you for a great time. We will definitely be coming back.

title: The Hotel Belleclaire, a diamond in NYC!
text:
My wife and I flew to NYC for a family visit. We travel there at least twice a year. This particular vacation was fraught with disasterous airline/FAA controllers issues. We were trapped in NYC for an extra week because of the enormous amounts of cancelled flights. We booked the Belleclaire for our forced extended stay due to our familiarity with the hotel (we have stayed there before). 
Let me first tell you that we have always enjoyed our stay at this hotel. But, it was quite conforting to know that even though we were stuck in NYC for an extra week, we would be well taken care of by the hotel and staff. The staff, all of them, from management to the regular employees are wonderful.
They are responsive to requests, they help you with transportation and things to do and see.
We also couldnt ask for a cleaner hotel. They really take pride in their appearance and it shows. I mean, come on, this is NYC, the land of tourism! You would think that with that much foot trafffic coming and going, the place would be kind of run down, worn out. I assure you that it is not.
An additionak benefit is the most lovely french cafe in the lobby, yes it does get quite busy, but people like good things so the crowds can grow for the cafe alait and pastries.
The location of the hotel on the upper west side is perfect. When in NYC you tend to walk a lot! This hotel is centrally situated and is walkable to most spots you would want to visit. The subway system is still decent in NYC and this hotel is close to the subway lines. The added benefit for us, is the location to Columbus Ave, Broadway and Amsterdam Ave. Theses streets on the UWS contain so many restaurants and bodegas that you will be able to eat, whatever tye of food you want, whenever you want.
So a quick recap. This is our favorite hotel in NYC! I reccomend staying here any time you travel to th 'Big Apple'.
Kudos to the Belleclaire for this gem of a place. Go, you'll be gad you did.

title: Wonderful experience!
text: Absolutely wonderful experience. Rooms were very clean. The staff were the nicest I've ever experienced.  We got there hours before check in and they found a room for us.  Much appreciated after a long travel day. The bakery on site was perfect to get us going in the morning. The Chai latte was scrumptious and what a wonderful variety of pastries. We were walking distance from central park , the subway, and tons of restaurants, catering to all budgets. The area felt very safe and vibrant. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Best welcome and home feeling ever in NYC
text: Amazing service from first welcome.  Shanies and Veronica gave the biggest smile and heartfelt welcome to NY I have ever heard.  Also gift of wine bottle and macarons made me feel I am back home.  Then trying to find me best room possible, and they did.  Overseeing beautiful Broadway Ave, lush green in May.  An unmatched experience.

title: Re-visit for many reasons!
text: This is a great hotel in a great location on Broadway with quick access to the 1 subway line.  Friendly helpful staff (shout out to the front desk staff Shanies, Veronica, and Angel) who provided early check-in.  Great outside corner room with 4 windows!  Looking forward to on site bakery and coffee like last trip.

title: Great Front Desk Service
text:
The front desk was amazingly hospitable! Shanies, JV, and Veronica worked diligently to accommodate me and my wife! They are extremely polite, attentive, and as professional as they can come. They are are true Asset to the company!
The professionalism cleanliness, location makes it a desirable place to stay!
Would definitely stay again!

title: Hotel Bellclaire
text: Very clean rooms, polite and helpful staff (especially Maria at the front desk) Vouchers up to $10 for each night you stay that you can use for food, and beverages at the cafe in the hotel, amazing location on the UWS. Highly recommend staying here!

title: Great
text: It is always my choice in NYC, the super location and wonderful French bakery are the most. The hotel was renovated by keeping the charm and minimalism. The staff has been more and more friendly in each new visit. The Allure bar/restaurant has brought a good vibe for the evenings. Congrats the entire team

title: Will stay here again
text: I really enjoy this place. Small clean rooms, great location, friendly staff (shout out to Maria and Christian at the front desk).  Fitness center is nice and on the second floor facing the neighborhood. Close to the Sunway and easy walk to Central Park or Lincoln Center.

title: NY-Woche mit charmanter Homebase
text: Das Belleclaire war unser charmanter Ruheort in NY. Danke Shanies, Maria Argel und Sare („the bellman“) vom insgesamt supernetten Hotelteam für alle guten Tipps! Und spezieller Dank dem Bäckereiteam fürs leckere Frühstück! Gutes Hotelfrühstück in NY gibt es also ;-)

title: Good overall
text:
I stayed here for 6 nights in early May 2024 at a total cost of $2300 B&B. 
The quiet location of the hotel, and access to the subway and buses, are very good, and overall it is less over-priced than other hotels of its class. I had a relatively spacious Delux King room, although the bathroom was tiny without any surfaces on which to store anything. Good quality bed and linen. Small closet without shelving or draws. Decent lighting. Paper thin walls  allowed one to hear everything from plumbing to babies in neighboring rooms.  Front desk service decent, but housekeeping erratic (on one occasion it took 3 requests before an extra bath towel was provided). Breakfasts at adjoining Mille Fuille bakery not bad,. but long lines, and after 6 days got a bit repetitive.  Lobby and restaurant become a nightclub on weekends, but this did not disturb me on the 7th floor.
All in all, a good experience but definitely room for improvement as regards service consistency.

title: Spring visit to the city
text: Lovely hotel - hard to find many on the Upper West Side.  We had a wonderful bellhop and the front desk personnel were very helpful and friendly.  Buses are pretty much right outside on Broadway or Amsterdam and subway entrance is close as well.  Food at the lobby bakery was delicious!

title: ease and comfort
text: Members of the staff at the Belleclaire, especially Shanies, Maria, and Benedict, are welcoming, attentive, helpful, and efficient.  The rooms are comfortable and super clean, and the value of breakfast coupons at Mille Feuille Bakery makes for an easy pleasant morning.  My husband and I have stayed at the Belleclaire since 2017, making yearly visits.

title: Una grata sorpresa en el Upper West
text: El Belleclaire fue una grata sorpresa en NYC. La ubicación me permitió descubrir una ciudad diferente, más tranquila y sofisticada, e incluso mejor comunicada que otras con el midtown. El edificio es histórico, pero sus instalaciones son completamente nuevas, bien decoradas, funcionales, amplias y con excelentes servicios. La cama y el baño perfectos. La atención del front desk, con una especial mención a María, cálida y eficiente. El estilo del desayuno take away o take into the room, me pareció novedoso y su calidad excelente. En fin, un hotel de esos para hacer base en NYC por bastante tiempo.

title: Cozy and charming place!
text: Great hotel, well located, very close to Metro station. Very clean and comfortable room. Maria was a great host! We will be back!

title: A fantastic experience on uws
text: Its a fantastic old school hotel on uws who prefer to stay in fantastic vintage hotels.Both Maris and the bellman were extremely helpful and made the exoerience smooth and wonderful.I cannot wait to be back!All the fabulous restaurants are around

title: Spacious & Gracious NYC Accommodations
text:
I had 6 of my book club ladies with me for a fun weekend in the city.  I previously lived in NYC but never had stayed or been inside Hotel Belleclaire.  The options for larger rooms were impressive.  I booked 2 adjoining rooms that had two queens and a king as well as the King Parlor Suite that had a king and a pull out queen.   The beds, linens & pillows were lovely.  The bathroom was spacious, clean & had beautiful tile.  The size of the rooms was ridiculously large for NYC.  The parlor inside our King Parlor Suite had seating for 7!  Having been a wedding planner in NYC, I've been inside most of the hotels in the city and I was extremely impressed with this one.  

The staff was warm, inviting & super accommodating.  The voucher system for breakfast was super simple and the beverages, pastries & other food were delicious.  It felt like a gourmet treat- not a low quality continental breakfast.  

I'll definitely be back!

title: Great stay at the Belleclaire
text: The second time I have brought a large group to the hotel in the last two months. It's always a great stay with exceptional customer service led by Shanies and frankly the entire team. Any question we had was dealt with immediately. The rooms are clean, new, and comfortable. The location is unbeatable. All in all an great experience. We will be coming back again.

title: An absolutely lovely vintage building, beautifully renovated – wonderful staff and amenities
text:
Hotel Belleclare is an altogether lovely vintage building, beautifully renovated and situated in a fantastic residential Upper West side neighborhood with plenty of restaurants, shops and grocery stores. It is conveniently near the number 1 subway on 79th street and the neighborhood is quite walkable.

At first I was seriously considering nearby hotels that seemed to offer a better value price-wise, but decided to splurge a bit and my friend and I are glad we did – we enjoyed our stay very much.

Because this stay was a bit of a splurge I'll be looking for values in the future and booking here again will be based on current prices (post-pandemic sticker shock!)

Hotel Belleclaire is part of a collection of Triumph hotels, of which there are five - there are walking tours and wine hours offered every day at one of the hotels. It's very nice that guests at one hotel are welcome to join a wine hour (5-6pm) or morning (10am) walking tour at another of the hotel locations if not staying on a day when the wine hour or tour is offered at the hotel where booked.

Everyone we encountered at Hotel Belleclaire was flawlessly professional and helpful. I'd also like to mention that I was a bit confused at some of the fees listed online (NYC and NY state really load on the 'resort' and other fees!) - but when I called the hotel desk Josh was quite kind and helpful in explaining the price structure to me and this really helped to influence my choice to book with Hotel Belleclaire, because there were no hidden fees at least.

The room was altogether lovely. My friend and I enjoyed the very comfortable double beds, Frette bedding and C.O. Bigelow toiletries. Blackout shades were really appreciated in the morning.

It was nice to have bottled water waiting in the room on arrival.
The CVS across the street was handy in getting additional drinking water - however, it would have been fantastic to have additional water available right in the hotel throughout our stay.

The only issue was that the room was not as well sound-proofed as it could have been.
I was awoken a bit after midnight after turning in around 11pm by voices in a nearby room. It seemed to be a calm conversation but it was loud enough to disturb my sleep.  I cut the sound down a bit by closing our room's bathroom door. 

On returning to the room after breakfast someone in the room on the other side was participating in an online meeting and we could hear every word. This wasn't an issue because we were ready to check out, however if we ourselves needed to join a zoom meeting we would have needed to use headphones.

I understand that soundproofing can't always be perfect in city hotels - I'm just mentioning our experience so others may know it may be helpful to bring earplugs for a sound night's sleep - I certainly will next time! 

Mille-feuille Bakery Café is certainly an important asset to Hotel Belleclaire! Not many hotels offer breakfast in NYC and this is an outstanding bakery in the Parisian tradition. Each guest receives a voucher for $10 at the bakery or the Allure restaurant for brunch or lunch - which we didn't try. 
The bakery staff were very warm and welcoming - and although my heart sank a bit when I saw how long the line of other hotel guests was - snaking down the hotel hobby - the line moved efficiently enough along.

Seating was plentiful if the seats in the hotel lobby were taken in to account - but we very much enjoyed being able to have breakfast at the tables outside and felt a part of the lively streetscape on Broadway!

Most important -  I'm vegan and I was able to find something for breakfast - the whole grain loaf was truly fantastic, and I really appreciated that oatmilk and almond milk were options.  I am used to traveling with my own snacks because vegan options are often unavailable - so I rounded out my breakfast with almonds - however it would be absolutely fantastic if a vegan yogurt or assortment of nuts or almond or peanut butter were also available as a source of vegan protein.

(I understand that traditionally French bakeries are not vegan - however, friends in Paris tell me more and more French eateries are providing vegan options - so why not follow this trend...?)

Check-out was smooth and there were no surprises - the hotel lists all additional fees to the room rate clearly on their website. A small complaint -  I peeked into the fitness center - it's a small room with weights and a Pelotan - if it is possible to partner with an area fitness club or yoga studio that would be another enticement to stay again! I'm a fitness swimmer and  yoga enthusiast and being able to try a new studio or pool - even with a small additional fee – would have been nice.

title: Very good hotel if a bit spartan.
text: We stayed in the hotel on a recent trip to visit family. It has a great location on the upper west side and close to transportation. It is a more residential area full of restaurants and shops that the locals frequent. The hotel is extremely spartan in appointments. I thought it was almost monastic in a sense with one dark painting on the wall and hard floors. The first king room I was in only had a desk chair to sit in with an out of the way window. I asked for a better room and, though larger, was still very spartan. The breakfast is a voucher for the excellent pastry shop off the lobby. I want to give special thanks to Benedict and Veronica at the front desk who were incredibly helpful.

title: A hotel you’ll want to return to
text:
The staff at this hotel was amazing. We had a maintenance issue in our room as well as some confusion as to our dates. ( our fault because flight was cancelled and we needed to add another day to an existing reservation). 
MARIA did not hesitate to change us to another room for the entire stay and she arranged to have everything moved for us from one room to another.

We also had several requests for items that we had forgotten but needed, and again the service was amazing. The desk clerks were all very friendly and accommodating and very manmerly. It’s been a long time since we’ve had such a friendly staff, and it was quite refreshing.

The room was clean and spacious, especially for New York City.   

The location was wonderful. Public transportation is within a block. And it was easy to navigate any place in the city from this address. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Everything was to our liking.

title: Belle Claire - tres bien!
text:
Staff, in particular Iga (housekeeper) and Angel (front desk) were great.
Room was neat and clean. Iron was provided on request. One suggestion is more bottled water per room, but very nice place.

title: Great location, staff and amenities
text:
One of my favorite hotels. Great location, helpful staff (Maria, Sherry and bellmen), dog friendly and very clean. 

The partnership with three bakery Mille Feuille is a great addition and the bar/restaurant Allure in the lobby is a great new addition.

Will definitely return.

title: Very welcoming and cute hotel for a NYC visit!
text: I highly recommend this hotel in NYC West Side! The hotel is in a great location close to Lincoln Center, Central Park, Natural History Museum, Planetarium, restaurants, two subway lines, buses , taxis ! Small in size but big in friendliness, cleanliness, safety and value! Rooms are immaculate and well appointed . Hallways are decorated in a very soothing blue paint/ wallpaper combination. Two vouchers for coffee and brunch. Attentive , professional staff and as a solo traveler i felt very safe walking to the hotel late after a night at the opera. Finally, you can't beat the price!!!

title: C’est magnifique!
text: A beautiful hotel with great customer service (shout out to Maria and Shani) plus delicious French pastries for breakfast!

title: EXCELENTE UBICACIÓN, SERVICIO Y ATENCIÓN
text:
El propósito de mi viaje era asistir a una función de ópera, un concierto y al MoMA. Todo perfecto. 15 minutos caminando al Metropolitan Ópera House y al Lincoln Center.  A sólo 25 minutos del MoMA.
Excelente atención a la llegada (casi media noche) y a la salida ( dos AM). 
Solicité el servicio de transportación del hotel al aeropuerto y 
fue excelente.( sobre todo el precio por la hora). 
Las habitaciones muy limpias y cómodas. Los baños impecables. ¿Qué más se puede pedir?
Los vouchers para la cafetería que está abajo del hotel fueron de muchísima utilidad. Muy buen café y excelente panadería. También me sirvió ese voucher para el restaurante. Buen ambiente en ese restaurante, aunque sólo disfruté de una rica hamburguesa y una buena copa de vino.
Se viene la próxima temporada de ópera. Con gusto me hospedaría nuevamente en este hotel si encuentro una buena promoción como la que encontré a través de Travelzoo.

title: Upper West Side Hotel Gem!
text: Always such a great time at the Hotel Belleclaire! Staff is extremely welcoming and friendly every time we go. Maria at the front desk always greets us with a smile and goes over and beyond to make sure our stay is perfect. We will continue to make this hotel our home away from home whenever we are in NYC!

title: A NYC gem with excellent staff
text: The front desk staff were exceptional, especially Shanies, who even had to deal with my misplacing my key on the way up to my room. The room is well appointed, like the two water bottles, and some of my favorite toiletries. You really can't beat the location - outside of the bustle of Times Square but only a few subway stops away. Love the breakfast vouchers provided, and the hotel is steps away from some wonderful restaurant options.

title: Fav hotel of Upper West Side
text: LOVE this hotel! Perfect location, clean rooms and wonderful staff! And the French bakery, Mille Feuille, is worth the trip! Can't imagine any other hotel being better.

title: It’s the people that make a place
text: Wow, the service was impeccable! My concierge Ronin was so quick, warm and funny — he is a true professional! I’ve been  to other hotels nearby but it’s the staff who are the cherry on top of my experience. When I was checking out, I asked him to call me a cab to the airport and he made even the wait feel like a breeze, as he recommended some local restaurants to try the next time I’m in town. I was super impressed.

title: The hotel is nice and cozy. However, was charged additionally for items we thought were included in our price.
text: We loved the location and the staff. However, got charged steeply for bottle water in the room that we thought it was complimentary and breakfast which we received a voucher for. No place to seat to have breakfast and a long line to get coffee.

title: Felt right at home
text: Shanies and Wallace were outstanding off the bat! Felt welcome and cared for. Inside, cosy rooms, everything you need and nothing you don’t. A+

title: Five stars — highly recommend
text: Great room and terrific location — room was clean, spacious, and we experienced excellent customer service, especially Shanies at the front desk! We highly recommend and will return. Walking distance to public transportation, restaurants, and entertainment.

title: Wonderful hotel. Pristine albeit tiny room, friendly and efficient staff. Highly recommend!
text: My 4 day stay at  Hotel Belleclaire was hands down the BEST hotel experience I have ever had! The room, although tiny, was spotless. No rugs, wooden floor, comfortable king size bed, excellent front desk staff. Special kudos to Shanies, Veronica, Benedict and Wallace. Thanks to Housekeeping staff member Betty for her work. AND, a special perk: the hotel provides vouchers for no cost purchase of delicious bread, sandwiches and pastries from the French bakery next door. An all around terrific experience!

title: A wonderful hotel on the UWS!
text: We just returned from an absolutely wonderful stay at the Hotel Belleclaire.  We visit NYC somewhat regularly and have stayed at several other properties on the UWS and all have been fine.  However, Hotel Belleclaire will be our go-to hotel from now on for so many reasons.  The convenient-to-everything location, beautiful rooms, comfortable beds, lovely decor, and delicious French bakery off the lobby make it a special place to stay.  But the exceptional customer service is why I am writing this review.  It is rare to stay in a place, especially in a big city, where every single person working at the hotel is friendly, warm, welcoming, and making sure your stay is comfortable and enjoyable.  We encountered that at Hotel Belleclaire starting with a welcome from the manager as we checked in.  I also want to give a specific shout-out to Shanies at the front desk who went above and beyond for our family to ensure that we were comfortable and happy with our accommodation.   With Shanies's help, we upgraded our room and ended up in a jaw-droppingly beautiful, spacious suite.  She wanted our family to enjoy our stay and we loved the suite so much we had a hard time leaving!   Thank you to Shanies and everyone at Hotel Belleclaire for an unforgettable stay.  We will certainly be back!

title: The Best!
text: The of the best expletives I have had. Highly recommend!!! Great location, great service, fantastic atmosphere and vibe! From start to finish the staff was very friendly and attentive. The gave great recommendations for things to do in the area, which is exactly what I needed. The hotel Restuarant Allure was fabulous a well.

title: Great trip, great staff!! ❤️❤️
text: My recent stay at BelleClaire hotel was nothing short of exceptional, thanks in large part to the amazing service provided by Shanies and Angel at the front desk. From the moment I arrived, they greeted me with warmth and professionalism, making me feel instantly welcome.

title: Excellent service
text: Maria at the front desk was wonderful and extremely helpful. We were greeted right away in a warm manner. 5-star service. She helped us navigate an early arrival, offered to store our bags and pointed us to local places to go. Maria is a true asset to the Belleclaire. First impressions have been fabulous.

title: Lovely stay
text: We stayed for eight nights and had a terrific time.  Room was beautiful, quiet and very comfortable.  Shanies quickly resolved a problem for us which made all the difference in our stay.  We also enjoyed the restaurant a couple of nights after busy days with family. We’ll be back!

title: Best hotel in the Upper West Side
text: I come to New York every week and always stay at the Hotel Belleclaire. I love this place. The location is great, the rooms are modern and clean, the breakfast is yummy, and the price is right. Shoutout to Benedict at the front desk for always giving me a warm welcome!

title: A trip to remember
text: My stay at BelleClaire hotel was exceptional thanks to Angel from guest relations and Benedict at the front desk. Her warm welcome and attention to detail made me feel valued from the start. The hotel itself is elegant, with spacious rooms and a prime location. I highly recommend BelleClaire to anyone seeking a luxurious stay in the city. One of the best locations by far!

title: Things I loved about the Hotel Belleclaire.
text:
Things I loved about the Hotel Belleclaire:

- The location, which sits at the perfect spot on the UWS, right off of Broadway just blocks from Zabar’s and the 1/2 trains.
- Chanies at the front desk who makes every transaction at the front desk positive and efficient.
- The croissants at Mille Feuille, the bakery and coffee shop right off the lobby.
- The fitness room, which is always clean and well-equipped.
- The housekeeping staff, who were kind and helpful.
- The bedding, soft and comfy.
- Getting a taxi, which was easy because one was almost always waiting in front.
- The restaurants and grocery stores nearby, such as Jacob’s Pickles, Serafina, and Citarella.

title: Great hotel!
text: I recently stayed at BelleClaire hotel and had a fantastic experience. The staff, including Angel, Veronica, and Joelle, were incredibly friendly and helpful throughout my stay. The hotel itself was beautiful, with comfortable rooms and great amenities. I would highly recommend BelleClaire to anyone looking for a wonderful stay in the city.

title: Easy peasy check in
text: After a long day of travel, had a WONDERFUL check-in experience with Benedict and Victoria. Only just arrived and already happy as a clam to be here.

title: Best Upper West Side Hotel with Tons of Charm
text: The Belleclaire is the perfect Upper West Side Hotel. The front desk staff from Veronica, Benedict and Shanies to the bell staff and housekeeping were welcoming, professional, friendly and fun! We loved the fitness center and cafe. We were within walking distance of everything. Thank you for a memorable experience. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect!
text: From the moment we arrived at BelleClaire, we knew we were in for a treat. The hotel's luxurious ambiance and impeccable service exceeded our expectations. Angel, the concierge, was an absolute gem, providing personalized recommendations and ensuring our stay was nothing short of extraordinary. Their attention to detail and genuine care truly made our experience memorable. We can't wait to return and indulge in BelleClaire's exceptional hospitality once again. Thank you, Angel, for making our stay unforgettable!

title: room with a better view!
text: lovely room but there was no view at all, literally a brick wall. on second day I asked at reception whether it would be possible to get a different room and Maria was managed to arrange it there and then. what a difference a view makes - it made our holiday in many ways. many thanks Maria

title: Excellent clean three star hotel. Great location
text:
So this is a three star hotel.  But it is a darn good three star hotel.  The rooms are NY small, and there’s no closet, but these things were also true:
* plenty of hot water
*nice towels
* firm bed
* foam pillows (I hate down)
*ventilation system was good - we could cool the room pretty quickly and there were no odors.
* there is an overhead light and the room was actually pretty brightly lit (rare in a hotel room).
* staff was friendly
* lobby is small, but pleasant.
* location is great.

We would definitely stay here again.

title: Highly recommend this chic yet comfortable hotel.
text: Love, love this boutique hotel. It is chic, clean, and comfortable and the service is fantastic. We felt very welcomed by staff; they were professional, considerate hosts (kudos to Maria and team!). The French bakery next door was a perfect coffee spot in the morning. Great location, too. Highly recommend.

title: Wonderful stay
text: A beginning of a wonderful stay in this heritage hotel. Conveniently located, close to Central Park and Metro, a great bakery and supported through excellent customer service.  A shout out to Veronica and Benedict who manage the front desk. Grateful for a seamless check-in.

title: Historic charm plus all modern comforts
text: Our favorite hotel in Manhattan!  We come many times a year for the opera season at The Met.  The Belleclaire is the ideal location for us--Upper West Side, steps to bus, close to subway, walking distance to excellent and diverse restaurants.  The hotel has historic charm plus all modern comforts.  The secret ingredient to a delightful visit every time is the staff.  Maria at the front desk has deep knowledge of the hotel and helps us find a room location that suits us perfectly.  Shaneis is another welcoming and helpful presence at the desk, along with Christian.

title: Good hotel in an excellent location
text: This is a very good hotel with excellent location. The staff was kind and helpful all the time, The room was spacious enough and clean. Even though I was super tired from almost 20 hours travel and overseas flight I has an excellent and restful sleep. It is conveniently distanced from metro station(s) and walking distance from some landmark locations.

title: Home away from home
text: I have stayed here every other weekend for 2 years. Best hotel on the UWS. Great new renovations. Staff is great, and the bakery next door is a nice touch!

title: Lovely stay at the Hotel Belleclaire!
text: We visited the upper West Side and found the Hotel Belleclaire a perfect base for exploration of the area. Our room was clean and quiet and close to a lot of good restaurants and a short walk away from Central Park and the American Museum of Natural History. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: Beautiful and charming
text:
Elegant simple delight.  The hotel staff was engaging with a sincere desire to please.  I loved the added bonus of a pastry  coffee shop attached to the hotel.  The hotel restaurant equally pleasant. 
Finally the location is wonderful.   Two blocks from central park.  Neighborhood is tree lined, flowers bloom in the middle of broadway and the architecture is old world guilted age mansions.

title: Nice stay, friendly staff
text: We had a great stay. The hotel has a historical charm and is clean and modernized. We stayed in a room with two queen beds and a view of Broadway. The room was comfortable, clean, and had everything we needed. The staff were great - Maria was especially helpful and welcoming.

title: Lovely location but noisy
text: The hotel is in a nice neighbourhood on the Upper West Side. The room was functional but rather on the small side. My room had a connecting door and I could hear every word in the other room which is far from ideal. Staff at reception is mixed - some are amazing whereas others could do with some training in terms of the advice they provide. There is a 'facilities fee' of about $30 per night. The fee is used to cover the breakfast. Breakfast is served in the small cafe in the hotel. People get a voucher of 2x$10 per night to redeem. There are not many seating options there, so people seem to take the breakfast to their room or eat in the restaurant/lobby space. Lines can be long. The facilities fee is also used to cover internet but one day the internet was down which is highly problematic if you are there on business. The facilities fee is simply an additional fee on top of your room rate but I struggled to see the benefit. Room rates can be reasonable but for what I paid I am likely to look for alternatives next time.

title: Great location and staff
text: Hotel was well run, clean, and the staff professional and friendly.  Maria at the front was efficient and kind. Millefeille had wonderful French pastries, yogurts and coffee. The service was friendly even under pressure with long lines. Everyone in NY seems to love Millefeuille Cafe! Hotel location is perfect on the upper West Side for restaurants, shopping and the park. Overall, I highly recommend the hotel and cafe.

title: Wahou!
text:
Amazing travel! And perfect hotel. We were very happy to stay at Hotel Belleclaire. Warm welcoming And very Good location.
We were 6, big family ;) And the room was well adapted for us. 
Special thanks to Joele And her beautiful smile! Se you soon!

title: Don't Pass it Up!
text: I live in NJ and had a rehearsal uptown Broadway.   This hotel was recommended by the director.  It is in a nice location and safety being alone, and a senior, was my concern. However, I felt safe.  Room was comfortable and clean.  Employees were helpful and very polite.  TV not easy to maneuver but whenever necessary, I will not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

title: Bien sauf le petit déjeuner
text: Hôtel très bien placé, calme, chambres correctes. À ce niveau de prix, il manque au moins un micro-ondes, un réfrigérateur et de l’eau dans la chambre. Les petits déjeuners se prennent avec un bon de 10  $, dans une boulangerie à côté, cela correspond à café et une viennoiserie et c’est tout. C’est compliqué de s’asseoir dans la boulangerie, donc vous allez soit dans une petite salle près de la réception soit dans la chambre. Il y a tous les jours la queue à la boulangerie, bref, le petit déjeuner dans cet hôtel, c’est vraiment nul. Dommage !

title: Perfect NYC Hotel
text: This is the perfect NYC hotel in the Upper Westside. It’s in a beautiful old building but everything is updated to a high standard. The location is perfect if you’re visiting nearby Fordham University. We had a king parlor suite and it was very spacious for three of us. The breakfast at the French cafe next door is great, but go early. Shanies and Maria at reception were amazing. Professional, friendly and very helpful. We were able to check in early after a long day of travel thanks to their help. I travel often and would highly recommend this hotel. I can’t wait to come back soon!

title: Exceptional Hospitality! Shanies at the reception sets the standard
text:
Absolutely wonderful stay at Hotel Belleclaire!
Shanies at the reception made our experience truly exceptional with her warmth and impeccable professionalism. Highly recommend this hotel for a delightful stay!
We'll definitely be back!

title: Excellent location, hospitality and breakfast.
text:
Great location and wonderful hospitality. There is an excellent bakery, which is in the meal plan. 
The front desk staff, especially Maria, was excellent. She was so kind to let us check-in early when we were feeling miserable and completely exhausted after arriving on a red-eye long-haul flight from Hawaii on a snowing day. We will definitely stay here again!

title: I Hope to Come Again!
text: Comfortable, clean room, however, a little noisy at times due to its location directly opposite the lift; dealt effectively using earplugs. Staff of various functions were very friendly, courteous, and helpful. Excellent location on Broadway!

title: A balm for travellers high on Manhattan
text:
Friendly, helpful service from staff, including cleaning staff but especially Joelle, Wallis, Maria and Benedict, at the front desk, which made our stay a joy. Krishna, the ,  with a temporary overseas money glitch with ease. 
A welcome balm for over stimulated travellers high on Manhattan.

title: Bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Idéalement situé, personnel accueillant et professionnel 
Petit bémol la formule petit déjeuner qui se traduit par 10$ à utiliser dans la « boulangerie » attenante : ce qui correspond à un café et une viennoiserie ☹️… pas de salle pour consommer ce frugal petit déj’

title: We didn't want to leave
text: This has been the best hotel experience!  We didn't want to leave-- everyone was very friendly, the room had a boutique/chic vibe, it was CLEAN, and the bakery downstairs was wonderful each morning for coffee and pastries.   We will always return to Hotel Belleclaire when traveling to NYC!

title: Fabulous
text:
Bed and pillows super comfortable. Hotel is very historic, beautiful and clean.
Maria at the front desk was very efficient and pleasant. Convenient to everything we wanted to do. Bellman were very helpful and kind. Breakfast at the French bistro was amazing.

title: MY HOME AWAY FROM HOME
text: When ever I am in the nyc area I always make sure I stay at this location. The staff the cleanliness the list goes on and on. These people know how to make a hotel operate and keep a smile on while doing so. The staff always puts the guest first and makes you feel welcome as soon as you walk in the door.

title: One of the smallest rooms and no storage
text:
We’re currently here now, rooms 929 and 930 for our friend’s 40th birthdays. We did contact the hotel prior to arriving and asked for possibility of interconnecting rooms to be told they don’t have any but they are on the website.
We are in rooms 929, a very small room, and absolutely no storage, no hanging space or drawers! So it’s living out of cases! 
Room 930 is a corner room so slightly larger and does have a small amount of hanging and drawers. 
Shower is cold or scorching! Nothing in between. 
Room is cleaned daily and towels replaced. 
We had 2 bottles of water in the room upon arrival but not replaced. 
Hotel provides you with $10 dollar voucher per person a day for the bakery, this is ample for a croissant or yoghurt and a hot or cold drink to start your day off. 
We did have a bottle of Prosecco in each room upon arrival wishing the 2 birthday girls a pleasant stay. 
Beds are standard doubles and rooms are warm and pleasant for somewhere to sleep when you’ve been out exploring the sites all day long as we have. 
A nice enough hotel for a short stay but be prepared to live out your case!

title: A bit of Paris in the upper westside
text: Veronica and Benedict made us feel like we were VIP regulars in a very friendly, kind and positive way! The rooms are just right with great comfy beds, and a well designed bathroom. The room is not cramped which is greatly appreciated and enjoyable. Overall, the service is amazing and we will definitely be staying here again!

title: Hotelcon mucho encanto cerca del Central Park
text:
El hotel es precioso, tiene mucho encanto.
En la recepción, mención especial para María y 
Shais, ambas son encantadoras, amables y muy atentas. Da gusto encontrarse personas como ellas. Les doy un un 10.
Las camas y las almohadas son comodisimas, se agradece después de un largo día paseando por la ciudad.
En los alrededores del hotel hay muchísimos restaurantes y el metro está muy cerca.
Recomendable 100x100

title: Benedict, Veronica, Angel and Sare are the best!
text: Clean, comfortable, quiet hotel in perfect location on the UWS. All around excellent service. Benedict, Veronica, Angel and Sare are the best. They helped answer questions and made us feel at home. Thank you for the memorable expel! We’ll be back again.

title: Exceptional experience at the Belleclaire
text: The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. Maria was all smiles every time we saw her. The hotel is conveniently located just blocks from the subway. The breakfast at the French bakery was delicious!  We also enjoyed a tasty dinner at the restaurant. Highly recommend!

title: Excellent Stay, Excellent Staff, Very Clean!!
text:
We had a wonderful stay at Belleclaire. The staff was extremely helpful, accommodating, and caring. In particular, Veronica at the front desk was especially helpful, and definitely made our stay during our time at Belleclaire. 

The hotel itself is very clean and has many things to offer in terms of amenities. The room is so hygienic! It really stood out to us, especially having traveled to many a hotel in the few years post covid, where cleanliness often seems to take a backseat. Little things throughout our stay such as nice products in the bathrooms and a small welcome gift upon arrival really made an impression on us. 

The hotel has such a nice charm to it; highly highly recommend!

title: WORST WIFI OF ANY HOTEL I HAVE STAYED AT IN A DECADE
text:
Great hotel in terms of location and basic amenities. OK, a smallish room with no couch in it, and not really any lobby, but it's Manhattan. 

THE WORST WIFI OF ANY HOTEL I HAVE STAYED AT IN A DECADE --- PREPARE TO USE YOUR SMART PHONE AS A HOTSPOT SINCE THE WIFI SO TOO SPOTTY

title: Well-located, expensive Motel 6
text: I don't understand the high ratings of this hotel.  There's not a lot of choice in the upper West Side, but this is a very expensive Motel 6.  There is NO LOBBY.  In the morning you can sit in the restaurant but in the afternoon you cannot.  Internet is dialup speed.  My double room was barely large enough to accommodate the queen sized bed.  No robes, no carpet on the floor.  Staff is nice enough, location is good, the little coffee shop adjoining it is nice.  But it is an average hotel at best.

title: Excellent Front Desk Service
text: We had excellent service to solve our issue from the front desk employees Shanies and Maria! They were most helpful. We loved our room and were most satisfied with our stay. We look forward to returning to the Hotel Belleclaire on our next trip to New York.

title: Friendly, helpful, clean, comfy and well located--stay here!
text: This was our second stay at the Belleclaire with a group attending a conference in NYC. Our planning experience was seamless thanks to Amanda, our groups coordinator, and that smooth experience continued through our check in with Benedict, check out with Marie and the excellent help of doormen Mark and Sare. The staff at the Belleclaire is top notch--friendly, helpful and welcoming. Our rooms were nicely updated, well appointed, meticulously clean and very comfortable. We very much enjoyed spending our breakfast vouchers on pastries and other delicacies at the attached Mille-Feuille bakery, and found the hotel conveniently close to a subway stop to facilitate our explorations of the city. I highly recommend the Belleclaire!

title: Stellar guest service
text: We travel to NYC a few times a year, primarily to visit grandchildren (and their parents). We discovered the Belleclaire a few years ago and have never looked back. The hotel is very well-maintained, the rooms are bright and comfortable, breakfast pastries from the Mille Feuille are phenomenal, but what truly sets the Belleclaire apart is the quality of its staff. The doormen are welcoming and helpful, the front desk staff knowledgeable and gracious, and the cleaning staff are always friendly and clearly care about keeping guests comfortable and everything looking great. On occasion we've had travel through NYC that required an overnight stay. Rather than look for a hotel near the airport, we come into the city to stay at the Belleclaire. There is much about travel these days that is difficult and frustrating. The Hotel Belleclaire is a welcome respite.

title: A gem!
text:
We are New Yorkers who decided to stay a night in the city to celebrate a birthday. We popped in the hotel early to drop off our bags before heading out and lovely Shanies at the front desk made us aware that not only was our room ready hours early, but that we were upgraded and given a small bottle of wine. It was such a surprise and so helpful since it was a horrible rainy day and it was great to freshen up!

Upon returning to our room there was a beautiful handwritten birthday note, bottle of Prosecco and delicious macaroons from the hotels amazing bakery. Such a special touch and thoroughly enjoyed. 

The room was impeccably clean. It was the perfect touch of old NY architecture and modern features. Everything was comfortable, the lounge was sexy and trendy and it was just a wonderful stay. We hope to visit Hotel Belleclaire again in the future!!

title: Niet slecht, maar het kan beter
text:
Het gebouw dateert van 1902 en is schitterend gerenoveerd. 
Ook de ligging is ideaal : op 10 minuutjes wandelen van Central Park, in het midden van de chique Upper West Side. Nadeel is wel dat er vlakbij een brandweerkazerne is en dat - ondanks de goede geluidsisolatie - je 's nachts regelmatig de brandweerwagens met loeiende sirene hoort voorbijrazen.
De bedden zijn aangename en comfortabel.
Er is echter een minpuntje dat voor ons doorslaggevend was : je krijgt een voucher om het ontbijt af te halen in een aanpalende broodjeszaak. De kwaliteit van het aanbod is weliswaar uitstekend, en zal best ok zijn voor een verblijf van 1 of twee nachten, maar als je zoals wij 6 nachten geboekt hebt, begint het wel wat te vervelen. 
Er is ook geen fatsoenlijke ruimte om het ontbijt te nuttigen : ofwel op de kamer aan een te klein, wankel tafeltje, ofwel al stappend....

title: Good Feeling
text: It is hard to overstate the kindness of the people at Hotel Belleclaire, from the desk to the bar to the incredible doormen, William and Mark, the feeling that you are safe and well cared for is the best of all the good feelings at this hotel. I have traveled around the world, and am in Barcelona now on my way to Paris—-and wish every hotel had that personal touch.

title: Excellent experience at a good location
text: Excellent service, location, and value.  Clean, quiet rooms.  The breakfast voucher provided fresh French pastries and excellent coffee choices.  Ask For slippers and robe if needed.  The lounge was comfortable.  They will store your luggage on request.

title: Wonderful stay at Hotel Belleclaire.
text:
We had a wonderful time at Hotel Bellclaire! Our family suite was perfect for traveling with 4 children. The room was very clean and we loved the space!  I also appreciated that the heat & ac worked quietly, as we like sleeping with a cooler room. 
Maria was exceptional throughout our stay and made our visit feel extra special!

title: Very comfortable hotel which we return to often
text:
We come to New York frequently and have been looking for a hotel where we could stay for a long. The Belleclaire fits the bill perfectly and we shall return often. 

The property is well-maintained by an efficient and cheerful front desk staff and management team as well as strong housekeeping and engineering teams. 

The neighborhood has a variety of restaurants, stores and markets and there is easy access to both the subway system and the West Side Highway. 

We look forward to returning.

title: Highly Recommend
text:
As a nurse and NYRR member, I would definitely recommend Hotel Belleclaire to colleagues and fellow runners. My family and I volunteered for the United Airlines NYC Half and needed to be at Central Park by 6:30 am. Coming from NJ, we didn't want to risk being late or stuck in traffic, so we opted to stay at a hotel near Central Park. Hotel Belleclaire turned out to be the perfect choice. Its convenient location within walking distance to Central Park, along with a great bakery next door and an elegant bar inside, made our stay enjoyable. The hotel itself was gorgeous and maintained impeccable cleanliness, from the lobby and our hotel room.

The experience of being in New York was already exciting, and the staff at Hotel Belleclaire added to it. In particular, I'd like to commend Mark for his exceptional service. He was professional, knowledgeable, and incredibly welcoming. Mark's warm hospitality and great customer service, including providing guidance and assistance, truly enhanced our stay. Thank you to Mark and the rest of the staff for making our time at Hotel Belleclaire memorable!

title: The Belleclaire is a gem!
text: The Belleclaire is a gem! My mother and I stayed at this lovely boutique hotel while we were in the city on Valentine’s Day to see Tina Fey and Amy Poehler’s Restless Leg Tour. The historic building has been carefully updated and the bedrooms are absolutely charming. The drinks at Allure’s bar were first-rate and Mille-Feuille Bakery Café was a welcome breakfast stop before heading back home. The reception staff couldn’t have been more accommodating and helpful. They surprised us by making us “guests of the day” - champagne and macarons waiting in our room. If you’re looking for a go-to hotel near the Beacon Theatre or Central Park, don’t look any further. We’ll be back!

title: Spring Break stay at Hotel Belleclaire
text: We had a great time at Hotel Belleclaire. I was traveling with two teenagers and we found our room simple but comfortable. We really enjoyed the coffee and pastry breakfast. All the employees were very kind, especially Maria, who was super helpful.

title: Great experience at Hotel Belleclaire
text:
We spent three nights at the Belleclaire this week, and thoroughly enjoyed it.  Great location, interesting neighborhood with good restaurants around.  The hotel itself was clean and comfortable, with nice features like a very good shower.  And the benefit every morning of French pastries and coffee!  What stood out for us were the people at the front desk, who were unfailingly friendly and helpful.  When we ran into small glitches, they smoothed them out, and were anxious to please.  
We will stay here when we come back to NYC!

title: Customer service review
text:
CUSTOMER SERVICE A+

Came here the other night on a whim while visiting a friend. By the time that I left it wasn’t busy and so I wanted to inquire about a future stay. The nicest people work here! 

When it was time for a cab I had a lengthy conversation with Ronin-  who in my opinion needs his own tv show. He was very charismatic and knowledgeable of the area. He suggested a ton of must see and must try restaurants and I was just visiting a guest at the hotel. If this is how the staff treats friends of guests then sign me up! I booked a future stay online for my husband and I to stay here and I hope that I will run into Ronin again.

title: Best value in Manhattan!
text: Best value for the money in all Manhattan.  An attention to detail from check-in to check-out.  I always say good service starts at the top--and at Belleclaire, Robert Holmes, General Manager, has made service the top priority.  The entire staff has been imbued with the same focus.  This historic hotel is situated in a perfect Upper West Side location, close to dozens of great restaurants, shopping, and has easy access to public transportation.  After staying in 25 different hotels in Manhattan over the past six months, Belleclaire is now my go-to hotel!   You won't be disappointed.

title: Terrible, terrible hotel.
text: Terrible hotel. Many of the hallways smell like smoke. Some staff are unhelpful and others are rude. The shower in my room didn’t have any hot water because the shower knob was only for volume, not temperature. When I complained, they offered me a room that smelled like cleaning fluid and smoke. Never again.

title: Quiet and close to the park
text:
Our second time staying with this hotel group
And  the staff is super friendly A very comfortable and quiet stay. A stroll through Central Park awaits you. We had a suite upgrade for our family The French bakery is a nice touch  and we attended a off Broadway play just a few blocks away  highly recommend

title: Perfect blend of charm and comfort
text:
Ideal location, near bus snd subway, walking distance to wide choice of restaurants and to Lincoln Center. 
The historic building offers a perfect blend of charm and comfort. On site French bakery and coffee shop plus new bar and restaurant Allure. 
Exceptionally helpful and knowledgeable staff.
Maria has been a key to our enjoyment of the hotel through the years. Her deep knowledge of the building has helped us spend our visits in exactly the kind of room we enjoy. 
Shanies is the other gracious and energetic contributor to our enjoyment of the Belleclaire. The positive energy of her welcome and her concern for our needs help make every arrival and every stay very special.

title: Hidden gem on the UWS
text:
This is now my go to hotel in NYC. Large clean rooms on the upper west side. Rooms are huge compared to usual NYC standards. Love the small boutique feel. Everyone on reception is super friendly. I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a Broadway view corner room so had a great view. Coffee and pastries in the cafe downstairs always much appreciated! My only comments are to improve soundproofing where rooms connect.  

I will return later this year and can’t wait. I’ve also recommended to other business colleagues

title: Fantastic NYC hotel!
text:
I got in late from a business trip.  The front desk was so helpful and so very nice! 

Upon check in they offer you discount cards for dinner served in the hotel  (I think $10)  and breakfast (which can buy you fresh coffee and delicious pasties at the amazing bakery next door.)

My room was spotless and had a beautiful view up Broadway. 

There was bottled water beside.

In the morning both Shanies and Maria were at the hotel desk and very helpful and so nice.  What a great crew they have there.

I’ve already made my reservation for next month . What a lovely surprise to find such a great hotel - in a beautiful and safe neighborhood and walkable to Columbus circle and the symphony. 

Bravo!!

title: Hotel Belleclaire
text: First time in NY and this hotel was so welcoming and accommodating. Shanies and Maria were the front desk clerks that’s took care of us. They give you a voucher for coffee and pastry. They made check in so easy. Clean rooms and definitely worth the price I will be back in the future

title: My Carnegie Hall visit!
text:
I very much enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The rooms were clean and simple but the staff was wonderful. Very attentive and friendly!!!
Thanks to all of them!!!
Location was terrific, very central to many things and very close to Zabars and the Museum of Natural History, an excellent museum!!

title: Great hotel
text: Exceeded expectations I was able to check in early made my day ! Maria was so helpful and went above and beyond !!! It was clean everyone that works there is very friendly.  It is very clean ! The sheets and bedding is fabulous!! The location is perfect! I will always stay there when I am in New York !

title: Very Nice Place
text: My wife flew in from Atlanta, I came down from Boston and we were headed to see Jerry Seinfeld.  The hotel was in a great location to see shows at the Beacon Theater.  But my wife was tired from a week's business travel and this hotel just made everything nice.  The staff were all super helpful and clearly hard working,  The place is very clean.  The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet.  Not what I had necessarily expected for being in such a big city, and so we both slept great.  And that was nice.  We were able to walk and enjoy both Central and Riverside parks.   The food in the whole area is excellent, waking up to good coffee and French pastry isn't awful.  Just had a great time and I attribute that to both my planning and the hotel's execution.

title: Great Experience. Friendly staff. Maria is fantastic.
text: Check in is 3 pm. But we arrived at 1 pm. We were greeted by Maria at the check in counter. I told her that I had an important conference call I needed to take and if the room was ready. Maria checked with housekeeping and was told it would take another hour. So we waited in the lobby. But a few minutes later. Maria called us to the check in desk and told us she had upgraded us to the Palace Suite and that the room was ready!! I was blown away! The room was fantastic. And the whole experience after that was perfect. Thank you so much Maria! You are a star. Employees like you are hard to get. And I hope the hotel gives you a raise. Thank you. A. Paul.

title: Gute Adresse für einen Besuch in Manhattan
text:
Angenehme Einrichtung, sehr nettes Personal.
Süße kleine französische Bäckerei direkt nebenan.
Zimmer sauber, geschmackvoll.
Dusche für Europäer vermutlich etwas ungewohnt, aber voll in Ordnung. 
Anbindung zur Subway nur zwei Blocks entfernt.

title: Clean, cute, exceptionally welcoming staff
text: The staff was extra kind, solicitous, helpful. Lovely bakery off the lobby with delicious, amazing latte and sweets. My room had plenty of space, was very comfortable, super clean, and well appointed. Even the hallways were cute and felt charming, with carpets that must be new …

title: Quiet, welcoming European style hotel in a perfect Upper West Side location.
text: We spent a week enjoying the City, and found the Belleclaire to be perfect base of operations. Central Park and the Natural History museum are a couple of classic brownstone blocks away; the subway at 72nd has both local and express trains for easy access to the theater district and the Village; and the crosstown bus 5 minutes walk at 79th whisks you to the Upper West Side with its great art museums. This quiet, European style hotel was very welcoming and comfortable. Our king accommodation was roomy, freshly updated and sparking clean. The small bathroom had a great two-person shower and modern fixtures. The subsidy for the excellent French patisserie/cafe on site was a brilliant way to start the day. We’ll be back!

title: Fabulous Stay
text: This was a GREAT stay! From start to finish… everyone was so attentive and helpful. In addition, the breakfast vouchers for the bakery downstairs was a perfect touch.  I highly recommend their almond croissant! We will definitely stay here again.

title: Simply lovely
text: Lovely hotel. Beautiful outside and inside. Small room, but this is normal in NYC. Our room was beautifully furnished with three windows. Small bathroom, but again, this is not unusual. There is definitely a historic feel to this little gem. The bedding was soft with a big comfy king bed. We did have quite a bit of trouble with the wifi, but upon check out, I mentioned this, and the wonderful attendant at the desk asked specific questions and said they would report it. We felt welcome in every interaction with their staff. The French bakery downstairs had excellent macarons. The $10 per guest per night gift certificate for the bakery was fully used eaxh day and much appreciated. Although there is a lively bar/restaurant downstairs, we heard no noise from the 1st floor. Roo. Darkening blinds in the room were not noticed until we checked out but are a nice touch.

title: Good experience
text:
We were greeted by Maria at Reception who was very friendly and made our stay seamless.  The hotel is old but charming.
Room spacious and sunny.  Bathroom very small which is common in old hotels.
The location serve us well with tons of interesting restaurants, Central Park, and Riverside all at walking distance.

title: Charming hotel on the Upper West Side
text:
Hotel Belleclaire is everything we wanted in a hotel in New York City -- and more! This was our first time staying on the Upper West Side and we can't wait to book our next visit! It was absolutely perfect in every way. It's warm and welcoming, from the friendly staff, both those at the front desk and housekeeping, to the baristas at the attached Mille-Feuille Bakery/Cafe. If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Midtown Manhattan, stay at the Belleclaire! 
We traveled with our college-age daughter during her spring break to visit the American Museum of Natural History and see Moulin Rouge on Broadway. It's blocks away from the museum, and only a 5-minute walk to the subway station at 79th Street and Broadway, giving us a quick option to get to Midtown Manhattan. The location is perfect for exploring the Upper West Side's restaurants and shops, as well. (We especially liked Sarabeth's for breakfast, and Patsy's Pizzeria and the Hi-Life Cafe for dinner.) Don't miss shopping at Zabar's for baked goods and coffee beans to take home!
We booked a Deluxe Two-Queen room and had plenty of space for the three of us. The rooms seem recently remodeled, and we also had lots of outlets to charge all of our cell phones, ear buds, laptops, etc.
The beds are extremely comfortable, and the plush towels and soft bed linens make it even more luxurious. We hated to leave after three nights, but we hope to plan another visit soon!

title: Weekend getaway
text: Clean, comfortable, quiet, great service, convenient location. We were originally attracted to the Hotel Belleclaire due to the price and the location. However, we were very surprised that the quality of the facilities and the excellent service were far better than we would have expected. We will be using the Belleclaire for our New York getaways from now on!

title: Great hotel
text: Belleclaire was an excellent experience, awesome place, vintage style and lovely people to help you to get the best room and the best services. Maria and Shanies stood out to me as peolple who are genuinely there to make your stay the best in every single way.

title: Fantastic Customer Service & Hospitality (Especially for Groups, Great Location)
text: From the moment I began working with the sales team through check-in, during my stay and at the end when I needed to store luggage - truly at every turn I was greeted with kindness and hospitality and personalized care. The staff at the Belleclaire should teach courses on hospitality, they are experts and models for what care looks like. The hotel is sparkly clean while keeping old-NYC charm, modern and historical. The rooms are spacious for NYC and at a prime location near public transit. The bakery located by the entrance is absolutely delicious (and efficient for the morning rush), too. Just... WOW! (Special shout outs to Amanda T & Ann S in sales, as well as Joelle and others at the desks.)

title: Stay here! 🤭🥰
text: Huge s/o to Shanies! I called ahead of my reservation asking if the room we booked had a microwave & it didn’t but upgraded our room to a family suite, which would have a microwave + fridge. I was not expecting that level of kindness! Our room was clean and comfortable. The location was perfect. Subways, local restaurants, grocery and convenience stores were only a walk away! We’ll definitely be coming back 🥰 Thanks for checking us out swiftly & donating our blankets, Mariah!

title: Will definitely be back!
text:
Excellent hotel. I have stayed here before and love everything about it. Perfect location,  beautiful building, comfortable rooms, clean,  and super friendly staff - everyone from Shanier and Benedict at the front desk to housekeeping to doorman. 

This trip was to be there for my daughter who was having her wisdom teeth out (she has an apartment in the next block). We arrived back to the room while housekeeping was working on our room. I didn't get her name but she went out of her way to help out, bringing extra tissues, water bottles, etc without being asked. 

Will definitely be back!

title: The staff at this hotel are exceptional !
text: We stayed a couple of nights after my partner’s ACL surgery. We needed an accessible place near her doctor for an appointment. Amazing team that went above and beyond for us during our stay. Everyone is so kind and helpful! Especially, Ting, Mark, Benedict, and Shanies! We cannot wait to return!

title: A Pleasant Stay
text:
This was our second visit to Hotel Belleclaire.  This time we had a really nice room.  It was clean and the bed was very comfortable, though an extra blanket would have been welcome.  The bathroom was a nice size.  I loved the view over the rooftops of the city. The staff, especially Maria and Bendit, were welcoming, friendly, and helpful.  Thank you!

The Belleclaire is a French styled boutique hotel that is not in the thick of the city bustle but up Broadway a bit in more of a local neighborhood.  Of course we loved the exquisite daily made French pastries--they are the real thing!  Eh, the coffee is mediocre though.   There are plenty of eateries in the neighborhood along with interesting grocery stores and coffee shops as well as bookstores and other shopping venues.  The subway is easy to get to as well.  

All hotels in NYC are pricey, there's no avoiding that.  But I will say that the additional facility fee at checkout was a downer.  

I have already shared the hotel's information with several friends.  And hope to return again.

title: A Friendly Oasis on the Upper West Side
text: The Belleclaire is small enough that we felt welcome and recognized by the staff from the very first evening. We enjoyed staying in an older (but very nicely renovated) building. It was like visiting a good friend in one of those wonderful Upper West Side apartment buildings. Everyone at the front desk during our week-long stay was helpful and friendly: we saw Benedict, Shanil, and Maria most often. It's true that there were lines at the bakery on a couple of mornings, but we didn't mind because the pastries are spectacular. What else? The bed was great and the price was reasonable. There are subway stops and lots of good restaurants nearby. We would definitely stay here again.

title: I will return for sure
text: Was a good place to stay, near of cool places like the Natural History museum and Central Park jus walking distance. In a nice neighborhood. It has good restaurants and cafeterias around the area. For sure I will return to my next stay ☺️☺️ I love NY

title: Beautiful Hotel, excellent location
text: We went to NYC with a team of 10. The hotel was a great location for us.  Everything was great.  Only two recommendations:  put hair dryers in the rooms and allow for prepaying for the room.  Yummy breakfast option with the french bakery next door.  Almond croissants were so yummy!

title: Great Hotel in Nice Location
text: One of the most pleasant hotel stays I have had. The entire hotel felt as if it had been recently updated. The room was very nice with distressed hardwood floors and a beautiful tile walk-in shower. It was very clean. The staff was friendly and welcoming. We had arrived several hours before check-in time and when I looked to check our luggage, they actually had a room available.  That was very useful. The fitness center was newly updated, all the equipment worked and was of good quality. Location is convenient to the Upper West Side and a block from a subway stop. The coupons for the bakery were an unexpected touch and the bakery was outstanding.

title: wonderful and comfortable stay!
text: Me and my daughter came for her audition in Manhattan, Christian was so kind to offer us a room before check in due to our schedule. The hotel is very clean and has a very cute homey feel, all the staff is very kind! Thank you for the pleasant stay!!

title: Veronica & Wallace are dedicated Belleclaire Hotel Employees!
text:
Veronica & Wallace are two outstanding people & Belleclaire employees, friendly, & helpful in every way.  I was staying overnight with my Lagotto  Romagnolo, Elizabetta.  Wallace played with her and kept her occupied while I was checking in, she can be a handful.  He also accompanied us to our room and brought up dog water/food bowls.
And somehow my medicine bag fell out of my carryall bag he found it on the floor and brought it right up.

title: A theatrical welcome at the Belleclaire!
text:
Phenomenal greeting by Benedict, Joelle, Raul, and the other bellman!  Benedict practically sang us through the entire checkin process - hilarious!  Joelle presented wife a bottle of wine (her birthday).  Very warm welcome.  A+.

Room was adequate- no coffee or fridge. Water for shower was warm to tepid.  Not super comfortable. Very clean.  Probably a B-

Breakfast in AM was a nice chit for the authentic French bakery that adjoins the site.  Expect a small wait as is busy spot.  Hotel was beautifully aged, narrow, lots of nooks and crannies.  What you'd anticipate for a hotel that's 120 years old.  I think it was a great value for being in heart of Upper West side.  

It's a place where it's evident the team is working together to make you feel at home.

title: Good location, excellent service
text:
The room was clean, comfortable, and a good value for the price. But what prompted this review was the exceptional service from the front desk agent Maria, and from every single member of the staff we encountered (the doormen, housekeeping, and maintenance personnel).

Above and beyond being friendly, Maria and her coworkers were incredibly considerate and helpful, preempting all of our needs and offering suggestions for parking in the neighborhood. We will be staying at Hotel Belleclaire on all of our future trips to the area purely for the responsiveness of Maria and all other staff members.

title: A gem in the city
text: Our stay at Hotel Belleclaire was truly exceptional, marked by the warmth and friendliness of the staff, an incredibly smooth check-in process, and a prime location that provided easy access to the city’s main attractions, making our trip both enjoyable and memorable.

title: The Best
text: The staff were AMAZING!  We were traveling with a big double bass for auditions and every staff member, housekeeping, every bellman, and the front desk was wonderful.  I will stay there again just to see the smiling faces and hear the show tunes in the lobby.

title: We will be back!  Benedict was so nice!
text: We loved the Belleclaire! The staff was all so nice - Benedict and Veronica were the best!  Everyone is so happy and helpful.  Definitely a great find on the uws. And it’s such a great price for being so close to the action.  Great place if you have an event at the Beacon.  We will be back!

title: Absolutely amazing!!
text: The room was absolutely beautiful with the comfiest bed ever! The view was amazing. The windows gave great light throughout the day, very comfortable. Benedict and Veronica are so funny and kind, they made all of us laugh. 10/10!! Will recommend to friends 😄

title: Mother/daughters Trip to NYC
text: I stayed at Hotel Belleclaire with my mother and sisters for a mother/daughter trip to NYC The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We were delighted to find out that we were “guests of the day” and received an upgrade. Our room was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. It also had a great view of the river. A special shout out to the very lovely Shanies! She was so warm and welcoming to us.

title: Benedict at the front desk rocks
text: Wonderful hotel! I checked in at 11 PM on a cold winter night, weary from my day of walking, eating, drinking, enlightening myself at a play. In other words, I was tired. Fortunately, Benedict at the front desk greeted me with friendly warmth, and happily and efficiently checked me in, even surprising me with an upgrade. He also arranged for my suitcase (which I had left at the hotel in the morning) to be delivered to my room.

title: SHANIES ROCKS!!!!!
text: I JUST WANTED TO LET YOU KNOW THAT ALL OF YOUR STAFF THAT WE ENCOUNTERED WERE VERY FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL. HOWEVER I WANTED TO SPECIFICALLY HONE IN ON SHANIES. WE HAD A COUPLE OF ENCOUNTERS DURING OUR STAY AND SHE WAS VERY PROFESSIONAL, FRIENDLY AND KNOWLEDGEABLE. ON THE MORNING OF OUR CHECK OUT ONE OF OUR FRIENDS WAS ILL AND WASN'T ABLE TO CHECK OUT / MAKE HER FLIGHT BACK TO ARIZONA. SHANIES JUMPED INTO ACTION. SHE WAS VERY COMPASSIONATE ABOUT THE SITUATION; HELPFUL WITH SECURING A ROOM FOR ONE MORE NIGHT; PROVIDING A REASONABLE RATE FOR THE EXTRA NIGHT; AND ALSO IN MAKING SUGGESTIONS FOR FOOD DELIVERY SERVICES AND PLACES NEARBY TO GET CHICKEN SOUP!

title: My new home away from home
text:
I had a great stay and will look forward to coming back whenever I’m in NY.  The beds were really comfortable and the rooms were really quiet- so it was a great night’s sleep.  And the room was perfectly clean. The vouchers for the French bakery downstairs are 
such a great morning or afternoon treat.  And the staff were great.  I had to change plans multiple times, and they were so accommodating- above and beyond.  Many thanks especially to Shantes.

title: Quiet location
text: This was my fourth trip to NYC and I regret not booking at this hotel sooner. I absolutely loved our experience. Great location if you are looking for a quiet residential experience but close enough to transportation, small shops, and more!

title: I’ll be back the next time in in NYC!
text: The hotel was beautiful, classic and timeless. The staff working up front, Joelle, Benedict and JV were kind and went above and beyond. They were a great welcome and had excellent service. My room was clean and organized. It was a marvelous stay, thanks to all of the staff that keeps this hotel operating at its highest level!

title: Perfekt, empfehlenswert
text:
Ein wunderschönes hotel, mit schönen Zimmern und schönem Foyer. Sehr zuvorkommende Mitarbeiter die einem immer freundlich heben und alle Fragen beantworten. Stets ein Lächeln im Gesicht. Wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt. Die Zimmer wurden jeden Tag gereinigt, dass Bett frisch gemacht. 
Frühstück ist mega lecker. Mit einem Voucher geht's ins kleine französische Café, wo es die besten allmond Croissants gibt, die ich je gegessen habe. Auch wenn der Kaffee extrem heiß war, hat er doch gut geschmeckt. 
Preis Leistungsverhältnis absolut in Ordnung, auch für die Lage. 
100m bis 300m zu den nächsten Subway Stationen. Man ist in 5 min auf dem Times square.

title: It was wonderful - comfortable, elegant, superb serive.
text: The Belleclaire was perfect for our Galentine's Day stay. We were 5 50-something gals spending the night in the city with tickets to the Beacon Theater (Amy Poehler and Tina Fey - not to be missed) and, all experienced city dwellers and visitors, so we were ready for anything, and we were thrilled it was excellent. The Belleclaire is a beautiful, historic building on the Upper West Side with an interesting history. It was recently renovated with beautiful results - preserving the Old New York charms while incorporating modern everything else. The rooms were as pictured and so comfortable, and we were delighted by the little touches - bathrobes, slippers, wine and macroons in our king room and the list goes on. The staff was very professional and so very, very friendly. I have to give a specific shout out to Shanies and Yelena who went above and beyond to make sure we had what we needed and that our stay was wonderful. It was a wonderful celebration of our 35 years of friendship and we will all be back. We love this hotel.

title: Awesome!
text: I truly enjoyed my time here at Hotel Belleclaire. The staff were very courteous and helpful. Shanice was exceptionally kind and welcoming and was apt to aid in any questions etc. regarding my stay.  I will recommend this hotel without reservation. Thank you!

title: Excellence in Service + Hospitality
text:
I have visited the Belleclaire Hotel every day this week because my wife is staying there while our apartment is being painted. She was unhappy when allergies chased her from home, but now she’s thoroughly enjoying a dust-free, clean and comfortable room. Her room is beautifully decorated with no hanging fabrics, no curtains, no rugs (wood flooring), all great for a germaphobe. The moment she got to the hotel, she was relaxed, feeling cozy and pampered by the staff. Her room is perfect for a restorative getaway, with a big, comfortable bed and a large tv.

She speaks very highly of many staff members, including Benedict, Maria and Veronica at the font desk, as well as managers Angel and Christian. She even raved about Monica, who has been cleaning her room!

I’ve had breakfast with my wife in the hotel lobby and dinner in the neighborhood several times, and I can report without hesitation that the Belleclaire has been great for her, as well as for me.

Happy wife, happy life!

title: Great welcome!!!
text: Joëlle, Verónica, Jossvan and Bénédicte at réception are absolutely wonderfully welcoming and accommodating! We warmheartedly recommend! We felt at home right away and the place is really warm and well located. They also speak many languages!

title: Dream hotel in NYC
text: Hotel Belleclaire is truly the most incredible stay in NYC! The experience from the moment we arrived was magical! The staff is so welcoming. Shanies & Maria made us feel like we were arriving as their most valuable guests. The room, the view & location was a dream. Hotel Belleclaire  is a must stay in NYC!

title: Hidden gem, a delightful place to stay in NYC
text:
The Belleclaire is the true hidden gem in New York City. I’ve stayed 5-6 times and I love the experience every time. 

The management and staff are top notch and treat me like I’m family. Michael, Maria, Chenise, Benedict and Reuben are always cheery, have a can/do customer focused spirit. They have become my “family” away from home. In fact, the Belleclaire has become “home” in NYC. 

Accommodations are simple but always spotlessly clean. Just right for a simple nyc stay. In a quiet part of town but easy to get to anywhere by car or subway!  It’s a place I feel safe when I’m there. 

Another delight is the association with the small, intimate French bakery and pastry shop off the lobby. Included with your room are vouchers for a great cup of coffee and delicious pastry of your choice. Everyone there is a delight with a cheerful “bonjour” as you order!!

It’s a clean, humble, delightful place to stay!!   Give it a try and you might fall in love with the Belleclaire as I have!

title: Our Go -To Hotel. Excellent stay.
text: We had a comfortable stay in our king size room. The rooms are clean and beautifully updated. The front desk staff consists of friendly, helpful, and accommodating individuals. A nice breakfast from the adjacent French bakery is included in your stay. This is our go to hotel when we visit the city several times a year.

title: I loved walking into the warm and friendly environment of the Belleclaire!
text: This was my first time at the hotel Belleclaire... and I will definitely come back again!!!  I was extremely happy with my room! The cleanliness and cozy hominess of the room... the view from my room...and, last but not at all at least, your professional staff:  Shanies and Veronica we're so warm and friendly... and made my friend and I feel very welcome.

title: FROM THE MOMENT YOU WALK IN ....
text: From the moment you walk in with the smell of the bakery you know your in for a treat! The front desk staff  Michael and Veronica took very extra special care of this old women when there was a big party going on they made sure I saw the room and liked the room prior to checking me in all while keeping a positive vibe and a upbeat personality. I was hear visiting my grandson who raved about this hotel and after my experience here I am sure to come back. I had my room cleaned on my 2nd day here and had asked for extra towels each and every day after that those extra towels were always there. THANK YOU ALL AND EVERYONE AT THE BELLECLAIRE.

title: Highly recommend to stay at the hotel
text: It was a nice family experience staying here. Wonderful room, convenient transportation, good breakfast, sweet front desk people. Special Thank you for upgrading our room. Definitely will come back again. Recommend to people who visit New York.

title: Great for girls weekend
text: The cutest hotel with the nicest staff! Especially Shanies at the front desk! She went above and beyond to accommodate our group! Excited for our visit!  Rooms are clean and modern and the location is perfect. The hotel also has unique rooms to help accommodate big parties.

title: Amazing
text: Myself and daughter spent five days here. The hotel and our room were beautiful and immaculate. Staff very friendly and helpful, situated in ideal location to get everywhere.
