Bakery attached was also outstanding, our morning coffee and pastry was delicious, setting us up for the day exploring. Highly recommend.

title: Great weekend stay
text: We had a great stay at the Hotel Belleclaire last weekend. Shanies and Maria were incredibly helpful during our check in process after a long red eye flight. The room was clean, comfortable, and in a great location. I would stay here again for future visits.

title: A terrific hotel with spectacular staff!
text:
I’ve been staying at the Belleclaire Hotel for just over a week and it’s been spectacular! 

The location is extraordinary (a great neighborhood minutes from Central Park in one direction and Riverside Park in the other. And it’s right on Broadway - convenient to restaurants, concerts, theater and everything the upper west side has to offer!). 

We’ve stayed in 2 different rooms because we decided to extend our time here. The rooms are bright, clean and cheerful, and even the smaller one felt spacious enough, with a king bed, two night tables, a small dresser and a desk with a chair. The larger of the rooms had a small sitting area (with another table and chair).

There’s a lovely lobby area with tables for breakfast, which later becomes part of the attached restaurant, Allure. We love sitting in the lobby in the mornings over breakfast, and we’ve eaten twice at Allure (once for brunch and once for a light dinner with cocktails) – the décor is beautiful and the atmosphere is really festive. An amazing bonus is the French Bakery (Millefeuille) that you can enter from the lobby, and for which the hotel gives you a $10 voucher per person per day of your visit. Millefeuille was already one of our favorite bakeries, and with the vouchers it’s been completely irresistible!

But the most fabulous (and I mean fabulous!) thing about the Belleclaire is the staff. From the doorman to the front desk personnel to the restaurant waiters and cleaning staff, they are without exception attentive, efficient, caring and delightful! They’ve made every aspect of our stay even better. 

Benedict, Maria and Veronica not only took care of everything we needed (sometimes before we even asked) but their fun-loving, joyful personalities have kept us smiling the whole time. 

Christian arranged for us to extend our stay. He gave us the second room at a great rate and made it all effortless. 

And Angel in Customer Relations has been another smiling, caring presence. 

We’ve had such a great time here we don’t want to leave!

title: Amazing!
text: Amazing!  The Hotel Belleclaire is our favorite hotel in NYC.  The staff is amazing!  Shanies and Maria at reception are the absolute best welcome to this little oasis hotel property.  After a dozen or so stays at Hotel Belleclaire, we are still excited to arrive.  Everything is seamless from the reservation to check out.  We are always thrilled with the accommodations.  A business trip brought us to the Hotel Belleclaire, Shanies and Maria keep us returning for our stay in NYC.

title: Really cool place, worth seeing even just from the outside
text: Great place to stay. On Broadway, cool area and unbeatable retro atmosphere. The staff is also really friendly and helpful and they make for a nice, comfortable stay. The French patisserie downstairs to which I received two vouchers is unbelievable too!

title: This is  the place to stay
text: This is the place to go when on the upper west side the staff takes care of you the rooms are clean and there is an amazing bakery in the front of the hotel. Angel Joelle are amazing and Michael took great care of me in my hour of need all together this place is a well oiled machine and the place to go when vising the NYC area.

title: Lovely place in a great part of town
text: I’ve stayed here a few times and really like it; the location is great, in a lovely part of Manhattan (UWS) and the staff are really helpful. The rooms are very varied, some are tiny and awkward and others are spacious and well laid out. On my last trip, Maria at reception was really lovely and so helpful - my original room was small and there was a very cold draught in the bathroom, so she changed my room for me and upgraded me to a larger and much more practical room. She made the effort to check with me afterwards as well, to make sure all was ok. They also give you vouchers to use at the bakery downstairs for each day which is great, although it can get a bit “samey” as although their selection of pastries is good, there isn’t much else to choose and they don’t do many vegetarian options in the non-sweet selection. They should offer a plain cheese/cheese and tomato croissant as well as the ones with different meats! Overall it’s a great place to stay, and I’ve always found the staff very kind and helpful. One thing which would be helpful is to clearly list what facilities are available (there is a facility fee after all!) - apparently there is a gym but no one has ever told me about this! And once again, I just want to give a shout out to Maria, she was so pleasant and helpful :)

title: Great stay
text: I had a great stay at The Bellclaire. I arrived early and Maria was so kind and generous to let me check in early. I can tell she enjoys her job and making customers smile. Not to mention, the whole front desk was rocks! My room was better than I expected which was a plus!

title: Outstanding experience
text:
The room was amazing with a nook that gives a sens of extra room and very pleasant in the morning to drink your coffee. Maria and Angel really gave us an amazing service to ensure the experience in the hotel by providing options and explaining all the features of different rooms. They were very nice and welcoming. 
I definitely recommend Hotel Belleclaire because they have the best reception desk and really care about their clients.

title: 4 great nights on the Upper West side!
text: This is our third stay at this lovely UWS hotel.  Great front desk (especially Maria!), great included breakfast, and a warm friendly vibe.  We had a queen bedroom which was pretty small, but a beautiful, big bathroom.  We love the location and will definitely be back.

title: What a welcome!
text: Completely wowed by the friendly welcome from staff at check-ink. I learned their names are Mark, Benedict, and Veronica - thank you guys for making my day! I was offered a complementary glass of rosé (don’t mind if I do!) while I caught my breath and got my bearings after a long day of travel. Lovely hotel with period details, great location, fantastic staff!

title: Helpful and Friendly Staff
text: I only stayed for one night, but was greeted but great front desk staff. Also had a great bar and restaurant in the lobby. Rooms are very nice and staff is great. Had a great experience with Joelle and Benedict at the front desk. They were both helpful and friendly!

title: Another fabulous stay!
text: In and out for a quick trip to NYC - Love staying at this Sweet boutique hotel on the upper west side. The staff is always wonderful…gracious and thoughtful… The rooms are comfortable and stylish… and the rates are amazingly reasonable for all that you get. Love the new restaurant Allure  – great food, and excellent vibe… And, of course… The French bakery Mille Feuille attached to the hotel is to die for! We’ve been staying at the Belleclaire for the last few years… Love it… Always know what to expect. We will  be back!

title: Tres, tres, tres Belleclaire!
text: I loved staying in this beautiful beaux arts building on the upper west side. Benedict upgraded us to a room with two beds so my granddaughter and I didn’t have to share a bed. Looking forward to breakfast tomorrow at Mille-feuille. I went there when my daughter lived in this neighborhood and k ow it will be great.

title: Everything is awesome….except the room itself
text:
This is my second stay at the Hotel Belleclaire. Let me begin by saying the staff is wonderful, I am aware of the nice amenities and the breakfast and the wine reception. The hotel is very clean. If it wasn’t for the room!

When we stayed last year (September of 2023) we were quite happy with the room. It was clean, small but adequately sized, funky angles and view into other hotel rooms from the window, but we liked it.

Forward to January 2024.  I arrived on a one night solo stay in an “standard full”. Again, the “experience” was fine. When I opened the door into my small room my first thought was:  
THIS IS A CELL IN A MONASTERY. OR A ROOM IN A YOUTH HOSTEL.

I understand industrial aesthetic, but this is just so bleak and bare. All hard surfaces and echo.  The bed frame looks like a fold out cot- maybe a temporary piece of furniture? Not a soft surface in the room. No window treatments. No half-quilt on the bed. Just bare sheets.

No noise insulation, and my neighbors in the two rooms next store were drunk-conversing and slamming doors at 3 am.

Even with the industrial style window blind closed, the room was not dark enough for good sleep. 

There appeared to be fresh paint and plaster drips on the floor. 

I think that this room is likely not indicative of all the rooms at the Belleclaire. I understand that I did not book a room at a luxury property. Still……

It would be awesome if your design team would make some slight improvements so the room itself is commensurate with the rest of the great amenities offered at the Belleclaire.

title: Très satisfaite
text: Très bon hôtel calme et typique personnel agréable et système de petit déjeuner dans une boulangerie francaise très bien par contre on ne peut pas ouvrir les fenêtres des chambres sûrement par sécurité mais pas pratique quand même. Pas de regret bon choix

title: Would definitely come back again, nice location
text: Stayed for 4 weeks, convenient location close to Central Park and 79th station, nice staff! Angel and Veronica at reception helped a lot. Also highly recommend to go to Mille Feuille Bakery and the Allure restaurant (both located in the hotel).

title: Belleclaire Hitel
text: Hotel Belleclaire is a beautiful a hotel on the upper West side. We were greeted warmly at the front desk by Benedict and Shanies. They were wonderful and made sure we had a comfortable room and explained all the amenities the hotel had to offer. Mille Feuille for breakfast daily with $10 dollar coupons for each guest daily. Beds were comfortable and housekeeping was spectacular. Many Bigelow  toiletries were provided. This hotel is in a great location to get to the museums, Central Park and the MTA. We plan on coming back! Thank you all, we really enjoyed our stay

title: UWS couples staycation
text: Neatly renovated quiet hotel with nice rooms and very pleasant staff. Staff is all smiles with very clear desire to leave good impression. The place will stay pleasant as long as management wants it to be pleasant. I can easily recommend it for a pleasant UWS vacation.

title: Our Stay at the Belleclaire Upper West Side, NYC
text: Great Customer Service, Clean Hotel, Great Bakery next door for the included Daily Breakfast. The only complaint I have is The TV's need to be upgraded to smart TV's so you don't have to watch boring local TV stations. It's hard to live without Netflix/Hulu/Prime or Applte TV these days!!

title: First class service and a lovely hotel
text: The BelleClaire was excellet. My daughter and I stepped out of the cab on an icey, cold rainy day and instantly someone was there to assit with our luggage so we could get inside. I noticed the front desk was genuinely helpful and gracious with a customer who had endless questions about transportation. We were helped as quickly as possible and permitted to check in earlier than I expected since a room was ready. There is a lovely French bakery next door where we enjoyed our breakfast as part of our visit. Their was also a lounge area which we didn't have time to visit this trip but maybe next time. The rooms were clean, quiet, and comfortable with nice bedding and a good shower. We slept well. Shanies, Maria and Angel were so friendly throughout our visit.  We look forward to our return. Belleclaire is a charming boutique hotel with first class service. The location worked well for us too. I definately recommend it when in NYC.

title: Amazing!
text:
This is my first time comeing  to New York, and the impression that staff members Joelle and Ronin left on me is out of this wolrd!  The kindeness and aproach that they had whit me is amazing, and they were so helpfull whit all of my questions and request. Can’t wait to come again! 
A special thanks to these two! 
Sara

title: Upper West Side Gem-great landing spot for Beacon Theater events
text:
Pros-
Large boutique hotel with fabulous bar/great drinks. 
Rooms ready 3 hours ahead of time.
Friendly check-in. No lines.
Attached French bakery and breakfast voucher.
Clean room and comfy bed.
Walk to Beacon theater and Central Park.
Gave complimentary bottle of wine to our friends celebrating a birthday.
Warm shower with good products.
Additional full size mirror in room-helpful for getting ready.
Friendly housekeeping staff

Cons-
Tinier size bathroom
View can face other rooms due to angles
Bar can be limited hours if private events

Would stay here again!

title: french and classy!
text:
this is always my go-to place to stay in new york. the neighborhood is quiet and not super touristy. The hotel is sparkling clean and the decoration very classy and chic. 
It was not my first time there and definitely won’t be my last. Everyone is so nice and in such a good mood. Special thanks to Veronica, Benedict and Angel for helping me with anything I needed.

title: Excellent stay
text: Lovely hotel in a perfect location,room was lovely and clean with fresh towels daily staff were so helpful only issue we had was every evening our room smelt of weed it was so strong,after two nights we did complain to reception who must had sorted it couldn't quite understand how this happened as the hotel had a no smoking policy.The hotel is in the perfection location to central park and time square,new york didn't disappoint us

title: Best place to stay on UWS
text: Oh my gosh. Not only was this a beautiful hotel with all we needed in the perfect location on the Upper West Side, but the staff and customer service!!! They were lovely during our stay to celebrate my husband’s birthday, but they went above and beyond - Maria saved us and was incredibly kind and reassuring!!! - when weather detained us for an extra 2 days!!! Maria assured us we had a place to stay, and even did more for us as I broke down in tears (trying to get back to our kids!). We knew we would be warm and safe until we could get back home. They have two VERY loyal customers and you can count on us staying here very time we visit the UWS!!! We love you, Maria!!! Thank you!!!

title: Lo mejor la ubicación y el personal
text:
El personal muy amable, las niñas de la recepción atentas y siempre dispuestas a resolver cualquier duda, en especial María y Verónica que fue con las que más interactuamos. Se agradece que al menos una supiera español. Los porteros también muy amables.
Lo malo es que la mayoría del tiempo siempre había un solo ascensor (uno siempre estaba en mantención) y también no disponían más espacios comunes para tomar un café o leer (habían mesas pero eran del restaurante).
El desayuno era rico, temática francesa y el vale nos sirvió. Algunos días no tomamos desayuno por lo que se podían acumular estos vales , así que bien en ese sentido!!
Otra cosa a mejorar es el aseo de la habitación, si bien se cambiaban toallas y artículos de aseo todos los días, el aseo no se realizaba en algunas partes (w.c , aspirar piso).
La ubicación también nos encantó!!! cerca de dos metros, cerca del central park, a una micro de times square y el lugar muy residencial y seguro. Recomendado 🫰

title: Perfect NY Hotel on Upper West Side
text: Great little hotel on the upper west side within walking distance of Lincoln Center, the Met, the park, the NY Historical Society and Natural History Museum. Staff were super and the affiliated French bakery is like being in Paris. Highly recommend.

title: Very nice!
text: Very nice and clean hotel! My boyfriend and I enjoyed our room. The bed was so comfy, the receptionist shanies and Maria were very welcoming and kind when we checked out. Would definitely go again. The cafe was very nice and next time I would love to try out the restaurant. :) Thank you

title: Great hotel!
text: My family loved this hotel! All staff from the front desk and door, to housekeeping were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, large enough for a family of 4, and the beds were so comfortable! This is the perfect location for walking to Central Park, restaurants, and our show at the Beacon. We loved using our vouchers the hotel provided for delicious coffee and pastries at Mille-feuille Bakery.

title: Great Boutique Hotel on the Upper West Side
text: Great location close to both Central Perk, Riverside Park and Subway, food markets and. Good value, all staff were both friendly and helpful.  Quiet, rooms clean and well appointed. Enjoyed the complimentary walking tour. Highly recommend

title: My go-to!
text: This is always my go-to hotel in NYC. The location is great (close to trains, shopping, and Central Park), rooms are clean and decent-sized for the city, and the staff is always so accommodating! I stay here pretty much every time I travel to NYC!

title: 🥳 A Very Happy Birthday Stay 🎉
text: I stayed at Hotel Belleclaire on my birthday weekend, and it was the best surprise! The room was beyond amazing: the bed, sheets, and pillows were clean and comfy; the bathroom was perfect; the tv and lights were super nice; and the views of the streets below were charming! On top of all that, the staff (Shanies and Veronica) made me feel so honored when they found out it’s my birthday weekend. Even better still, the price was better than nearby hotels.

title: Warm and elegant
text:
Such an elegant location and the staff is warm and welcoming. Shanies and Veronica were so kind upon check in and the location was perfect. 

Our room was beautiful and spacious with great views and plenty of light. We truly enjoyed our visit to Hotel Bellclaire!

title: Phenomenal service
text: Exceptional service from Maria & Shanies & Joelle at the front desk. They upgraded me upon checkin and changed my room with pleasure when some noisy guests checked in next door. The rooms are beautiful and the hotel is very chic and clean. The french cafe is AMAZING!!!

title: Great experience! Love this hotel!
text: Great location in very conveinent UWS neighborhood. Close to restaurants, Central Park, subway stop, Beacon Theater, lots of shopping and museums. The room looked and felt brand new. Immaculate, all redone with white Frette linens, very comfy bed and fluffy pillows and duvet. Bed and pillows were more comfortable than our own! Bathroom was well equipped with large shower, hot water and a magnified mounted make up mirror. Lots of light, mirrors, outlets. Front desk was so nice! Gave us an early check in and a free upgrade to king size bed. Such a nice thoughtful surprise. Felt so welcomed. French bakery off lobby and we were given vouchers for that. Our experience could not have been better. Highly recommend and will be choosing this hotel on our next visit. Thank you Hotel Belleclaire!

title: Brilliant hotel.
text: From the minute we checked in to the minute we checked out.everything was perfect.honestly could not fault this hotel.the room was big enough for two people,not much view out the window but I was not there to look out the window.i was on 2nd floor.beds were comfortable,large tv enough space for clothes.free safe large walk in shower.maid cleaned room every day and left us bottles of water.hotel was quiet on a night time so no disturbed sleep.lovely staff nothing was a problem for them.you get a $10 breakfast voucher each to use in the bakery which is very nice.we paid a deposit when we got there but that was returned when I got home.we paid a resort fee of $140 each room when we checked out but that was expected.(so you only really paying $40 after you get you food vouchers.)we checked out at 12pm and they booked us a taxi to the airport for 14:45 and kept our luggage for free until we were ready to go.there is a subway close by and shops.amsterdam avenue is close which has loads of places to eat.central Park is about a 10 min walk away.turn left out the hotel then walk straight down and your there 5 blocks away.i would definitely return to this hotel if I came back to new york.and highly recommended this hotel you won't be disappointed.

title: Friendly staff and great location
text: The hotel is in a great location and easy walk to Central Park and to public transport. The staff were very friendly and attentive, helping us with all our needs and questions about the local area. Would definitely recommend.

title: Small rooms, clean & quiet neighborhood
text: Hotel appears to have been recently renovated.  Common areas are bright and clean. Basic rooms are very small and dark with windows facing other parts of the hotel and not getting much light.  Bathrooms appear to have been renovated as well - marble and bright.  The room included a breakfast voucher that we used at the attached pastry shop.  Unfortunately, the hotel and pastry shop had inadequate seating so guests sat and ate on the lobby benches.  The neighborhood is quieter than the bustling tourist areas to the south but easily walkable.

title: We would stay here again!
text:
My wife and I did a quick 3-day trip to NYC and stayed at the Belleclaire. We had never stayed here before, and we really enjoyed it. The best thing was the staff. Joelle, Benedict, and Maria at the front desk were all totally friendly, helpful, and downright fun.
The rooms were fine—very clean and the linens were new and crisp and clean. The only problem was the cramped nature of the rooms—rather small, but that’s New York for you. Amenities basic and good.
Prices were moderate and came with vouchers of $10 per day per person for breakfast at the connected bakery (excellent) or restaurant (didn’t try).
Overall very nice experience.

title: Small nice hotel for intellectuals
text: Very nice staff for the most part. Room was small but nice. Great cleaning staff and bellhops/doorman. Continental breakfast is fun at the attached little bakery or kiosk in lobby. Lobby gets crowded and the cleaning guy tries to shoosh you out at 11. Other guests very nice and easy to talk to. Great location. Recommended!

title: Pre Christmas Holiday Visit
text: Belleclaire was recommended to me by a local, and I got a fabulous rate booking in advance. I have no complaints. 2 elevators, Angel was very pleasant at the Front desk. The upkeep is immaculate and breakfast was a voucher to the French Bakery on the first floor. The Bell Hop made my transition to JFK with a taxi and non issue. It would be difficult for me to stay elsewhere.

title: Upper West Side trip…
text:
Wonderful time!!   Clean..comfortable room.. the king size bed feels brand new!   We arrived at 8;45 in the morning… much much earlier than the scheduled check in time of 3:00pm.   The staff at the desk, Maria, Veronica and Shanies were friendly and professional.   Had a room all ready for us… the weary travelers!  
Thanks for a great time!!’

title: Really recommended!
text:
Posizione perfetta a Broadway , in 5 minuti a piedi tutto dritto sulla 75th sei a Central Park! Subway vicinissime! 
La suite dove abbiamo soggiornato molto ampia, pulita e con una vista bellissima!!! 
La backery è un altro punto a favore!!!
Ristorante Allure ottimo… 
Che dire?? Posto affascinante e perfetto per visitare in lungo e largo NYC

title: Great experience
text:
Le personnel est super attentionné, une attention particulière à veronica et Bennedict qui ont été incroyable ! 
Les viennoiseries délicieuses 
L hôtel est bien placé et le métro est à deux pas en particulier la galette des rois

title: Comfortable and friendly hotel
text: The hotel is clean and comfortable. Small rooms as expected in NYC, but quiet and in a great location—-with tasty pastries for breakfast in the cafe downstairs. Benedict and Veronica were super friendly and accommodating when we checked in, which we really appreciated.

title: Extremely well located, charming hotel with European feel.
text: The rooms are simple. But quite comfortable. The hotel is very well located. Outside the usual tourist areas in the fantastic Upper West Side with close proximity to restaurants, bars, museums and Central Park. A 10 minute straight shot subway ride to Times Square. Only a little longer to Chelsea, West Village, and Tribeca.

title: Lovely little hotel, friendly staff, great location.
text: We stay here every time we come to NYC. The staff are always very friendly and the rooms very clean. The beds are VERY comfortable. We stay in small rooms with king beds, but they are well lit and comfortable---the new heating system worked great. We were never too hot or too cold.  The only downside was that just one elevator worked the whole time we were there.  We stayed on the second floor so that wasn't a big issue for us because we took the stairs, but it was a bit slow getting our bags down when we were ready to leave.  We love this location because we can walk to the park and to many museums, but the hotel is also convenient to subway and buses. There are also good restaurants in walking distance, some that are pretty affordable for NYC!

title: Soggiorno nell'Upper west side
text:
PRO: L'hotel non è male ed è in una posizione comoda vicinissimo alla linea 1 della metro che porta ovunque e a due passi dal Central Park. La zona è molto tranquilla, vicino ci sono alcuni locali e ristoranti. Le camere non sono molto grandi, noi avevamo una queen doppia. Il personale è molto gentile. La colazione è compresa, danno un voucher giornaliero di 10 dollari da usarsi nella bakery attaccata all'hotel (sappiate che con 10 dollari prendete un caffè e un cornetto). Servizio di pulizia/cambio asciugamani giornaliero.
CONTRO: un solo ascensore minuscolo per tutto l'hotel (l'altro fuori servizio) con file interminabili per salire. Code lunghissime per la colazione, che è buona ma gli addetti sono lentissimi e il locale è microscopico. L'acqua calda arriva dopo un quarto d'ora (se arriva), almeno a noi che eravamo all'ottavo piano. La wifi funziona a singhiozzo (ricordatevi di disattivare i dati perchè quando si stacca la wifi sennò son dolori). Un giorno non hanno rifatto la camera e quando glielo abbiamo fatto notare hanno detto che ormai le cameriere erano andate via.

title: Eloise can keep the Plaza--I'll take the Belleclaire!
text: What a lovely hotel!  Totally remodeled and retaining its original charm, with comfortable, modern rooms with all the amenities one would expect, including high-end duvet bedding, Frette towels, and nice furniture.  Modern baths with glass showers (HGTV would approve) and soaps/shampoos provided.  The front desk clerks were very nice and the bellman especially helpful.  Elevators were small, but guests remained cheerful and there is a service elevator available. Saving the best for last -- guests receive two tickets, worth about $10 each toward breakfast at the Mille Feuille Cafe off the lobby, serving expresso/cappucino/etc.; croissants, quiche, pastries, and other French treats.  This is now my favorite hotel in Manhattan.

title: Will stay here again.
text:
My adult daughter and I stayed at Hotel Belleclaire for three nights. We really thought the hotel was beautiful, very clean, and we were surprised that we didn’t hear much street noise. 
I would stay here again.

The subway was very convenient.

title: Highly recommended
text: Great location, close to the subway stations and groceries stores. The neighborhood feels safe to walk around in the evenings. The room is very clean with a nice view of Broadway. Awesome service - Shanies made our day :)

title: Service made it worth it
text: Benedict was exceptional!! Friendly and accommodating from the minute we arrived. The location was great close to everything, small but charming. The location was perfect and close to anything you might need. Would stay again. Thank you Benedict and shanies

title: A great hotel with exceptional staff in a charming, lively neighborhood
text: Beautiful hotel within walking distance of lots of great shops and restaurants in the neighborhood, as well as Central Park and the Natural History Museum. The staff went above and beyond to help make this a great trip - they were all so friendly, especially Shanies. We had a corner suite, which was beautiful, neat as a pin, and spacious. We loved the extras, such as the breakfast coupon to the excellent downstairs cafe. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Cosy and convenient
text: A cosy and convenient spot, close to the subway, CVS, central park and the American Natural History Museum. Shanies was super helpful upon checking in, and the staff were very accommodating throughout the stay! Would highly recommend, we will be coming back for sure!

title: Nice to be back in NYC
text: I’ve stayed at the hotel for one week. The location is great, near Lincoln Center, Natural History Museum and Central Park. It is not as noisy as a Times Square hotel. The area is quiet and tow blocks away from Metro station line 1 or 5 blocks away from Metro stations 2 and 3. Aside from other hotels in NY, they give you a 10 dollar ticket a day to purchase your breakfast at Mille-foullie, a French bakery next to the hotel. Although is expensive, you can get a coffee and a pastry, and the pastries are delicious. The only negative thing is that it is very small and very little place to dine in. You can get your breakfast at the hotel’s restaurant, but between 9 and 10 am it is hard to find a place to sit, I suggest to go earlier. The rooms are well equipped but there is no fridge in common rooms, only in suites. Beds are very comfortable, and so are pillows . There is only one elevator working, if you are lucky and get higher floors, you can always get in but if you are in 4th floor or less, you always have to wait. Elevators are too old and there is a service elevator in case of emergency, cause the day the only one working, broke down, we have to use the emergency one. People from reception are very nice and comfy, and I have to congratule Jaelle, Benedict and Mark, that been very nice and helpful with me. I had a problem with the tidy up room service, that for two days in a row, they forgot to come in, and people from reception come up with a quick and helpful solution. I love New York, and this time was my fifth visit, I definitely will come back and come back to Belleclaire. Have a nice Holidays and happy new year!

title: Amazing Location!
text: Hotel staff were so friendly and accommodating, and gave us great lunch and dinner recommendations.  The complimentary coffee and bakery pastries (esp. the chocolate croissant) are amazing.  It's right near the amazing Zabars - be sure to go on the last day of your stay and stock up!  Central Park and the Museum of Natural History and the MET were all walkable distances.  I loved walking to Central Park in the earlier morning and seeing about 25 dogs playing everywhere.  It's very close to the subway station, and I love the new system where you just swipe your credit card now right at the turnstile versus buying tickets at the confusing pay stations. While the room was small (they all are in NYC!), it was so clean, and the bed was very comfortable. We make an annual visit to from NH annually, and Hotel Belleclaire will definitely be a hotel we stay at again. It has been our favorite so far - best location!

title: Exceptional Hotel
text: I had a heartwarming experience at Hotel Belleclaire when I ordered a bottle of champagne and treats for my daughter. To my surprise, the manager refused payment and went the extra mile by sending a congratulatory card. The genuine kindness and generosity of the staff will truly make their stay unforgettable. Hotel Belleclaire not only provides excellent service but also adds a personal touch that sets it apart. I highly recommend this hotel for its exceptional hospitality and thoughtful gestures.

title: Grosse déception
text:
Grosse déception pour cet hôtel… L’accueil est médiocre, le personnel n’étant pas aux services de ses clients (la moindre question dérange le personnel de l’accueil…). De plus, la chambre était de piètre qualité avec une vue sur un mur, aucun rangement ni dans la salle de bain, ni du côté pièce à vivre. 
Nous y avons séjourné 5 jours. Nous avions eu qu’un rouleau de papier toilette, jamais plus… nous étions obligés de descendre à l’accueil pour en demander un. 

Pas de petit déjeuner mais la boulangerie Mille feuille au pied de l’hôtel est bien. L’hôtel propose un système de bon d’achat. 

Points positifs : chambre très calme, silencieuse, literie confortable et emplacement central.

title: A Westside Gem
text: An older hotel with lots of charm that they are currently upgrading but did not effect our stay. Our corner room was large, comfortable and quiet. The French bakery was as good as advertised. Shanien (sp?) at the front desk was pleasant and accommodating. Great neighborhood, would love to go back.

title: Excellent welcome to NYC
text:
Excellent assistance upon arrival! Shanies was amazing and so helpful!
She allowed us to check in early, complimentary bottle of wine, and credits to the bakery for every morning. 
What a nice welcome after an early morning flight. She gave our holiday trip to NYC an excellent start!

Thank you

title: GREAT except for breakfast
text: I had a very nice stay with the Hotel Belleclaire. Great location, welcoming staff, lovely room (spacious, well-appointment, super quiet & comfortable). The only downside is the breakfast. The bakery next door cannot handle the volume. Long lines in the morning lead to frustrated people and harried bakery employees. I stood in line on the first morning for 20 minutes and finally gave up. Made for a very grumpy start to the day. Otherwise, thumbs up!

title: A Delightful Stay at Hotel Belleclaire!
text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Belleclaire during my trip to New York City, and I couldn't be more pleased with the experience.  The staff went above and beyond to help us with our questions.  Our room was compact but very clean, and the bed was great.  Absolutely amazing accommodation, we will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent accommodations in a fine NYC location
text: Our room was comfortable, quiet and spacious. Service was friendly and efficient. The upper west side location, close to Lincoln Center, was convenient and safe. Breakfast, in the form of a $10 USD voucher for the adjoining Mille-Feuille boulangerie / pâtisserie / café, was adequate.

title: CLEAN, friendly, comfortable and great location
text:
CLEAN! Friendly! Great location for restaurants, transportation and touring. Easy stroll to beautiful Central Park. The interior is a gleaming Art Nouveau surprise - setting the tone for a New York visit! Everything you need - a comfortable, quiet lounge at the end of the hall. Well placed benches near the entrance, for awaiting uber or friends. A moody, inviting bar/restaurant and best of all - the very popular French bakery on site,  and even better - the room comes with vouchers for the bakery. The bakery food is fresh and delicious, says me, the bakery snob. 
We stayed the night for our daughter's wedding, and upgraded to the New Amsterdam suite, with bath & ½, water in the fridge, microwave - great for the bride dressing and prepping with friends and family! And a great option for a long stay. The suite has huge windows with views of sky and pretty buildings on the side street (and blackout blinds for sleeping). It was quiet sleeping. We really loved the suite - highly recommend. It's bigger than our daughter's NYC apartment!! Everything was comfortable, simple, and most importantly - deeply clean. 
Our first impression of the hotel was the lobby restroom which was shockingly clean midday - not easy to maintain. That made us very happy.
I'm taking the time to post reviews of this hotel because we did have an issue we couldn't resolve when we were there, due to the sudden Go Time rush of a wedding (which was in Central Park -- this is a great hotel for that location!). I emailed the hotel when I returned home and received an IMMEDIATE response, which was a happy surprise. The issue was professionally resolved, and THAT is what impressed me the most. Now we can confidently recommend this hotel, and we would stay again. 
If you’re wondering if you should stay here, we think you should feel comfortable booking the reservation! Have fun!

title: Roach motel
text: Checked in late and was getting ready for bed. Found a live cockroach on my pillow. Called the desk and they moved us to another room. The room was very warm and thermostat didn’t work. Couldn’t connect to WiFi unless I paid for premium. There was only 1 wash cloth for the 2 of us. When checking out all they gave us was elongating the $26 facilities fee. I took their survey they emailed and someone reached out to apologize. I asked them to Comp our room but didn’t get a response. $365 roach hotel per night!

title: Great staff and location
text: I had a wonderful stay!  I was able to check in early which was a godsend and all of the hotel staff were friendly and accommodating.  The room was cozy and comfortable and the location is walkable to everything you need.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great overall experience
text: The staff was friendly and helpful, it was located in a very walkable area and when we asked if we could change the room from one king to two queens they were able to accommodate us. Overall great time.

title: Joelle and Benedicl made this trip and stay the best!!
text: Upon check in, Joelle and Benedicl welcomed us with such warm greetings and smiles and have helped accommodate me and my family beyond to what was really necessary. They are the best and have made our trip and stay so much better and were given a high floor room with an amazing view! I appreciate you guys so much and thank you. Hotel Belleclaire is such great location and so clean with great staff. I wouldn't choose to stay anywhere else. When I come back to New York, I will for sure stay here again. Thank you Joelle and Benedicl for everything!

title: Very helpful front desk, got is in our room quickly and our luggage delivered to our room.
text: Benedict , Joelle and Veronica showed real class to our accommodations. Benedict solved an issue with our booking quicker than I could think and I received nothing but smiles from Joelle and Veronica. Recommend 10/10 would return in a 💓 heartbeat. They set the bar high for other hotels in the area.

title: New York has lots of hotels, i'd select an other one.
text:
I stayed Hotel Belleclaire Nov 7th to 14th 2023. I booked my accommodation prepaid, so all room charges were paid before arrival. On arrival they wanted to have credit card. That's normal, but i did not know that they were going to double charge the room for whole stay. After my return to Finland i noticed they had charged additional $2500 for the stay from my credit card, even though i had paid whole over $3500 for it already. I made a reclaim, and they replied they'd refund it in 10 to 15 over business days, but they never did.
It's a nice hotel, nice atmosphere,  nice personnel, nice rooms but i recommend never to pay them anything in advance, because they can't be trusted and they might double charge you, like they did to me. 
I have been there twice, for the first and the last time.

title: Outstanding Front Desk personnel and clean, comfy rooms!
text: Shanies gave the perfect warm welcome and was so accommodating to ensure my daughter and I had a lovely stay!   She set the tone for a delightful stay.  We will definitely come back to stay at this hotel!

title: The Belleclaire is clearly the best boutique hotel in the Upper West Side
text: The hotel continues to get better and better, upgrading the rooms to where they are luxurious and modern while keeping the art nouveau style. The rooms are free from noise in the hall or on Broadway, the rugs are deep and soft, the blinds are electric allowing you to choose to let in the light and street scenes. The bathrooms are complete with excellent shower, room to place your items and toiletries. There is now a bar with a very pleasant bartender, a small restaurant with a separate coffee stand alongside a french cafe with the best pastries, coffee and macarons. The front desk (hats off to Shanies Hunte) sets the stage for making you feel important by knowing your name and in my case, my history of staying there many times over the years. Thanks also to Benedict and Joelle. They are ready with suggestions and get you whatever you need to make your stay complete. Tours of the area are free and available. I heartily recommend the Belleclaire.

title: So many annoyances
text: So many annoyances. First, grossly overpriced at $600 a night (including tax) for a tiny room without even a closet or a single hanger. Taking advantage of the new ban on Airbnb's? Adding insult to the price injury, as we checked out of our pre-paid room, they added a $30 "facility/resort fee." For what? This is no resort, and they had already charged me $600 for access to their "facility." Protesting did no good. WiFi was very weak, and was limited to one device per person, so you can't use hotel WiFi on both a cellphone and a tablet unless you have multiple different email addresses; I do and it still didn't work. I've never seen this in any other hotel we've stayed at. Walls were paper thin; we went to bed listening to someone across the hall and one room down tongue-lashing her partner for a half-hour. Were awakened before 7am Sunday morning by someone in the next room on an extended phone call. So we went downstairs to get coffee and a pastry at the in-house breakfast bar. The hotel provided complimentary coupons as part of the room price; how nice! The place was so tiny that the slow-moving line stretched down the hall - this just for hotel patrons trying to take advantage of the "free" continental breakfast coupons. We went out for breakfast and the line was still there when we returned. Ugh.

title: Awesome hotel on every level
text:
I love this hotel. It has a very international feeling. The rooms are small but comfortable and very tidy. You get a bottle of wine and a voucher to their patisserie / cafe- the pastries are very good and the front desk staff are also friendly. I made a call for a blanket and help with my thermostat and both happened very quickly.  The location is very central too. I walked to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, through the lovely Central Park in 20 minutes. It’s my second time staying here and i will definitely stay again if the opportunity arises.

Shout out to Shanies for help with my
late checkout. (Nov 20th 2023)

title: Excellent stay, service, the restaurant was great food, the hospitality for the vouchers for the French cafe extra nice!
text: The entire experience at the hotel was truly pleasant! Excellent service every day by these kind and attentive hotel staff, Maria at the desk, Hector helping in and out of the hotel for my numerous trips in n and out of the hotel! Sare’ was an excellent service and guidance attendant and Shari , awesome. Room was up to expectations and the area was quiet for sleeping! Thank you for making my first stay with you terrific! Will recommend and be coming back! Janine T Roe

title: Canadians in New York
text: We enjoyed our experience very much. There are a few challenges with the elevator and the lines for breakfast daily which is why I gave it a four I would’ve given 4 1/2 but that was not an option. We enjoyed our time and we would recommend this place to anyone it is beautifully located off of 76 street close to Subway options but less hustle and bustle and being further downtown central Park was four blocks over very convenient. Staff was very good and accessible. Just some logistics in the hotel challenges that we felt were challenging for us.

title: When we travel to NYC, for business or pleasure, this is our spot!
text: When we travel to NYC, for business or pleasure, this is our spot! The location is perfect and great for walks to Central Park, it also feels very safe when going on adventures with my kids. The hotel has so much character and a really cool history. (Look it up!) The staff is second to none. Comfy beds with cool views!

title: Cool hotel tucked into the upper west side
text: We stayed at the Belleclaire recently for a quick getaway to visit friends in the neighborhood.  It is in a beautiful old building but has been renovated with modern touches. Our room was very small but functional—just what we needed since we were out and about. The bar area was very cool, especially the solarium above with the building lit at night, and the F&B offerings were excellent. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating and the location was great with easy access to the upper west side.

title: Colaboradores y serviciales
text: Quiero agradecer la amabilidad de todo el staff a mi llegada, tuve un problema con mi pasaporte (pensaba lo había perdido) y una de las personas del front desk Miss Angel nos ayudò e incluso facilitò las cámaras para saber dónde lo había guardado. Un estresazo momentáneo donde fueron de gran ayuda

title: Boutique hotel with great front desk staff
text:
Excellent hotel in a great UWS location. Benedict and Michael were particularly helpful. 

I also enjoyed the morning patisseries!
I had a nice newly refurbished corner room which I enjoyed. I’ll be back.

title: Wonderful hotel with the best customer service!
text: Based on the great reviews we decided to book this hotel for our family vacation and we are so happy we did! The hotel is at a great location close to lots of restaurants and the subway. The hotel staff were very helpful and accommodating when we asked for an upgrade to conjoining rooms and wanted to add a night. Thanks so much to Shances and Maria for being so kind and helpful. We definitely plan to come back to this wonderful hotel!

title: Thanksgiving at HB!
text:
Such a great experience at the property this past week / accommodated every request for our larger family group and what a great neighborhood for a home base in NYC!

Our kiddos loved the bakery downstairs and also check out the Lush store on ground level next to the hotel.  Will be back next time we visit!!

title: Pleasant Experience
text: I am pleasantly surprised by this hotel and will stay here again. First, the price was right! It has been recently updated, has a location convenient to the subway, has an attached bar with food, and an attached French bakery. Being an older building, I was expecting a smaller room than we received. Bottled water is complimentary. Staff is friendly and helpful. Our room is quiet, maybe because it does not face the street. The only downside is the small elevators, and currently one is out of service. If you don’t mind taking the stairs and you’re on a low floor, you wouldn’t even notice this inconvenience, but we are on an upper floor and in our upper years. Not a huge problem, just a minor annoyance until the third elevator is fixed. Overall, a pleasant experience.

title: The best hotel in NY - Hotel Belleclaire
text:
The Hotel is very confortable and the neighborhood is beautiful, Robert Holmes who’s the manager and Shanies always give us a support and great hospitality.

Thanks for all this experience in thanksgiving days! I recommend totally this hotel.

title: Great staff and lovely hotel!
text: The front desk staff was SO gracious and professional. They went above and beyond to make us welcome. Benedict, Maria and Shanies are fantastic!  They worked together to correct our room error all the while maintaining friendly and professional demeanor.

title: The best attitude
text: Despite the fact that the hotel was under renovation and one of the elevators was out of service, the attitude of the hotel staff was amazing, excellent. The people who did us the favor of assisting us at the reception were the most professional and friendly that I have rarely found in any hotel. (Maria, Veronica, Bennedict, Shanie) thanks a lot!

title: Great location and great atmosphere with lovely staff
text:
I've stayed in the Belleclaire and the hotel has really benefited from its renovations, the lobby is now welcoming and a pleasant place to be. The rooms are a good size for NYC with pleasant bathrooms. 
We stayed on a Wednesday night and enjoyed the fantastic location near Zabars, Levain and Riverside as well as Central Park during our morning in the city. The hotel does offer vouchers for the bakery downstairs which you can redeem for a delicious breakfast, I recommend the lemon croissant! Staff are brilliant in the hotel and at the bakery. 
The small points to note are that the elevators for the hotel are tiny so if you're on a lower floor you may struggle to catch a lift around check out time. The hotel was very busy with school groups and flight crews in the morning which can make the lobby overcrowded but that wasn't a massive problem.

title: Accomodation
text: Good location, metro walking distance, cozy room, voucher for breakfast, helpful front Office. Upper West side is a quiet location, several restaurants and cafes are walking distance and sane for supermarket.

title: Homey elegance in NYC
text: Quaint hotel on the Upper West Side.  Well located for Lincoln Center, shopping & dining. Lots of Old World Charm like crown molding, marble bathrooms, marble staircases, etc. brought to modern standards. Lovely staff that follows through on requests as promised (Shanies & Veronica). Front door crew makes you smile coming & going. French bakery on site with La Colombe coffee is a bonus!

title: Beautiful, Clean Hotel
text: Beautiful hotel with Clean Rooms, great location, beautiful restaurant and lounge, great service will stay here again!!! A few blocks from the park, CVS across the street, bakery and coffee shop down stairs is amazing!!

title: Perfect Hotel
text: Shanies was so helpful and accommodating. This is our second time here and it’s always been exceptional. We were able to receive an early check in and we were upgraded to a suite with additional beds. Above and beyond. The complimentary breakfast from the French bakery was also outstanding.

title: Great find! our new favorite place to stay in NYC.
text: Beautifully decorated and retains its old world charm. Fabulous location- best neighborhood in NYC! Rooms are quiet  due to double windows. The folks at the front desk and throughout were helpful , funny and knowledgeable- thanks, Maria, Shane's, Angel and Hector! And don't miss the delicious French bakery and cafe in the lobby.

title: Hard Pass
text:
Take a hard pass on this hotel.  Despite spending over $700 for one night, this was the tiniest hotel room I have ever stayed in.  The bathroom door couldn’t open all the way as it hit into the bed.  The only way I could open my suitcase was to put it in my bed or to open it in front of the door - thereby preventing me from being able to exit the room.  Not a very safe option if I had to get out quickly at night.  The window looked onto a huge AC unit that blocked all light from coming in., making the room feel coffin like.  There was no coffee maker or refrigerator in the room.  There wasn’t even an iron or steamer- a real issue when you’re traveling for work.  On top of this the room wasn’t even very clean - there was trash in the corner.

Seriously- just take a hard pass.

title: Strongly recommended
text: Great location, near Central Park, American Museum of Natural History, and Zabar's; friendly and helpful staff (should mention especially Maria, Shais, and Hector); comfortable family room, with one kingsize bed and queen-size ones.

title: Nice room, an ok stay
text:
Stayed in room 831, good size but close to the lift.
Room was clean and well prepared, size was good.
Location was good, only 2 blocks from 79th St metro and a short walk to Central Park. Times Square was about 20-25mins walk too.
The cafe downstairs was included and although people were saying the queues were busy, we found it ok. 5-10mins on average if anything… but after a few days we were tired of the pastries too.
If we were not so tired from the day I think the noise would have bothered us a little more. The aircon constantly hums in the central corridor from level 0 and the noise in the corridors too.
Overall, it was an ok stay.

title: Beautiful, comfortable and quiet.
text:
We stayed in the Hudson Loft (room 922) from 11/6 through the 14th. My granddaughter started a new job in NY and we needed a home base while looking for an apartment. Hotel Belleclaire exceeded all expectations. Our room had a wonderful view of the Hudson and the hotel provided a mini-fridge and tea kettle during our stay. The room was spacious and the bathroom was truly luxurious. I slept very soundly in the comfy king bed and both my granddaughter and I took full advantage of the huge bathtub. There is a Lush store just next to the hotel where we bought lovely bath salts and bubbles. 

Coming back to the Hotel Belleclaire at the end of the day was so comforting and relaxing. Housekeeping staff were very kind and we came back to a spotless room every day. The wine hours from 5-6 on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday were a nice bonus. I regret that I didn’t catch the names of the people on the front desk, but they were always helpful. 

The adjacent restaurant, Allure, was excellent when we were just too tired to seek out a spot in the neighborhood. And the breakfast vouchers for MilleFleurs bakery were much appreciated. 

My only comment, as others have said, is that a proper lobby would be nice. Allure has a nice seating area but it seems like they’d hadn’t worked out how or when hotel guests were welcome in there. Most people wound up sitting on the benches in front of the door. That was ok but chilly each time the door opened. It was also noisy when guests were coming or going. 

The bellmen were awesome too. 
I will undoubtedly return to Hotel Bellclaire in the future.

title: Elegant and easy.
text: Joelle and Benedict at the front were a charming and welcoming duo.    They saved us at least $50 by offering to upgrade us to two beds instead of a solo queen.   Very thoughtful.   Also the hallways are a gorgeous Willy Wonka esque labyrinth -- you have to check them out.  The place is elegant, and gentle.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
Wonderful stay at the Belleclaire Hotel !

All the staff was very nice. 
Special thanks to Maria
Our request was accepted and she managed to give us a new room with a better view. We appreciate that. 

Very confortable bed.

We will keep a very nice memory of the hotel. 

Take care ! 

Hortense & Viktor

title: Best hotels at NY
text: Everyone working at that hotel are very kind. The hotel is very beautiful from the outside and the inside, bed was comfortable, there’s no noise from the outside so you will take an incredible rest. I was having some trouble but Karen and Sare helped me a lot, they seré so kind. I definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Hotel Belleclaire, Upper West Side Gem
text: Conveniently located, comfortable stay, delicious breakfast and accommodating staff.  Sare, the bellman, was the most hospitable and helpful person who made us feel welcome.  I will definitely return and will recommend to friends.

title: Great Hotel!
text:
We stayed for 2 nights and we had a very relaxing stay. The staff are friendly and the beds were comfortable. On top of that, it’s quiet!

The location is really the reason this place is great. It’s a short walk from the Museum of Natural History and Central Park and about a 45 minute walk from Time’s Square and the theaters. Mom and I did not need to pay for a cab to get around. 

If you are looking for a less expensive hotel in Manhattan that’s in a great and walkable area, 100% recommend this hotel.

title: Marathon Weekend
text: We stayed at Hotel Belleclaire during marathon weekend and they truly went above and beyond! The service from the staff during check-in, at the bakery, after the race, and as we were checking-out was wonderful—all smiles and always looking to help. Not knowing much about Manhattan, this was the perfect location for the race. We were close a couple blocks from the finish line!

title: Great boutique hotel on the upper West Side
text: A great boutique hotel on the upper West Side within walking distance to Central Park and convenient to major bus lines and subway. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. The coupons for breakfast at the adjacent French bakery give you a yummy and quick breakfast. The rooms are small but equipped with everything you need. I strongly recommend.

title: In USA alberghi americani e non francesizzanti;  In the USA American and non-French hotels
text:
Negli USA amano molto la Francia. 
Invece noi italiani così così. 
Tutto fumo e niente arrosto. 
Stanza con un bagno minuscolo 
Non esiste una hall dell’albergo né una sala per la colazione. 
Che si fa - nel baretto francese attaccato all’hotel con un buono da 10 dollari a persona che copre a malapena un cappuccino e una brioche. 
Dimenticate le belle colazioni americane. 

In the USA they love France very much.

Instead we Italians so so.

All smoke and no roast.

Room with a tiny bathroom

There is no hotel lobby or breakfast room.

What do you do - in the French bar attached to the hotel with a $10 per person voucher that barely covers a cappuccino and a brioche.

Forget the nice American breakfasts.

title: my favorite Upper West Side hotel
text:
We had an amazing stay. Everyone was so welcoming and nice. Great hospitality.
They also have an amazing bakery inside the hotel. ( you should definitely try their macrons )
Perfect location .There are several restaurants and grocery around the hotel. Also, it’s only few blocks from the beautiful central park.

title: Not a 4 star hotel
text: Not even close to a 4 star hotel, lack of amenities, construction in hallway. Poor and slow service. There are much better hotels in the area. Only thing going for them is it is let friendly. Long line for the free breakfast. Staff was friendly, but not enough around for good service

title: What a cute hotel!
text:
I stayed here with my 4 year old as a home base for our quick two night trip. Overall, the hotel was beautiful and the staff was very friendly and helpful. A few small tweaks and this could have been a 5 star review.

I found it strange there was absolutely no welcome packet or info about the amenities in the room. It would have been helpful to know about things like when checkout time was, what the options were for breakfast, local spots to check out, etc. 

On the topic of in-room amenities, for a hotel with such a gorgeous exterior and lobby, the interior of the room was pretty sterile. Virtually no place to store anything in the shower or bathroom, and only a single hanging photo.

The only other thing that bothered me was that I was granted a later checkout, but found out the hard way that my key was disabled regardless. Thank goodness  the housekeeper was in the room next door to let me in. 

Overall, I’d stay here again!

title: Charming hotel in great location with some downsides
text:
We had high hopes for this hotel and for the most part, they met the requirements.  The room was a good size and overlooked Broadway.  The location is superb.  I made sure I took advantage of the complimentary benefits (breakfast vouchers, wine night, free walking tour) since I am essentially paying for them.  However, the breakfast vouchers meant everyone at the hotel is waiting in the same line - give yourself at least 30 minutes each morning.  The selections of pastries and espresso was great but fruit options were nil.  By the 5th day, I was tired of the breakfast.  

Also, with it being an old hotel, our shower's temperature controls were OUTSIDE the shower/tub itself.  With a piece of fixed glass covering half the tub, you have to get inside the tub to turn on the water and if the temperature isn't satisfactory, you have to then get out and fix it outside the tub (in front of toilet).  Our rug had pet hair that hadn't been vacuumed thoroughly.  Also, no fridge (despite what Tripadvisor says) or kettle in the room - would've been nice to have.  

Front desk service was fabulous. The bed was very comfortable.  As others have mentioned, the elevators are tiny - we were lucky to be on the 8th floor but we had to pass by many folks on the 5-6 floors.  All in all, we had a nice stay but for the price and "resort fees", I may choose one where I just grab my own breakfasts and sign up for free tours on foot.  Although the hotel talks about providing all these "complimentary" items such as wine night and walking tours, the "resort fees" really cover activities you may or may not partake.

title: Hotel Belleclaire,  Easy warmth and charm, updated to meet the now!
text:
Jonathan, Joelle, Benedict, Ange, Juan. Not familiar with the names?Y You will be after your stay at Hotel Belleclaire, a former Grande Dame of New York's Upper West Side, but no snob. Those names are attached to a few of the smiling faces you will meet during your stay. They and their equally charming, helpful colleagues will do their best to accommodate your every need and make your stay memorable. 

Built around 1903 and once home to the likes of Mark Twain and Babe Ruth, Belleclaire received a major facelift in 2008. A fitness room was added. The lobby was updated in 2013, and, voila, back to the future was complete.

The (relatively) modestly priced digs at Belleclaire felt Scandinavian modern - read understated elegance or all things minimal, but essential in place.

Our only gripe was a temperamental internet. But at our departure Jonathan, who is director of the front office, happily informed us the whole system was about to be updated. In addition, the hotel will soon host a brand new restaurant  called Allure.  Jonathan also told us his favorite rooms at Belleclaire are the Broadway Kings (?).  If we did not get that quite right, ask any of the above hosts for one of the rooms with rounded walls. 

Faces make places and the list above really aim (and almost always succeed) to please. 

Comfortable digs,  a helpful staff, a great location, reasonably priced, with plenty of built-in amenities. Unless you require white gloves and deep bows, who could ask for anything more?

title: Great Service!
text: Hector, Shanie & Maria are fantastic & so    helpful!!  3rd stay this season - convenient UWS location.  Close to the 1 line & Central Park.  Nancy Langdon, Columbia Football Parents Club President/Indianapolis, Indiana

title: Great place to stay
text: A really fun place to stay with excellent customer service.  Very clean, comfortable rooms. Renovations have been tastefully done with attention to maintaining the ambiance. Great location   Maria and rest of the staff friendly, knowledgeable and willing to help.

title: Nice little place
text: Very cozy hotel in excellent location near Central Park, Upper West Side. Very clean, finished, elegant. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms soberly and elegantly furnished, with every comfort. Breakfast available at a romantic French patisserie next door (Mille Feuilles). To return.

title: Bon hôtel
text: Nous avions réservé une chambre de luxe avec lit king size pour 10 jours J'avoue que de prime abord j'étais satisfaite. Mais c'est en ouvrant le store que j'ai été un peu déçue. Aucune vue, juste sur le mur d'en face. Aucun rangement pour la salle de bains. Rien pour poser la trousse de toilette (pas pratique). Sinon chambre propre (bien que pas nettoyée un jour sur les 10 jours) et literie confortable. Mais je n'aurais pas qualifié cette chambre "de luxe". Concernant l'hôtel, personnel très gentil et à l'écoute du client. Quelques désagréments pour le petit déjeuner, car manque de place. Globalement je conseillerais cette hôtel.  Proche de toutes commodités (métro, restaurants, commerces...). Quartier très sûr.

title: Great stay at Belleclaire.
text: Quaint and quiet hotel.  Staff were very welcoming.  Small but nice gym and cafe at the hotel. Rooms were spacious as well. Close to transit and Central Park.  Lots of her eat restaurants and the Beacon Theatre is only two blocks away.  Everything you need to enjoy NYC.

title: Great hotell!
text: Really lovely hotel at for me, that like walking, in a great place. The room was really nice and the servcie great. They had a cafe where you could pick up  breakfast but no restaurant (yet). Great and really helpful staff.

title: Boutique Charm with Updated Finishes in the UWS
text:
The Belleclaire is a gem, blending Beaux Arts Charm with modern updates and high-end finishes. The hotel provides excellent service. The linens and bed are comfortable and the room and all public spaces are immaculate. 

The staff are first-rate. Friendly, professional, knowledgeable, and accommodating, you will feel like you’ve stepped back in time to an earlier, friendlier era in this small boutique hotel.

They have updated a sitting area and high-end cocktail bar, serving small bites at night, or a cozy place to chat and rest over complimentary coffee and croissants in the morning. 

The Upper West Side location is really special for visitors who want a different perspective of NYC. It is safe, quiet, and has a neighborhood feeling with cafes, restaurants, stores, and proximity to a safe subway or short rides in taxis and Ubers to take you to Broadway theaters, Soho, the Highline, and much more. For opera and ballet fans, Lincoln Center is a safe walk just minutes away. 

Since Covid, and with a push for “green,” even high end hotels are cleaning rooms only upon request or once every few days. We simply asked for extra towels, and our room was cleaned thoroughly. Just ask. 

Times Square is hectic, noisy, and filled with tourist attractions. Step away from the big hotels and book early for a European style getaway.

First class experience in a world class city.

title: Lazy, hostel standard service
text: Location is very good.Service is lazy, in 4 days visit the room was cleaned only ONCE so not hotel standard. We did point out this after first day and next day it was cleaned. 3rd day no cleaning or towels, no rubbish taken. Toilet paper we had to ask from reception.

title: ungenügend - kein 4-Sterne Hotel!
text: Lage: Einzig Gutes am Hotel. Frühstück: Gutscheinen fürs Café, Essen/Trinken aus Plastik in der Lobby. Management unfreundlich/unprofessionel. Zimmer: Kein Wasser, keine Minibar, oft zu wenig Handtücher, Duschmittel, WC-Papier.

title: Great location, great people

title: Great Staff and Great Location
text: The front desk staff were very accommodating. We needed a room change and all worked out, Very clean hotel room. And we got an iron and ironing board on request, Great location near Central Park and fabulous restaurants and cafes nearby. Would stay there again.

title: BEST Boutique Hotel!!!

The hotel offers FREE anchor hour a few nights a week plus free umbrellas when necessary. It's clean, comfortable beds and just a fantastic unique boutique hotel. Truly this hotel will not disappoint!!! 10 Star rating!!!

text: great location, breakfast coups for the bakery next door are very useful but pro tip-do not use them for the coffee cart in the lobby-actually go next door(handy cut thru doorway n lobby) & u will have a far wider selection of options for your coupon! the room itself was ok, a bit spartan, bathrm tiny, one needs to request a bathrobe, which was immediately provided. service was excellent. easy stairwell access. a lot is squeezed into a small area, all over the hotel. it felt a bit tight everywhere i went.

title: Love Hotel Belleclaire in New York City.
text: I stay at the Hotel Belleclaire every time I go to NYC because of the great service and outstanding staff. Great location and the right price. Try it and enjoy a delightful stay. Also, great restaurants near by and parks too.

title: Old World Charm
text:
We stayed in a premium room for 4 nights and really loved our stay. The room was big enough and the bed was quite comfortable. The hotel is nicely located and we alternated between taking the subway and walking to midtown. Zabar’s deli is nearby and we would pick up lunch there and picnic in Central Park. The elevator was slow at times so we would walk down from the 8th floor. We enjoyed the French breakfast, but no matter what time we went, the line up was usually too long a wait for us. There is service of regular coffee and some pastries at the front desk which was a better option for us. The gluten free muffins were fantastic!
We will definitely return.

title: Fantastic trip and stay at Hotel Belleclaire
text:
Staff were so wonderful. Big thanks to Maria for all her wonderful help in navigating my way around NY. Saved me a lot of angst and not to mention stop me getting lost!! 😙 
All the staff were so accommodating and friendly, Benefit, Shines and especially so for 2 other front desk staff who always offered lovely assistance and a warm chat and smile.
The gym was great to keep my training schedule. Daily breakfast was wonderful at the cafe downstairs. Room was lovely and well serviced. Definitely want to go back. Thanks a million for everything. Highly recommend this beautiful hotel.

title: Lovely hotel for trip to New York City.

Front desk Staff very pleasant and helpful and room was well maintained by the first floor housekeeping. Would definitely recommend and return. Cafe Mille Feuille next door was super for coffee and pastries in the morning.

Congratulations to them!

title: Great 4 night stay!
text: A great find in the upper west side. We stayed for 4 nights and found the staff very helpful and the location was ideal with its close proximity to Central Park. They had a wonderful bakery next door for breakfast each morning with a fantastic selection. We would return on future visits to New York!

title: A great location and a wonderful place to stay!
text: We stay at the Belleclaire whenever possible every summer and it gets better each time! The staff is very pleasant and helpful even when they are busy at the front desk.  This summer, Karen, Michael, Benedict, and Shanies went out of their way for us and we were very appreciative! The complimentary ticket for the café in the hotel is also a welcome addition!

title: Fave locale & chic boutique hotel
text: Our entire experience at the BelleClaire was top notch - from our welcome at the front desk to our fabulous suite - the chic decor & comfortable & spacious living space - we were thrilled from start to finish.  We can’t wait to return to NYC - and we won’t stay anywhere else !

title: NYC gem
text: I ALWAYS hit Hotel Belleclaire when I’m coming into NYC. So do all of my friends. People like Michael and Benedict are representative of the incredible, bend over backwards type of service u get here. The rooms are always beautiful, free breakfast in a lovely cafe where u can eat breakfast on the sidewalk and take in the amazing people scene NYC offers. From helping u unload ur vehicle to delivering it to ur room…Seriously well-run. As u can see, I can’t say enough about this precious NYC gem.

title: Basic 3 star hotel with a very good location
text: We stayd for 7 nights at this hotel and had booked 2 rooms. The hotel is really basic with rather small rooms and no windows opening and very small washbasins and bathrooms. Fonic insulation is weak so you can hear everything from the neighbours. Beds are though comfortable and sio sleep was good. Breakfast is offered via a very good bakery accesible from the lobby though limited to pastry, coffee, juice or yogurt. Therefore, qeues are long or very ling in the morning. Eating breakfast in the bakery or the lobby is very much limited by the limited space available. Staff was very nice from the beginning to the end. Location of the hotel in Uppe West Side, in the proximity of the subway on Broadway makes it very accesible.  I rated it 3 stars because for mor than 300 Euro/night, one would expect more.

title: Made my NYC trip extra special staying here
text: First of all, this hotel is AMAZING! I love the location in the Upper West Side, it's much calmer and cleaner than most of the city. This hotel is adorable, the interiors, it gives chic home vibes and feels like a home away from home. The location is great, the staff is super friendly, the cafe downstairs has amazing pastries and coffees. I would stay here over and over again! I highly recommend, don't think twice about booking your stay here!

title: Perfect experience at a gorgeous hotel!
text: We booked this room for my sister and her husband for their wedding weekend and they were so kind and helpful. My sister got a free upgrade and the room was gorgeous! All of the women were able to get ready in the hotel with room to spare. Thanks for a great stay! And thanks especially to Shanies!

title: Surprising location

title: My recomendation

title: Highly Recommend
text: Overall the Hotel Belleclaire is a great hotel, super friendly and accommodating staff. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Great breakfast options in the lobby and adjoining french bakery. Location was beautiful and safe! Would highly recommend them for your trip to NYC.

title: Great hotel in Upper West Manhattan
text:
Very nice hotel in a good neighbourhood near Central Park. The room was spacious and clean, great beds and a good bathroom.  
We had a room in a quiet part of the hotel like we asked, but unfortunately there were some outside airco systems on that side of the hotel which made noice. title: NYC Upper West Side
text:
PLUSSES: Great location. Clean rooms. Nice bed. Helpful front desk staff.
NEGATIVES: Only one elevator working and it holds 4 people comfortably. Sometimes had to wait for several to find one with room to get on. Got impatient and took 7 flights of stairs twice. Lost our reservation - luckily had reservation email readily available. Dorm room size unit. Tiny bathroom. Narrow hallways. Thin walls. Furnishings were dated and worn out. “Free breakfast” was a $10 credit at the adjacent bakery with limited seating and long lines. Just pastries and yogurt…no eggs, pancakes, waffles, etc. 
Difficult to recommend at NYC prices.

title: Great stay
text: Very cute hotel, close to everything you need. Friendly, polite and helpful staff. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Nice bakery within the hotel with fresh French pastry where you can have breakfast. Always happy to come back

title: Upper west side gem
text:
Really lovely boutique hotel in an area with very few hotel options. Our room was large and nicely updated, very big by NY standards. Great uws location, nice neighborhood & charming all around. Friendly, unpretentious staff and guests. 

Wi-Fi extremely S L O W even though it was “premium”. Struggled to even get text messages to send. 

Overall, though, this place is a gem. I’d stay here again anytime.

title: The Best Hotel in the UWS
text: Just returned from our perfect staycation at Hotel  Belleclaire, a real gem of the UWS. My family and I were warmly greeted by Justyna and Jonathan who were welcoming and made my daughter feel so special. Karen took wonderful care of us as well. Our room was impeccable, clean, bright and beautiful. With windows facing Broadway, it’s was so quiet that we had the best sleep. Thank you to Hotel Belleclaire for an amazing stay, we can’t wait to be back.

title: "Enchantingly Enjoyable Stay at Hotel Belleclaire: Exceptional Service and Comfortable Ambiance!"
text:
Me and my fiance thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Belleclaire! The staff was genuinely warm and helpful, always ready with a smile to assist with any request. The room I stayed in was not only 
  also thoughtfully appointed for comfort.

The hotel's location was a real highlight for us – really close to the subway and had some great food options, making our 6 day stay an easy one. 

The staff's willingness to go above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable was truly appreciated. We also received a $10 voucher for breakfast, which was  enough for a nice big coffee and a pastry 😁

All in all, our time at Hotel Belleclaire was a delightful one. It's definitely a place we'll consider returning to in the future, thanks to the overall positive impression it left on us.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Very nice hotel, very nice staff, out room was very clean and spacious. Breakfast with french Pastries was very good.  It is very well located near of subway stations, restaurants, supermarkets, clinic..... We recommend this hotel.

title: Great customer service!
text: JV & Karen at the front desk were amazing. They helped with questions, a room upgrade, suggestions, etc. In fact all of the employees were very helpful and welcoming for our entire 4 night stay. The hotel was clean and cute and I highly recommend upgrading to one of the bigger rooms with a view if you can. The bakery in the hotel had great food, especially if you book with the included breakfast. The location was great for the upper west side with easy access to the pier, restaurants, shopping, green space, and the subway.

title: Clean, spacious, stylish, comfortable and delicious.
text: Another excellent stay at the Hotel Belleclaire!  I stayed in March for a girls trip and returned again in August with my family. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are exceptionally clean, spacious, well appointed and very comfortable. Breakfast pastries at the attached bakery are to die for. The location was perfect for us - easy access to the subway and just a few blocks off Central Park. I didn’t think my return visit could top my first stay at the Hotel Belleclaire but it did. It will always be my first choice when booking a trip to NYC.

title: Super hôtel dans l’uppercut west side
text: Hôtel très bien, parfaitement propre et personnel très accueillant. L’emplacement est dans un quartier calme. La ligne 1-2-3 passe pas loin pour vous propulser en une poignée de minutes dans le coeur de Manhattan. En quelques minutes de marche on est aussi dans Central Park

title: Hotel Belleclaire - our UWS favorite!
text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire for a very quick trip to NYC and had the best experience! First of all, the location on the UWS cannot be beat. So close to Central Park and the Museum of Natural History! The property itself is gorgeous and intimate and it really felt like everything had a personal touch. The front desk staff were really friendly and made check-in a breeze. (They also made it a point to greet guests as they passed, which I thought was awesome, and assisted us with scheduling a car to take us to the airport.) Our compact but well-appointed room looked out over the outdoor spaces behind the buildings and it was so charming, with a European feel.  The toiletries were high quality, the bed and pillows extra comfortable. The bathroom and shower were bright and beautiful. Our rate included breakfast vouchers for the Mille-Feuille Bakery café, which had delicious food and coffee. (The drip coffee - yes drip - and almond croissant were my favorites.)
