All of this for rates that we felt were very reasonable. We will absolutely stay there again - cannot wait!

title: When in NY do what a Newyorker does
text: Just a couple of corners fom the Cenral park, a corner from a Metro station, everything looks like you are in the middle of the city but without noise, trafic jam and lots of people on the street. The hotel is placed in a neighborhood where people say good morning to a stranger. Very nice and well equipped rooms, heplful hotel stuff, easy check in/out. This is a place where you feel like a NewYorker.

title: Great Find on the Upper West Side
text: Stayed four nights at this wonderful boutique hotel in the Upper West Side. Well located, close to Central Park, Beacon Theatre and the Lincoln Center. Rates were reasonable. Rooms were well appointed. Renovations have given the rooms a contemporary look. Staff were helpful. There is a daily fee that gives you breakfast vouchers (coffee and delicious pastries) as well as access to a fitness room and local tours. Bathroom was small but functional. Two down sides…spotty internet and cramped common space in the lobby for breakfast. Cramped quarters will be dealt with once a lobby dinning space is ready.

title: La Belle Hotel!
text: We recently stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire with children and grandchildren. We loved it. My husband and I have loved this place for many years and it is now even better than pre-covid. The rooms looking over Broadway or 77th St. were larger than we expected, very clean and comfortable. The staff is so friendly and helpful, even to our grandchildren. The continental breakfast  in the lobby was perfect to get us going in the morning. Set in the wonderful neighborhood of the Upper West Side, staying  here is really staying in New York as a New Yorker (which I am!) would. We look forward to doing it again.

title: What a lovely stay
text:
The staff and the hotel helped to make our vacation fantastic. Michael, Maria and Karen at the front desk were all so helpful and courteous. Our room had a wonderful view of the Hudson and the room was ample size and it felt modern and clean. All and all the vacation was perfect. 
  Thank you to the Belleclaire.

title: Welcoming Staff.
text: Welcoming front desk team. Karen remembered me from my previous stay, which goes a very long way within the hospitality industry. Very much appreciated. The rooms were very clean and well kept. Seemed like the rooms were newly renovated. I have recommended this hotel to all of my colleagues and will continue to do so. Great overall experience.

title: Belleclaire Hotel
text:
Belleclaire is a decent clean no frills hotel on west 77 St in NYCity.
I think it’s too expensive for what you get however it’s convenient to the subway and ad long as you can afford it it’s fine. There is a free croissant and coffee breakfast and I thought that was great. Most NYC hotels do not give a free breakfast.

title: Gem of a place - will return
text: Nice hotel very convenient location- staff was very friendly and the rooms were recently renovated- super quiet HVAC SYSTEM- close to everything- hotel was very quiet- the breakfast was ok (included) just a coffee and a pastry but overall good

title: Happy
text: I can't even explain how happy I'm with my experience in this hotel! The housekeeping did a fantastic job. We were greeted by the manager Yelena in the elevator. She made sure to ask if everything ok with our stay:). Overall amazing experience with this hotel. And most importantly it was cristal clean!

title: Solid hotel, but TAKE an UBER
text:
At the Hotel Belleclaire you get what you  paid for. The standard rooms are very small and if you are unlucky ( like we have been) you have view on the air conditioning system. However, the rooms are comfortable, quit and the bathroom has everything you need. 
You get vouchers for the French bakery next door and the quality of the pastry there is excellent. The staff at the reception is friendly and professional. The location at upper-west is very good. If you go to Amsterdam avenue you find plenty of good restaurants. So far a four to five rating for Hotel Belleclaire. BUT: When we checked out the doorman advised us, that we should take a taxis to Newark airport. I said that we planned to take an UBER. He said because of a parade it would be difficult and very expensive to take an UBER at the time (2 pm) , we were supposed to leave for the airport. I asked him, how much the taxi would cost. He said around USD 100 plus tip. He would organize everything for us. When we left the hotel, the taxi was waiting for us. I asked the driver for the price to the airport. He answered: USD 150 plus tolls and tip. I said an UBER would cost us USD 115 inkl. tolls.  Indicated time to pick us up from
UBER was four  minutes at that time. After some discussion we agreed on USD 115 inkl. tolls if we pay cash. Just after after departure from the hotel, the driver began a conversation with somebody over the speakers of the taxi (which was very dirty), where somebody (probably his boss) told him, that the “fxxxx” passengers should pay more. He asked us for more money. I told him UBER would take us for the agreed USD 115. He drove us back to the hotel. My wife and my two children really felt offended by that guy. We took an UBER. When we left Belleclaire, the taxi was still waiting in front of the hotel. I take a bet, that the doorman “sold” it to the next tourist. So avoid the “recommendation” of the doorman.

title: Thank you Maria and Hector
text: It’s a beautiful hotel, great service. My compliments to Maria and Hector for their kindness and help during my stay. The place is very nice the rooms clean and confortable. It’s a wonderful location and I definitely recommend.

title: The best experience
text: Location is perfect, the stuff is very nice and friendly, rooms are very clean,  the bakery in the hotel is my favorite thing.. I have nothing to complain about. I look forward to coming again here. Thank you!

title: Amazing hotel near Central Park
text: Excellent location, amazing staff, very cosy and always pleasant stay. Close to Central Park so you can walk everywhere without using transportation. Bed is really comfortable. For every recommendation.

title: I love this hotel, wonderful staff, the room is always clean and the bed is very comfortable
text: The most comfortable bed in the world. Wonderful staff, the hotel is very clean and hygiene is at an enviable level. It is in a great location, everything is close. Next to the hotel is a wonderful bakery where you can have breakfast.

title: Sweetest Shanies
text:
My family and I arrived early from an overseas flight. The front desk, Shanies, was able to assist us with a room, check us in early and set us up with breakfast for the same morning. She was kind, helpful and very generous with our needs. We felt welcome and grateful to be in a place that felt like home. If we could give more stars we would! 

Highly recommend this hotel! Gorgeous room, soft beds and wonderful location in the heart of Manhattan.

title: Can now get continental breakfast without line to bakery, but may have to share table
text: This has become our go to hotel when visiting relatives on the Upper West Side.  The rates are comparable to name brand hotels but be aware the total rate needs to include taxes to get a fair comparison.  The improvements to the lobby area since our last visit allow you to get a continental breakfast of pastry and drink without having the stand in line for the bakery on the ground floor.  But guests didn't appear to share tables and several were done eating but didn't leave their table despite some waiting to sit. We took our breakfast back to our room.  That is a bit of a challenge since the elevators require you use your key to access your floor by waving the card and pushing the floor button, all while holding your drink and bag.  The bellman arranged a private black car ride to LGA that ended up costing only slightly more than our cab ride from the airport.

title: The Hotel Belleclaire is a gem!
text:
After many years, we wouldn’t even consider another hotel in New York City  - the city of my birth. 
Located in a terrific neighbourhood adjacent to two great parks and the number one subway line, and staffed by people who seem to care, the historic Belleclaire is a gem. The recent renos are tastefully successful. And the daily included croissants and coffee - as good as in France - cap the experience. 
And - all at a fair price. Bravo The Belleclaire!

title: Vacation visit with my husband to the city and neighborhood where he grew up. Upper Westside. We have stayed here many t
text: The hotel is awesome and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Benedict when we arrived late on Tuesday night was friendly and helpful. Maria on check out was just as helpful. We had vouchers for coffee and pastry every morning in the lobby. The housekeeping staff were very attentive. They did the rooms everyday. It is a wonderful boutique hotel. In a neighbor hood on Broadway. You can walk to Central Park, theatre district and museums very convenient location. We have stayed here many times and have never been disappointed. Elevators are small, but nothing that can’t be dealt with. I encourage you to try it out if coming to the city and don’t want to stay in Times Square

title: Gem in the Upper Westside
text: Our family recently stayed at the beautifully refurbished Hotel Belleclaire. We have stayed at this hotel previously and were pleasantly surprised with the upgrades. The new layout of the lobby is fantastic. Check in was an absolute breeze and the staff were super friendly and helpful. Having that wonderful cafe within the hotel is a welcome addition. We were given cafe credits for everyone in our party for every day of our stay. Our family felt very taken care of for the duration of our stay. We love staying in this historic hotel in one of our favorite neighborhoods. The proximity to the subway is a huge plus. In addition to the hotel’s proximity to many other points of interest. We look forward to our next visit.

title: Great experience
text: Great hotel in a wonderful location! The staff were kind & offered good recommendations for restaurants in the area. The accommodations were veey clean and comfortable. My husband and I stayed for an overnight in June & couldn't have asked for a better experience.

title: Great place
text: Hotel is very customer focused. Room was clean and beds were  comfortable. The location was great, upper west side. close to central park and museums.  Bonus was the bakery in the lobby. I would stay again.

title: Great location, great staff & accommodations
text: Our family of four had an amazing stay over the weekend. We loved the simple charm and appreciated the size of our suite on the third floor. This was our first time at Hotel Belleclaire, but it definitely won't be our last. We're local to the NYC area, and now we know where we can spend future weekends. The staff was professional and hospitable, and made our stay great. We could have used a few more towels from the start, but the slippers were a great touch since the floors are not carpeted. The hotel's location is an absolute plus. UWS, close to 72nd station, walking distance to many delicious restaurants (Daily Provisions, Joe's Steam Rice Rolls, Luke's Lobster, Parm). If you want the NYC experience, but don't want the chain-hotel stay, then Hotel Belleclaire is a great choice.

title: Bravo Belleclaire
text: The room is well cared for, extremely comfortable, the front desk staff are courteous and helpful  and the location is perfect. On street parking is relatively easy as an ex-New Yorker. Breakfast is an ideal bonus of excellent French pastries and coffee.  An all-round superb experience. We have become “frequent fliers” over the past decade, getting up early, running in Central Park and taking in a Broadway show and dinner and having the full NYC experience. bravo

title: Love ❤️ Belleclaire The Best !!
text:
The front desk staff awesomeness 
I worked in hotel industry in nyc 
I love the Belleclaire!
My go to in NYC
I remember I knew people living in the Belleclaire back in the day before Triumph took it over 
I lived at Chelsea Hotel back then 
Love the Olde NY vibe 
Keep it going

title: Lovely stay in the UWS + French bakery (better than continental breakfast!)
text:
LOVED our stay for a week in the Upper West Side--close enough to amazing restaurants, shops (including not one, but two grocery stores), and sights plus subway stations, and quieter than more tourist-y areas of NYC. Having only stayed with friends when visiting in the past, it was my first time staying in a hotel in NYC and bringing my family along, and we were pleasantly surprised by everything. Wonderful staff/service (both the lobby and housekeeping). Our room and bathroom were clean, comfortable, and had all the amenities we needed for our family of three. And it didn't hurt to have one of the *best* French bakeries in the city as the included breakfast for our family every morning! So much better than the barely edible "continental" breakfasts at chain hotels that cost the same per night. Our tween especially loved being down the street from Sephora *and* right next door to LUSH (and the wonderful aromas from their store doors always being open, plus the French bakery open to the hotel lobby, were such a nice escape from the otherwise oft-unpleasant smells of the city :)). 

P.S. Yes, the elevators are on the smaller side and the hallways aren't super wide, but honestly that didn't bother us. Part of life in a big city is that you are going to have to maximize efficiency in small spaces and get used to being around others!

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: We had a wonderful stay!  The minute we walked in the door everyone was very friendly and welcoming!  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  We highly recommend this hotel and we can’t wait to come back.

title: Lovely Little Spot
text: Hotel Belleclaire was a great place for our stay in NYC. The location is ideal. It’s so close to the subway and a short walk to Central Park. The hotel itself is very charming and everything was impeccably maintained and clean! The best part for me was the very comfortable King Size bed and very nice updated shower. Even though there are so many options to stay in NYC, I would love to come back to Hotel Belleclaire for our next visit!

title: Good starting point to visit NY
text: The very friendly staff upgraded our room to a suite, and what we so received was a very spacious room on Broadway, NY, with a huge bed, fridge, and a small but practical microwave. Close to 2 subway stations, this hotel proved to be the perfect starting point to visit the Big Apple.

title: Recommended: good location, smallish rooms, excellent pastry shop
text: We had a three-bed family suite, consisting of two bedrooms (one double, one twin) and one bathroom.  It wasn't huge, probably not unexpected for NY, but with four people the bathroom was particularly cramped with almost no storage for toiletries.  However, the staff were helpful and friendly, there's a small but modern gym and the attached pastry shop was excellent for breakfast (or lunch) - our room came with daily vouchers sufficient for at least a pastry and drink per person.  There's also decent aircon (quieter than in any other hotel we stayed in in US).  It's conveniently situated for Central Park and the subway to everywhere else (though eg Times Square is walkable) but quieter than more downtown areas (though was near a fire station so did hear quite a few sirens).

title: Thank you Benedict!
text: Benedict was super helpful at check-in. All the hotel staff are courteous and attentive. Hotel Belleclaire is historically beautiful and the lobby smells amazing! Highly recommend for your stay on the Upper West Side!

title: The Belleclaire is the Best!
text:
My husband and I had a wonderful experience at the Belleclaire while in NYC visiting family. The staff was great, especially Sare at the front door. 

The room was immaculate and the queen bed comfortable, as were the pillows. I loved that the floors were not carpeted: so much cleaner! The room was quiet. The bathroom was new and the shower had good water pressure.

The subway is two blocks away. The west side is a great location; lots of nice restaurants and shops, and not crowded like midtown.

Another plus is the French bakery attached to the hotel. We each got a $10 voucher for breakfast each day. Great coffee and excellent pastries, and the staff was friendly and professional, especially during the morning rush.

I will stay at the Belleclaire every time I visit NYC. It’s a great place!

title: Great Summer Stay
text: We had a great experience at Hotel Belleclaire. They were a responsive and respectful host as we stayed for our first time in NYC for my daughter’s birthday. Shanies was very friendly and helpful, we won’t forget her very kind spirit and amazing smile!! Hector was also very kind and helpful when it came to things to do and see in NY. Although we didn’t go during 4th of July to see FIREWORKS, we still had a BLAST! We recommend Hotel Belleclaire to anyone planning a stay in NY.

title: My go-to hotel in NYC
text: The Hotel Belleclaire has long been my go-to choice of accommodations in New York City.  Comfortable, relatively inexpensive (well, it's New York), perfectly located, surrounded by excellent restaurants, close to the subway, and walking distance to Riverside and Central parks.  And the great bakery next-door.

title: Great hotel and location
text:
Great hotel and location. A little bit away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Close to an express subway station. Short walk to Central Park.

Nice rooms, small as expected for NYC, but clean and modern. Comfy bed and tv with range of channels. There is also a small gym. Breakfast credit of $10 per person per day and great. A range of pastries to choose from and coffees. If you want a “proper” coffee you’ll need to queue and wait, this can be super busy. Whereas if just grabbing a pastry it is quite fast. 

Only downside is no spare pillows in the room and there were a few of these tiny bugs in the bathroom which I think just come in the humidity through the drain. Super tiny and not harmful.

title: Functional, well-located & comfortable, quiet room
text:
Hotel relatively close to the Park. Quiet. Air conditioning nice and quiet too. Our room was small for 4 people, but clean and comfortable. There is a bakery attached to the hotel which serves nice pastries! - much better than Starbucks!
Staff are friendly and helpful.
Hotel is adding a proper restaurant, but there are plenty of dining options close by.

title: Great place, perfect location!!!
text: The hotel was fully renovated and the rooms are awesome. Shanies and Maria paid special attention to my requests and we had the perfect room. Thanks to all the staff for making me feel special and to management for the free breakfast every morning…definitely my place to stay when visiting NYC!!!

title: Doesn't dissapoint
text: Beautiful hotel,  very comfortable beds.  Staff are very accommodating.  I have stayed in Truimph Hotels since 2008 on an annual basis,  as well as their beautiful buildings you receive a more personal hospitality than most other NYC hotels

title: A great hotel
text:
We have stayed at the hotel every year since 2013. Usually twice a year for a few days. It never disappoints. The staff are polite and eager to help. If you ask for anything, for your room, it will be done in a timely fashion. The hotel was recently renovated and they are even adding a restaurant and a roof top bar.
We loved the place even prior to the renovations. Great location and an excellent  French bakery next door that does business with hotel. We have also stayed at the hotels around the Belleclaire  bit they don't compare.

title: A nice and warm place to stay. Convenient location to go to most places.
text: This is a very nice hotel, a warm place and a very convenient neighborhood. All the service people in front desk are very nice. Especially, Jassvan and Karen are extremely helpful, friendly and patient. This is certainly a place I would recommend to stay in New York!

title: Staff was accommodating and created a great positive environment and experience.
text: Absolutely perfect experience. The staff was amazing!. The happy hour was great and staff made you feel like you were v.i.p. We visited with my family and we had a perfect time. Perfect spot! Loved it

title: Chris made the hotel experience exceptional!
text: Chris is the absolute best! He has an eye for design and was excellent at making my guest experience memorable! It was my first time staying with Belleclaire and he made sure I loved my room, much appreciated!

title: Great place for a quick NYC stopover
text:
I have been here before and I used to be local. I love the UWS.
Hotel's location is quite central to most things, convenient to subway, close to both Central Park and Riverside Park. Great restaurant right across the street (Serafina - italian). Pretty close to all the night life and restaurants also available up and down Amsterdam Ave. Staff was great, room was clean and comfortable. Great value, particularly for Sunday-Thursday travel. If you get the Breakfast package, Mille feuille (pastry shop next door) provides wonderful coffee and pastries.

title: Great place to stay at UWS !!
text: I had never stayed on the west side : my whole experience at the Belleclaire has been wonderful !! From Michael at the front desk to the French bakery next door, everything is there to make your stay just perfect. Thank you.

title: Hidden gem
text:
What a jewel to discover on the upper West side. I love everything about this place especially the friendly staff and  charming old building. Found it to be very convenient for everything I needed to do. Subway stop nearby. Never waited more than a minute for a taxi. Zabar’s is  three blocks away.  Also, easy cross town bus to the east side.  Everything I love about New York with the hassles of Midtown noise and crowds.  

Booked a king premium room which was very well appointed and comfortable and way more spacious than most in the city.  I had  a 5 night stay.  Will definitely return.

title: We loved it and would definitely stay there again!
text:
Beautiful property on the upper west side. The area surrounding the hotel is gorgeous. The area is quiet, easy subway access, just a few blocks from Central Park, a CVS across the street for any needs, and a great little restaurant (Serafina) right across the street that was wonderful. We also loved the little French bakery that was adjoined to the hotel.
The staff was extremely nice and helpful.
The director of the front office, Jonathan, was kind enough to have macaroons, a card, and little decorations sent to our room for our daughter’s high school graduation. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

title: Best hotel
text: The hotel is really beautiful and well-kept. The localication is also great. Employees are always helpful and  nice. I really enjoyed the whole stay and I recomend it to everyone who want to spend nice time in New York.

title: The best week of my life
text: I really like the service the employers are so helpful and kind The room it s always clean in my opinion it s the best hotel at nyc and i have i can come back here at next year i can recomend this hotel and servic to everyone

title: Favorite Hotel on the UWS
text: Love this hotel. We have been visiting our kids on the Upper West Side for the past 10 years. We have stayed all over the city and had not found a hotel that was convenient, had spacious, well thought out rooms and an accommodating staff. Last month we discovered this gem of a hotel and are back for a return visit. Hotel Belleclaire is our it destination from here on out!

title: Fantastic location
text: Great location! Wonderful staff and comfortable, newly redecorated rooms. A real gem. And a bargain too! Easy access on the 1 train from Penn Station, if you arrive at Newark and go to Manhattan by train. Lots of great restaurants in the neighbourhood, and just a couple of blocks from Central Park. Great breakfast at the French bakery on the ground floor - vouchers included in your room price.

title: Nice!
text: Very comfortable rooms, quiet room, safe neighbourhood! We received a lot of vouchers for breakfast, which was nice. The staff, Shanies and Benedict, were friendly and gave us an upgrade with no strings attached:-)

title: The people make all the difference
text: We had a last minute change to our schedule and decided to stay at the Belleclaire - so happy we did! The service from Sare - with making us feel welcome as well as offloading and moving our luggage and providing recommendations - was very much appreciated especially after a long trip. Maria and Shanice at the front desk were super helpful and friendly, and Hector helped us  store our bags the next morning while we saw some sites. Great people at Belleclaire!

title: Decent hotel with good location.
text: Lovely staff, clean rooms and good location. Rooms were serviced daily with clean towels. Plenty of restaurants and eateries nearby. Would definitely stay again. Breakfast is from the bakery next door and you get a $10 voucher to use as you like. Had plenty of choice.

title: Fabulous hotel!
text: The front desk female at check in was the most friendly I have ever encountered in NYC, wish I knew her name. I got an early check in at no charge...:) The room was clean, the rest of the staff was great. My only suggestion would be coffee makers in the rooms, and/or for the coffee downstairs to be ready earlier. Great location, close to where I want to be - ballet studios great restaurants, Lincoln Center, great boutique shopping - yet out of the frenzy that is Times Square - I will definitely stay here again:)

title: Fixable Flaws
text:
Good:
- Location in the upper west side. Near the 1 subway line. Easy walk to Central Park, American Museum of Natural History, Zabars, ...
- Expensive, but you can spend a lot more on NYC hotels.
- Breakfast included, but it's not what I expected.
 We received $20/day in vouchers that can be used in a pop-up coffee and pastry cart in the hotel lobby. Can also be used in the Mille-feuille Bakery Cafe,  a French family-owned craft bakery and coffee bar" adjacent to the lobby. Excellent espresso and cappuccino, french pastries, breads, quiche, yogurt. 

Not so good:
- Housekeeping issues:
  -  Mold in the shower. Yech. Asked them to fix this and they tried, but it's long-term housekeeping/maintenance neglect that caused this this problem.
  - Clogged sink drain. Full of hair and mold. Easy to clean, but they didn't. I did.
  - Missed one day of housekeeping services. Sent email to the front desk to ask for towels, toilet paper, etc. to be delivered. No response.
- "Deluxe Room" includes a narrow window looking into the bowels of the building. No light, no view. Depressing. Not so "deluxe."
- Breakfast.
Booking says "Included amenities  Breakfast for 2"
I imagined "Breakfast" to be more substantial.
For a longer stay, the Mille-feuille Bakery Cafe's menu is limited.
Paper cups, no plates, limited seating are tolerable for a day or two, but I was looking forward to a real breakfast dining option.
A voucher of $10/person is a cappuccino and croissant. Is that breakfast?
 Perhaps they can create a better experience in the future.

title: Lovely hotel that rips you off after checkout
text: Watch out for this hotel taking extra money from your credit card after you’ve left!  It’s such a shame to be writing this negative review.  We had a wonderful stay at the Belleclaire.  The staff were lovely, the location perfect.  I booked via Trivago / Algotels and paid upfront.  And was told THREE times by the hotel that we had paid in full and there was nothing more to pay - once when I called to check a fortnight before arriving, then when we checked in, and again when we checked out.  So what a shock to find a debit for over $120 when I received my credit card bill a couple of weeks after checking out.  I called straightaway to query this, and was told that it is a “facilities fee” - something that had NOT been mentioned beforehand.  So I then emailed, and waited.  Nothing.  So I sent a second email.  Again, no reply.  So I’m now raising a dispute via my credit card company, but just want to warn anyone else off.  In the scheme of things, it’s not a great deal of money, but it’s the principle of raising random charges without letting people know.  And I’m even more annoyed because we recommended the Belleclaire (before this spurious charge) to a friend of ours who has booked for his extended family of 8.  Oh, and I’ve checked out “facility fee” on their website.  It’s apparently for the so-called “free” breakfast we were told we were getting (a pastry and a coffee), the wine hour twice a week and a free walking tour - all sold as “free” to residents.  If you’re ok to get these additional charges after you’ve checked out, do go ahead and book - but avoid if you don’t want to feel ripped off!

title: Excellent stay
text: Our stay at hotel belleclaire was absolutely wonderful.  Shanies at the front desk was so welcoming and accommodating.  When checking in, she upgraded our room for no reason.  The hotel was quiet, clean and very comfortable.

title: Hirrrndous service
text:
Room is sparse, good size, clean. Staff service atrocious. Asked if hot water for tea in room. Said they would send it right up. Never did. Tv did not work. Asked for 
Service. Never came. Asked for another room. They refused. Stay away!

title: Excellent séjour.
text:
Parfait, propre, chambre jolie et spacieuse, literie très confortable, au calme, proche du métro et à 30 min à pied de Times Square.
Boulangerie française excellente pour le petit déjeuner, seul bémol : un temps d’attente un peu long aux heures de pointe le matin (comptez 30 min à 8h pour avoir un chocolat chaud).

title: Nicely updated and great service
text: I would definitely return to this establishment. The rooms were small, but that is to be expected in NYC. It was slightly difficult for me to enter the bathroom, and I'm not a big person. The bathroom entry was very narrow. The door didn't open all the way, due to a towel hanger on the back of the door bumping the wall, and the pedestal sink sat right at door, somewhat blocking the entrance. I could slide between the door and the sink but I kept bumping my hip on the door knob. Other than that, it was great. The service was great. The room was very clean and nicely updated. It was also right across the street from the Beacon, which is where I needed to be.

title: awesome stay
text:
Wonderful location and neighborhood, close to transports but also quiet. Belleclaire is comfortable and chic, staff is really kind and always available (we arrived during the night and they were there ready to welcome us).
Room are comfortable and silent. Wonderful atmosphere.
We'll definitely come again,
silvia

title: Family Friendly plus Frette
text: I love writing rave reviews when the situation merits it - especially when it comes to boutique hotels. Personally, I don't think a hotel on the Adriatic in Croatia should feel the same as a hotel on the UWS. That's why I prefer to stay at boutique hotels every chance I get. Hotel Belleclaire and its staff have reaffirmed my disposition. From the Frette linen, bath, robes and slippers to the Mille Feuille coffee shop in the lobby you are guaranteed to never stay at another hotel exactly like this one. You will never be greeted as warmly as my family and I was by Shanies and Mike. And I'm still trying to figure out how a boutique hotel on the UWS can be so family friendly. My kids are 12, 10 and 8 and it was no sweat - for me and apparently not for the staff either. Even the other guests were happy to see my kids - that's different. Plus you can't beat the upper west side. It's residential but you can stroll to Lincoln Center or the American Museum of Natural History or Fairway Supermarket or Trader Joes, plus dozens of restaurants, bars, lounges etc. As a former New Yorker who is visiting again, Hotel Belleclaire put me right in the heart of everything I miss about NYC - including the friendly people.

title: A fantastic option for the upper west side (a place with few options!)
text: An excellent choice for a mid-range hotel on the upper west side of Manhattan - an area notorious for limited hotel options. The rooms were big for Manhattan, the shower actually had water pressure, and the bakery downstairs made good croissants.  Is it the Mandarin Oriental? No. Is it a perfect and convenient place to stay when visiting family on the upper west side? Absolutely.

title: 1층빵집
text: 뉴욕여행에 벨르클레어호텔과 함께해서 너무 좋았습니다. 특히나 1층 빵집은 모든게 완벽했습니다. 분위기, 빵향기, 인테리어.. 서빙도 모든게 좋았습니다. 근처에 센트럴파크가 있고 마트도 멀지않게 위치해있었습니다. 물론 호텔에서 음식을 해먹을 수는 없었지만 기념품용으로 사기엔 충분한 물품항목들이 있었습니다. 이런 호텔을 적당한 가격으로 머물 수 있는 것은 매우 행복합니다. 다만 방음은 잘 되지 않는 것 같습니다. 어찌되었든 호텔의 위치, 빵집, 서버들의 친절함은 제 여행을 더욱 행복하게 만들었습니다.

title: Una settimana a Ny
text: Hotel molto comodo, in bella zona e a pochi passi dal Central Park, metropolitana sotto casa e colazione inclusa anche se bisogna fare un po' di coda. In alternativa c'è un ottima panetteria vicino. Noi avevamo una camera al 4 piano, sconsiglio piani bassi perché alcune danno sul cavedio. Arredamento rilassante, letti comodi, bagni in marmo.

title: One of the best hotels I have stayed in
text: What a wonderful hotel.  We rented a family room, meaning two rooms separated by a door and with one bath.  The rooms were large, clean and the beds were extremely comfortable.  It was also very quiet.  The staff was extremely friendly.  When we had minor requests, like extra towels, they were brought up within minutes.  The gift coupons for the little bakery for breakfast were very convenient.  The receptionist staff was friendly and efficient.  And it was a great location in the Upper West Side with a few minute walk to restaurants and the subway.

title: Maria at the Belleclaire
text: The Belleclaire has an ideal Upper Wedt Side location. Walking distance from subway and bus and an array of restaurants. Comfortable rooms and helpful staff. Maria at the front desk always enhances our visits.  Her smile is part of her personal welcoming us back. Her detailed knowledge of the hotel helps us spend our visit in a room that suits us perfectly. Maria is a very special part of this special hotel.

title: Fabulous find!
text: Truly a hidden gem found with Hotel Belleclaire! Fabulous location, updated clean rooms and incredible service. From the moment we arrived we were personally greeted and welcomed by Mike at the entrance and Mark at the front desk. Both were extremely helpful and hospitable insuring our stay was the best. Will definitely return and highly recommend to anyone looking to stay in the Upper West Side!

title: Awesome stay!
text: Awesome hotel in a great location with exceptional service from staff! Thank you for everything and highly recommended! Close to great restaurants Central Park and museums easy access to subway and bus service. Will be coming back soon!!

title: Great hotel with lovely staff.
text: This is a really great hotel.  The service is excellent - the receptionist who booked us in was courteous, friendly and very professional.  Our room was small but very adequate and was well appointed.  It was serviced every day to a high standard. Although the hotel is on a busy street our room was fairly quiet and we slept well in the comfortable bed.  We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely return.  Its a shame there isn't a bar in the hotel but there are plenty nearby.

title: Best hotel in Upper West Side
text: I traveled with my adult kids and my husband from California for Mother's Day weekend. Hotel Belleclaire made our stay most memorable. The staff was attentive and friendly. Maria, Justine and Hector really went above and beyond with their service. They welcomed us with a bottle of red wine which was a wonderful treat. At our departure we left several items behind in our room, the staff returned the items to the front desk and we were able to pick them up a few days later. The bedroom was spacious, comfortable and super clean. They serviced the room daily which made a big difference as we had little time to rest and change between the many scheduled outings. The location is excellent, right in the center of Upper West Side with so many restaurants, and the cafeteria right at the hotel was great to start the busy day. Thank you so much Maria, Justine, Hector, the lost and found staff and the room service staff for making our stay in NY so memorable. We will definitely return to Hotel Belleclaire!

title: Hospitable Belleclaire
text: The location of this hotel is worth the price of admission.  It is very central and also, it felt safe to wander around the area in the evenings.  My room was comfortable and the bed was very much so.  A continental breakfast can be had downstairs every day, which is courtesy of the cafe next door.  The coffee, by the way, was excellent!  The only downside for me was that the internet did not work very well in my room at the back of the hotel.  This was problematic as I had a lot of work to do.  I was assured that this situation was being remedied.  All of the staff, at the front desk, in the breakfast area, and throughout the hotel, were very helpful and friendly.  All in all, I would stay there again.

title: Upper West Side gem
text: The location of this hotel is near the subway, a short 2 blocks to west end, 4 blocks to Central Park.  It is surrounded by many good restaurants, markets, as well as a fun Sunday flea market on 77th and Amsterdam.  The service we received from the beginning to the end was courteous and professional, as offered at high-end hotels.  Our family of 3 had a corner suite that was clean, spacious, and tastefully decorated.  The bed and pilows were very comfortable.   Both the shower and the tub were huge for hotel standards.  Our room package included a daily voucher to the French bakery downstairs that served La Colombe Coffee and a huge selection of tasty bakery items as well as baguette sandwiches, and quiches.   We have stayed at many NYC hotels, this one will be our go to from now on since we have friends living in the area and for its accessibility, style, comfort and service.   This hotel is a gem on the Upper West Side that's not to be missed!!

title: Mellow, modern UWS hotel.
text: The hotel has been recently updated and is located in a calm neighbourhood, comfortable and modern. The floors and bathroom could do with a better cleaning.  Coffee and croissants a nice convenience.

title: Wonderful stay for three generations of travelers
text: This hotel is far and away the best hotel experience I’ve had in NYC. It’s surprisingly affordable for the size of the rooms (comfortable), level of service (impressive), style (tasteful and elegant), and location (near Central Park and subway). The family room was so comfortable for two teen girls, a mom, and a grandmother.

title: Lovely experience
text: Very nice hotel. Comfortable, quiet and clean room. Pillow very flufiest. Perfect breakfast. Trully recommend the hotel. Mr Jonathan Quezada, Director of Front Office, was so lovely and helpfull. I’ll sure be back

title: Genial! Muy bien el hotel y la atención
text: Una experiencia 10/10, sobre todo el servicio, a mi me atendió una señorita llamada (María) súper amable, nos buscó la mejor opción y nos dió todo tipo de información, el hotel muy bien también, nos tocó muy biena habitación! Gracias Maria!

title: Feels like coming home...
text:
I've been a guest at the hotel for the past 10 years exception Covid years.
The location is quiet, safe and convenient. The property is well maintained very clean and staff is extremely well trained, courteous and friendly. Unlike so many other hotels the staff has been there for years and extremely kind, always smiling and  friendly.
Every request 'is possible' and accomodated. A personal favorite at the front desk is Maria. Looking forward to returning soon.
Thanks for making every stay special.

title: An unexpected gem
text: Sophisticated, cosmopolitan and refreshingly unpretentious.  Incorporating the adjacent  french pastry shoppe makes it even better.  Location, neighborhood, and easy access  make this a prime choice when we return.

title: Fantastic in all ways
text:
Reception was warm and welcoming.  Accommodated us with an earlier check in since we flew to NYC on an all nighter. Overall incredible staff- friendly, helpful, genuine. The rooms were clean and much larger than typical NY hotel rooms. Bed was comfy. Lots of outlets to charge electronics. Not much space in the bathroom to store cosmetic bag,etc. but we made it work. 

$10 credit at bakery in the lobby area was great for morning coffee. Beware the line was always long but the baked goods were tasty! 

Location was amazing. Within two minutes of the 79th street station and Amsterdam Avenue, where there are a slew of wonderful restaurants, is just one street over. Loved being able to walk to dinner. Also, Trader Joes and Zabars are within walking distance. 
In the past we’ve stayed in midtown and in the Chelsea areas but we like being away from the huge crowds and feeling like we’re in a quasi neighborhood. 
My only complaint is that there was cigarette smoke on our floor that permeated into our room. I should have mentioned it to reception earlier but did so only at checkout. They said it was a non smoking hotel!  If I had reported it earlier they would have changed my room and investigated the source. Despite this, I would definitely return.

title: Fabulous hotel if you can afford it
text: Pretty much the only thing I didn’t like about the hotel was the price - I couldn’t afford this on a regular basis. Every single staff person from front desk to cleaning was friendly and helpful. Just terrific - if they don’t love their jobs, they’re great actors… This is an old building (tiny old elevators and windy, narrow corridors) but it’s been renovated and is lovely. The room (2 queen beds on 4th floor with Broadway view) was spacious, clean, modern and comfortable. Beds were FANTASTIC and pillows were AWESOME - I usually hate hotel pillows and sleep terribly but these were great. Loved the fact that there was an actual floor and not a grungy/filthy carpet in the room. Bathroom well-appointed, if very small. Room was no-frills (no fridge or coffee/tea maker). Could hear some street noise (e.g., ambulances passing) but not a problem. Fantastic location, easy walk to 72nd street subway and only 1 stop to 42nd street/Broadway shows on express train - local is only slightly longer at 3-4 stops. Close to both Central Park and, in the other direction, Riverside park. We walked all over. Fabulous restaurants a block or two away on Amsterdam. We loved Miriam (middle eastern) and Sala Thai. Cannot beat this location. Daily vouchers ($10 per person) for Mille Feuille bakery downstairs are a real plus - coffee is the best and baked goods outstanding but  few savory options if you want a nutritional/healthy breakfast. All in all, I would stay here again if I could get an affordable room.

title: Hotel buenísimo de Nueva York
text: Uno de los mejores hoteles de Nueva York. Todo muy limpio y además reformado. Tiene una pastelería francesa para desayunar buenísima. Los recepcionistas María y Hector me atendieron muy bien y me ayudaron con el viaje. El conserje Orlando también me ayudó con los taxis. Hotel totalmente recomendado

title: Hotel Belleclaire
text:
Nuestra experiencia en el hotel ha sido maravillosa, las camas muy cómodas,tanto el colchón como las almohadas eran esponjosa. EL personal siempre muy atento y servicial,la ubicación del hotel muy buena es una zona tranquila y residencial, con 
Parada de metro muy cerca , sin duda repetiremos.

title: Je recommande
text: Bel hôtel, personnel accueillant et serviable, services bagages et taxi nickel, 10 USD par personne pour petit déjeuner à côté à la française , très bon mais parfois peu et patronne gentille , parle français, notre chambre était petite et vue sur un mur mais belle et propre. Repas possible aux alentours 2 métros pas loin, Quartier calme mais loin à pieds pour Time Square le soir, il faut utiliser métro.

title: Really So Very Nice
text: Lovely stay! Every staff member we encountered was warm and friendly. Very clean and comfortable room with a nice sized bathroom.  Absolutely the best shower we’ve ever experienced in a hotel stay - crazy amounts of water pressure and plenty of hot water. Nice location, easy access to the 1, and plenty of shopping/eating options close by.

title: Best deal in town!!!
text: Love this hotel!!!   Super friendly staff (shoutout to Naomi!!!),  super location on the Upper West Side near restaurants and shopping, easy subway access.   Really the best  deal in town for a quick trip to New York.

title: Atmospheric UWS boutique hotel, very central
text:
Had a very nice 3 night stay in a king deluxe room at Hotel Belleclaire on my way to Europe, room 825. The hotel is newly renovated. Well done to the hotel for a nice fit out. 

If you want an atmospheric boutique experience in an authentic neighbourhood - the Upper West Side (Seinfeld country) then this is a good choice. It's a very central location near two subways 72nd and 79th st, and Central Park, hence the high rates they command. 

Was a bit alarmed when I checked in at 9.30pm to be given a room with no view - but on the plus side there was also no noise. The room was compact, commensurate with the age of the building. Was going to request a room change in the morning but I slept very well in that room and decided to stay there. 

Shout out to the young lad Michael, I think, who gave me a warm and friendly welcome on check in, after my rather long shuttle ride from Newark. He put me on to the fabulous nearby Sala Thai eatery where I ended up having three meals.

The hotel is 1903 art nouveau/beaux art style. It’s just gorgeous! So the lifts and hallways are not your modern day dimensions. Didn't bother me and makes me laugh at the reviewers complaining about the charming vagaries of a 120 year old building. These people should go to Holiday Inn next time.

Bed was good and nice cotton linens. Good aircon. The room had been renovated recently so very good condition. Room was serviced daily which seems to be a rarity these days.

Paid an astronomical price of $300 usd incl taxes per night but that's NY for you. I believe the month of May is graduation season and consequently the UWS accom area is very busy. The whole world wants to travel now as well! 

I was thinking of staying at the nearby Hotel Beacon, down the road, which has kitchenettes and which we've stayed at before. But their prices ranged from $450-$600++ a night the whole three months prior to travel. So it's all relative between Hotel Belleclaire and Hotel Beacon (which offers cooking facilities). The location is basically the same. There are two fabulous food markets 5 minutes walk from both these hotels - the Fairway Market and the wonderful Zabars.

Wi-Fi was ok. Did disconnect from time to time. I would have liked a coffee maker in the room.  The included breakfast at the adjacent, excellent French bakery makes the stay very pleasant. You can take your pastry/quiche and coffee to a dining lounge next to reception. 

To summarise, I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Belleclaire, despite the
view being basically out to a light well, the room was in very good condition, quiet and the staff are friendly and the breakfast yum. I think I'd go for a broadway king room next time. They are the rooms on the curved facade and would have good views of Broadway. 

Airport transportation.
From Newark
On arrival I ordered a go Airlink shuttle for $42 from Newark. Not sure I'd recommend this. Took 1.5 hrs to get in to Manhattan, due to having to wait for another party. I'd recommend having Skype and connectivity for this mode if you are coming from offshore. Do your homework on this. 

To JFK 
To get to JFK to fly out I caught an Uber ($25) to Grand Central station 383 Madison entrance, where there’s a connection to Long Island railway which takes you to Jamaica station. ($5.26), from there you catch the jfk air train ($9.25). Takes up to an hour and a half and would only be doable with minimal luggage as there’s some big escalator rides at Grand Central Station.

title: The perfect hotel for an amazing NYC experience
text: I booked this hotel for my first ever trip to New York during my birthday week, and I could’ve chosen a better one. The location right next to Central Park is truly ideal, and not only the decoration of this hotel is very charming and perfectly curated (absolutely loved the authentic carpeted corridors and the black and white style of the bathroom), but our room was also surprisingly large, which was so enjoyable. The front desk staff was also very welcoming and heartwarming - special mention to Shanies at the front desk whose kindness and help made our stay feel truly special.

title: Upper West Side Gem
text: Love this hotel and would stay again in a heartbeat. The staff are welcoming, lively, and helpful. The rooms are very clean, well-designed, and comfortable (comfy linens, pillows, nicely done lighting, quiet A/C). Great location and the adjoining French bakery is a bonus! Kudos to the people who made and continue to make this hotel a fine gem.

title: Immer wieder gerne.
text:
Personal: sehr freundlich.
Zimmer: gute Grösse, sauber und ruhig!
Lage: in der Nähe der Metro.
Morgenessen: spärlich und ungemütlich. Es hat jedoch eine andere Bäckerei um die Ecke...
Maria, Franceli und Hector an der Theke sind sehr sympathisch!

title: A real taste of France in the heart of Manhattan!
text: Amazing staff !! From Wallace who helped us with our bags and provided us with useful information, Mike at the reception who was so kind and Mark who helped store our bags - all of them made a real difference at our stay at Belleclaire ! The room and facilities were spacious, clean and beautifully decorated. The French bakery was the icing on the cake! Memorable stay at a memorable hotel!

title: I recommend it!
text: A great place to stay. Location is fabulous. Price is fair for what is offered. Breakfast is OK. the voucher given to the guests is  not enough for a good breakfast, but that is not a problem. The place is very well-kept.

title: Good value for the location and surroundings
text: I booked Hotel Belleclaire through Booking.com, which usually has better prices than the hotels’ websites. Great location in Manhattan which will mean higher price. But I thought the price was a good value for being close to the subway, restaurants, museums, and access to Time Square, shows, and Central Park.  Breakfast French pastries included with vouchers. Attentive housekeeping and lobby service. Old place, but modern appointments in our room. Quiet. Good mattress.

title: Comfy rooms, great location, and fantastic front desk staff
text: Located only a few blocks from central park with lots of great food options nearby. The rooms were comfortable and modern, and there's a French cafe downstairs with delicious pastries for breakfast. When we first arrived to check in, Shanies at the front desk didn't hesitate to go above and beyond to switch room types for one of the couples we were traveling with. Throughout our stay, everyone at the front desk was very welcoming and helpful. We had a great stay!

title: Great stay
text: I stayed at this hotel on a week trip to NYC and it was an amazing stay. The staff are so lovely and welcoming and very helpful. Beautiful hotel, I always loved coming back to the hotel after a busy day in the city, and I’ll always stay here when I come back to NYC. Thanks Maria and the rest of the team during our stay!

title: A NYC gem with excellent staff
text: Great location and excellent staff...Francelle is a great ambassador at the front desk, very accommodating and friendly. And I was pleasantly surprised at the size of my room. I'm a fan of the Bigelow products they use as well.

title: First time in NYC and can't wait to be back.
text:
My partner and I spent our first time in NYC with Hotel Belleclaire and let me tell you: it was the best decision! It comes in a really prime location, you have SO MUCH to see just around the block. Everything was always spotless clean, the rooms were tidy, cozy, spacious and super comfy. The BEST pillows and mattress I've ever had in any hotel. From the Belleclaire you are at an easy walk away from Times Square, shops, restaurants, clubs (Comedy and Jazz!!). wine bars and more. A 3 minutes walk away from the underground line 1/2/3 that will take you pretty much all around Manhattan and Brooklyn (with the right connection). The staff was lovely and super helpful, our deepest THANK YOU to Maria, Hector and the entire team for making our stay the best experience in NYC. 

Only note on the WiFi; is a bit tricky to access, but it's an easy IT job to fix. Also, the bakery inside the hotel would elevate the experience by providing Vegan Options as they have so many lovely pastries and croissants but unfortunately, all with dairy. 

Overall very looking forward to come back and enjoy the new improvements in the Hotel are happening by Summer this year.

title: Great stay at Hotel Belleclaire
text: We had a fantastic stay at Hotel Belleclaire. It was the ideal spot to come back to after our busy days in NYC. Conveniently located with close access to the metro, it was quiet at night, clean, comfortable and tasteful. There were a few add-ons that really made it special - including a wine hour in the afternoon and live jazz. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. I’ll definitely recommend it and I’ll return in the future!

title: Hotel BelleClaire NYC
text: This beautiful little Hotel is a gem. A short walk from Central Park. It’s character was absolutely 10 out of 10. The staff were very friendly and eager to assist and make my stay the best it could be. Breakfast included every morning from the beautiful French patisserie and the coffee was amazing. Definitely recommend to stay at this beautiful little hotel

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text: Friendly, welcoming, helpful staff.  Room was a bit small/crowded, but clean and up-to-date and conveniently laid out; comfortable bed; wonderful shower!  The breakfast deal, whereby you get a voucher for the bakery next door that you can use any time, was great!  And the neighborhood is vibrant and convenient (short walk to subways and buses and all kinds of shops and restaurants).  And the price was certainly right, compared to the alternatives.  We look forward to finding a reason to come back.

title: Incredible value, comfort and location
text: What a great value for a New York City hotel! This place is modern, clean, comfortable and great service. We booked directly through their site which gave us a credit for breakfast at the French bakery right next door in the morning, free waters ans a wine Happy hour. Beds were comfy room was super clean.  . Actually was larger than most New York City rooms. I stay in (we got a king room.)The front desk people made us feel very welcome.Maria, Hector and Francelle were great.I would totally recommend this hotel and stay again.We were there for an evening for a show at the Beacon great location if you're seeing a show. And a short walk to Central Park. We'll be back!

title: 6 night stay at the Hotel Bellecaire on the Upper West Side
text: The hotel was great and loved the location . Close to the subway , the Hudson River park , Central Park , great restaurants , a cvs and outdoor fruit stand . Loved the art deco vibe and the $20 daily coupons to the Mille Feuille bakery - great pastries and coffee there. I highly recommend staying here away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Manhattan but my only complaint would be that the walls are thin so we could hear people talking and playing music in the room next door and we got a noise complaint from the lobby one night when we were only talking. Other than that we really enjoyed our stay at this property.

title: Boutique hotel vibe
text: Nice boutique feeling hotel. Lobby area is currently going through some minor renovation work. Check in staff very friendly and the standard room whilst compact is nicely furnished. Ideal for one but for two a definite squeeze. Only here for one night but would certainly consider staying again.

title: Great Upper West Side Find
text: Came for a show at the Beacon Theatre & wanted to stay nearby. Excellent customer service - friendly and welcoming. Stayed in a queen bed room that was small but well appointed. Great value for the cost. Feels smaller and intimate, as a boutique hot should. Maria, Hector, & Francelis were great!

title: Charming boutique hotel
text: Everything was super clean, lovely & a great location. We had breakfast at the French bakery & cafe next door, all was delicious. The hotel was quiet, charming, and the staff was so helpful & lovely. Johnathan, Francille & Shanies  surprised us with macarons & a bottle of wine as we were celebrating our late Christmas present with tickets to a show at the nearby Beacon Theatre. When staying on the upper west side we will  absolutely return!

title: Great place to stay! Stop looking and stay here
text:
Location worked for visit to Columbia University - definite paralysis trying to book hotel given the options. Convenient Starbucks down the street in addition to the French Bakery adjacent to the hotel. I'm from the South, so the small elevators and narrow hallways were interesting. Short walk to 79th subway or a couple more blocks to 72nd. Convenient. We rented a car while there and Avis was just a block away.

Clean room, comfortable bed. Loved the shower - large and new. A/C worked well. It might be helpful to have a shelf or two in the bathroom to put toiletries bag - but it's NYC, so space is always premium, everywhere. 

If I go back to New York, I'll be staying at the Hotel Belleclaire.

title: Just perfect.
text:
Stayed here with my young daughter for a mommy and me overnight. This hotel was everything a boutique hotel should be. I couldn't have been more thrilled with the location, quiet rooms, and personality of the staff and property. 
I was able to take my little to Alice's Tea Cup, Strawberry Fields, Museum of Natural History, and strolls through Central Park. While she may not remember as she is young, I'm hopeful this trip shaped her soul- it certainly did mine. Thankful for this hotel being our spot for this event. The bakery was perfect. Having a Lush downstairs was fun too!

title: Mother/ Daughter trip
text: Visited with my daughter during spring break. Hotel is comfortable and very clean. We had a wonderful stay.  Great location, walking distance to Central Park, tons of restaurants and cafes as well as subway stations. Our stay included breakfast, it’s a $10 daily voucher per person to the French little bakery next door. We really enjoyed it. Something light to start our day. Coffee /juice and a pastry or yogurt. They did offer sandwiches and heartier items. Overall I loved the look of the hotel, the rooms are small and the walls are thin but it wasn’t anything that bothered us. Would absolutely stay here again.

title: What a delight!
text: Such a lovely hotel with excellent service!  The room was spacious and clean.  We couldn’t beat the price!  We feel lucky to have found this gem.   Breakfast is included as well as wifi.  It is not far from Lincoln Center and Fordham University LC.

title: EXCELLENT
text: Je suis désolée de ne pas y être allée avant !!!!! Cet hôtel a tout pour plaire, y compris une boulangerie française !!!!!! Le personnel est gentil et arrangeant, que ce soit Michael, Benedict, Maria ou Francelis. La chambre est spacieuse, ce qui est plutôt rare pour Manhattan. Je recommande vivement.

title: Demasiado ruido…
text: Hotel con encanto en una ubicación excelente, a pocos metros del Central Park, cerca de todos los atractivos turísticos de New York. Las habitaciones son pequeñas y con vistas a un patio horroroso, no entra nada de luz. Es muy antiguo y se escucha todo, imposible dormir por las mañanas, las chicas de la limpieza hacen demasiado ruido y se escucha el ruido de la calle. Tiene una cafetería/panadería justo a bajo donde hay muchas opciones para desayunar/comer.

title: Praise-worthy, with nits
text:
Great location  in a wonderful neighborhood.  Many ethnic restaurants within a 3 block walk.  Attractive wall art in room.  What's missing?
- in- room coffee (Not helped by under-staffed lobby person in charge of managing the coffee-and-pastry bar)
- no facial tissue
- regular doorman to help with luggage

title: Great Service
text: Maria and Jaden are very nice. Almost all staff here are very welcoming and helpful. The room is tidy. It’s just the food provided is quite simple and can be more diverse and tasty. The dining environment can also improve.

title: Excellent experience!
text: I had the most incredible experience at Hotel Belleclaire . After a long and exhausting flight I was welcomed by Shanies the hotel front desk staff. She was so warm and welcoming and made me feel right at home . My room is was perfect . The video was great and the bed was very comfortable. I recommend anyone stay at hotel Belleclaire when visting nyc . Please ask for Shanies !

title: Magical place
text: There is no other word but perfection to describe my experience at belleclaire - which was literally the best experience i've ever had when it comes to hotels that. All the members of the staff were so nice to me and my dad, specially Naomi who made my experience even better. Great and clean rooms, the location is amazing (you can walk to the central park). I mean, there is nothing bad to say, i just wanna go back there asap. Thank you guys so much

title: Hotel bonito, bien situado y con un personal encantador
text:
Es un hotel de estilo francés situado cerca de Central Park, en la zona del upper.

El barrio es muy tranquilo y es una zona llena de restaurantes. Está relativamente cerca de la zona más turística de Manhattan: se puede llegar en 20 minutos de paseo o si no hay muy cerca una para de metro.

Nuestra habitación era algo pequeña y oscura porque daba a un patio interior, pero otros compañeros de viaje tuvieron habitaciones mucho más amplias  y que daban a la calle. La avenida, como todo NY tiene tráfico pero no es especialmente ruidosa.

El hotel tiene un pequeño gimnasio, pero con completo, con todo muy nuevo y limpio.

Para el desayuno te dan un tique por valor de 10$ que se pude canjear en una cafetería que hay al lado. Hay café, zumos, bocadillos y sobre todo mucha variedad de bollería francesa. Bastante bueno.

Lo mejor del hotel es su personal.  El personal de recepción es muy amable. Especialmente Shanjes, que algunas tardes nos invitaba a una copa de vino californiano en el hall del hotel. Fue muy simpático y es de esas personas que transmite buena energía.

Sin duda, volveré.

title: Excellent Quick Stay
text: Shanies and Francille, the staff at the front desk, were excellent and extremely accommodating! The room was fantastic and had a great view of the city. I would definitely recommend staying at the Hotel Belleclaire!

title: Great hotel, well situated
text: Great hotel. Very well situated on the upper west side. Beautiful neighborhood. A few minutes away from Central Park. The staff was remarkably helpful, especially Francelle and Sharies. Would recommend to anyone!

title: Given the wrong room
text:
What you room you reserve, is not always the room you get, sadly.
We were not given the amenities that we reserved.
The older portly doorman during the day just sits there and doesn’t do anything.
Orlando, the doorman in the evenings, is the best!

title: Lovely time
text:
Everyone was warm and accommodating (Maria, Hector, Rueben). 
The breakfast included at Mille Fuille was amazing.
Best location, very clean rooms. 
I love everything about this hotel!
Highly recommended!

title: Maria saves the day!
text: Maria is the best!! My wife and I were moving to a new apartment in the area, and we were stuck for a couple of days waiting for some work to be finished. Maria was super helpful in helping us weather the storm. Rooms are also clean and comfortable, and the complimentary breakfast at the French bakery is delicious. Would definitely recommend!

title: Exceptional experience
text:
We spend one night , but was incredible all the personal is very kind and helpful, we arrived by night and they give us perfect attention. 
Ruben the men in the reception, was very nice person the give us and upgrade room ,
Thanks for great experience in New York

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: I had stayed at the Belleclaire twice before they closed for renovation. Two bad experiences and I vowed not to return. But the hotel is a block away from my family so it is so convenient!  I decided to give it another go after reading positive reviews. I was so pleasantly surprised!  The room was lovely if small (not atypical for NYC). The king size bed and pillows were so comfortable. Big flat screen TV. No dresser but large closet, in-room safe, writing desk with chair. Beautiful marble bath with large walk-in shower and great water pressure!  Magnifying makeup mirrors is a plus. And they give you $10pp vouchers for the French pastry shop in the lobby. (They gave me 2 even tho I was staying alone). Location on the UWS is close to shopping, museums, Central Park, Lincoln Center. The staff was welcoming and friendly. I will absolutely stay here again!  Thanks for stepping up your game!

title: A fantastic stay with the Family in Belleclaire
text:
Top logistic, top room, very kind and professional service personal, from the front office manager Jonathan and his team Sara, Monic and Sharies  (not 100% sure about the names…). Rooms are renovated, still to be finished some of them, so some noises are still around but acceptable. Breakfast included at the French bakery very good, everything fresh and daily prepared. Some reviews criticized the waiting time at the elevators, for us it was always fine, some minutes are never an issue when you’re on holiday 🙂.
Certainly an Hotel to recommend

title: Great Reception Staff, especially Shenies
text: The staff here is lovely. Shenies who worked at the front desk was exceptionally thoughtful. She went out of her way to make our stay memorable (after hallway construction set it off to a rocky start). From unexpected wine, cookies, and (great) slippers waiting for us in our room to her genuine daily greetings, these personal touches made our experience of the Belleclaire so much better.

title: Great Property in UWS.
text: This was our first stay, 4 nights for a little romantic getaway. Our room was spotlessly clean, quiet and comfortable. Front desk service was welcoming and efficient. We didn’t expect much from the discount cards for breakfast at the bakery, but it turned out to be perfectly wonderful with excellent food options like fresh squeezed OJ and ham/cheese croissants. The cards covered all but a dollar or two. Wine night in the lobby was a great way to socialize before we went out for the evening. Altogether a lovely stay, will book the Belleclaire again.

title: Great trip! GREAT Hotel!
text: Great experience and special trip with friends. Hotel did not disappoint! Excellent location, clean rooms which were also quiet. Staff extremely accommodating, professional, and helpful. Would highly recommend.

title: Not worth it, stay at a more modern hotel
text: The suites are wayyy to tiny, elevators can barely fit 4 high school kids. Walls are paper thin, and the bathroom smells like paint, barely anywhere to sit in the main lobby, and the hallways are so small

title: Absolutely amazing stay at UWS
text: The staffs (shout out to Benedict and Shanies) were so friendly and accommodating - I have never felt this welcomed at any other hotel! The hotel is at a prime location, heart of UWS, with CVS and a bunch of cafes, restaurants within 5mins walking distance. At the same time, I felt so secure and safe staying at the hotel, which is a MUST staying in the middle of NYC. The room was impeccable and the cleaning service was amazing. Definitely would stay here again!

title: An amazing trip in NYC! What a wonderful experience we had using Hotel Belleclaire Central Park as our home base.
text:
First, the staff (Benedict, Michael, Mona, Shames) were amazing, accommodating and provided us with many suggestions for restaurants and things to do. 
They were friendly and provided us with a confidence in feeling safe and being a very large city. The cleaning stuff for impeccable left her space, clean and tidy. (Justine). The breakfast from Mille-feuille bakery was exactly what we needed on a travels through NYC.

title: Easy, pleasant stay; very good attention to detail
text: Elegant, europeanate, charming and cozy, with updated physical plant - bathrooms, wifi, excellent & quiet heat in the rooms, big thermal windows. Quiet location and guests. Short walk to Lincoln Center, and on the #1, so well placed for ‘everywhere else.’ Exceptional in-house café with free patisserie breakfast. Secure, with keyed access to the elevators as well as rooms. Mondial guests with many accents. Staff have an outstanding can-do attitude - housekeeping, front desk, engineer, doorman, even the workers doing renovations. My shower ran cold, and though it took several efforts to fix, everyone took the issue seriously, and it was escalated all the way up to the GM til it was settled. A few of us from CA, DC, NJ and MA meet 2/yr for a week, this time at the Belleclaire. We will stay there again next time, with pleasure!

title: Great service and care
text: Exceptional service all the way around! Shanice and Maria at the front desk were wonderful. Monika in housekeeping checked in with our needs since we kept our 'don't disturb sign' hanging. The doorman (name escapes me) tended to our bag storage and transportation to the airport for less than the cost of Uber. Our room was clean, comfortable and spacious for our family of 4. With updated windows, the room was super quiet.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Lovely hotel! Rooms are spacious and clean, great location and staff are wonderful. Will definitely be returning. Received an upgrade of our room upon arrival due it a birthday in our party and it made the trip even better!

title: Charming and friendly elegance in midtown Manhattan.
text: The staff are amazingly friendly, from front desk to housekeeping. I didn’t expect that in NYC! Maria and Shanies greeted  us warmly on our arrival and and that attitude did not stop there. The hallways are clean and freshly painted. We upgraded to a corner room that has 4 large windows facing Broadway. The room is just what the pictures on the website promised (another pleasant surprise). We love the location with short walks (about a mile) through Central Park to the Met, Lincoln Center, and Carnegie Hall. We love French bakeries and there is one connected to the front lobby. Even discount coupons were given to us for each day of our stay. The only drawback are the 2 small elevators, which we expected in Manhattan. I recommend this charming hotel over the generic big name hotels that are so common these days.

title: Great hotel with amazing location
text: The location is great. It is really central in upper west side and you are quite fast in the central park and at the times square. The room was really clean and comfortable, especially the pillows. The staff was really friendly and also the caffee, where you get breakfast vouchers for, was really good.

title: Worth it.
text: Arrived slightly late due to a change in flight, on arrival we was greeted warmly and told to our surprise we were being upgraded to a super queen room. Paid our tourist tax of $94 and then was given vouchers totalling $80 for breakfast, no argument from me. The room was a nice size and clean on the 6th floor. Room attended to daily and bottled water left. The staff were very friendly and really helpful. My only complaint was that there was building work through the reception area. In the morning, when getting coffee and pastries, the countertop had a layer of dust and wasn't cleaned. Overall, I would and will stay again. Thank you.

title: REFUSE to pay their hidden charges.
text:
BE AWARE that if you're going for a week, they're going to try to sting you for an extra $550 upon check-in.
 
One thing Las Vegas has really screwed us all on is this idea that hotels now all think they can get away with sticking an extra "resort fee" on top of the fee you've paid to, y'know, use the hotel room, before they'll let you actually use the hotel room. 
This bunch wanted to add a fee of circa $200 to.... use the hotel room..... that I'd already paid £700 for?

How about just charging the right amount to begin with? How about being transparent about your pricing rather than trying to bait-and-switch people?

I refused to pay this nonsense charge, because it wasn't included in any of my booking documents (either during the booking process or in the confirmation document itself). They don't get to demand a hidden fee at the point of handing you the key. 

Then they told me that I had to pay a $350 deposit as well... I asked why, and was told that this represented $50 per night deposit. So, by their logic, I had to pay more than someone else who was staying for one or two nights, as a deposit, because I'd pre-paid to stay longer? This made no sense to me, so I refused this also. I told them they could take a $50 deposit and no more, and that I would not be authorizing any other payments to the hotel.
 
This was not the kind of experience I was expecting after travelling for about 15 hours to get there. There was no "can we get you a coffee" or "how was your trip?" - it was simply "and now we'll be charging you money you never agreed to pay". 

The room wasn't what I expected really; there were holes in the ceiling where previous light fittings were, and the walls are VERY thin - we could hear every single thing happening within 30 yards of us, from doors opening and closing (loudly) to people in adjacent rooms turning their showers on and flushing the toilets. You can't open the window (at all) which is poor. The hot water doesn't work a fair proportion of the time, which at one point meant we were stuck in the hotel room since we couldn't shower or wash for most of a day. 

The worst part of the whole week was having to keep on explaining to different people (honestly, how many "managers" do they have?) about the extra fees they were trying to charge us. After all of this, and after one of these "managers" telling me in reception that I was being entirely fair, that she'd read the documents and I was right, there was no mention of any fees due, *THE HOTEL STILL TRIED TO CHARGE MY CREDIT CARD, WITHOUT MY AUTHORIZATION*. 

It wasn't enough for them to cast a shadow over our whole week there by creating this tension, but then they agreed I didn't need to pay and tried to illegally take the money anyway.

title: Upper Westside Gem
text: The services and accommodations were exceptional!  All staff were friendly and welcoming.  Maria, front desk attendant, was professional and extended her gracious hospitality.  The French pastries were fresh and delicious.  We will recommend to friends and we will be back.  Thank you, Hotel staff.

title: Best NYC Hotel!
text: Hotel Belleclaire is an absolute delight. They have free breakfast vouchers each morning from Mille-Feuille French bakery and cafe right in the hotel! I had an almond croissant and peppermint tea each morning and I wasn't sad about it. The workout room is VERY nice. Machines, new dumbells, exercise mats, medicine balls, in-room bathroom, filtered water, towels and clementines! The room's view of the Hudson River was spectacular. I didn't even know we'd get such a lovely view, but the 9th floor was the best! The decor is modern and tasteful. Sheets were lovely. Pillows were perfect. Cleaning staff always had our beds made and bathrooms cleaned before we returned from our adventures in the city. Staff was so helpful (holding bags, hailing taxis!). I cannot wait to return!

title: Charming property
text: This is my favorite NYC hotel to date. We had a corner room (deluxe king), which was spacious, quiet, clean, and charming, with an art deco vibe fitting the age of the building. The motorized black-out shades made for a pleasant night's sleep. The rooms have a mini safe, microwave, and mini fridge, but no in-room coffee maker. But no worries: the coffee served in the lobby from the adjacent bakery was delicious, as were the complimentary pastries. The bathroom, though tiny, was recently refurbished and is modern and pretty... but will only accommodate one person at a time for sure. The pillows could have been a bit softer, but that's my only complaint, really. The location is wonderful, and we ate dinner on Friday night right across the street at Serafina. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Free upgrade
text: My family and I came to the city for a concert. We were only staying 1 night. I have a family of 5 with three kids under 10. I booked a room with 2 double beds. When we were checking in the gentleman at the front desk noticed that there was 5 of us. He gave us an upgrade to a 2 room suite. It made our evening much more comfortable. Everything was clean and we had plenty of room. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect for couples
text: Nice hotel in an excellent position. The staff was always very helpful if needed! Especially the receptionist Naomi, who managed to cancel us an late airport ride and made us get our money back - thank you!  Total recommendation

title: Bad customer, unwelcoming and dull!!
text:
I booked this hotel for a 4 night break for my partners 50th
Our initial room was tiny. We asked for an upgrade which after negotiating the price was given a room just as small with an awful view. 
We booked this hotel after reading previous reviews however, it appeared that English tourists are not awarded with the same treatment as others. The staff member was rude, dull and not welcoming at all. We will be returning to New York however, won’t be staying at the Belleclaire.

title: Great stay in UWS!
text: We loved the Hotel Belleclaire for its simple charm, and we slept very well in comfy beds and crisp linens. We had a family suite which was clean and comfy.  Water pressure on the 7th floor was great with plenty of hot water.  2 blocks from the 79th street subway, CVS across the street for any incidentals, and quiet area of the city. Others have mentioned the small elevators, narrow hallways, and possible line for breakfast, but none of these things bothered us.  We did have to request an additional washcloth each day as we were always given two for a suite with 3 beds and 3 guests. I will be back with friends next time.

title: Excellent customer service!  Nice room, Great Price, Great neighborhood
text: I stayed here for a week in October of 2022.  I was on vacation, visiting friends and this was a great central location ( i did not need to be in times square).  Totally usual for NYC hotel there was a wait to check in because I arrived at 1pm.
