The front desk staff were great, stored my bags, offered local info and told me they would call me as soon as my room was available.  I went and grabbed a late lunch at the restaurant across the street and my room was ready ASAP.   I can be a little picky so when I asked about changing rooms to one that faced the  street the desk staff were great and were able to move me the next morning with no trouble.  I had a great week, the hotel room was average/slightly bigger than average  size for NYC where rooms tend to run small, good amenities, solid wifi, great breakfast pastries!  and I had a great vacation.   I look forward to staying again.  I want to give a shoutout to Francelle and Naomi for making my stay wonderful and helping me with all my questions and requests  you rock!

title: Can’t wait to return!
text: Charming, simple and comfortable, the Hotel Belleclaire is an UWS hidden gem. Check-in was quick and easy, even though I was hours early. Both Shanies and Maria were super-helpful and friendly and went out of their way to satisfy my several requests. Thanks, you two! Definitely coming back!

title: my home whenever i stay in nyc
text:
The location of the hotel is perfect. All of the hotels employees are very friendly. I was taken care of by Maria at check-in and check-out and she was amazing. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom products are the best. Housekeeping is very professional and the rooms are sparkling clean. The only reason why I’m not giving 5 stars is because there is no coffee machine in any room, you have vouchers for breakfast to use at the coffee/french bakery place downstairs. 
Overall, would 100% recommend this place!

title: Shanies made it perfect.
text: Thé Belleclaire is our favorite hotel in NYC. Great location on UWS. Spacious comfortable rooms. The extra touches that make our stays special come from Shanies st the front desk. Her warm greeting is the beginning. She uses her knowledge of the hotel to help us find the room location that suits us perfectly. If there is any small thing that needs adjusting she will make sure its done. She makes a great hotel truly special for us.

title: a really nice hotel in a super upper west side location
text: Friendly staff, nice room, and a great location within easy walking distance of Central Park and the major museums/galleries.  We did the free Triumph hotel tour with Dave who helped us learn interesting facts about the upper west side and Central Park- I would recommend it.

title: Great location and clean rooms. Needs improvments
text:
My family and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel Belleclaire.
The hotel is located on the corner of W 77th and Broadway. The location was ideal for us and we were happy to have chosen it over Time Square which is a super busy and overcrowed area. The Belleclaire area is more residential, very safe, next to the Beacon Theater and very close to the Natural History Museum and Central Park. There are subway stations on both W 72nd and W 79th and there is a lot of shopping in the area.
The hotel, opened in 1903, has a very beautiful architecture. It is a renovated building, but it has kept the original style and decoration. The lobby and breakfast area were under renovation, with a somewhat neglected appearance because of this and we found the area too small for the number of guests. The two existing elevators were frankly insufficient for so many floors and so many guests.
Check-in was a bit impersonal, we didn't feel a particularly warm welcome. There was some confusion with our rooms, but it was quickly resolved.
Given the age of the hotel, the stairs and corridors are a bit dated, but they are clean and well maintained. The rooms were very good and looked very clean and renovated. They were cleaned daily. The only thing that we didn't like was the sound isolation. You could hear everything and it seemed that the guests in the rooms next door were in our own room, which is not pleasant as it seems that there is no privacy.
Our stay included breakfast (with this additional cost paid in advance). This hotel breakfast has its own system, it is not the typical buffet breakfast. The hotel has a direct connection to a bakery-coffe shop (Mille-Feuille) and gives guests daily vouchers worth $10 per person. Both the bakery and the breakfast area are too small for so many people. Prices in NY are high, so 10$ to cover breakfast helps, but not much. There was little variety because the bakery mostly offers croissants and other cakes. It became repetitive and the voucher was insufficient for other types of products, so it was almost always necessary to give more money to cover the order.
Despite some less positive points that really need to be improved, we would return to this hotel for the fantastic location and cleanliness of the rooms.

title: Lovely clean hotel.
text: The hotel is beautiful. I picked it due to its gothic style. The rooms are very clean, clean towels each day. Shower was glorious and the area is out of the hustle and bustle of times sq still loads of shops near by and close to a subway. Get on subway 1 it takes you straight to times sq and the ferry. Bakery downstairs was nice. You cant buy much with your 10 doller voucher a day though. Cons. I knew I had to pay the daily tax of 21 dollers a night. and a deposit of 100 dollers as per website. But on arrival it was 200 dollars. I queried this to be told no! Its 200 in a not so pleasant manner. This should be updated as people budget when going on holiday. Also, we could hear every cough and sneeze of our neighbours. So if your a noisy bunch be weary.

title: Great Value for the UWS
text: Our room was teeny tiny (even for NYC) with no closet but very clean with high quality towels and linen. It was also relatively quiet. All staff were very friendly which really makes a difference. The elevators are small but the stairwells are very pretty with marble and iron rails, if you prefer to walk up to your room. The vouchers for breakfast were a plus, and there were gluten free options for my celiac husband. It's close to Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, the Beacon Theater, and the American Museum of Natural History. Subway stations are close/easy to get to.

title: Terrific Service and Location
text:
We loved our stay at Hotel Belleclaire!! The service here is top notch. 

We checked in late (10pm) and Michael was wonderful at the desk. Sare met us at the car, loaded our bags, got us to our room and knew what we would need before we could ask (more towels and water).  Francelle and Shanies at the front desk were very helpful during our stay. The staff is amazing. 

Breakfast vouchers for Mille Fuille (the bakery attached to the hotel) were given one for each of us per night of our stay.  It was delicious and super easy. We were there over a holiday weekend, so a line could form for the bakery. Yet, the bakery knows how to move people through. Even if you don’t need the voucher for bfast, grab some macarons for later. 

Our room was clean. The water pressure was strong. Simply and tastefully decorated. The rooms are small, but that is expected for NYC. There were four of us in a double queen room and it was not a problem. 

The location in the Upper West Side is wonderful. CVS across the street for anything the hotel can’t provide. Very close to shopping on Columbus Ave. At night, there was not a lot of city noise. 

We loved Hotel Belleclaire and would love to stay here again.

title: Quiet Cozy and Cute
text: Our stay at the hotel was amazing the location of the hotel and the price of the hotel you cannot beat it! The staff was so attentive, and so friendly from every single shift, like every employee in that hotel is so attentive and caring and sincere and so hopeful, this is the best hotel to stay at. The hotel is extremely clean. You’re really close to a couple of trains, and there are a lot of things to do within walking distance the room size was actually quite nice. We loved having a private bathroom to herself and waking up in the morning to smell the fresh bread and coffee from the bakery with something else. We will definitely be returning to this hotel and staying every time we come to visit. If you have any issues Maria is your lady!!!!!! She was amazing from beginning to end the whole staff!!!!

title: GREAT UWS GEM
text: i love this hotel.. great location , great staff. nice new little gym , and the bakery on the ground floor provides a free wonderful breakfast . i would say MAYBE the WIFI could be a touch better but the kind staff always was willing to help me. i got COVID ( not the hotels fault AT ALL) and FRANCESCA helped me keep my room for a few  weekend days at the weekday rate..i will be recommending this hotel to all my friends .

title: Awesome check in
text: Francelle at the front desk is amazing. Her smile and friendly,  helpful attitude made this experience so much better. She's a gem! We've stayed at this hotel several times and never had such a wonderful check in experience.

title: Nice stay - not so nice checkout so reluctantly have to rate it a generous  3/5 instead of 4 or 5
text:
The overall stay was nice but I have to give a generous 3 rating based on the checkout and the mess that has followed - more at the end of this review

We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of January 2023, upon arrival Maria made us feel very welcome (and was very polite and helpful throughout our time) and even gave us a complimentary upgrade as there were some building works going on, the elevators and stairways are narrow but do the jobs needed.

Our double room was very nice, very comfortable bed, lovely bathroom and iron, ironing board and hairdryer all included in the room along with a flat screen TV with plenty of channels to choose from. The only things really missing are tea and coffee facilities but this should not detract anyone.

The location itself is good - a subway station on the corner of the next block along can get you a train to Times Square in 5 stops, and Central Park is a mile walk away which is well worth visiting. Plenty of shops, bars and eateries around and I gather they are building a restaurant within the hotel which I am sure will be good.

The hotel take a $50 per night deposit for damages, you get this back (or are meant to more to follow!) upon checkout, but they also charge a $24 daily resort fee which is used against the deposit so that the difference is returned at the end of your stay. This $24 is for the following

Use of the hotel gym which is on the first floor and can be accessed with your room card at anytime, has a handful of exercise items in

Use of the hotels wi-fi which is simply logging in with your email and quality is good

A $10 breakfast voucher per guest per night for the cafe which is within their lobby, they serve a good variety of hot drinks, sandwiches, pastries and cakes which are well worth having as are great quality

They also have a luggage room for storing luggage if your having to wait for an airport taxi after checking out (check out time is at 12pm)

Now onto the checkout.....which is where our experience sours somewhat

Upon checking out we were presented with a $323 bill for the room (bearing in mind we had prepaid it through our holiday booking with British Airways) so we then went back to the front desk and asked them about this at which point they realised our mistake and Maria assured us that not only would this be corrected but they would also waive the resort fees - problem solved

Well NO far from solved, they put the resort fees of $72 back on our card as a credit but then put the remaining difference of $251 on as a DEBIT meaning we were now $502.00 out of pocket - and from reading some recent reviews it seems this is not the first time there have been billing errors like this!

We had to call them from back in the UK on 2 separate occasions before we were given an assurance by one of the girls on the desk that it had been done, but at this point we were only refunded $251 and not $502 as we should have been

2 more calls to the duty manager Benedict and nearly 2 weeks later and the matter is nearing resolution but we have not been refunded the resort fees (despite the earlier promise) so we have emailed him asking about this

So in short would I recommend this place YES - but be wary and careful upon checking out!

Would I stay again based on the overall experience, never say never, but our immediate reaction after what we've experienced with the billing errors and how long its taken to resolve something which could have easily been avoided is a NO

title: Another lovely stay at the Belleclaire
text:
This was our second time staying at the Belleclaire. It was just as welcoming and friendly as previously. Our room was a good size, had a very comfortable king size bed, good a/c, adequate wardrobe space. The bathroom was an accessibility bathroom so it was huge, and with seat in the shower, which was actually three showers; a waterfall one, a wall mounted one and a shower head on a rail. Slightly chilly in the bathroom. Some traffic noise but it’s right on Broadway so it has to be expected. 
Breakfast is coffee/tea and pastries in an area adjacent to the lobby. They only offer ‘drip coffee’ in this place but the breakfast vouchers are valid at the lovely Mille Feuille next door. Gorgeous coffee and pastries etc. and again with really friendly service. 
Maria in reception was as helpful and lovely as always,- as was Christina in Mille Feuille :)

title: Great room & quick to sort a problem
text:
What a lovely hotel.  Staff were friendly and the room was very clean.  My room was small, but I knew it would be when I booked it.

The bathroom had a great shower - very powerful.

Breakfast was excellent, the pastries were extremely good.  Drip coffee was a bit weak for my tastes, but I do like my coffee on the strong side.  It would have been nice if the espresso machine in the lobby worked.

After checking out there was a problem though, my credit card was charged for my stay even though I had prepaid.  After contacting the hotel a refund and apology were forthcoming.  It's better if mistakes don't occur, but we're all human and mistakes happen.  I was happy with how quickly it was resolved.

title: Great stay, great value
text: I booked the Belleclaire for a repeat visit with my husband last month, after having stayed there this fall with my sister, and he loved it too. Pros: Location! The  hotel is on an elegant stretch of Broadway, close to shops, restaurants, museums, Central Park, the subway, and several buses, but it doesn't feel hectic. Decor and amenities: The rooms are fresh and pretty and super clean (albeit smallish), the lobby is welcoming, and the pasty shop is charming and delicious. Great to be able to choose a king bed. Service: Perfectly friendly and attentive. They checked us in a bit early (with a smile). Price: Incredible. We paid nearly double at the Beacon on 72nd Street last year, which admittedly has bigger rooms but is a bit shabby. Cons: It would be nice to have a mini fridge without an extra charge. We will be back!

title: Situation
text:
Hôtel 4* mais qui en vaut réellement 3.
Chambre suffisante , sauf salle de bain un peu petite mais dotée d'une grande douche à l'Italienne.
Voucher de 10 dollars par personne offert par jour pour déjeuner soit au mille feuille soit à l'hôtel.
Personnel sympa et à l'écoute des clients.
Gros défaut, le bruit des travaux le matin au petit déjeuner. ( Marteau piqueur!!!)
La dame Française du mille feuille est très sympa!
Hôtel très bien situé, métro proche avec ligne directe 1 et 2.

title: The perfect quiet stay for a solo traveler
text:
-nice, quiet location in a beautiful building
-loved the macaroons from the bakery & welcome wine
-the vouchers to the bakery were the perfect option for breakfast
-robe & slippers were clean & comfortable
-comfortable bed, would've been nice to have two different-sized pillows as they were ------very tall (I know this varies person to person)
-while the room/street is quiet, the door feels paper thin when people walk and talk down the hallway
-bathroom could use a soap dish by the sink
-overall - simple, clean, and very helpful staff!

title: Great Hotel in upper West
text: This is a very nice Boutique Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the room very clean. The breakfast is served by the French bakery adjacent to the hotel. 2 subway stations are conveniently close by. I can highly recommend to stay here. I definitely will return

title: Shanies saved the Day
text: My spontaneous decision to get a room last night was made a wonderful experience by the staff at the front desk. The gracious Shanies was helpful in every way fm suggesting nearby shops to giving me the perfect room. She & Benedict are lovely.

title: Great Service!
text: The Belleclaire exceeded all of our expectations for our stay this past weekend. We had previously booked a couple of weekends ago but had to cancel last minute. We spoke with David who not only helped with our emergency cancelation but then helped us find a new weekend and the perfect accommodations for my family of 5. I spent quite some time speaking to Maria on the phone and Shanier once we arrived - everyone we met at the Belle Claire was fantastic. The rooms are spacious for NYC and the service impecable. I travel to NYC a lot for work but usually stay downtown at hotels that are 3x as expensive and the Belleclaire rooms and amenities were comprable if not better but the service blew all the fancy downtown hotels out of the water. I highly recommend.

title: Help from Manager
text: My dealings with Francelle, the hotel manager, about a reservation mixup, my fault, were excellent and resolved my issue. We were able to rebook our reservation for the correct date. She was lovely and easy to work with. Thank you, Francelle

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text: I really enjoyed my recent stay at the hotel.  I received excellent service from the front desk staff, particularly Maria.  Everyone was friendly and helpful; I had several questions about navigating the subway and they were amazing.  The room was incredibly cozy and nice.  The housekeeping staff was great as well.  I loved that the hotel was so close to subway stations and to many shops and restaurants.  It made for a very walkable trip.  My only complaint was that despite reaching out to the accounting department about a billing issue, no one ever acknowledged my emails, no my phone call.  That is poor customer service, in my opinion.

title: My New Favorite Hotel in NYC!
text: From start to finish a great experience. The staff was very welcoming. The room was comfortable, and on the small side, but normal for New York standards. There is nothing chintzy about it. Great bedding, thick towels, nice hairdryer. Super location near lots of eateries. And near the park. Also, near a subway station. The bakery and coffee downstairs quite yummy!  We will stay here again next time!

title: Birthday Trip 24th Jan to 27th Jan
text: We were upgraded to the deluxe suite for free by Maria and we had a pleasant 3 nights and 4 day stay, the suite was immaculate and was cleaned daily, we were charged a resort fee which included breakfast at the French cafe attached to the hotel and the selection they had was amazing and it tasted good. The hotel did have some building work going on, which didn't really affect our stay. You just couldn't relax in the lobby with the noise. The staff were really helpful you get charged a damage deposit so bring a credit card which is refunded back minus the resort fee, but when I came to check put i was charged for the room again even though I had paid for the room a few months back, Maria sorted everything out and refunded everything back including the resort fee as it was a mistake on there side which I was very thankful for, I just need to wait for my credit card statement to reflect this. MARIA deserves a special mention she is a credit to the hotel. She is very kind and always has a smile and goes the extra mile to make sure everything was sorted out. Would definitely come back again when we visit New York in the future.

title: Good hotel
text:
Great location near to 79th St subway station. You get a voucher for breakfast to use in the attached French bakery. Note this is not free as it is part of your daily service charge. The bakery had an amazing selection of pastries which were heavenly. 
The room was clean and an adequate size. Plenty of hangars, decent shower. Very good hair dryer accordingly to my wife! 
Lift to rooms was quite small but functional. 
Overall a good stay and we would stay here again.

title: Holiday Weekend on the Upper West Side
text: Absolutely perfect location close to Central Park, museums, amazing restaurants, entertainment, shopping, transit, and more bakeries than I could count including Mille-feuille downstairs (divine mini cranberry pumpkin seed loaves, nutella plie, blueberry croissant, 5-star espresso, and their signature macarons). Room was spacious, bed was super comfortable, free wifi and all the extras needed (one exception - they need more feather pillows). Excellent customer service and friendly guest services. I left some items in my room after checking out, and the Hotel Manager went out of his way to locate them and have them shipped to my home. Couldn't have asked for a better experience and the price was incredibly reasonable. The Belleclaire will definitely be my home base whenever I visit. Go now!

title: Thank you
text:
I would like to thank Benedict for taking care of me the whole stay.
I will come back for sure....
The hotel is great, very clean, located on broadway near the subway station and all the staff,  including Benedict are great.
Thank you!

title: Lovely Stay
text: Lovely stay at Hotel Belleclaire. We had 2 small rooms, one for my mom and me and one right next door for my teenager daughter and her friend. The rooms are recently renovated, bright and clean. Amazing location right on Broadway and 77th. Maria and Francelle (not sure spelling of her name) were amazingly friendly and helpful from making sure we didn't leave without items we had left in our rooms to a history of the hotel. Will definitely stay here again.

title: My New Favorite
text: I stayed at Hotel Belleclaire for two nights, Nov. 10-11, 2022. First, I was impressed by the size of the room. Many rooms in NYC are tiny and this room blew me away. The service at the front desk was friendly and accommodating. Sometimes the small things matter the most: a smile, solid directions, a box of delicious cookies etc. One very silly highlight of mine was the music in the lobby. I felt like they stole my playlist! Lastly, I must mention the Assistant Front Office Manager Benedict. He was there for my check out and his outgoing personality sealed the deal that I would be back on my next visit. Hey Benedict, I'm booked for this upcoming weekend in January 2023... I hope to see your face.

title: Perfect for families
text: This is an outstanding hotel. We traveled with our 3 kids & stayed in the family suite. It is exceptionally clean, well-located & modern. Their team is friendly, helpful & attentive. In particular, Sare & Maria were kind & thoughtful with their service. The connection to the bakery made a morning coffee & a quick breakfast feel easy & authentic to the city. Perfect location for AMNH, Central Park, playgrounds & public transportation. Looking forward to returning!

title: Very good and clean hotel
text:
We stayed 3 nights as a couple in the Belleclaire and it was a very good hotel for our purpose.
The whole team and especially Maria is very kind and helpful. Also the breakfast at the nearby located french bakery is very recommended.
The only one negative thing was the perpament noise of the AC at the neighbor building. But, after walking a whole day in NYC we slept very well espite the noise.

title: Clean, safe, economical, close to attractions and subway
text: Clean, safe, economical, with friendly helpful staff. The hotel's location near many attractions in the upper west side and close proximity to both the subway and crosstown bus line makes it super convenient as well.

title: Thank you for the upgrade!
text: Arrived at the hotel at 11 AM to drop off my bags before check-in, but I was pleasantly surprised when our room was upgraded by Shanie and Marla. After our room is upgraded, we were even allowed to check in early before exploring the city. This is my first time here in NYC, and I really appreciated the warm welcome.

title: beautiful, well-situated hotel
text: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Belleclaire very much. Loved the location with its proximity to Central Park, incredible restaurants, and Zabar's. The hotel staff were very friendly, helpful, and responsive.  Great lounge music every time we got off the elevator too! Also, the breakfast vouchers for Mille-Feuille Bakery Cafe were so appreciated (the polar opposite of a generic continental breakfast). The room itself was tight but comfortable for a family of four.  We could have used a few more hangers for clothing and the bathroom needs more hooks for towels and washcloths.  The building itself is an architectural marvel...a sight to behold especially in the evening.  Thanks for a great stay!

title: Lovely and Comfortable stay in New York
text: Very lovely and comfortable hotel, rooms were spacious! And everything was spotless. The hotel has a lovely vibe to it comes with beautiful history and lively architecture. There is also the cutest coffee shop next to it that makes the most delicious macaroons ☺️

title: Amazing stay for our honeymoon!
text:
Booked the beautiful belleclaire for our final stop on our honeymoon before heading back home. The hotel is clean and elegant and wonderful on all aspects. 

Along with the great value for price, you get a complimentary pastry and drink for breakfast which was well welcomed.

We are especially delighted with the excellent service by the front desk (Benedict, Mark, Maria and Shanies) who, upon hearing that we were on our honeymoon, gave us an amazing room upgrade! 

We are no experts on New York boroughs however the area felt very safe and the front desk made sure that we were well accomodated! Also the closest metro stop is only a couple of blocks away.

We will remember this stay fondly. Thanks Belleclaire!

title: Unbeatable location.
text: The location is unbeatable, the staff was wonderful, the room was adequate (two grandparents and two teenage granddaughters), BUT . . .  the bathroom was so cold - especially in the middle of the night - that I couldn't believe it. There was no heating in the bathroom (other than to run the shower with hot water) and the draft coming in through the "closed" window was unbearable. True, we were there during an unusually cold period (end of December 2022), but even so . . . In addition, there is no lobby per se, and the entire ground floor is unheated, so anytime the doors were opened, the blast of cold air that came in was insufferable. Everyone had to eat breakfast with coats on in the ground floor area with tables and chairs, and if anyone opened the door on the 77th St. side . . . whoa! Welcome to Antarctica! Other than that, I'd gladly stay there again, but NOT in the winter.

title: Absolutely Fabulous stay for my birthday!!
text: Maria at the front desk was absolutely amazing!!! We stayed for 2 nights in this adorable and quaint hotel! It’s centrally located and walking distance to many parts of town.. we took the subway and bus throughout the town. A wonderful cinnamon roll and coffee for breakfast was the perfect touch. Thank you, I will absolutely return!

title: Great service from host Benedict at front desk and a lovely room!
text:
Yes, the pillows and beds ARE the fluffiest I’ve ever felt too, as another reviewer just wrote.. but my husband and I arrived really bushed from a full day of travel to NYC and Benedict, the host at the Front Desk was extremely gracious and when we inquired about our room accommodation (would there be anything more spacious available?), he assigned us a terrific spot that was just what we’d wished for..light/space/sharp upbeat design..& we quickly freshened up and set out for our evening with a real spring in our step!

Now we’ve stayed already for one night and I’d love to live here! Super service from Benedict (who also told us about Mon. & Wed. wine offerings downstairs) and a great hotel at a good price point in our old neighborhood on the Upper West Side! Many thanks!

title: First time at NYC
text: Stayed for 7 nights.  The building is old but everything is renovated with modern design.  Room is simple and tiny as described by other travelers with close to nothing amenities.  Close enough to Central Park and Museum of Natural History.  Few minutes walk to subway station.  Nice bakery for breakfast.  Want to say thank you to one of the housekeeping staff (whom I forgot to ask for his/her name) who delivered a beyond standard tidiness for my room.

title: Best Staff!
text: A few weeks ago my husband, son (2) and I stayed at Hotel Belleclaire for 7 nights. It was our second time staying there (also stayed there in July 2022 for a few nights) and we would definitely go back. While the rooms and general ambiance throughout the hotel are lovely, and the location is wonderful, it is the staff that make Hotel Belleclaire truly shine above the rest! Literally every staff person we encountered (and there are many when you stay somewhere a whole week) seemed genuinely interested in ensuring our stay was as great as possible. They all went above and beyond to help us when we reached out with a need or request. We'd like to give a special, huge thank you to Shanice who took very good care of us upon our arrival, helping us solve an unforeseen (by myself) issue, and to Maria and Hector who helped us kindly throughout our stay as well. From the front desk, to housekeeping to the building engineer and all the incredible staff in-between, they all exceeded our expectations with their professionalism and authentic care. We could not be more grateful for such a dreamy stay and would highly recommend Hotel Belleclaire!

title: WOW!  JUST WOW!
text:
This was a great place to stay on the UWS.  Very well-located for museum hopping, park exploring, and deli-hopping.  Close to the subway, with very nice, friendly staff, warm, welcoming lobby.  Our experience limits my ability to comment on the regular rooms, as we  were upgraded to "the best room in the house!"  I don't know why the front desk captain chose us for this very unexpected gift, but thank you, thank you, thank you from these mid-seventy year olds, who had recently celebrated 50 years of marriage!  
         A few days earlier, we had visited the Whitney's Hopper exhibit, and the view from the 9th floor suite's windows looked out on a scene that could almost have come from one of the paintings.  The roofs of low--rise brownstones gave way to the Hudson River, and the NJ skyline.  A large, homey and clearly designed living area gave way to the king bed, more windows (all with room-darkening shades) a fuzzy shag rug and dressing table.  And next to the bed:  a box of a half-dozen pretty and delicious macarons from the French patisserie next door.  A massive bathroom with a soaking tub, and walk-in shower completed the suite.  Frette linens in the bathroom and on the bed (as well as robes and slippers) made use feel like royalty.  Capping it off was the Hopper print that hung on the wall of the sitting area!  Bliss!  Thank you Hotel Belleclaire!

title: Close to the Natural History Museum
text: Good location near the natural history museum. Lovely area on broadway with French feel to the area . No phone system and only intermittent wifi which dropped in and out . Really helpful staff and breakfast from the French Cafe next door was delicious.

title: Our fifth visit to NYC and by far the best Hotel
text: The nicest staff you could possibly wish to meet.We arrived at the Hotel around Mid night (after a long journey where our flights had been cancelled due to Snow in the UK!!) so we were a little frazzled to say the least.We were warmly greeted by Benedict getting our stay off to a good start.He then kindly gave us a larger room than we had booked !! this we really appreciated.The room itself was perfect spotlessly clean beautifully decorated and warm with everything you could possibly want.We were also provided with breakfast vouchers for the patisserie next door (delicious Coffee and pastries served by charming staff) The neighbourhood was ideal (Upper west side ) away from all the craziness of the more touristy spots but just a short subway ride 7 minutes to times square.Another mention for Maria the lovely Receptionist so helpful and welcoming.All in all a lovely lovely Hotel the very best by far ,already planning our next trip for December 23.Thankyou Benedict and Maria and all the staff that work so hard to provide such a fabulous experience

title: Décevant !
text:
2 points positifs l’emplacement et la literie !! 
Pour le reste on s’en reparle ! 
Wifi qui fonctionne 1 fois sur 2 , pas de possibilité de petit déjeuner en chambre ou autre ! Pas de services tout court en fait !!
On doit faire la queue pendant minimum 45 minutes en bas dans le lobby pour pouvoir prendre son pt dej avec un coupon d’une valeur de 10$ qui vaut pour 1 viennoiserie et un café !-(( 
Si vous avez davantage faim ce sera à votre charge !
Les chambres sont très très mal insonorisées ! Faites attention si vous avez une chambre communicante à côté de vous, vous allez vivre la vie de votre voisin ! Les murs sont du papiers calques…
L’hygiène est assez approximative, on a pas fait ma chambre pendant deux matins, il a fallu que j’aille me plaindre à la réception et même malgré cela on peut pas dire que la fée du logis soit passée après !
Même topo pour le savon, il vous donne des flacons minuscules et il n’y a ni coton, ni Kleenex, ni rien comme kit de salle de bain, sans parler de leurs tailles minuscules ! Vous avez les toilettes dans le lavabo !! ( si si c’est possible !) 
Bref je ne retournerai pas dans cet hôtel et je le déconseille fortement aux personnes qui ont envie d’un endroit un petit peu cocooning pendant leurs vacances en famille.

title: Excellent customer service + Great Location
text:
This is a great choice for a hotel with a fantastic location, a solid breakfast and wine bar and clean/comfortable rooms. 

What makes this an exceptional hotel is the level of service and care the team provides. 
On a recent visit I arrived and discovered I had made our reservation for the wrong night. This was right between Christmas and New Year’s Eve and I knew many hotels were booked up. I braced myself for either being turned away or being charged 10x what we had booked for. Instead Shanies and Francille at the front desk quickly went to work to see if there was a room available. They found that one room had just cancelled and switched our reservation AND found a better rate. They seemed so happy to have helped us out. I couldn’t believe it.

I come to the city often and usually stay at a few different hotels. Because of Shanies and Francille, Hotel Belleclaire will now be my first choice.

title: Birthday getaway
text: This hotel ended up being an unexpected blessing in disguise. I had never heard of this hotel we’re staying at this hThis hotel ended up being an unexpected blessing in disguise. I had never heard of this hotel or stayed at this hotel. Normally we stay at a Hilton Marriott or IHG located outside. The lobby is a French pastry shop, which we ate breakfast every morning thanks to the hotel giving us vouchers. From the beginning, the lady at the front , I believe her name is Shanirs was more than helpful and pleasant as we did have a bit of a problem, getting there too early for a check in and not having the room that we had originally reserved.

title: Great hotel and staff!
text: My husband, teenage daughter, and I spent three days just before Christmas in New York. This was our first time staying at the Hotel Belleclaire in the upper Westside. It was truly a wonderful experience. I was a little cautious at first. In my experience, with smaller boutique hotels, the experience can go either way, Luckily, we found a gem in Hotel Belleclaire. It’s a great location and we were able to take the train to within two blocks of its location on 77th and Broadway. It’s a beautiful old building nicely restored with a quaint French bakery attached. The neighborhood was clean and safe. We arrived early, around 12 noon, but Maria, at the front desk, was wonderful and allowed us an early check-in at one, once the room was clean. The weather was nice, so we walked to Central Park which was about a 10 minute easy walk from the hotel. When we returned, Maria had a room available, which she upgraded so that we had a bit more room, and a wonderful front facing view. On arrival we were also given a gift box of macaroons which my daughter loves as well as breakfast tickets for the continental breakfast they provide from the bakery next-door. Coming out of the pandemic, it was a real pleasure to experience such wonderful customer service! The young man who was the bellman was a gem. Full of great information and recommendations. On top of the kind and professional staff, the room was lovely as well. It was renovated, clean and comfortable. The bathroom had a great shower.  I can go on, but it will suffice to say that Hotel Belleclaire is a great choice for a stay in New York.  Definitely will return.

title: Christmas at the Hotel Belleclaire
text: My wife and I chose to stay at the Belleclaire during its Christmas special -- a corner room facing Broadway, a Christmas tree in the room (with gifts under the tree), and a sense of the season we came to New York to enjoy. We hardly recognized the place, since we hadn't been there after the major renovations were completed. They've managed to give it a modern feel without losing the character it has as an historic hotel. Jonathan Quezado, Director of the Front Office, saw to our needs and made sure we had a wonderful time... and we did.

title: A good place to stay in the Upper West Side of NYC
text: Overall a good 3* hotel. Location, staff, cleanliness, all top notch. The reception desk gave me a hassle over breakfast vouchers upon check-in. We were a party of four and the clerk would only give me vouchers for three while the reservation confirmation clearly stated breakfast for four. I got four vouchers, but the check-in process was unpleasant. The hotel's breakfast room is located on street level and I needed to wear my winter coat to breakfast due to the arctic winds and freezing temperatures that accompanied my coffee and croissant. The bathroom window in my room is in need of insulation around the edges as cold air comes in all the time. Reception staff gave us top notch service to solve a stuffed toilet issue at 4 AM. A hotel of this stature should offer modern amenities in the room. A refrigerator, coffee corner and a working telephone would certainly be appreciated. No gym or business center on premises. With these caveats, I would recommend.

title: Belleclaire hotel
text:
Nice place, confort and good service 
Special thanks to Shanies and Francille for the professional and kindness 
They are very nice and mêle very good job 
I recommend Belleclaire hôtel 
we are very welcome 
Thanks so much

title: L’Hotel perfetto per New York!!
text: Perfect location a stone's throw from the red subway that crosses Manhattan.  Clean hotel with very comfortable bed (knowing we were Italian they let me find the queen size).  Breakfast inside.  very friendly and very helpful staff;  especially Maria who assisted us in everything when our flight was delayed!!!  highly recommended

title: helpful staff
text: There are already lots of reviews for this property, but I did want to leave a short note of appreciation for the front desk staff (Maria!) who went the extra mile in ensuring that we had a comfortable room and relaxing stay.  Also appreciated were the breakfast coupons for the very good French bakery that is located just off the lobby.

title: Great find in the upper west side NYC
text:
1. The hotel was perfect and had charm. Great location close to subway, Central Park , and next door to French bakery that they serve at their breakfast time.  Away from midtown madness but close enough to get there fast. 
2. The hotel front desk. Francelle and maria and another woman whose name I cannot remember were friendly and helpful.  I think there is a Mike and some other men and the bellman were all awesome. 
3. Our room was very good. No coffee or tea in rooms but it was easy to get downstairs and grab. 
4. Monday and Wednesday they have complimentary wine. They had an accapella  singing group in to sing Christmas music one evening It was lovely. 
5. I cant say enough good things abou this hotel. I was traveling with my granddaughter and I felt safe and well cared for the entire stay. I 
 Look forward to staying here again

title: Mount Sinai Visit
text: The staff was very attentive and accommodating to our travel needs.  We were visiting NYC for a family member’s medical procedure at Mt Sinai hospital, an easy cross town cab ride.  When our family member was released early from the hospital the staff was able to accommodate our schedule to allow to return for home recovery. I especially want to thank Shanies very professional attention and expediting our travel changes.  We hope to be back next time for a non medical NYC visit.

title: Enjoyable Stay
text: Very clean,quiet hotel in nice neighborhood.The room size is like Europe,on the small side.However  great customer service via Jonathan&Maria!Extra touches appreciated like early check-in,upgraded room nice happy hour,delicious breakfast pastries from French bakery nxt door not too mention the gift of delicious macaroons(thanks Travelzoo!)Would definitely recommend!

title: Bad service
text: I stayed at this hotel on Friday 12/9 and booked a room for 2 nights. On Saturday 12/10 I had an emergency and had to leave at around 10am and asked the front desk since it was very early if I could get a partial refund for that second night since they had plenty of time to get rid of my room. The woman said since I booked online they can’t do anything. I don’t understand how online makes any difference if the answer is no that’s fine but that’s a bad excuse. There was also nothing special about this hotel room was small and no amenities

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Just returned from a five night stay here and we really liked this hotel. The entrance/lobby is lovely and the staff who greeted us were nice and friendly. We wanted a hotel away from all the noise of times square but still within walking distance. It's about a 30 minute walk there but there are also two subway stations nearby too. Our room was generally quiet but you were woken early by the noise of people running their shower in the next room. Not a big deal unless you want to sleep in. 
We were upgraded to a king room which was lovely and the bed and pillows were comfortable especially after a long day of walking. The bathroom was small and could use some tlc (tiling and grouting) but was okay for a short stay.
We didn't have breakfast here so can't comment on that but there is a bakery a couple minutes walk away that does the best cookies you'll ever taste- levain bakery. 
Overall I enjoyed my stay here and would definitely return again.

title: Shanise is THE BEST
text: When you check in, ask for Shanise! We felt like we got the royal treatment when we arrived. Some of the best customer service I’ve ever seen at a hotel. She made our 9 day stay very comfortable. Also, the hotel was very nice, in a great area, and close to the 1 train. I would definitely stay here again

title: Great location, terrible value
text: I wanted to like this hotel. The people who work here are friendly and kind, the location is wonderful and the lobby is very charming. Unfortunately, my room was absolutely tiny (basically large enough for a queen bed and a little bit of space to maneuver around it) and the "view" out of the window was over a stairwell so dark I couldn't tell if it was night or day. This was an upgrade from the first room I was shown which had a "view" of several heat pumps. For almost $500 a night I would expect something much much better. I never write reviews, but the quality of this room was so shocking given the price that I wanted to let others know.

title: Small Hotel Nestled in UWS
text: This is the first time I stayed here, as my usual hotel was booked. The rate was reasonable for a brief stay shopping for a wedding dress. The room was clean simple and quiet. Nice bath amenities and towels. Sweet cafe in lobby. Staff was accommodating as possible with some room requests. I always stay in this neighborhood. This is not a fancy hotel, but clean quiet and overall friendly. I would stay again. Thank you.

title: I wanted to love it…
text:
I first stayed at this hotel many years ago, and was looking forward to a return visit. Unfortunately I was disappointed with my recent stay at the Bellclaire, 

You cannot beat the location! The Hotel is located UWS away from the madding crowd, yet easy to access anywhere in Manhattan with multiple subway and bus options only a few short blocks away. 

Also fantastic was the little French cafe attached to the hotel which, dependent on your room rate, you are provided vouchers which can be redeemed in the morning. 

But maybe it was the discounted TravelZoo deal that we took advantage of to book our stay (I don’t know for sure) but the room we got was small/poky and without any basic amenities that you expect in a hotel room of today (coffee maker, glasses). Our bathroom was poorly designed, so much so the toilet literally sat under the vanity. And yes I know NY hotel rooms are known to be on the ‘small side’, however having stayed in many hotels over the years this was just a case of poor design.

The wifi was deplorable. Basically non-existent. When we asked reception if there was anything that could be done we were told ‘come down to reception where it is better’. Not ideal when it is 1am and you just want to action some emails.

I really wanted to love this hotel, and I did love the location, but that’s about it.

title: Shanie at Hotel Belleclaire was excellent!
text:
I don’t normally spend the time to write a review but I have to vent and say SHANIE at Belleclaire was exceptionally grounded and kind. 

She leads by example. Thank you for being an empathic human to others. Thank you again. I will try y’all again only cause of you. PEACE

title: My NY home away from home
text: I stayed at the Belleclaire for almost a week, and had a very comfortable stay. The location is great, and the reception staff, especially Benedict, were very helpful and welcoming. I'll definitely stay next time I'm back.

title: Not what it used to be
text: This has always been our go-to-hotel.  Without warning they discontinued their valet parking.  This is not acceptable.   I know Covid has everyone making excuses, but in Manhattan valet parking is a huge asset for travelers, especially those with physical difficulties.  I’m so very disappointed in the Belleclaire not notifying as reservations are being made.   We used to recommend the hotel all the time, but this is a big deal to us.  Poor way to make customers feel respected.

title: stay at Belleclaire
text: excellent location, the Upper West Side area is quiet and well connected to downtown thanks to the metro, with stop near to the hotel.  very good staff, quite a big room, good solution the breakfast vouchers.

title: Fav location in upper west side 🔝
text: I spent a wonderful holiday in NYC with my mum back in April ‘22. The hotel was super comfortable, clean and very close to the subway for downtown. They offer vouchers for having breakfast at the bakery located in the adjacent building, which is reachable directly from the lobby; this made us save a lot of time and money! The only downside: I wasn’t able to take note of the scent used for the reception and the hall… I would have bought it in order to feel that vibe at home, too. “Kate, we have to got back!”

title: First Time at Hotel Belleclaire
text:
Book without knowing much about Hotel.  From the moment we arrive Naomi at the front desk made us feel we were at home. She picked us a great room and gave us plenty of ideas thinks to do, eat, shop.  
Give Naomi and Belleclaire a try next time need upper Westside hotel

title: Highly recommend
text:
Stayed for 2 nights. Staff friendly and professional. Room was clean and quiet. Location close to central
park and subway. Bakery next door was delicious. We got a $10 voucher for the bakery each day. Total value of $40!

title: Excellent staff!!
text: What made my stay excellent at Belleclaire was Benedict of the reception who was always warm, helpful and always went the extra mile to accommodate my requests. The bellman, Mark, was also very helpful with everything we needed.

title: New York
text:
Recently travelled to New York and stayed at Hotel Belleclaire 2175 Broadway. The hotel has just been renovated and was a nice place to stay. Although the gym wasn’t available they had made provision to use a local one at no cost.
Special mention for Maria on reception who helped answer any question regarding shopping, taxis and food. She was approachable and extremely helpful throughout our stay. Oh and had a sympathetic ear when it came to herding children to various places !!!

title: A typical NYC hotel
text: We spent 4 nights here, choosing it mainly because of the excellent location. But the amenities are limited: the rooms are very small, there is no room service or coffee maker in the rooms. No hairdryer.  When we asked, we were brought an electric pot, but we had to supply the cups and coffee. Guests are given vouchers for breakfast in one of 2 locations on the main floor, but the choices are limited. The room was cleaned daily, but there were areas under the bed and along the wall which had not been cleaned in awhile.  There were constant problems with the WIFI.  With that the staff was very helpful.

title: What a great hotel!
text:
Just got back from a 2 night visit to NYC with my 16 yo daughter to visit colleges and see some wonderful areas of NY including Union Square, Central Park and Washington Square Park. Hotel Belleclaire was a wonderful find! An affordable option in the heart of NY that has grand style with modern updates and is connected to a lovely French bakery where you can enjoy a delicious pastry and a coffee or OJ on the house. 
When we first arrived Benedict was so friendly and upgraded our room for us so we didn't have to share a bed. The upgrade was much appreciated. The room was super clean and although on the smaller side, it was totally adequate and surprisingly quiet. The towels were bright white and very absorbant. The sheets and pillows were so comfortable and also white & crisp. The beds were also super comfortable. We requested TP for the room because for some reason it was hiding in the closet rather than hung in the bathroom so we didn't see it. A few minutes later, someone arrived with several rolls and asked if we needed anything else. We asked if there were any blankets available and were given nice quality blankets for each bed also within minutes. The service at this hotel is amazing! Everyone was so attentive and we felt very well taken care of. I was also pleasantly surprised that our room received a cleaning and a turn down service while we were out exploring the city. I thought those types of cleanings ended with Covid. Why would you stay anywhere else? It's a great value and the location can't be beat. Staying near Central Park was so much nicer than other places I have stayed in the Times Square area and you can be in Times Square in about 15 minutes by taking the Red #1 train on the subway that is one block over.
We will definitely return to this hotel for any future NY visits, thank you staff, we really appreciated the personal attention that we received. One area of improvement would be to fix the bad wifi signal, otherwise, no complaints from us. We loved it!

title: Vacaciones descubriendo NY
text:
Estuvimos fantásticamente bien en este hotel,  lo recomiendo sin duda alguna, sobretodo por la situación. Teníamos incluido el desayuno, que era una panadeía francesa, aunque extremadamente caro.  
La habitación fue muy cómoda, una cama extragrande y almohadas muy confortables.  Todo muy bien equipado, incluso con plancha y tabla de planchar. La limpieza también muy adecuada y discreta, no los vimos en ninguna ocasión. 
El hotel se encuentra en la misma avenida Broadway, cerca hay muchos supermercados y sitios para comer algo, y caminando unos veinte minutos llegas hasta Times Square. Cerca se encuentra el metro de la calle 72, aunque estaba todo tan a mano, que sólo lo usamos para largas distancias.

title: Enjoyed our stay on the UWS
text: Friendly and most helpful staff, comfortable bed and room (although not too large), some nice amenities and great location.  Noisy at times (our room was by the elevator) but otherwise a very good experience. Would happily stay there again.

title: Love this place
text: Got the most amazing welcome into the hotel from Benedict & Shanies. They were kind and help and made us fell right at home. Hotel is great location clean, has character, very happy. Great hotel and staff.

title: Great hotel!
text: This will be our go to hotel the next time we are in NYC. There was something about arriving in the early evening with this beautiful old hotel brightly lit and welcoming. The rooms were spacious, comfortable, newly renovated with an almost silent HVAC system. One would think there would be a lot of street noise being located on Broadway but not in our room.  There were a lot of restaurant choices in the area, subway was easily accessible, good access to Central Park and a good walking area. Best of all, the staff were thoroughly pleasant and accommodating. They seemed to like their jobs. :-)

title: Shopping, Theatre & Sight seeing trip
text: This is the 4th time my friend and I have travelled together to New York for mostly shopping & theatre. This is our favourite hotel and one to which we intend to return to. The foyer is beautiful and when we arrived we were warmly greeted by Benedict who was excellent during our entire 4 night stay. Nothing was any problem and he always greeted us when he saw us every day and showed interest in our plans for the day and offered good advice. Breakfast was an added bonus from the amazing French Bakery adjoining the hotel. You can get served in the hotel or in the little bakery itself and bring your breakfast into the hotel to enjoy. Having had difficulty finding a lovely diner for breakfast on our previous 3 trips meant we really appreciated having such a wonderful breakfast in our hotel. Our room (2 double beds) was beautifully appointed and newly decorated. It was extremely clean and we had maid service every day. The room was a good size by New York standards. The air conditioning was excellent. I am claustrophobic and was concerned when I read a review about the tiny lift however Benedict directed us to the service lift which is bigger and was less of a problem for me. On previous stays our hotel was closer to the main shopping areas in New York however Hotel Belleclaire is a 2 minute walk to a subway station (79th Street) which we used a lot during our stay. That said the hotel is only a 38 minute walk to the Rockefeller Centre off 5th Avenue and the walk is very pleasant passing the fabulous Columbus Circle Shopping Mall and part of the walk overlooks Central Park. The $120 taxi fare from JFK airport can be easily avoided by taking the Air Train ($8) to Howard Beach then the subway ($2.95) to Columbus Circle (about 20 or 21 stops). At Columbus Circle change to the No. 1 line to 79th Street (about 3 stops). This is about 15 minutes longer than the shortest subway route however with heavy suitcases it is the easiest in my view. It is also worth buying the $33 (7 day unlimited rides) on the subway and bus ticket.

title: Uma joia encrustada na Broadway com 77 St
text: Ficamos hospedados no Hotel Belleclaire entre os dias 13-26 de outubro de 2022, e só temos elogios. A começar pelos funcionários, que são muito educados e prestativos, desde a recepção, passando por todos os funcionários da cafeteria, e também a camareira e o senhor responsável pela limpeza das áreas comuns. O quarto é grande, a cama é confortável, o chuveiro é ótimo. O hotel está localizado na Broadway com 77 St, o metrô mais próximo (linha 1, super indicada para ir nos pontos turísticos) fica na Broadway com 79 St, então é muito perto. Na esquina do hotel tem uma farmácia da rede CVS, e na quadra ao lado uma loja Marshalls. Quando for para NY, não deixe de se hospedar no Hotel Belleclaire, eu super indico!

title: Great stay at Belle Claire
text: My wife and I stayed in the Belle Claire last week for 3 nights from 25th October. We had a great stay- the hotel is in a nice area in the Upper West Side. It has a fantastic coffee shop called Mille Feuille for breakfast. Our room was nice and had a very powerful shower which was great. In particular I would like to thank Maria on reception for her kindness and help throughout our trip with helpful info on transportation and sites to see. We would definitely stay at the Belle Claire again

title: Good breakfast, bad wifi
text: For NYC the hotel was pretty nice, and the included breakfast pastries were great, but the WiFi was just terrible -- to get it to work even halfway decently you had to sign off the WiFi and sign back on again each time you opened your device.

title: We’ll definitely be coming back here again!
text:
Stayed for 5 nights. First given a room with an extremely small bathroom. Literally nowhere to put anything or hang anything up. Asked for a different room and they could not have been more helpful. Maria at the front desk showed me several rooms to pick from.
Large room (especially for NYC!) with a very nice bathroom. Super comfy, huge bed. Enough wardrobe space, writing desk and chair. 
It was squeaky clean and pretty well soundproof, given we were right on Broadway. 
Front desk staff in general was very helpful and courteous. 
The hotel was closed and refurbished during the pandemic, so it’s fresh and nicely decorated.
‘Breakfast’  is a bit if a misnomer as it’s pastries and regular tea/coffee and nothing more.
Location, for us, was perfect. Max ten minutes walk to Central Park and half hour to Times Square.
There are endless cafes in the neighbourhood. Arthouse hotel, which is across the road, does the best coffee in NYC!

title: Great New York hotel
text: This hotel is located at Broadway Ave and 77th street. A great location next to subway station and Central Park . Just about a 1.5 miles from center of New York. Rooms clean, stuff provieds great service. A French Café next to it for light breakfast with very good pastries.

title: The Best Staff-Thanks to Miss Francelle
text: I stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire for the four years my son was in college in the City and found it to be, as they advertise, a jewel. Great rooms, great location, lovely lobby, friendly staff that always went out of the way to make you feel well. So when my son returned for Grad School, of course, I went to book there and yesterday, found that I had made a mistake with the online booking. I called the front desk and was so very happy to work with Francelle, the supervisor, who immediately rectified the situation, re-booked me and was quick and so very thoughtful. Once again, the Hotel Belleclaire comes through. Thank you so much to Miss Francelle!!

title: Hotel Belleclaire is lovely, but esp Shanies
text: Hotel Belleclair is a lovely hotel.  Clean, spacious room with a view of the Upper West Side.  Our experience would not have been nearly as good if not for Shanies at the front desk. Our reservation was altered in error and she quickly remedied while showing empathy and patience.  Shanies also has the most warm inviting smile.

title: Staff
text: The women at the front desk: Francelle, Maria and Shanies were very nice and accommodating. I give them a 10/5!! The room was clean and comfy. Could have used a small loveseat. Close to everything. Would recommend.

title: Nice affordable hotel on the upper west side
text:
Sayed here two nights while visiting our daughter. 
While the rooms are rather small (it is New York after all), they are clean, modern and well maintained. Elevator is likewise - big enough for four without luggage.
Breakfast (included) is a coffee and pastry from the shop next door offered in the lobby - fantastic pastry by the way.
Pretty convenient to the 1/2/3 (red) subway but we drove and actually found street parking a few blocks away!

title: First time in NYC
text: Friendly and attentive staff. Nice modern rooms which are clean and have everything you need. The lobby area smells amazing every time you walk into the hotel. Reservations include vouchers to use in the bakery daily - the coffee and almond croissants are 10/10! Really nice location - we cancelled our hotel on Times Square to stay here instead and we’re glad we did as it’s much nicer and more of a real New York feel.

title: Mala mala experiencia
text:
La verdad llegamos al hotel para estar 8 noches, es lindo y muy muy bien ibicado, el desayjno son tickets en una cafeteria buenisima en el ñrimer piso si hay cola es lento y el ticket se hace poco 
Las habitaciones muy cuidsdas el estilo del hotel es muy apropiado 
No nos entregaron la habitacion ni un minuto amtes a pesar de q llegamos muy temprano en un dia nevando y lo solicitamos...se entiende pero era una kmportante deferencia 
Lo peor vino la segunda noche donde se paseaba un raton por la habigacion .... por muy NY q sea es complemamete impresentable ...no habia nadie q nos pudiera ayudar solo nos llevaron la llave de otra habitacion y por rsa noche dada la hora aceptamos al dia siguie te nos fuimos ...no es algo aceptable en un hotel asi de simple

title: Lovely hotel in great location
text: This is a great little hotel. It was my first trip to NYC and I wanted to stay outside of the crazy midtown area. This was a perfect choice. It is easily walkable to Central Park and the MET and a quick, convenient subway into midtown. Rooms are recently renovated, comfy bed, nice linens and towels. Helpful staff. Housekeeping was a bit spotty which is the only reason I give it four vs five stars. They took my shampoo and conditioner one day which was inconvenient, but the front desk was quick to replace with a call. Appreciated the bottled waters, fruit at the front desk. The daily bakery credit for breakfast was also a fab bonus. The bakery is amazing. I will be back.

title: Lovely hotel, close to Central Park and the subway!
text:
Lovely hotel, great location, pet friendly, with great staff! Hotel Belleclaire in a great part of NYC, very close to Central Park and very close to one of the main subway lines (red- 1 train) With plenty of restaurants nearby. The hotel has been recently renovated so the room we stayed in was modern and clean while the building itself holds a classic charm. The lobby is gorgeous and the included voucher for the coffee & pastry place next door is a nice touch. 
Naomi at the front desk took great care of us, very thankful. We’ll definitely keep Belleclaire on the very top of our list of NYC hotels in the future.

title: Great fall getaway
text: Clean rooms. Lovely lobby. Great staff. Convenient location. We loved it. We came up for four days and we’re so thankful to have such a great place to rest and refresh every day. Plus the food at the French bakery for breakfast every morning was just delicious.

title: Wonderful!
text: Great location! The hotel is super comfortable, cute, and clean!! Special shout out to the amazing staff so nice and welcoming specially Benedict and Michael. Thanks for your help! ! I really recommend!

title: So Helpful, accommodating & friendly!
text:
My mom & I came to NYC to visit her cousin, who came in from out of town!  I looked & looked at different hotels in this area because of where our relative was staying!  We wanted to be close to her! How lucky were we to find the Hotel Belleclaire!  I couldn’t have picked a better hotel! With my mom mobility issues, the front desk staff (Michael, Bennett & Marial) we’re SO wonderful & accommodating to me & my mom!  They even switched up our room for a Handicap accessible one when we asked.  These guys were fun, funny & help to put me at ease when they saw me SO stressed out as I was trying to accommodate my mom’s needs, making sure she was doing ok & got what she needed, and to keep her safe!
But I have to tell you, The front door man, (I don’t think his name was Hector, was it? I thought his name started with a B, something like Berle…oh, I’m SO, so sorry I don’t remember his name) though, if it is Hector, I have to tell you, this man was so wonderful & kind to my mom….and helpful to me!  When he saw my mom getting out of my car, was having problems walking into the lobby, he assisted by making her feel at ease, by letting her take his arm & walk with her!  He actually left his post to walk her up to our room, as I had to deal with going to park my car at a nearby garage!  What a wonderful, kind man!  I can’t say enough about him!  (Was his name really Hector?) 
Room was clean, small, but we managed! It’s a typical size room for NYC hotels! The Continental breakfast was a wonderful treat!  Though for people like my mom, who is Diabetic, she needed more substance!  The bakery attached to the hotel has fabulous treats! I really enjoyed them!  (Apple turnover was delicious!). My only suggestion (it’s my fault though, I didn’t speak to someone at the bakery to see if they could/would arrange to have something egg for my mom to eat, even if we had to pay more for it! But I didn’t) Is to have more egg options that would last later in the morning (for slow moving Mom’s like I had!) for her to choose…..but things went very quickly there!  You really do need to get there early in the morning to get the best options to eat!  
All in all…I really can’t say enough for the treatment & accommodations we received during our stay there!  Plus, I do have to say, the people at the Belleclaire, as well as during our outings around NYC, were very accommodating to my mom & I, as I did have her in a wheelchair most of the time, opening & holding doors for us, giving a hand to helping us with whatever was needed at the time to help my mom be successful!  Though we don’t come to the city much these days, I will be sure to arrange to come stay with you again next time!  Thank you for everything you did for my mom & I, making our stay the best it could be!  Thank you!

title: Exceptional Service From Maria at this lovely hotel!
text:
My daughter and I spent two nights at the beginning of September at Hotel Belleclaire. We were in NYC to celebrate my birthday. Maria, at the front desk, was exceedingly kind. We received a room upgrade and early check-in (my daughter needed to work), and on my actual birthday, a box of macarons from the great bakery next door to the hotel. 
The hotel is very clean. Our room was spacious, and the bed comfortable. Our only issue was with caliber of wifi, but the engineer who came up to our room was aware that this was a problem and that the hotel was working to resolve it and insure better connectivity.
We come to NYC often and have been looking for a hotel to which we can return regularly. I think we’ve found it! I’ve recommended Hotel Belleclaire to others already. 
I’m so sorry for waiting nearly a month to post this! Thank you especially to Maria.

title: Adjustment of customer policy’s protocols
text:
On Sept. 25th, 2022, my wife and I checked out from Belleclaire hotel. The night before our departure I approached the front desk to request the possibility of a late check out. One of the desk front officer (the younger one) offered a symbolic half and hour late check out and asked me to request to the next morning’s front desk officers  a longer check out time. 
The following morning what happened was that I was offered the same late check out extension without any offered. In fact, the person in charge was clear when mentioning that, as a hotel’s policy, only half an hour was offered to guests as a complementary late check out. That’s it. 
To put it clear, I am not complaining because I was not given a longer late check out (even if half an hour is more of a symbolic late check out as mentioned). I am disappointed because we were not treated fairly. The front desk officer on evening Sep.  25th could have mentioned that complementary late check out was only half an hour and that was all he could offer to guests. However, he did not and this is why I understand we were not given a fair treatment. Instead of that, he sent us to speak to another colleague  the following morning knowing in advance that the answer was going to be exactly the same: half an hour late check out as a rule. 
In a world of fierce competition, loyalty means a lot. Behaviors like these ones Do Not contribute to generate loyalty ties  with customers. 
Hence, I would respectfully  suggest those responsible of Hotel Bellclaire’s  customer relations to review their customer service’s protocols in order to avoid in the future practices like the one above described.

title: Annual Forum UN
text:
Shanies has been outstanding and very helpful to make my stay short but very sweet! The hotel is well situated and super accessible. Rooms are clean. Lobby is well maintained. 

It’s giving a cache of new and chic.

title: Fun Night at Belleclaire
text: We had a nice king size room that was lovely and inviting. The staff was friendly and accommodating. They handled our bags prior to checking in and again after we checked out so we could go out and experience the Upper West Side without worry. The hotel organized a car to take us to the Newark Airport, making our stay seemless and effortless. We highly recommend the Hotel Belleclaire!

title: A Price Performer on the Upper West Side
text:
We have stayed many times on the upper west side, but this is our first time using the Hotel Belleclaire;  we'd definitely stay here again! 

It is excellently located for access to any parts of the city via bus or subway. You can easily walk to the Museum of Natural History, and Central Park.  It is surrounded by many good restaurants! We took the red-eye in from SF and they offer, for a small fee, a 10:00am check-in, which is a wonderful amenity. We were well served by Shanies when we checked in, and by all staff when needed. For a quick breakfast, there is the outstanding bakery with an entrance thru the hotel lobby. 

All of this, and at a very reasonable price for a New York hotel.

The room was tight in space and there is no refrigerator, but more importantly, the bed was comfortable, there was a good sized TV, and the bathroom was more than adequate!

title: Pleasant in the right room
text:
Hotel Belleclaire offers modern minimalist decor in an old-time hotel with some degree of charm.  
    First things first:  I'm deeply grateful to Francella at the front desk, who made a special effort to relocate me after I had spent my first night in a room that was right behind the elevators.  (That fact was not obvious from the start because the room was partway down a hall, and for the first few hours of my sleepless night, I thought that someone upstairs was dragging furniture around!)  Francella was sympathetic and efficient in moving me, and she even took the trouble to check in with me at the end of her evidently 12-hour shift to make sure I was truly comfortable.  
       Pros about the hotel:  good location; attractive lobby; clean throughout; reasonable-size rooms; updated bathrooms; good beds; good elevators; wide carpeted staircases at both ends of the main corridor; streamlined room decor; no carpeting in the rooms (good for those with allergies).
       Cons: narrow halls branching off the main corridor (tight for bulky suitcases, and seemingly likely to get clogged in an evacuation scenario); rather austere room decor; no carpeting in the rooms (an element of the spartan feel).
       I've listed some things as both Pros and Cons because they can be viewed differently according to your preferences.

title: Excellent hotel!  Highly recommend
text: We loved our stay here.  Great staff, super clean and gorgeous historic building. We also loved the bakery downstairs and the 10 per person per day credit gifted by the hotel.  It was also easily walkable to all UWS places and Central Park.  Would highly recommend!

title: Great boutique hotel on Upper West Side
text:
I used to live in this neighborhood and walked by this hotel almost every day. So I knew the location would be great. But I had no idea it was so nice inside. The lobby is lovely and all of the people who work there are very friendly and helpful. And the rooms, although small (it is Manhattan, after all) have everything you need and it's extremely clean and comfortable. My room faced an alley so it had no view nor sunlight. But this made it very quiet, which was great. I'm sure there are other rooms that might be larger and have a better view but I'm sure you'll pay more (and the quiet was worth a lot!). Finally, one of the best surprises of this hotel is the Mille Feuille French bakery next door (actually there's a lobby entrance). Each room is given two $10 vouchers for each morning. This can be used on anything they sell. I even got a delicious sandwich to eat on the plane the day I left. The pastries and bread were amazing--like you get in Paris! And although the line is long in the morning, you can use the vouchers any time you wish. This is a wonderful benefit of staying at this hotel. I'd eat there even if I didn't stay there.

But, having said that, I will definitely come back to the Belleclaire on my next visit to NYC.

title: Location and restaurant are great; rooms cramped but clean
text: The best part about this hotel is the french bakery on the ground floor.  If only ever hotel's complimentary breakfast consisted of a voucher for $10 worth of fresh croissants instead of a stale-bagel-and-rubbery-egg platter. The room itself was small, but clean and comfortable enough.  I had a rear-facing room, so the view of the back alley wasn't my favorite part about anything.  But the location is great too. Near subway stops, Central Park, museums, etc.

title: Excellent service!!!
text: Maria and Naomi were amazingly helpful!! 10/10 service and highly recommend staying here :) when I wanted to open a can and couldn’t find a can opener anywhere nearby, Naomi saved the day and tried everything until she opened the can for us. Truly an excellent vacation thanks to these wonderful people!

title: Great Hotel
text: Great neighborhood and location on the Upper West Side. A block away from family that I was visiting. The staff at check in and during my stay were all so welcoming and responsive. My room was clean and contained the most comfortable bed. Don't think I've slept so good in years! There's a lovely Cafe in the lobby but I only got to visit once because the line gets long. Special thanks to Alicia who came to my rescue during an emergency. Top notch!! I will definitely visit again.

title: Muy buena opción para quedarse en NYC
text:
Nos quedamos 8 días. Al principio nos dieron una habitacion pequeña y algo sofocante .Luego se echó a perder el aire acondicionado ( lo que fue bastante terrible en agosto) y felizmente nos cambiaron a una habitación más grande  ( aunque no inmediatamente) y la experiencia fue mucho mejor . Es lindo el hotel con su estilo art nouveau- beaux arts.  Internet funcionaba mucho mejor en la segunda habitación que en la primera. El sistema de desayuno en la cafetería Millefeuille si bien es poco ( dan tickets de 10 dólares a cada pasajero ) es exquisito con verdaderas delicias francesas. 
La atención de Maria en particular en el front desk muy amable. La ubicación perfecta . Sin  duda volvería ahí mismo ,ojalá a una mejor habitación ya que claramente hay mejores . Lo recomiendo .

title: Perfect spot for us in NYC!
text: We stayed three nights at Hotel Belleclaire and had a great time. Room was nice, bed was very comfortable with the fluffiest pillows.  The room stayed cool in spite of the heat and humidity outside.  The location of the hotel was perfect for us. The room rate worked out to be about $278/night when considering the breakfast vouchers.  Having the french bakery next door was a treat and they served delicious coffee and pastries.  This was a great stay for our first trip to NY.

title: buona struttura pessimo servizio e colazione
text:
Camera da letto adeguata per la tipologia della struttura, letto comodo.Durante il nostro soggiorno, tuttavia, l'aria condizionata non ha funzionato per circa 5 o 6 giorni (su 11 notti di soggiorno) e ciò nonostante l'albergo non ha praticato alcuno sconto. Al di là dell'inconveniente che può accadere (e non è imputabile all'albergo), ciò che rende questa recensione insufficiente è la colazione. Abbiamo optato per la colazione inclusa: niente di più sbagliato! In realtà l'Hotel consegna tanti voucher da 10$ per ogni giorno di permanenza che possono essere spesi nella Pasticceria adiacente all'albergo. Al di là del fatto che al momento della prenotazione ciò non è stato specificato (contesto nello specifico il limite di spesa per la colazione), ciò che è assolutamente inaccettabile è il doversi mettere in fila anche per oltre 30 o 45 minuti (a seconda dell'orario) per poter acquistare una brioche o un pezzo di pane dalla Pasticceria. Tale situazione si crea perché il personale della Pasticceria (di regola 2 persone) si trovano a dover servire sia i clienti delll'Hotel Belleclaire sia tutte le persone (newyorkesi, turisti e altre persone) che desiderano - buon diritto - fruire dei servizi della Pasticceria. Non è prevista una corsia preferenziale per i clienti dell'Hotel e ciò comporta che se si vuole evitare il più possibile di stare in coda ci si debba alzare molto presto (7.30 a.m.) oppure molto tardi (10.30 a.m.), situazioni che durante un soggiorno di vacanza non sono il massimo.
Consiglio quindi se proprio desiderate alloggiare presso la struttura di non acquistare il pacchetto con la colazione: soldi buttati.
Suggerimento alla Struttura: realizzate una sala da pranzo e offrite una colazione continentale, magari con una maggiore attenzione al cliente!

title: Home away from home on the Upper West Side!
text: This was my family’s second stay at the Hotel Belleclaire and it again exceeded expectations. The staff are exceptional, from Francelle and Jonathan at the front desk, to the friendly doormen and bellhops. The Art Deco building has been recently restored and rooms are crisp and restful, with space economically used. Our seventh-floor king room had views to the river and lovely tiled shower. Mille-Feuille bakery is a bonus — the hotel offers $10 vouchers/guest each day and yes, there is a line at times, but it moves swiftly and with the wait. Sandwiches are great to take to the park.  Always feel very welcome and cared for at the Belleclaire!

title: First Time Stay!!
