text: You can always tell a lot about a hotel because of the way the front desk greets you!! I was greeted with a great smile and pleasantries from Maria. She did a great job expediting my check in process as I arrived on a redeye flight and was looking forward to getting to my room. No hassle, just great customer service!! I will definitely stay here again!

title: Nice stay in NYC
text: Clean and nice rooms, personnel available 24/24, good location. Special thanks to Maria (reception) for her kind and efficient assistance and help. We really enjoyed the hotel, the metro is not far away and there is a multitude of restaurants and shops in this pleasant district.

title: Amazing staff!!
text: We booked here last minute on a Saturday. The staff were all insanely welcoming, helpful and courteous. The hotel smells wonderful!! Everything was clean and well kept. The cafe attached had delicious, well priced goodies for breakfast. Will definitely book again here if I find myself back in the City.

title: Wonderful staff and Experience
text: So grateful to have found this beautiful hotel at the last minute. Shanies and the others working the front desk were so kind, fun and generous-upgrading our room so there was lots of space for us. Thank you so much-would definitely recommend

title: Best hotel stay in Manhattan ever!
text: This hotel is beautiful and the staff go above and beyond to make you feel special. The rooms are clean and they have done an amazing job keeping the historic charm of the building while also offering modern amenities.

title: Everything you want in a good hotel
text: My husband and I were only in town for one night, and your service and hospitality made it a wonderful short visit. Francella at the front desk could not have left a better first impression. Loved the room - great view and crazy clean. Nice linens and towels. Would absolutely stay here again.

title: Outstanding Staff!
text: I stayed at this hotel for a critical standardized test, and everything about the stay put my mind at ease for that experience. The staff are thoughtful, knowledgeable, and responsive. The location is excellently placed in the UWS. The rooms were clean and featured all the requisite amenities. I would highly recommend the Belleclaire.

title: Great Base in New York
text:
Clean basic room. Historical building with original dark wood features. Great position. We walked lots 30.000 steps a day. So much to see and do. Subway too hot so we preferred to walk. Breakfast vouchers $10 per person in lovely little cafe. Just pastries, quiche, baguettes and cakes. We preferred the yogurt and coffee. If leaving too early you can use them any day. We still spent a fortune in New York not realising they have tax and whopping 20 percent added. Harry Potter on Broadway incredible. Staten Island tour needs booking in advance. Big bus good but cheaper if bought there.. the edge is closed. New York is easy and u feel safe. So many police. 
We loved it.

title: Weekend Break
text:
Beautiful hotel - really enjoyed our stay - staff are outstanding. Bakery is truly French pastries and in our opinion worth the line in the mornings.

Only 2 things could have been improved - our room seemed slightly sparse , there was a desk and chair but no other seat- our room definitely had space for an arm chair or sofa - which would have taken it to the next level.

Hotel wanted $30 a night for an in room fridge, that’s a little high. Again a free fridge on demand would add a level of service.

We will definitely be back though

title: Good spot for a weekend away
text:
The room was spacious and spotless. Beds extremely comfortable. The staff were all attentive and couldn’t do enough to help. Loved the decor and wooden floors. Plenty of towels. 
The attached patisserie is amazing , though get there early as the queue was very long !

title: A solid option
text:
Hotel Bellclair offers tidy affordable accommodations. The room was comfortable and tastefully furnished. I’d ask for a room on a low floor next time as the elevators are somewhat crowded & wait time can be a little longer than optimal. 

Our $20 breakfast coupons went unused as the line in the cafe was just unreasonably long. Adding  coffee service in the lobby would be a big improvement.  

It’s a good hotel, they offer value for the money.

title: Hervorragendes Hotel
text:
Das Belleclaire liegt an der Ecke der 79St direkt am Broadway. Dennoch ist das Hotel recht ruhig gelegen. Es gibt viele Essensmöglichkeiten um das Hotel herum. Eine U-Bahn Station ist wenige Meter vom Hotel entfernt. Das Hotel ist in einem sehr guten und gepflegten Zustand. Der Eingangsbereich ist marmoriert und duftet sehr gut (aufgrund des Lush Shops nebenan). Die Flure auf den einzelnen Etagen sind recht eng, aber mit großem Koffer gut zu passieren. Die Zimmer sind gepflegt und es wird jeden Tag sauber gemacht. Wir haben ein kostenloses Zimmerupgrade für ein King Size Bett erhalten. Es wird zwar kein Frühstück direkt im Hotel angeboten, jedoch erhält man jeden Tag einen Voucher über 10$ pro Person für die französische Bäckerei direkt neben dem Hotel (die Cinnamon Buns sind sehr zu empfehlen, man zahlt ggf. wenige $ dazu). Für 10$ bekäme man in der Regel ein Getränk und ein Gebäck. Der Fußweg zum Central Park ist nicht weit, sodass man sich dort gut mit dem Frühstück dort hinsetzten kann.
Man hat mit etwas Glück einen Blick auf den Hudson River. 

Fazit: Sehr zu empfehlen, gerne wieder!!

title: Francelle to the rescue
text: A beautiful boutique hotel in an amazing location on the UWS. Some hiccups with AC and wifi dealt with well by the front desk and then when our return flight was canceled last minute - hours after we’d checked out- the amazing Francelle at the front desk rode to the rescue!  Can’t thank her enough!! Highly recommended.

title: Mr. Karim Abou-Izzeddine
text: The staff at the hotel was the highlight of our stay. Mr. Jonathan helped us immensely in trying to find the perfect rooms for a long stay along with great rates. Jonathan and the whole staff were very welcoming and also helped us a lot with the use of public transportation and how to move around the city. The hotel’s breakfast is also great and so are its rooms and cleanliness. This is a must stay at hotel in New York City. Thank you Hotel Belleclaire.

title: Front desk superstar
text:
Spent a fabulous week in Manhattan at the Hotel Belleclaire.  The hotel is located in the Upper west side, walking distance from some fantastic restaurants.  I called the hotel the night before we got there and was lucky enough to have Benedict answer. I'm claustrophobic and read reviews about the elevators being very small. They are tiny!!  Benedict assured me he would accommodate my request with a room accessible by a staircase . He assigned us a very nice room. Benedict was always welcoming with a warm smile and greeting . The day we were supposed to leave, our flight was canceled.  I called the hotel , Benedict answered luckily, he offered us a room at our conference rate. It's was always so comforting to see his smiling face at the front desk.
 He is a real asset to your team!! Will gladly come back to Hotel Belleclaire because of Benedict 
 The $10 voucher for the French bakery attached to the hotel was an additional plus. Loved the coffees and French pastries.

title: Convenient to Upper West side but with some suggested improvements
text:
We usually stay at 8th and 51st in a name brand hotel but had to commute by cab to my daughters apt on W 72nd.   Found this hotel on TripAdvisor.  Great location for our purposes since it was a short walk to 72nd.  Renovated lobby, rooms are great with some exceptions noted below.  Price is comparable to what we paid at name hotel but without the cab fare to 72nd. We stayed twice - one Sunday night and then 9 nights just 2 days later.  All inclusive rate for one night was $260 ($204 rate plus taxes and fees) while 9 night inclusive rate was $302 per night for same king bed room.  Both included $20 credit for bakery. I booked with hotel using Triumph coupon.  Not sure if the extra fees would show up when comparing rates with other hotel booking services.  No explanation for why the longer stay was more expensive.  First night room 810 was fantastic.  Longer term room 727 was slightly smaller and shower control seemed to be broken or not easily adjusted. Maid service was more consistent than name brand hotels are offering today.

 $20 bakery credit was used as much as we could but limited offerings and long lines from 7:30 am to 9:30 am made it difficult to use if you were in a hurry to get somewhere.  Drop by later for no line or book without the bakery credit since there are other places to get  breakfast nearby that are less busy..  No published menu so you have to review the offerings by looking at the display case once to really know what you will want. 

We had the staff order a Black Car to LGA airport on the last morning.  The car did ok but the vehicle had an issue with the trunk release not working, an unbalanced tire at high speed,  and a check engine light on the dash so my confidence in the maintenance of the vehicle was not high.  The hotel should consider supporting another transportation group.

title: Lovely Belleclaire
text: The staff at Belleclaire is superb and hospitable.  Everyone from the doorman to the front-desk staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was pleasant.  Francelle and Benedict knew us by name and greeted us in the morning.  My room was a single a king bed and the room was large, there was ample space for multiple pieces of luggage (6).  I enjoyed the view from our room and being conveniently located near the subway lines and Central Park.  There is lots of shopping in the area.   Breakfast at the adjoining Mille Feuille Bakery was an added bonus!   The only downside was the hotel's wifi but I will definitely stay again.

title: Would like to thank to BelClraire hotel service desk
text:
We have been served by Naomi the reception lady for a great service and a smile during the whole stay
Although we are first time in NY we didn't feel strangers due to Naomi great service attitude
The hotel is lucky to have such a person in the team
Thanks
Meni DAVIDOV

title: Great hotel - clean, friendly service and excellent location.
text:
Fantastic experience staying at the Belleclaire hotel this week. Spent 4 nights there with my 11 year old daughter. The room was one of the cleanest I have ever stayed in (and I’ve stayed in some nice hotels including the Ritz Carlton). The room was newly renovated and was a good size for NYC. Right on Broadway. We walked to Central Park, Times Square, 5th Ave, etc. Saw 4 Broadway shows in 4 nights. This hotel is very central and great value. So happy we stayed here and would definitely stay again the next time I’m in Manhattan. Absolutely loved it. Staff are wonderful as is the French cafe attached to the hotel - there is a line but it’s worth the wait. The lattes and croissants were delicious. 

The only challenge we experienced was with the wifi. It was very spotty in our room on the 6th floor. I tried calling their tech support line a number of times but eventually just resorted to using my data. Next time I would just plan to have data coverage from my carrier rather then try to rely on the hotel’s wifi. 

Overall, highly recommend.

title: Would stay again
text: Very happy with our 4 night stay. Staff friendly especially on the door! Great location on the red line station 72 and 79! So close to Central Park. Beds were comfy. Breakfast was great you get vouchers to spend in the French cafe next door, which had a huge selection.

title: Top Customer service
text: Excellent service, beautifully renovated hotel in great location. Very clean and comfortable. Only downside is the breakfast facility which is too small for all the customers. A special thanks to Naomi from the reception for the exceptional service. We had a problem with a noisy neighbor and had requested a room change. Naomi was understanding of our situation and immediately continued to help us without hesitation and even provided us with an upgrade for the last night.she deserves à bonus for customer service.

title: Great hotel on the UWS!
text: The Belleclaire was recently renovated and presents a modern, fresh appearance. Rooms are simple but clean and comfortable. They are installing a bar and lounge area. Belleclaire is convenient to theaters, Lincoln Center and the many restaurants along Amsterdam Ave. They also provide a voucher for breakfast at the French bakery  off the lobby. Staff are welcoming and helpful. Definitely returning for another visit!

title: Amazing stay as always!
text:
Have stayed in this hotel many times and it never fails to deliver! Excellent service, excellent location and excellent staff! Located in the upper west side this allows for a nice quiet family atmosphere to get away from the hustle and bustle of mid-town. Subway is within walking distance to get you anywere in the city! Rooms have recently been refurbed and they look amazing! (Sorry no pics). 

Complimentary breakfast from the cafe downstairs is a nice touch 👌

Special mention to Shanies who looked after me and my family throughout our stay - excellent service!

title: A Suite for Five with ONE Bathroom
text: Our very small suite for five (2 adults and 3 teenagers) was barely sufficient.  The newly redecorated rooms were noisy, the one bathroom(with ill applied tissue dispenser) was small and the lobby was under construction. Wi fi was reprehensible and made it very difficult to conduct business.  The door men and front desk people were exemplery under the difficult circumstances.  For the exhorbitant price, I expected a quality that was missing in these rooms.

title: Belleclaire Hotel is how hotels should be
text: It was such a pleasure to stay at Belleclaire Hotel. We stayed several days to celebrate our daughter’s  11th birthday. On her birthday, the director of housekeeping sent a beautiful handwritten note congratulating her, with goodies and a cute teddy bear that my daughter absolutely loved. In return, my daughter sent a note back thanking them. The hotel brings the best traditions within us that should not be lost. In addition, it has a wonderful French bakery on the first floor with a kind staff. So many options are walking distance. The rooms are wonderful. The beds are comfortable, and all the staff have a smile. We highly recommend this hotel for families or any group, as the rooms are separate. The Italian restaurant Serafina that is across the street is very good. There is Bloomingdale’s outlet is walking  distance. Central Park and Natural History Museum are also minutes away walking. The Metro is close, and also easily accessible to find an Uber. There is also a Market on Sunday’s with all types of goodies from vintage clothes to food and unique jewelry. We went to see The Broadway The Cursed Child (Harry Potter) which is one of the best plays we have seen. If your child turns 11, this is the place to stay, with a wonderful experience for the entire family. Thank you to the staff off Belleclaire Hotel.

title: Excellent location, great neighborhood.
text: The best things about our stay were: the size of the room, the great location and the very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly staff, especially Bernard at the front desk. The disappointing things were: no access to a computer, no iron or ironing board, no kettle to boil water with, and most important, the inability to open the windows so we couldn't get fresh air. Another minus mark was the breakfast, which was at a take-away place on the ground floor that was perpetually full, necessitating waiting in line for 20 minutes sometimes and then finding they had run out of many items. Despite these, I would certainly stay at the Belleclaire again and would recommend it to friends.

title: Shanies at the wonderful Hotel Belleclaire is the best!
text:
On several occasions at our favourite hotel in NYC, the Hotel Belleclaire, Shanie has demonstrated the best in kind, personal service.
We wouldn’t dream of staying anywhere else and always seek her out.

title: Solid Hotel For NYC
text: They keep it simple. Small room. New furniture. No art on the walls. Clean and quiet. No refrigerator. The front desk staff was friendly. The location is two blocks from the subway station and the neighborhood has a fair amount of restaurants. A produce stand is a block away. Perfect for me as a single traveler who doesn't spend much time in the room.

title: Helpful staff upgraded us from cramped, loud room
text:
We stayed four nights and I was extremely unhappy with the first three — we were stuck in an insanely small room with loud neighbors, the constant sound of the elevator on the other side of the wall, a small bathroom, and our only view was a brick wall. Overall the room was cramped, cold, and noisy.

That said, on our last day Francelle at the front desk was able to switch us to a MUCH nicer room— much bigger and cozier with a lovely view of the street. She was very nice and helpful and even brought the keys to us personally so we could switch. She really helped us end the trip on a good note.

So if you can get a sizeable room that doesn’t share a wall with the elevators, this is a very solid hotel with a location that can’t be beat.

title: Great hotel!
text: Great hotel, check in was fast and easy, staff was very pleasant and helpful. We were on the 2nd floor overlooking the street and it was very quiet, no street noise all night. The room was clean and comfortable. Lots of restaurants nearby. About 5 minutes walk to Central Park. Only complaint was the elevator, could always get it going up from the lobby but it would never stop at our floor to bring us down. The stairs from 2nd floor was not a hardship until carrying luggage

title: Hôtel très bien situé, personnel accueillant et serviable.
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, métro à 5 min.
Le personnel est accueillant et serviable.
Pour le petit déjeuner on reçoit un bon d’achat de 10€ à la boulangerie le Millefeuille, ce qui est tout à fait correct.
Notre chambre était un peu petite et le top ça aurait été d’avoir un coffre fort et un frigo.
Au niveau de la propreté, c’était nickel.

title: Unsere Empfehlung für NYC!
text:
Gemütliches Hotel in top Lage: 2 min zur UBahn 1, 2 und 3 - damit ruckzuck Uptown oder Downtown.

Wir hatten ein (für NYC Verhältnisse) großes, sehr sauberes Zimmer mit 2 Queensizebetten, groß genug, damit man sich auch zu dritt nicht auf den Füßen steht. Nachteil: Es gibt keinen Kühlschrank auf dem Zimmer, aber man kann im EG Eis holen. Wifi ist nicht sehr gut, wer darauf angewiesen ist, sollte eher kostenpflichtig zubuchen.

Fürs Frühstück gibt es Gutscheine für das im EG gelegene französische Café. In Stoßzeiten dauert das ziemlich lange und wir haben auch immer zubezahlt, die Backwaren und der Kaffee waren aber lecker.

Das Personal ist durchweg SEHR freundlich und jederzeit hilfsbereit. Momentan wird in der Lobby eine Bar gebaut, sobald das fertig ist, wird es noch besser sein.

Absolute Empfehlung - wir werden beim nächsten Trip nach NYC bestimmt wieder dort wohnen!

title: My New Favorite
text: The Belleclaire on Broadway is my new favorite. The hotel just went through an extensive remodel and the rooms are gorgeous. The decor is simple, modern and warm The bed was so comfy that I had the best sleep in years. The staff is friendly and helpful. Hector was right there to assist with my bags and Maria was so sweet and helpful. I also loved my chat with Alicia about handbags and boutiques. There's a bakery in the lobby that serves tasty coffee. I can’t wait to be back!

title: Very warm and welcoming staff!
text: My week at the Belleclaire was very enjoyable.  I received very courteous answers to all my questions, was helped with a smile any time I needed help and enjoyed spending time at the hotel. Shanis and Maria were particularly nice hosts, and hope to run into them during my next stay!

title: Amazing hotel!  They took the cake!
text:
I was there for a concert at the Beacon which is 3 blocks down.
My first hr there, they called to see if everything was ok.  I had told the bellman that I didn't need a luggage rack, but changed my mind as there was no dresser in the room. He came right up with it.
I came in the first night from the concert looking like a truck ran me over. I was greeted by a lovely person who came running over with a cold bottle of water and asked if I needed anything else.  He got me a bag of ice for the room, so I didn't have to come back down.
The next day I needed paper and pencil.  I called the from desk and they said come down, I have some.  
It was so nice to have a maid who actually changed the sheets (my arm was bleeding) and brought in fresh towels each day.
I very much enjoyed the breakfast coupons. Coffee is really not that bad.
Shanies and Maria were so helpful with everything.
I would stay there again in a heart beat.

title: Hotel Belleclaire NYC UWS 5 Stars
text: After spending the past several years abroad due to Covid restrictions, I came to NYC to see my children and grandchildren. I was looking to stay on the UWS. I found the Belleclaire on a travel website. It has been exactly what I wanted. Quiet, exceptionally clean, very close to everything. The price was reasonable and the staff very friendly and accommodating. The front desk were all very helpful and knowledgeable, especially Francelli. I’m definitely going to be a regular whenever I’m in NYC

title: Great location and super staff
text: Hotel Belleclaire is our favorite place to stay in New York City.  We visit often to attend the Metropolitan Opera.  The French bakery and coffee shop Millefeuille is just off the lobby for fabulous breakfast coffee and pastry.  The Upper West Side location is ideal for restaurants and an easy walk to crosstown bus for visits to East Side museums. Also an easy walk to Zabar's!  All the staff have been friendly and helpful.  But if I needed to describe the model for a perfect front desk person her name would be Shanies.  She gives us a warm, personal welcome every time we visit.  She has helped us learn which room location suits us perfectly.  Whether  we arrive for a return visit or come back late from an opera, Shane's greets us with her wonderful smile.  She truly makes us feel that the Belleclaire is our home away from home.

title: It’s ok.
text:
The good things about the hotel: location as it’s near the park and Zabars, which we love. The bed and bedding are lovely, the breakfast cafe food is delicious, the doorman was lovely.

The bad things about the hotel: useless wifi, it’s noisy, bathroom is minute, no storage, only one lift and it fits 3 people very uncomfortably. We had to ask for our room to be serviced after the first night. We had to ask three times for the breakfast vouchers and the cafe gets busy so it takes on average about 20 mins of lining up to get your coffee and croissants. It’s a pretty old building so windows dont open easily, carpet is dated etc. that didn’t bother us but if you’re looking for modern this isn’t it. I wouldn’t stay there again. It’s expensive for what you get. Look elsewhere.

title: Decent value
text:
This hotel got all the major things right: clean, quiet, great bed & bedding. Also a superb location. The small things were a different story: had to request extra hangers and luggage rack. Housekeeping (which we only opted for twice in one week) didn't replenish toilet paper or soap.

Be aware the hotel is undergoing renovations. We didn't know that. However we never experienced even the slightest noise or disruption. Also, tiny elevators, but they usually came quickly.

title: Room change
text: Upon arrival at the “Hotel Belleclaire” I discovered that my room had a “less than ideal” view out my window:  a brick wall.  Unfortunately I have some claustrophobia and would have been quite uncomfortable spending a week there.  I went downstairs and the desk agent informed me they had no other room that evening but would find me something the next morning.  The next morning I went downstairs and a very nice front desk agent, Francelle, informed she was aware of my situation and would find me a new room.  Boy did she!  She found me a beautiful, larger room with a view.  Can’t tell you how happy I was with the way my request was handled.  Francelle and the “Hotel Belleclaire” went out of their way to accommodate me.  I’ll be back!

title: Oui mais…petit mais…
text:
Très bel hôtel, bien situé près de lignes de stations, parfait.
Chambre petite pour un séjour de 6 jours (pas de placard, pas d armoire…) mais peut être ai je mal choisi à la réservation.
Pas de wifi, enfin si, mais il se déconnecte tellement…je ne comprends pas. Bon d un autre côté, je ne viens pas à New York que pour consulter mes mails…
Accueil parfait et chaleureux, ont fait des efforts de compréhension de mon anglais… rend service très facilement comme appeler un taxi. Sourire à toute heure, bravo.

title: FABULOUS Upper West Side Hotel
text:
i have visited NYC 16 times and tried quite a few hotels.  This hotel is my absolute favorite , fora very reasonable price,  and we will definitely be back!

First of all.... the location.  This location was fabulous.  We loved being able to  walk to Central Park, Riverside Park, Natural History  Museum and lots of restaurants!  Also, we took advantage of the subway being two blocks away which got us anywhere very quickly. Being outside the noise of Times Square and some other busy areas was very appealing for us.   And we loved the feel of the neighbourhood,.. more residential, very clean and safe but still quirky, lots of character and great places to eat nearby!

The hotel itself was the quietest we've stayed in, due to location but also the brand new windows they have recently installed.. I also found the walls were nice and thick and we rarely heard any other guests in the hall or in adjoining rooms.

The bakery was an amazing treat every day and definitely added to our happiness!  yes, there were lineups but they moved quickly and the people who worked there were lovely and very efficient! 

Speaking of LOVELY PEOPLE.. I cannot say enough about the FABULOUS staff at the Belleclaire!!  From the moment we checked in, we knew were were in a good place.  I would be remiss if i do not give a huge shout out to two people in particular, Francisco & Maria.  I would return to this hotel just to see their smiling faces again. They both radiated warmth and made our stay so wonderful. Seeing them each morning, or evening truly made our days feel wonderful!  We also loved the housekeeping staff and both Shanis & Benedict at reception were great and went out of their way to  assist us!

If i had any criticism of this hotel it would involved the lack of furniture in our room.  We stayed 8 days and not having a dresser to unpack our bags did make things very unorganized. I would have also appreciated a space in the bathroom such as a shelf to leave items on.  Hopefully dressers have been ordered as the rooms were all recently (and beautifully) renovated,..because that will truly make this hotel a PERFECT one for us!   

Thank you Hotel Belleclaire for a dreamy week in my favorite city and a huge hug of gratitude for Francisco & Maria for everything you did to make our stay so special. We can't wait to return... many times i hope!!

title: A True Gem!
text: We’ve stayed at the Belleclaire for the fifth time now and each experience has been wonderful. They’ve been going thru upgrades which means it gets even better. The location on the upper west side couldn’t be more perfect. Great restaurants close to subway and Broadway theatres.  Now let’s talk about the staff! Where do they find such courteous people? Everyone we’ve had contact with especially Fran Sally have been so nice and generous. Look no further for a place to stay in NYC! A true gem

title: Wonderful stay!
text:
This hotel is a wonderful stay! The rooms were very clean and charming,  and the staff was so accommodating.
my Husband and I were here for a short weekend and wanted to hit the town right away. A special thanks to (Christopher )which he had  told us about some cool spots to go to, which were so awesome and we were able to fit it all in to our mini vaca , worked out great! We  would  definitely stay here again.

title: Review
text: Have enjoyed regular visits to theBellClaire  Hotel . The staff are professional, very helpful and make my stay a pleasure. Special thank you to the Management , Maria, Francis , Christopher,Hector, and the rest of the staff and housekeeping too many too mention A special Thank You  to Shanies  Michele Manager Robert Falco and Franecillie at the frontdesk

title: Tipical city atmosphere
text:
l’hotel ha una atmosfera simpatica, molto tipica. Ha quel non so che di vecchio e nuovo che  fa parte della città e che ha un suo fascino. 9 piani con un solo piccolo ascensore chiedono un po’ di pazienza ma ne stanno realizzando un secondo. Per un episodio spiacevole mi è stato promesso un risarcimento dalla responsabile, al momento non ancora avvenuto, attendo e scriverò in merito. Eviterei la colazione, da pagare extra, la si ritira in una bakery associata,  e bisogna fare sempre la coda, i tavolini per consumarla sono pochi,  viene servita in bicchieri di carta, la qualità è buona, ma nel complesso è scomoda. Meglio fare due passi, in zona si trovano locali accoglienti e di qualità. L’albergo all’esterno è davvero un bell’edificio, nelle vie intorno si trovano piccoli ristoranti, ed è piacevole passeggiare la sera lungo gli ampi marciapiedi, ogni tanto un venditore di fiori o frutta, e negozi per la città, per intenderci non turistici. Siamo sulla Braadway, non lontano da Columbus Circle, Central Park è a due passi e poter fare una passeggiata nel verde salutando gli scoiattoli è un bel modo per cominciare la giornata. In conclusione ritengo una buona scelta questo albergo, anche per il rapporto prezzo/qualità, qui son tutti un po’ rigidi ma anche molto pragmatici, i newyorkesi sono interessanti, praticano una gentilezza diffusa che contraddice l’idea della fredda metropoli, le persone son sempre migliori della rappresentazione che ne viene data. 

the hotel has a nice, very typical atmosphere.  It has that something old and new that is part of the city and that has its own charm.  9 floors with only one small lift require a little patience but they are building a second one.  For an unpleasant episode I was promised compensation by the manager, which has not yet happened, I wait and I will write about it.  I would avoid breakfast, to be paid extra, it is collected in an associated bakery, and you always have to queue, the tables to eat it are few, it is served in paper cups, the quality is good, but overall it is uncomfortable.  Better to take a walk, in the area there are welcoming and quality places.  The hotel outside is a really nice building, in the streets around it there are small restaurants, and it is pleasant to walk in the evening along the wide pavements, every now and then a flower or fruit seller, and shops for the city, so to speak. tourist.  We are on the Braadway, not far from Columbus Circle, Central Park is a stone's throw away and being able to take a walk in the green while greeting the squirrels is a great way to start the day.  In conclusion, I think this hotel is a good choice, also for the price / quality ratio, here they are all a bit rigid but also very pragmatic, New Yorkers are interesting, they practice a widespread kindness that contradicts the idea of ​​the cold metropolis, people are always better than the representation that is given.

title: El hotel es sencillo pero lindo, tiene todo lo que requieres!
text: Cuando llegamos el primer día la atención de Francelle en recepción fue de lo mas acogedor, en todo momento estuvo muy atenta y complaciente con nuestras necesidades. El hotel es sencillo pero lindo pero regresaría mas por la atención de Francelle!

title: Bueno opción necesita algunos detalles
text:
Pasamos una buena semana en el hotel. El personal del Front Desk muy atentos y amables. María y Johnattan. La habitación tiene detalles que tienen que revisar: no tiene heladera, indispensable si estás en NYC. El armario no tiene estantes ni cajones. Muy incómodo. no tiene calentador de agua para hacer un té o un café, pero si lo pides, te lo dan. 
El sistema de desayuno es muy bueno. La ubicación a mi me encanta.
La cama muy buena.
Lo recomiendo porque es buena la relación precio/ calidad / ubicación. Volvería si ponen heladera y mejoran internet.

title: Great stay
text: Wonderful hotel. Great location. Outstanding service provided by Francelle. She was kind and attentive. We arrived quite late and she checked us in super fast and even gave us vouchers for the outstanding cafe/bakery on the main floor

title: Charming recent updated
text: Newly updated this hotel is charming. Great location in upper west side with easy access to many amenities (grocery, drug, restaurants). Immaculate with genuine personalized touch. Lobby bar and rooftop available in summer 2022 will make this am even better destination

title: Incredible staff & well appointed historic hotel
text: This was my favorite ever hotel stay. The staff went above and beyond, incredible customer service from everyone. The room was larger than expected for a standard NYC hotel, and clearly recently remodeled. Even though there was noise from ongoing construction down the hall during the day, I couldn't hear a peep from any other rooms at night. Breakfast coupons were included for the adorable and delicious cafe downstairs. Easy walking distance to two subway stations. Beautiful historic building and neighborhood a short walk from central park. Would absolutely stay here again, even though it's pricier than I usually go for.

title: Great staff
text: I was in NY unexpectedly due to an emergency and needed a hotel at 5AM. Christopher answered the phone, found me a great room, and was extremely kind when I checked in, given my situation. He did everything he could to make my stay easy and restful. The room was clean and modern, the bed was very comfortable and the included breakfast was perfect for me.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
We stayed at the hotel for 13 nights and were very pleased with everything: clean, close to subway, pharmacy, supermarket, wonderful breakfast at the cafe. Didn’t find anything that could be better ❤️
Absolutely will return to stay 
Thank you

title: Museum and Cuisine Hopping
text: Spent 3  nights.  Love the neighborhood and the general vibe of the place, Our room was perfectly clean and the bed was super comfortable. .I know the hotel  is under construction so  room was a bit spartan in terms of amenities and conveniences and  the internet was erratic making the tv flakey.  That said, we will be back soon.  I can empathize the situation, creature comforts are secondary to me.  I know that these items will be resolved by the various contractors as they fulfil their "punch list" items.  Shanies was professional, attentive and always ready to see how we can enhance our stay.  Staff with a sincere attitude will make me a loyal customer every time.

title: Excellent experience
text: They upgraded and redid all the rooms and hallways beautifully. Really elegant and comfortable rooms, great location and extremely courteous and helpful staff. Had a really nice experience would highly recommend.

title: Best hotel I have stayed at in New York!
text: The Hotel Belleclaire was absolutely wonderful! The room was very clean and wonderfully decorated. The location was amazing on the upper west side- very easy to get around. Benedict at the front desk was especially wonderful and made sure our stay was incredible! Would love to stay here again the next time I am in New York.

title: Upper West Side NYC hotel find
text: Great location on the upper west side of NYC. Convenient to subway, tons of restaurants, bakeries, diners and bars. Great service from the check in until check out. Simple, but beautifully decorated rooms-clean and great housekeeping service. A bonus is the complimentary (value is $10) coupon for a breakfast coffee/treat in the adjoining cafe/bakery. Everything looked so delicious-but I picked the sweet brioche both days! They are constructing a lobby bar that will be opened in early 2022. It will make a cozy spot to have a drink before heading out to see the city or a nightcap before bed. I will definitely stay here again in the future.

title: A very good place to stay
text: Spent 6 wonderful days. The Belleclaire is a fabulous hotel, centrally located, only about 10 minutes walk to Central Park. Newly renovated, it is tastefully furnished: cleanliness, simplicity, and functionality. The staff is attentive and wants to make sure your stay is hassle-free. It is a well-run hotel: the principals are local people and not some corporation headquartered in Brazil or Belgium. So it's a hands-on-management. We definitely plan to be back -   two thumbs up!

title: A fine hotel, good service, great location, comfortable and quiet room
text: First, Francelle, during our check-in, graciously fixed a bug in our reservation, and she was a pleasure to interact with! The room was lovely, spotlessly clean and the bathroom was nice. Thermostat worked correctly and it was easy to manage temperature. My only "complaint" is that like a lot of "modern" hotels, there was no chest of drawers of any type, so we had to deal with "living out of our suitcases". No major complaints about the "daily fee" which was offset by cards we could use in the bakery downstairs (albeit with torturously long line (offset by unbelievably good baked items)) plus "free" wifi. Other reviews mentioned the "daily fee" so I was not surprised by it. One tiny nit: bathroom sink faucets were hot/cold reversed, and NO hotel manager should tolerate dopey plumbing mistakes like that. GREAT shower. Room was utterly quiet at night. Location: great, very close to two subway stations plus everything you need nearby because, well, you're on Broadway!  All in all, a great place to stay in Manhattan.

title: Great value for money on the Upper Westside
text:
The hotel is one of a handful on the upper westside. I have stayed at most of them (Belnord, Days Inn, The Lucerne, Artshouse). In terms of value for money, Hotel Belleclaire can't be beat. 
My sister and I stayed in a newly renovated room with 2 queen beds for 2 nights. The room was spacious, the shower was fantastic, and there was plenty of storage area.  The staff was professional and super nice (Special shout out to Jonathan.)
Be aware that the hotel is on Broadway and you will hear the traffic from the street so if you're noise sensitive bring ear plugs. Also, the free wifi isn't great so if you need to work while there, you might need to upgrade to a paid plan. There is a mandatory $10 charge for the cafe but it only opens at 8 a.m. and we decided to skip the long line after waiting 20 minutes the first day. You can use the coupon any time though. The hotel is being renovated and they plan to add a bar! I will definitely be back there unless they jack the prices up significantly.

title: Mrs
text: Hotel Belleclaire, NY is a very nice hotel with an exceptional service and location at affordable price. Maria in the Front Desk was always with a very good disposition to help and made our stay very pleasant and comfortable. Thanks!!!

title: Art Nouveau style with both space and comfort
text: We chose this hotel for its location near Central Park and the museums. We have been  delighted by the size of the room ( enough room to tango if you will) with enormous TV. The lines of the room are clean and simple  and decorated in French grey with wooden floors. The shower is really large as is the bathroom. I really liked the quality of the fluffy towels and the high thread count of the bed linen. The corridors are decorated in Bourbon blue and the hotel is undergoing unobtrusive renovation . I look forward to staying here again and seeing the finished project. Maria on reception is very warm and helpful!

title: Great place to explore NY !
text:
My Wife and I spent 1 week at the BelleClaire.
We are glad to recommend this hotel.
Great location, nice room and good service too for a fair price. Special thanks for Jonathan and it's warm welcoming and sens of service.

title: Great hotel
text: The staff were all welcoming,, Maria was so pleasant at the check in. Room was clean and the bed really comfortable. I left behind some important items but Alicia was very helpful in getting them mailed to me. I hope to visit again.

title: Nice hotel on Upper West Side
text: My son attends Columbia and there aren’t many hotels near campus so this area in UWS is where  I stay while visiting. This was my first time at Hotel BelleClaire and I loved it . Room was comfortable, quiet, clean and staff very accommodating. Watched the Super Bowl in room on very large flat screen. Would definitely stay again. Little French bakery next to lobby was a nice treat as well.

title: Muy Recomendable
text:
Muy bien ubicado, cerca de todo. Un barrio tranquilo y seguro.
Las habitaciones con buen wifi (al menos la nuestra si). Quizás un poco ruidosas las calefacciones, pero en definitiva una habitación muy comoda. 
Los empleados muy amables, especialmente Maria en recepción  que nos ayudo y asesoro, muchas gracias. 
Volveremos a vernos.

title: Nice stay
text: Our stay at belleclaire hotel was really good! The staff is really professional and kind especially Shanies who was understanding and help us for a problem with our flight. Thanks to her help we were able to reach the company and she find a room for us in the hotel to stay one more night.

title: Wonderful hotel, great customer service and a very convenient location
text:
We stayed at this hotel for ten days and got consistently great service and daily housekeeping.  I want to point out two front desk people by name of Maria and Francelis  that went out of their way to help us with our requests and inquires. 
The location is very convenient, close to metro stops (79 and 72 just a quick walk) and million great food options. There is a cafe that is merged with the hotel where you can get your morning coffee without even putting on your coat or make up. I loved my stay here. Thank you!

title: I really enjoed my staying at Belleclaire Hotel NY
text:
I just spent 10 days in New York at Belleclaire. I found the hotel very confortable and the personnel always available to satisfy all my news, expecially Maria.
Thank you and I will definitely come back soon!

Alessandra

title: A great discovery
text:
A beautiful hotel at a reasonable price in a great location

Moreover, the staff is just fantastic. We were welcomed by the delightful Francelle, who directly made us feel at home and ready for a great week in New York.

title: Bella stanza, servizi scarsi
text: Partiamo dalle cose piacevoli, l'hotel si trova nell'upper west side a due passi da central park e dalla metro. La camera è spaziosa e lo staff gentile. Il wifi è pessimo, bisogna registrarsi in continuazione, la colazione consiste in un voucher da 10$ da spende nella caffetteria adiacente.  Nella caffetteria ci sono 4 tavolini, per cui bisogna fare la fila fuori e consumare la colazione all'aperto o nella hall. In ogni caso, con 10 dollari si prendono un cappuccino ed una brioche. Ultima chicca, con la scusa del covid, non hanno rifatto la camera per una settimana.

title: Great customer service
text: I had a family emergency right before I checked into the hotel, and Shanies was very kind and generous in helping me sort out our reservation which we needed to cancel last minute. The hotel was lovely and in a great location, and I will definitely stay here again.

title: Our help from Shanies
text: My family was about to check into the Belleclaire last week when my adult daughter had an emergency and had to return home. Even though it was literally last minute, and WELL past free cancellation time, Shanies did the right thing and waived any charges for the room. Doing so was very professional, and earned the hotel our loyalty for future trips to NYC. Also, my two nights there were very nice - a clearly newly renovated room and very comfortable bed. Thanks, Shanies, and thank you, Hotel Belleclaire!

title: Great stay!
text: I stayed at Hotel Belleclaire with my husband and 3 kids over Thanksgiving week. The location is fantastic. Hotel was clean and very comfortable. The beds were amazing! We had adjoining rooms with the kids which was a great set-up for our family. The rooms are recently renovated. Staff were attentive and helpful. Kevin from the front desk even lent me his phone charger when I couldn't find one nearby!

title: Fees
text: I’m extremely disappointed with the hotel. We chose this hotel at the time only because there were no resort fee included with the booking, as many hotels in NYC charge. When we arrived, doing the checkin, we were informed by the receptionist that our reservation was fully paid already, excepted for the resort fee, which was recently implemented due to some makeover done in the hotel infrastructure. We asked to talk to the manager, Mr. Robert. We explained all the situation to him, that when we’ve done our reservation there were no resort fee included and showed him the reservation history. After that, Mr. Robert understood our situation and concluded to cancel any resort fee or charges besides what’s been already paid. For our surprise after arriving in Brazil, I’ve checked my credit card extract and there is a huge amount being charged by the hotel! An amount that we’ve never being informed of. I’ve tried for many times contact the hotel by the emails available at their website, but we got no answer.

title: great place to stay in New York
text:
the place is in Upper West Side - nice place nice hotel . The rooms are newly renovated. Excellent staff helped us with every request. Maria wa nice also there workers - cleaning and etc'.
the place is near Amsterdam street - one  Bloc lots of restaurants. A synagogue and kosher restaurants nearby and a large supermarket with kosher products for those who need it.

title: Clean, good location but laking a few key things
text:
Wifi is tragically spotty , have to reconnect my phone every 5 mins, I was given an 'upgraded room' which was supposed to be larger, but the bathroom door nearly hits the bed, there is no closet or dresser or even hooks to hang anything (I stayed 4 nights so needed this), the bathroom window is drafty so needed to keep the bathroom door closed.   You need to book housekeeping (I thought I did the first day but didn't receive a service).  
Bed is comfortable, towels are great, but overall it feels like a bed in a closet (even for NYC standards).  I can't imagine what the smaller rooms are like.   
Staff is very friendly, but not much for them to offer (zero amenities or anything)

title: Nice Hotel in the Upper West Side
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Belleclaire from the welcoming staff to the comfortable clean rooms. We asked for some extras and the staff were very accommodating. Thank you Alicia! The subway station is nearby less than a 5 minute walk. It's better to take than a yellow cab during the day. We enjoyed breakfast at the bakery next door at dinner at Jacob's Pickles. Try both places when you visit - delicious!

title: Great hospitality!
text: I booked Hotel Belleclaire because of its convenience to Central Park and it did not disappoint! Within walking distance was the park and many great shops and restaurants. We happily found the Sunday market right down the road where i started holiday shopping! My trip had to be extended, and the Belleclaire team took great care of me! Robert, Jonathan, Maria and Benedict - they will look out for you! Hotel is undergoing construction, as many of them are, so i am looking forward to a return for my next work trip!

title: Amazing staff and beautiful accommodations
text: From the moment I checked in the service was amazing. Robert was so helpful and pleasant.  The check in process was quick and painless. Very much appreciated after a long flight. There was some construction going on during my stay but the staff all went above and beyond to switch me to a quiet room. The rooms are newly renovated, clean and comfortable. I mentioned having a hectic day ahead and was pleasantly surprised to come back to a nice pair of slippers left in my room from housekeeping. Thank you Alicia! I've stayed  at some 5- star hotels around the world and I must say the staff at the Belleclaire were on the ball. Not a day passed where I wasn't greeted which made my stay pleasant and comfortable. Can't recommend enough!

title: 2 nights
text: Staff was very welcoming and helpful (thanks Jonathan). Room was clean and newly renovated; very fresh, simple decor. High quality linens. French bakery breakfast was fantastic. Renovations still being completed, but did not interfere with our stay. Would stay again.

title: Great Location
text: I recently stayed here. It was the first time since December 2019 before that I would stay here at least three times a month.  I loved the location away from all the tourist areas in midtown but so close to the 1 subway line and only a few blocks away from Central Park.  The rooms were completely refurbished with all new furniture and beds and an updated bathroom.  The check in took only about 5 minutes and the check out was even faster.  Can't wait to stay again.

title: Disappointed
text:
We have stayed at Hotel Belleclaire many times before. They had closed down during in the height of the pandemic and recently renovated and then opened. Lucky for us, I called weeks ago to see if they were open and was given great rates for the upcoming trip we had this past weekend. In addition to the great rates, we also received $10 vouchers for each person, PER DAY, to spend at Mille Fiulle next door. This was probably the best part of the stay.

We had the best time but unfortunately, our stay was the least of favorite of our trip. Our room was recently updated with new floors, paint, furniture, mattresses, etc. but it was dirty. As if they finished construction but didn’t clean up the mess. The floor and window seats/area (we had the parlor suite) had a lot of grit, dust, and particles of sorts. The bathroom set up is terrible. Water from the shower just flooded the outside and we had to use a ton of bath towels just to keep the floor dry. The space was small to begin with, and having wet towels on the floor shrunk the space even more. In addition to that, the bathroom was dim as one light was out. 

And then, our group got stuck in the elevator and we were told that we shouldn’t have had more than 3 inside (there were 6 of us). The elevator states the max is 1500 lbs, and we were well below that capacity. My husband, thankfully, was able to pry the doors open while we waited for the fire dept, and got out quicker than anticipated. Please post signs if there are certain limitations anywhere - especially in an elevator! It would also be nice not to be blamed for something we had no knowledge of. To be told “you shouldn’t have more than 3 people in there!” as we were nervously getting out of the elevator was not necessary. If this was a policy, where were the signs?!

Like I said, we are repeat customers of the Belleclaire and was really excited to return and be one of the firsts to stay in the renovated rooms. Luckily, we got a deep discounted rate having booked the room weeks ago. Otherwise, we would’ve been very upset paying the full price for the way less than stellar expectation of “new” rooms and facilities.

After this past visit, I don’t know if we’ll ever return.

title: Enjoyed our stay
text: The hotel is located very close to central park and the red line subway. Very short walk. They just completed renovation and the hotel has a classic feel with some modern twists. All of the staff were friendly to us. The room was very clean and functional. Good size by nyc standards. The housekeeping lady left extra towels just as we requested during our stay. Nothing to complain about

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: My wife and I stayed here for approximately 6 nights and were welcomed by all of the staff. They've just finished renovations and the rooms look great. Very clean, spacious and comfortable.  We enjoyed our stay and getting the delicious croissants from the french bakery each morning. Upon checking out I realized that I left behind my iPad. I was relieved when the very nice lady at the desk told me it was turned in by the housekeeper. I received an email and phone call from Alicia who assisted in the expedited return. Thank you again Alicia! I cannot wait to visit again, the staff is amazing.

title: Terrific stay!
text:
I needed a neighborhood place to stay at for a night, and having newly re-opened, I was glad to try out the hotel.  I was quite pleased!  
- The staff was terrific and so eager to please.  GM Robert is so lovely as is Jonathan at the front desk and everyone I dealt with.
- The lobby has great contemporary artwork and a nice seating area.  
- The hallways have upbeat wallpaper and lighting, all freshly painted and new.  
- The room was quite large and clean with a great view down Broadway.  The floors were newly stained and the walls had clearly just been painted.  
- The bathroom was not big or fancy but everything was super clean and the Frette towels were luxurious.  
- The bed (including sheets and pillows) was extremely comfortable and both my son and I had a great sleep.  
- It was terrific in the morning to go downstairs to the French bakery to get a latte and croissant.  YUM!
-The location can't be beat - restaurants, shopping and museums all around!

Two Thumbs Up!

title: BEST NYC hotel!
text: This hotel is awesome!  It has an old school charm that takes you back to a time when people dressed for dinner, held doors for one another, and spent more time together.  Only a couple blocks from Central Park, close to all the trains, plenty of stores, restaurants, etc. nearby or within walking distance.  The staff was excellent.  They took great care of us and there was always someone ready to answer any questions or point us in the right direction.  The cost was on the same level of similar hotels but far more worth it!  We will stay here every time we visit NYC!

title: Great Place to base yourself for NYC
text: I stayed here for a few days for work, it had easy access to all the places I needed to be.  The staff were great and my room was perfect.  I had a small problem with the radiator, it made a bit of noise when it came on.  Not a big issue and I reported it to the front desk.  Would certainly come back.

title: encantador y trabajadores muy amables
text:
debo decir que es la sexta vez que me alojo en este hotel.
La hubicación me parece excelente cerca de metro Central Park y barrio acojedor y tranquilo para desconectar del bullicio.
Lo mejor su Recepcionista María es un encanto tuve un problemilla este año con mi habitación y fue encantadora lo resolvió enseguida,sin ninguna duda ste es MI HOTEL EN NY. Siempre que voy me alojo alli. Maravilloso.

title: EXCELLENT customer service
text: Massive thank you to the manager of Hotel Belleclaire who provided us with an excellent customer service in response to the COVID19 situation.  Cannot wait to visit hotel belleclaire when this all has settled.

title: Hôte plein de charme. Excellent rapport qualité prix
text:
Très joli hôtel de 1903 , cossu , plein de charme. Quelques travaux actuellement pour finir de le retaper mais ce n’est pas gênant! Extrêmement bien placé entre 2 stations de métros des lignes 1-2-3. Et à 10 min à pied de Central Park . Le quartier est très agréable et Hudson River a 5 min. Nous avions une chambre king size superbe ( avec un frigo)+ petit déjeuner pour 2 à 100€/ nuit... imbattable pour ce tarif et cette qualité. Personnel peut être un peu distant mais serviable: port d’une bouilloire à notre chambre, recharge de nos portables et batteries à leur guichet d’accueil... + on nous garde les bagages toute la journée de notre départ jusqu’à tard ( sans suppléments!) petit dej satisfaisant mais pas exceptionnel ( 1 grande boisson chaude, 1 croissant ou excellent carrot cake+ 1 part de quiche chaude ... que demander de plus!)
Oui l’hôtel est sur Broadway avenue et pas de double vitrage donc boule quies indispensables Mais bon sinon il faut aller dormir je ne sais où dans Manhattan et à je ne sais quel prix! Bonne insonorisation par contre entre chambres! Ménage fait tous les matins . Propreté irréprochable . Photos du site absolument conformesw

title: Dated hotel
text:
We paid extra for a luxury queen room with city view the room was dated with a 70s headboard. The window stuck together with cellotape and a view across the rooftops to the hudson. I would say hardly a city view. When i asked they said that was the room we had booked. The heating was noisy and banged throughout the night. The hotel looks like it is being updated to nicer rooms but iould leave this for abiut 6 months so that they may have finished.
Overall not a bad spot to explore NY as close to the museum and central park but right in the middle of manhattan so ok if you enjoy a walk

title: Fab hotel
text: Just come back from New York and stayed here, the staff are really helpful and  friendly, hotel is very nice, the rooms are excellent. Would definitely stop here again. Made our 1st ever trip memorable, only half a hour walk from Times Square.

title: 5 giorni a New York
text: Camere accoglienti,pulite e staff disponibile. Hotel e camere sono molto pulite. Situato vicino a metro, supermercato aperto 24/24 e Central Park. Ottima anche la colazione!! Ci torneremo sicuramente!

title: Again, a seamless perfect experience ay my favorite hotel in Manhattan
text: Everyone was friendly and helpful. They know me of course. The general manager Robert Holmes in particular was supportive and upgraded our room at my request. When we requested extra towels and other amenities they arrived immediately.

title: Perfect NYC Boutique Hotel!
text: My friends and I stayed here recently and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Staff was very friendly, warm and helpful. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious for a NYC boutique hotel. It really is the quintessential NYC boutique hotel. The location was perfect, a short walk to many great stores and restaurants. I will definitely stay here again!

title: Bon Hôtel
text:
Hôtel bien placé, métro a proximité.
Chambre un peu vieillotte, qui mériterait un rafraîchissement.....
Pour le petit déjeuner, vous êtes obligés de descendre ans un tout petit café dans l’enceinte de l’hôtel.
Literie agréable, et personnel cordial sans plus.

title: Winter in NYC
text: Loved the hotel and will definitely recommend to family and friends. Great location and friendly staff!  Super clean and cozy!  The bakery in the hotel is delicious too!  Down the street visit Zabar’s for yummy sandwiches and goodies.

title: Great hotel, location, staff.
text: stayed for a long weekend. Our second stay at this hotel.  It  is located in the upper west side close too two subway stops.  Booked Friday-Monday- wanted to have a room for early arrival Saturday.  Called and conformed.  Room was ready when we got there! Nice room, requested an fridge, no problem.  Front desk was great answered all our questions.  Comp newspaper on Sunday.

title: Pleasant upper west side gem
text: I have been to New York City many times and stayed in all kinds of hotels. Many were luxurious and more centrally located. This trip I had to visit my daughter and take care of her as she was ill. Her apartment is less than 20 blocks away from the hotel Belleclaire. From the moment I entered the hotel I was greeted warmly. The room was small but very tidy and quiet. The bathroom was nicely renovated. The price was definitely right and included a $20 value at the cafe Mille Feuille in the lobby. It was a lovely experience and I shall definitely visit again.

title: great vocation
text: Great location, nice room, good service when needed. Close to every place you can imagine. Metro station 2 blocks away. Placed on Broadway. A lot of small bistros around and nice small cafe that serves fresh bakery on site.

title: Great Location, Great Price, Friendly Staff
text: I originally booked through expedia but happened to call the hotel a few weeks before my stay to ask a few questions and during the course of the phone call was told of a much better deal by booking directly through the hotel. The room was spacious for NYC. The location was perfect very near a subway line and near Central Park and many restaurants. The staff were very friendly and we loved the bakery. It was a great stay and we would stay again.

title: Not the cleanest or nicest but will do
text: The first room I was put in had a horrible smell. It smelled like there were pets or something in the room but I don’t think it’s a pet friendly hotel so I’m not sure. I also had booked a deluxe double room which is supposed to have a sitting area with chairs set up because me and two friends were getting ready for a show there. There was nothing like that. The room was small but that is to be expected in NYC. I then went to the front desk to let them know and the lady at the desk was pretty rude and told me to then get my stuff and they’d have another room at 3. Check in was at 3 but I called earlier and they said they could have something ready by 1, I got there around 2. I was so annoyed at that point because I was told I’d be able to check in early I upgraded my room to a bigger space. It was fairly clean and did not have that smell. Another friend was staying at the hotel that week (there was a show nearby so there were about 20 people staying at this hotel for it) said they also had to change from the first room they were given because it’s dirty. I understand in the city you will pay a lot for a little space but I expect that space should at least be clean. I would recommend going for a suite, they seem to take better care of those rooms.

title: Charming, Old School Vibe. Perfect Location
text:
Special thanks to Shanies - ask for her, she will take care of all your needs. 

This hotel radiates class, has spacious rooms, and is located in one of the most convenient and upscale areas in NYC. 

It has hosted the likes of Mark Twain and Babe Ruth. The hotel has maintained to keep up with modern technology while honoring its historic roots and vintage feel.

title: Nice hotel
text: I love this place, it is very easy to get there, just a few blocks from Central Park near to the subway and a bus line, there are many good restaurants and shops in the area and they have a delicious  place to have breakfast.  The staff is great.

title: Birthday vacation
text:
Disappointed in this hotel. 

Had a deluxe queen for one night and had 3 issues. 

Biggest one was the bathroom. So small you
basically had to almost sit on the sink in order to close the door to use the facilities. For both the toilet and the shower it was not easily accessed.

Also renovating the 7th floor and my room was the only room that was finished so had to listen to the workers pounding and drilling.  From early morning throughout the day. 

Heating is with a radiator. No instructions on how to use it and coming from Florida had to have someone show me how to turn it on and off. 

My second stay was a larger King and old furniture, bathroom still small but easier to use and thermostat to set the heat didn't work so had to have someone come turn the radiator. 

Maybe when the renovations are completed the hotel will be worth the money. 

Great location for my stay near family but wouldn't stay until problems fixed.

title: One Night stay
text:
Hotel Belleclare is on the East side of Central Perk. It has good subway and bus routes close by. There are plenty of bakerys and restaurants within walking distance.
The hotel itself is an old character building. We stayed in a family room which had one room with two good sized singles beds and an ajoining room with a large double and the bathroom. There is a small fridge and microwave in the room but no kettle or coffee machine which would have been nice. The hotel also has complementary toiletries. They also offer a baggage room for after checkout.
The staff were all very friendly and we were never left waiting.

title: A nice clean hotel reasonably priced (for NYC) in a good location.
text: We previously stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire in September 2018 and decided to stay there again this month (January 2020).  The hotel is clean, reasonably priced and is in an ideal location to visit our daughter who lives just off Broadway in the Upper West Side and to get downtown via the #1 or #2 subway.   The room was small but since we were out of the room sightseeing or seeing a show or concert, we basically were in the room only at night to sleep.

title: MEDIOCRE, BUT COULD BE GREAT
text: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times, mainly because of the location.  Each time I go back I look for improvements, but other than a new entrance sign that is about it.  The entrance to the hotel and lobby is still bleak, the hallway on my floor needed new carpeting, a broken blind in my room, a mattress with a dip in the middle...all this and a very small room.  They do have fancy towels and nice bathroom amenities, but my bathroom was extremely small.  On top of all that, I was told they would put a $50.00 retainer on my bill...they never said $50.00 per night. Some times during the year this hotel charges extremely high prices for what you get.  So be sure you get a fair rate for a very mediocre accommodation.

title: Amazing hotel in the UWS!!
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 5 days at the start of 2020. Absolute 5* customer service, I can not fault this hotel at all! Walking distance to the 72nd and 79th street station which can get you anywhere in the city, and we just love the quietness of the upper west side.

Upon arriving we made the hotel aware that we were newlyweds and were on our honeymoon from Ireland. The hotel then immediately upgraded our room to a parlour on the 9th floor which was absolutely outstanding, a great start to our honeymoon. Oh and the champagne in our room when we returned that evening was a class touch!!

Special mention to shanies hunte who made our stay so memorable, her customer service was fantastic!so friendly and helpful!

This hotel is a must for anyone visiting NYC!!!we will defiantly be back!

Thank you to all at the Belleclaire for an amazing stay!!

Stephen & Erin

title: Hidden Gem
text: Needed a room on the upper West Side for Sunday Jan 5 . My wife and I were very pleased with our choice of the Belleclaire . The location was excellent and the service was very friendly and top notch from bellman to front desk.  We reserved a parlor suite which was perfect for our needs . We needed to check out at 530 AM and the bellman was very helpful and front desk friendly . There are many restaurants in the area within walking distance and enjoyed  a excellent meal on Sunday night at Cesca a fine Italian restaurant . In total we were very pleased with the hotel and will return .

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel, Great Service - take it from a picky New Yorker!
text:
My husband and I recently moved out of the city, but still need to travel in on occasion for business. We know A LOT of hotels in town.
We've watched the development of the Hotel Belleclaire since it began renovations a few years ago.
The new lobby is fresh and chic, and the patisserie delicious!
The staff is very warm and attentive, and the Manager Robert is extremely thoughtful!
The rooms, all in varying degrees of renovation (central AC still underway) are comortable and the beds are great quality sleep beds!
A gem and landmark in the charming Ansonia neighborhood of the UWS.

title: Great Hotel...Great People!
text: My wife and I have stayed at the Belleclaire many times over the past 4-5 years. You can not beat the location, the ambience of a classic boutique hotel and the friendly staff. We’ve stayed in just about all of the different rooms (queens, king, suites, etc.) and we’ve never been disappointed. The rooms are always clean and professionally made up each day. The hotel staff is always available and they can’t do enough to make you happy. If you ask my wife she’ll tell you the best part of staying at the Bellclaire is having the Mille-feuille Bakery Cafe right next door! If you’ve always stayed in one the “big name” chain hotels, do yourself a favor and try one of the nicest boutique hotels in NYC...the Hotel Belleclaire!

title: Ultimo dell’anno a New York
text:
Hotel in corso di ristrutturazione e quindi si possono avere anche camere ( come capitato a noi) non nuove. Il costo iniziale proposto elevato e inaccettabile per i servizi offerti ma parlando con i responsabili si è convenuto per un costo più appropriato e alla fine il rapporto qualità prezzo è diventato accettabile (questo spiega il 4 di valutazione che diamo).
Speriamo chela ristrutturazione proceda al più presto così l’albergo diventa più accogliente.
Posizione perfetta per chi non ama il caos del centro che comunque è raggiungibile a piedi in 15 minuti.

title: Not as represented!
text: We booked a double room based on the website photo.  We were shocked at what the hotel looked like in person.  The common area floors looked as though they hadn't been vacuumed for days, and the elevator looked beat up and dirty.  Our room was tiny with nowhere to hang clothes, and the headboards looked worn and and old.  The bedding didn't look fresh either, and the room had an unpleasant industrial disinfectant smell (which apparently wasn't strong enough to kill the mold in the bathroom).  If the room had cost half as much it probably wouldn't have been such a disappointment.  But the value just wasn't there.  And the website photos are ridiculously misrepresentative of the current condition of the property.  I'm not sure what the better alternative in NYC would be since hotels across the board are overpriced. If it's simply location you're looking for, Belleclaire is great.  But don't expect the luxury stay they're advertising.

title: Pleasant experience
text: Well I’ve done quite a few hotels in NY. However, this may not be on the same level with the newer hotels, it was a nice option. An older hotel but considerably clean. The bathroom was immaculate, as well as the room. Linen was perfect. The room was warm. It was just a small room for what was considered a suite. So if you’re not one to live in your room, this hotel is a good match. Oh, and the elevators are not for one with claustrophobia. Due to the age of the hotel, stairs are right there for you if you find the elevators a little close for comfort. As well, considering it may feel like a tight space of packed rooms, it was actually very quiet. Hallways were clean. No food trays left lingering in the hallway. Staff were superb and very resourceful and helpful. Let’s say they are in the category of above and beyond. Thank you! The subway is just up the street, very walkable. I’ll definitely keep this hotel an option for future!

title: Great and relaxing location away from the big city.
text: Excellent service and beautiful building with access to a lot of conveniences like restaurants, shopping and subway stations, but far enough away from the bright lights and noise of Times Square to get a nice night's sleep.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: The front of the hotel was so pretty and we were welcomed by extremely helpful staff from the start. Nice large room with such comfortable beds. What more could you need after a busy day sightseeing? Rooms were cleaned and serviced daily, would highly recommend.

title: Hated it
text: I hated absolutely everything about this hotel. It was dirty, run down and not at all central. We arrived at our room which smelt of something so strong it caught my breath & there were cockroaches running around . We phone reception to tell them we wouldn’t be staying in the room to be hold the smell was a good thing it was the smell of alcohol cleaning products. The fact we couldn’t breath didn’t seem to matter. The other people in our party had dirty bedding in their beds. The hotel was dark, dingy, dirty and poorly maintained. I would never return not even if they offered me free accommodation. Complete disappointment!

title: Hotel nel cuore di Manhattan
text:
A pochi passi dalla metropolitana e dal museo di scienze.
Non offre colazione (ma ci sono diversi bar nelle vicinanze)
E' pulito e le camere anche se un po' "tradizionali" sono dignitose.
Ci han messo in 6 (nel periodo della maratona) in una camera in cui però c'era un matrimoniale e 2 letti da 1 piazza e mezza....chiedete che tipo di letti sono

title: Not what I expected.
text:
Coming up to Christmas everywhere I usually stay was booked. This was in the area I like and while not reasonable, was not outrageous either. Room for two adults booked and paid for. City view, two beds sure what more could you ask for?

The hotel looked run down. Upon getting up to the floor in the tiny elevator, the floors looked dirty. Obviously there was some construction going on but I thought this would be tidied up when they were finished... nope... it wasn't done.

The room had a wonderful city view of the wall adjacent. The room was small, looked ancient and air conditioner was popped in the window...Bathroom was fine if a little small. It seemed clean. The bed was lovely though... very comfortable.

One other thing to note.... the smell of cooking in the room at night was terrible. Either a grease fryer or something similar... it was very evident in the hallway too.

Will I be back personally? Nope... it was not value for money.

title: Way off
text: I realize I booked with 4-5 days in advance and the options were few. It was a one night stay for a business trip. I paid $597 and they did not even have water or coffee maker. The restroom was clean but it's one of those that the shower and toilet and sink are all in the same level. A shower curtain division did it's purpose but it just seems like a room for wheelchairs. Bed was comfortable but the noise from the street (in the 8th floor) was annoying. Of course, it's NYC and the location is great, so my fault I chose in the middle of the action. The lobby is quite pretty but the staff was not too eager, lots of frowns prevailed, not enough smiles. My rating is based on the premise that I paid doubledof what could have seemed fair for the quality of the place. It could be so much better in service and amenities. Too expensive for what it was.

title: Great proximity to Beacon theater
text: Very old hotel, modernized rooms, very - - small elevators, narrow hallways. Friendly employees. Room very small - typical for NY. 2 blocks from Beacon theater, nice area in city. Furniture in room chipped, flooring in room is cheap, fake hardwood that was peeling, ewe!

title: Great Staff, building needs serious maintenance
text:
Perfect location, beautiful old building.  Fantastic staff.  BUT the air con units are a huge problem.  They have been fitted in curved windows with 2 pieces of perspex either side that are not secure, therefore it`s like sleeping with the windows open.  It`s very cold and noisy.  
the sofa bed is extremely uncomfortable.  Such a pity as with a little more care it could be perfect,

title: Hotel Belleclaire New York
text: When we arrived our rooms were not the cleanest desk and bedside tables were very dusty as was the wooden floor.  The bed was clean and also comfortable enough although small. The ensuite was very tired the unit the sink was in was painted wood but was all chipped.  I went straight down to reception and told the receptionist that the rooms 709 and 729 were not the cleanest and as it was late in the day I understood not much could be done tonight but that I would like both rooms given a deep clean next morning while I was out as I would be out all day.  The receptionist was very nice and full of apologies and said she would leave a note for the manager and house keeper.  Next day on our return to the hotel our bed hadn't even been made so I returned to the reception to complain again got apologies.  Next day the room was cleaned but the cleanliness was never great.  There was no amenities within the hotel breakfast which was advertised as continental buffet was orange juice,coffee and a croissant or pastry if your choice which you got at the bakers next door with vouchers you had to collect every morning from reception. Thankfully all we needed was somewhere to sleep because that is all it was good for.

title: Buena ubicación, instalaciones algo viejas
text:
El hotel está bien situado y nos salió bien de precio. Es un hotel con solera, se ve antiguo pero elegante.
Negativo: desayuno muy escaso y, debido a que son antiguas las instalaciones, se oía el ruido de las tuberías por la noche. La limpieza del baño dejaba un poco que desear.
La habitación para 4 personas era minúscula, la de 2 personas estaba muy bien.

title: My first visit to "Hotel Belleclaire"
text: I'm happy my cousin found this hotel.  It was our first time in New York and didn't know what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised once we got there.  Check in was quick and easy and they allowed us to move to another room because we preferred a room with a view which the first one didn't have.  The room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  This hotel is very well located, a couple of stations are close (Line 1 takes you almost everywhere on the west side of Manhattan) and restaurants and stores are in every corner which is great if you need to do some shopping.  There is only one thing that we didn't enjoy and it was the sound of the radiator but we were informed that they were doing some renovations and the radiators were about to be replaced.  With regards to the hotel staff, we can only say THANK YOU, they were very helpful and kind, specially Jasmin and Maria.  They made us feel very welcomed.

title: Rooms look nothing like the pics.....beware!!!
text:
I thought I was doing my due diligence. We usually spend a long weekend in NYC on the UWS every year with another couple. I called in to the Hotel to inquire if they had a 2 bedroom suite connected by a lounging area which was a very important criteria for our stay. I was told they absolutely had that type of suite and that there was only 1 left.
Omg imagine our surprise on entering this suite.
Before we even got to the suite I noticed that the passageway was filthy like it had not been vacuumed but then again I thought it could be that we had arrived mid evening and that was why...no worries moving on.
We enter the 'suite' to find that it's  2 bedrooms connected to each other with no lounging room in between. I became extremely irritated but thought I should make the most of it as we were already there.
The curtains on the window were put on backwards which makes zero sense. The chest of drawers was old and dilapidated and the drawers had the knobs missing and this to me seemed tacky and lazy as it is an easy fix. The headboard was so scratched and discolored you would think they would replace it...seriously, the leather had been scratched off the headboard.
The room looked barely cleaned but I reserved comment until a few days.
