We hardly slept through the first night as they have VERY old radiators that sounds like someone is crashing through the door. We complained the next morning and were told that somebody would fix it but that never got done.
After a full day of being out, we return to our 'suite' to find the beds made and nothing else. Bathroom still had all the dirt on the floor. There were no towels, no body wash and no glasses which we had to call down to get and when we were made to feel as if we were a bother.
I can't ever imagine recommending this hotel to anyone and I am floored by the positive reviews they receive. How is this possible when this entire hotel looks worn out and dirty.
The one positive was that the beds were made every day but that was the limit of their cleaning. I don't remember staying in a hotel that seemed so sloppy and unkempt. Who is responsible for the operation of this hotel?

title: Hotel Belleclaire
text: Once again, we had a wonderful experience at our stay in the Hotel Belleclaire. The staff are gracious, welcoming and helpful at all times. Our room was spacious, attractive and well appointed. The bed was firm and comfortable We will return!!!

title: Clean and pleasant hotel in upper west side NYC
text:
The bathroom had been renovated recently and was pleasant.   Staff was helpful and friendly.  We got the king size bed which has a larger room and it was larger than the average NYC room. 
Breakfast was included, but the bakery usually had a very small selection of cakes. Breakfast included juice, a cake,  and plain coffee - cappucino costs an  extra dollar and a half (not too much for the better coffee.)

title: Our home while in NYC
text: We come to NYC 1-2 times a year for medical appointments. Typically, this trip is grueling so, we don't really get to see much of NYC. We have been staying at the Belle Claire since 2016 and we just love this hotel. We are always treated like family. Marta, Rachelle, Maria and Rebecca are amazing and kind. We love the neighborhood feel of the hotel and it's nice that it's out of the touristy areas so it's less stressful. We will always stay at the Belle Claire and we always recommend it to others who may be travelling to NYC. Thanks Belle Claire for everything!

title: Overpriced, and you don’t get the amenities you’re supposed to.
text:
This hotel did not live to expectations at all. We paid over $1000 for three nights, however, the hotel is only worth maybe $300 for three nights. This is not a 3-Star hotel like it supposed to be, and I’ve stayed in nicer motels. 

We got a double deluxe room with a view. The double deluxe is supposed to be “spacious” which includes a window seat, include a refrigerator with a minibar, slippers, and robes just to name a few amenities. The first room they gave us was not a double deluxe, it was a standard room with two double beds crammed into the room any room. It also did not have any of the amenities listed above. And it was very dirty. So, we went down and told them and they gave us a new room (had to wait an hour and a half for it to be ready). When we requested the new room, we said there was no refrigerator in the first room, and were told that we had to request one when we booked the room (it does not say that anywhere online when you’re booking a room). They told us to call down and request one to see if there was one available. 

We got up to the new room and it was the right room this time, however, it still did not have any of the amenities listed above. No refrigerator (but we did get one after we had to call down an ask for one). There was no mini-bar (not a problem though, as we weren’t going to use it, but it was still listed as something that would be in the room). And we still didn’t have our robes and slippers. 

Although the room was cleaner, it was still rather dusty, and the furniture was very beaten up. There were cobwebs on the ceiling, the headboards were peeling off. There were chips and scratches in the wood on every single table, chair, shelf, etc. It was not a room worth spending over $1000 on. Also, there was no coffee maker or microwave in the room, although not listed in the amenities what hotel doesn’t have a coffee maker in the room? They also don’t have coffee sitting out in the lobby, every hotel I’ve been to has complimentary coffee in the lobby. 

We paid for the breakfast package, the hotel itself doesn’t have breakfast, it’s through a bakery next door. The breakfast package only includes one small cup of coffee, one croissant or a slice of cake, and a small cup of orange juice. The bakery doesn’t open until 7:00 am so when you need to be somewhere before then because you’re staying due to a business-related event, you can’t get your breakfast you paid for when you want your breakfast, and have to get Starbucks or Dunkin on your way. And for the price you paid for it, it did not include very much.

This hotel did not live up to the pictures or description you see on their website, and when I return to NYC in three weeks, I will be staying at the Fairfield Inn which is only $175 a night, and I know it will  have coffee in the room, a refrigerator without having to request one when I book the room. It will be clean, and it will have coffee in the lobby and have everything else you expect from a hotel. I would not recommend staying at the Hotel Belleclaire to anyone, it is way overpriced for what its offers, and you don’t even get the stuff it is supposed to have. 

*Cross-posted to Google Maps, as well

title: My go-to on the UWS
text: I am a fan of the Upper West Side, having lived there for 8 years (wish I still did!). Hotel Belleclaire is just ideal, and I have always had the same pleasant experience. The location is fantastic, and the accommodations are everything you need. It’s not fancy, but definitely a classic. The attached bakery is amazing, and I believe they will be converting part of the lobby into a bar in the near future, which will be great!

title: Historical NYC Hotel
text: It is an old but enchanting hotel designed by architect Emery Roth in 1903. Location was perfect. Near Cenyral Park and on Broadway Ave. The place is quiet and near parks. We love the exterior design as well as its classic interiors. However, the bedrooms are small as well as the elevators. They only have 2 small elevators and they are quite old, slow, noisy and rough. Bedrooms and toilet are clean but you will continuously hear a hammering sound everytime the heater is working. Their bed is also small and you have no coach or luggage rack to put your luggage on. They also don't have usb ports in the room and only provided power outlets on the bedside lamps. They also don't provide complimentary water bottles, and doesn't have a bar for liquor, coffee or tea. They also don't have a fridge. They also don't have All Day Dining area. Their breakfast place(very limited choices) is in a small cafeteria beside the hotel. Their wifi connection is free but average speed and you will need to log in your email everytime you use it. Overall, I give it a 3 only because of its historical significance. For its price, we could have gotten a newer and better hotel. I guess that's the price you have to pay for staying in a 116 year old hotel.

title: Decepção
text:
Ainda estou hospedada neste hotel. Esperava bem mais, inclusive pelo preço. 
Tudo que foi pedido tipo check in early, não consegui, mais dois travesseiros extras, tb não consegui.
Hotel antigo é uma coisa, mas hotel velho é outra. 
Quartos pequenos, mesmo com o free upgrade que disseram ter dado( pq no booking .com sou Genius nível 2)  pela funcionária do front desk
Não tem frigobar e nem existe uma única gaveta para guardar a roupa e o armário que existe, é mínimo e não cabe o cabide na sua posição normal. Tem que ficar virado de frente Existe dentro um ferro de passar e uma tábua, que se alguém quiser montar, só poderá faze- lo no corredor, não caberia no quarto
Banheiro reformado, mas o box de vidro vaza para fora mesmo com a porta fechada, e molha tudo ,mal conservado com móveis lascados. Mostrando que serviço de manutenção não existe.E sujeira nas quinas dos pisos e também sem gavetas que caibam uma necessárie.
Sistema de ventilação precário
. O local é insuportavelmente quente beirando uns  27 graus Celsius, e o velho ar condicionado.( poe velho nisto) só faz um barulho absurdo e não refresca. Ou você não dorme pelo calor ou pelo barulho.
Detalhe lá fora está 6 graus e nem eu nem meu marido conseguimos dormir pelo barulho e pelo calor.
Ponto positivo cama confortável , chuveiro bom e piso sem carpete, mas com tacos velhos que acumulam pó 
Elevadores minúsculos, devem caber 4 pessoas
Tanto o pessoal da recepção como o serviço de housekeeper são apenas ok! Nada que mereça um elogio.

Muito , mas muito velho e mau conservado, uma pena pq a localização é muito boa, perto do Central Park e de estações de metrô.
Sinceramente, não seria um hotel que eu voltaria e nem indicaria para ninguém que me pedisse uma sugestão 
Permaneço aqui, pq não achei nenhum outro pra trocar . A cidade está lotada por parada de Thanksgiving e liquidação de black Friday
Meu conselho seria só fiquem aqui se realmente não tiverem outra opção.
Sempre faço avaliações positivas dos lugares, mas em respeito aos outros viajantes , que  procuram aqui dicas para aproveitar melhor seu dinheiro, me sinto obrigada a falar a verdade.
Não é ruim, mas bem longe se ser bom!
Daria nota 6,5

title: Excellent service and confortable rooms
text: The service was great from the reception to the room attendant. The continental breakfast is really good and the room is very confortable and clean. The hotel have perfect location and near subway station, CVS pharmacy 24 hrs.

title: We’ve Found Our New York Home
text:
We found this little gem via a friend who’d stayed there in the past. Our first time in NYC we stayed in Greenwich Village and loved that part of town but the hotel was super expensive and the room minuscule. The first thought we had when we opened the door to our king deluxe room was how big it was! Two windows, one with a view of the Hudson, a few blocks away. 
Front desk service was flawless and friendly. We stayed for two nights, stayed with friends for one night and were welcomed back for two more nights like we were family. Ask about their car service to LGA. We saved a bundle using it on a rainy Tuesday morning. They also celebrated my husband’s birthday with some nice treats. 
The Belleclaire has a very European feel to it. Smallish elevators, narrow hallways, beautiful drapery and wall treatments. There is a lovely French coffee shop that opens onto the lobby. My husband went down daily to bring me coffee and a croissant. 
The hotel is ideally situated, close to Riverside and Central Park and just two blocks from the #1 subway that runs down Broadway. We walked everywhere and took the train home. 
We can’t wait to go back.

title: Overnight Stay
text: Beautiful safe hotel. Room was charming and very clean. Bathroom was beautiful and modern. Front desk customer service was great. Price was reasonable for the upper west side. They have an on-site bakery cafe.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: I want to start with how friendly the front desk is. They are so helpful and polite.I asked them for a few places to go eat and they helped me with a few choices. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. I love the little coffee shop down in the lobby. This is the only place I will be staying from now on when I visit NY.

title: Viaggio a New York
text: Hotel in posizione comoda,vicino alla fermata metro 1 e C. Lo avevo scelto sia per la posizione che per la colazione continentale inclusa ne prezzo, solo che di continentale non c'è proprio nulla. All'arrivo ci hanno consegnato dei voucher per la colazione da consumare in una caffetteria posta quasi all'interno della hall, dove la possibilità di scelta è relativa e comunque solo a base di dolci,quindi per chi come me è intollerante al lattosio è un problema. Le stanze sono piuttosto piccole ma nella media di NY e un po' datate. Letto comodo e bagno molto piccolo. Molto vicino a central park.

title: Marathon weekend
text: We spent the weekend of the NYC marathon at this hotel and had the best weekend. We arrived Saturday and they had valet parking at a nearby garage. So no need to worry about where to park or when to move the car. The hotel was full, but everyone was smiling, gracious and helpful. We will definitely remember this hotel and use it for whatever NYC needs we have.

title: Hotel Belleclaire
text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Belleclaire for two nights in early November. We had a flawless visit. The staff members were friendly and competent. The room was clean and comfortable. The French bakery next door was scrumptious. The location was perfect for walking to Central Park and nearby Upper West Side attractions. A subway stop was a short two blocks down the street. I would recommend Hotel Belleclaire to anyone looking to stay in a lovely hotel on Manhattan's Upper West Side.

title: Thumbs up for customer service, shame on ownership...
text:
The employees are doing their best with the product they have been given (except for maintenance). Shame on ownership (Triumph Hotels?) for not investing in this gem of a property and letting it be run down like this. Customer service was great but I can only imagine the abuse from the customers they have to take due to lack of quality of the product. What’s even more upsetting- a lot of it is easily fixable. Have you ever heard of preventative maintenance program? Look it up, get a capable head of Engineering and it will get 50% better. The first room we were checked into- the bed squeaky, luggage rack broken (literally fell apart when we unfolded it), the sink was stopped up. Should not happen. Susan at the FD was kind enough to move us to another room which was much better, but what’s up with the windows? They are paper thin and taped up with packaging tape? Really?? And have you ever heard of caulking? 

In general, location and customer service great. The hotel condition is disastrous.

title: Lomba60
text: Location eccellente stanze ben curate ben servito e con tutto quello che ti occorre per una bella vacanza a New York a portata di mano. Unico neo che toglie l'eccellente è che il silenzio non fa parte del confort che l'hotel offre con la giusta attenuante della posizione della struttura di una strada molto trafficata.

title: Nice place to stay
text: The location is amazing and our room was super clean! The hotel staff was nice and helpful. Our room was tiny and at night noisy, but it's Manhattan, so it's expected. We stayed 3 nights with our 3-year-old and it is a nice memory for us. I recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to take walks in Manhattan, or just go to the Central Park every day. :) (And there are a lot of stores in the near.)

title: Vale pela localização
text:
Hotel está envelhecido, mas em obras
Ficamos em um quarto reformado, piso de parquet, mas tivemos que solicitar mudança de quarto, pois o primeiro que nos deram estava empoeirado, como meus filhos são alérgicos solicitei a mudança e eles foram corteses, até providenciaram uma limpeza adicional no ar-condicionado 
A localização é muito boa, metrô a um quarteirão, muitas lojas , mercados, restaurantes no entorno( o Serafina em frente ao hotel tem uma ótima pizza no forno a lenha)
Ponto negativo: não tem área pro café da manhã, é um espaço improvisado no lobby, reservei com café e tínhamos direito somente a um café e um croissant com suco de laranja, muito pobre e desconfortável, tínhamos que complementar na confeitaria que fica no térreo do hotel!!

title: Disappointing
text: As we have done for over 50 years; four college friends got together -- this time to celebrate our 70th birthdays together in NY.  We made our reservations at the Hotel Belleclaire on the Upper West Side; with the promise that our two deluxe double queen bedrooms would be very close to each other if not connecting.   While the hotel location was great we found the hotel is not aging well.  It was poorly maintained, and service was inadequate and not as promised on the website.   The two rooms ended up being floors away from each other and each had serious deficiencies.  The management did offer us a discount given the many issues on checkout; but this did not make up for the hassles, inconveniences and disappointments.  We will not be staying there again.

title: Do the walking tour
text: Enjoyed everything about our stay at the Hotel Belleclaire! Coffee and croissants at the downstairs bakery were delicious to start the day.  Be sure to take advantage of the complementary walking tour-it was the highlight of our stay!

title: Be careful as website isn’t accurate in their descriptions!!!
text:
So after a long flight with delays from Heathrow to Newark, train rides & a walk in the rain to the hotel we were tired, soaked & just wanted to get settled in to our room. The man on reception whom we didn’t catch the same of (younger, long-ish hair tucked behind his ears) wasn’t particularly helpful, seemed bored & didn’t engage with our conversations.

When we checked in to our room we were VERY disappointed, it was tiny with a SMALL double bed & a desk squashed in to the room, with one side of the bed almost touching the wall. The bathroom was small, dark & the shower was appalling. My partner jumped in the shower because after being up for over 12 hours & pulling a 17kg case from Penn Station to the hotel he really needed one. In the mean time I sat on the bed disheartened, wondering how we would both fit in here let alone sleep!! I checked the website & the room did not fit the standard room description or images.

I decided to go down to reception to express my concerns. I was respectful & just stated my disappointment as the room didn’t match what we had paid for or the website. The same man mentioned above was VERY rude & abrupt saying ‘that is a standard room, what do you expect’ I showed him the website image & he said ‘you’ve booked a standard room, that’s a queen bed, you won’t get that when you pay for standard’ I showed him the website stated this was in fact a standard room so in that case the website isn’t accurate. He said ‘well I’m sorry about that’ I asked what could be done as it’s such a small room especially for 2 people & he eventually said we could look at another standard room. This room was so much better so it just shows you the difference in rooms, still a standard room but this was actually a double if not a bigger bed, plenty of room either side of the bed & the shower a lot better.

The man rang the old room to ask what we wanted to do & I said yes please can we change, he asked if we had used anything so of course I said my partner had used the shower to which he replied ‘oh really’ and put the phone down on me aggressively. I apologised when I went down with the old card, I know it wasn’t ideal but I didn’t know we would be able to change room & my partner needed a shower!! Anyway the man was plain rude & made me feel terrible for the whole evening, I never complain!!
Other than that the rest of the staff seemed lovely, the bed was really comfortable & the room quiet, just a shame about the rude man on reception & the hallways & carpets needing TLC.

title: Pretty good hotel
text: The best about this hotel is its location. It’s only two blocks away from a subway station and there’s lots of restaurantes, cafés and shops nearby. A short walk will get you to Central Park. The room wasn’t large, but was enough for us, and the bathroom had great shower. Cleaning was a bit irregular: very good one day, not so much the next one. Oh, and there’s a fine bakery. Anyway, it’s a good hotel and I’d stay there again.

title: Fabulous stay at The BelleClaire
text: We stayed at the BelleClaire for a week on a family holiday to NYC. Having read the reviews I requested in advance a quiet room and we were allocated room 816, this is a family suite with 2 bedrooms. The room was spacious and clean and we had minimal hotel noise which was great. The area around the hotel is a constant buzz of activity and so the street noise continued throughout the night but after a couple of nights this didn’t bother us and we all slept well. The room was cleaned and beds made daily and fresh towels provided. In terms of improvements it would be great to have some additional storage as we were unable to fully unpack as there was only a small wardrobe and 2 bedside cabinets which was not sufficient for a family of 4. Also would be nice to have a small mirror on the desks to use when drying hair or doing make up. Overall a really pleasant stay and would definitely recommend.

title: A Nice, Quiet Place
text: This is a nice, quiet basic place to stay in the area at a fair price. The staff is helpful and attentive. The rooms are spotless, comfortable and quiet. I sometimes work at a nearby museum doing events and need a place to stay over "in town". Belleclaire is my choice and this was my 5th stay. Nearby dining makes up for a lack of an in-hotel restaurant. Besides, getting out of the hotel makes for a real New York experience.

title: Hotel charmant
text:
Hotel charmant, accueil très sympathique, chambre petite (j'étais seule) donnant sur une cour intérieure. Du coup, aucun bruit. Très bien situé à 2 pas du métro, de Central park, du musée d'histoire naturelle. Nombreux commerces à proximité, pharmacie, épicerie, restaurant, boulangerie.
Pas de petit dej mais possibilité d'acheter une viennoiserie ou un sandwich dans le magasin attenant à l'hotel avec l'option prendre son "brakefast" dans le hall d'accueil de l'hôtel (petites tables à disposition). Le dernier jour, on m'a laissé la chambre jusqu'à 13h. Service de garde de bagage.

title: A bit rundown
text:
Good location on upper west side, 5 minutes walk from the park. The hotel has seen better days, it’s all a bit rundown. But if you get a good deal then it’s still a reasonable option for the upper west side. There’s a nice cafe attached to the hotel for breakfast/afternoon, with excellent coffee. 
Lost a star for not having a kettle/coffee machine in the room. Come on guys, would it really hurt to put one in the room. Also safe didn’t work properly and had to call them to get the passports out when leaving!

title: Nice Hotel
text:
It was our first time to New York and it took a long time to pick the right hotel for us (3ad, 2ch 7&10). We picked the Hotel Belleclaire due to it's location on the Upper Westside and the price for NYC was actually quite reasonable considering we needed a room for 5ppl.
The location was much better than we had anticipated, 2 blocks to Central Park and the American Museum of Natural History. 2 Subway stations only a couple of minutes walk away, bakery/cafe next door was great, up the road was a not so little convenience store and one block over was a whole strip of restaurants where we had many great meals. I never once had any issue walking around at any time of the day or night. It was quiet and I always felt safe. 
The hotel itself was lovely, clean and a nice size. We stayed in a Two Bedroom Family Suite which was actually a decent size and bigger than I expected for a New York hotel room, it was clean, comfortable and we didn't have too much street noise. It would have been nice to have some kind of view instead of the side of another building, but considering we didn't spend a huge amount of time in our room it was fine and probably why our room was so quiet, except for the air conditioning unit if you are a light sleeper it may annoy you.
All in all we had a great experience and even got used to the tiny elevators.

title: Gute Location zum wohnen in NYC
text:
Sauber, sehr gut gelegen, 3 min. zur nächsten Metrohaltestelle, 15 min. bis zum Timesquare. 
Die Zimmer sind ausreichend groß für eine vierköpfige Familie, Suiten darf man aber nicht erwarten. Recht großes Badezimmer mit großer Dusche. Als wir da waren haben die Wasserleitungen laut gerauscht wenn jemand geduscht hat, dieses Problem soll aber in naher Zukunft gelöst werden. Auf unserer Etage wurde bereits renoviert, was allerdings überhaupt nicht gestört hat. 
Wir waren sehr zufrieden, würden wieder da buchen und empfehlen das Hotel wärmstens weiter.

title: One of our best NYC hotel experiences to date
text: My wife and I celebrated our 38th wedding anniversary by going to a Steely Dan concert at the Beacon Theater and staying overnight at the Belleclaire Hotel. We received the best rate by calling the hotel directly and were surprised when the staff left us a bottle of Prosecco and two champagne glasses with a note wishing us a very happy 38th anniversary. The hotel and room were very nice, and very close to many worthwhile sites in NYC, including Central Park. Would definitely stay there again!

title: Bella location
text:
Situato benissimo vicino a Central Park e vicino a stazione metro. 
Camere dignitose con bella vista. 
Manca il servizio di prima colazione ma c’è una pasticceria bar francese nella hall dell’hotel. 
Wi-Fi gratuita ma non sempre attiva. Acqua in bottiglia disponibile e gratis. Palestra, computer e stampante a disposizione. 
Buon hotel.

title: Good and Bad
text:
For a start we had a very nice room. The Hotel is in a very good position, and nice and clean.
The unfortunate thing was on one day there was no water available.We, by pure luck, came back to our room early to find water flooding into the room from through a rooftop light. Fortunately I was able to shift suitcases away from the flood. If we had been any later they would have got very wet.  A small bag did.
When the staff were notified they attended to it. When we came back later all had been tidied up. This did make the room a bit moldy, there was never any suggestion of shifting rooms, and never of a suggestion of any compensation for the inconvenience.
Otherwise a nice Hotel.

title: Not a bad option
text:
We picked this place based on personal recommendations and location. Considering crazy pricing in the area, it also came at more or less competitive rate, which also played a role.

It doesn't look as impressive as some other places from outside, but lobby was spacious and functional with a lot of people taking space chatting or working. The attached coffee shop is a nice addition, but, unfortunately, their non-sweet selection was very sad.

Check-in went smooth and staff was helpful. Our room was on the 2nd floor, which was nice as elevators were a bit claustrophobic - tiny and slow. 

There was a sign, which looked somewhat permanent, that they are doing repairs, though we didn't see any work being done anywhere during the 4 days we stayed there. Repairs and updates are needed indeed.

Room was clean and need, but tiny. The few pieces of furniture there was (aside from the beds) looked not just old, but ancient and useless. No fridge and safe was just laying on the floor in the closet not secured to anything. Bathroom, on the other hand, was humongous and in serious need of updating. All windows were super drafty. Room appeared to have been winterized as A/C unit's vent was covered with the piece of wood taped by a packing tape. I'm not sure if that was due to us being pretty close to the street on the 2nd floor or because windows looked like they were 100 years old, but you could hear quite a bit of outside noise through the night - NY is never quiet, but decent windows could help with this.

It was pretty clear that no money was invested in the rooms lately, though lobby was kept more or less up to date.

The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because staff was very professional, efficient and courteous and location was great - two subway stations within couple of blocks (1 block one way and 3 another) and another subway line was about 5 blocks out. It's about 30-40 min walk to Times square (or couple of stops on a subway), 10 min to central park. 24 hour CVS right across from the entrance in case if you need something after hours and whatever else you might possibly need withing few blocks.

title: Super hôtel
text:
Très bien situé par rapport aux métros (2 stations à proximité), et à côté du musée d'histoire naturelle. Personnel accueillant et à l'écoute. 
Chambre sympathique mais le sol n'était pas très clean à notre arrivée. (moutons de poussière)
Bon petit dej

title: Where I stay when visiting this area
text:
Dependable, reliable, quaint, exceptional service, great location - all apply! During my last stay they even sent one of their staff out front to hail a cab for me at 4 am!! 

And the café off the lobby has great pastries and coffee specialties!!

title: Always a Great experience
text: We stay here everytime we visit the city as our son and daughter in law live very near by.  Always a nice stay. Christopher at the front desk is very professional and friendly. Highly recommend the Hotel Belleclaire

title: Lovely stay in a quaint hotel
text: In NYC for work with colleagues at Columbia University. Chose the hotel for its location - close to Central Park and train stations to get about the city. Warmly welcomed to the hotel and the city by the desk staff. Room was clean and bed was very comfortable for me. WiFi signal was strong (8th floor).  Water was nice and hot for my morning shower. The bakery located off the hotel entrance is addictive - coffee and pastries and some breakfast items. Housekeeping was attentive and friendly - I appreciated the slippers. Each time I came back to the hotel, I was greeted with a smile and asked if there was anything needed. Upon checking out, the front desk staff provided options for transportation to the airport.  I took advantage of their driver service. David, the driver, was kind and quiet, and the vehicle immaculate. Thank you for a comfortable stay in a lovely hotel.

title: Amazing Gesture of Customer Service by Christopher Diggs
text:
Hello
I wanted to commend Mr. Christopher Diggs for his exceptional customer service during my stay while visiting Columbia University on Oct 14-15. I forgot my black belt and had a job interview at Columbia. it was late at night when I realized that I did not have a belt. I called and Christopher answered the phone. I asked him about stores to   purchase a belt, but there were none open. He literally gave me the clothes off his back, he gave me his belt, a complete stranger. what generosity and what customer service. Christopher deserves great accolades for his gesture, is is a compassionate and caring individual.  Thank you so  much for your service, attention, and trust in this way.

title: Early autumn visit to NY
text: 1st time at this hotel. Usually stayed across street at Arthouse but their daily facilities surcharge was rediculous. Don't care to pay for amenities I don't care to use. Belleclaire was equal to the other for significantly less $. Upon arrival Rebekkah at front desk was welcoming, cordial and continued throughout the visit. Very helpful in assisting us find less stressful ways to negotiate NY with my impaired wife. When we return to NY in future will definitely put this hotel at top of list.

title: It’s a dump
text:
This hotel has redone the lobby but that’s it. The rooms are old and shabby with seedy furniture. (We had a “suite” and the sofa had such slippery polyester that one kept slipping off it.) The cleaning isn’t great — bathroom shelves weren’t dusted before or during our 3 night stay. It took 10 min each morning to get hot water in the shower. The Wi-Fi internet kept cutting out and eventually died all together. I had the maintenance people come up and they promised to call the service provider but it never came back. 

There are better options in the neighborhood (Arthouse Hotel). 

Never staying here again.

title: Vacations in NYC
text: We had a very pleasant stay at the hotel. The service was very good. Breakfast included: croissant, juice and coffee. Very well located, 2 blocks away from metro. In front there's a 24 hour CVS. Very silent room.

title: Parents weekend at college
text: We stayed for 2 nights. Our room was very clean. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a great location for us right on the 1 train on the Upper West Side. Great location for restaurants, museums and the Park.

title: Muy poco
text: Reservé una habitación "DeLuxe". Estoy en ella, no tiene frigo, no tiene un calentador para café o té,  el armario es de 70 cm, el baño mínimo. La vista a un patio oscuro deprimente,tanto que tenemos las cortinas cerradas. Tal vez tuvimos mala suerte, suele suceder, pero en NY no me gusta esperar acertar con la habitación. Definitivamente no lo recomiendo.

title: A.great base
text: A very pleasant hotel with helpful staff in an excellent location for transport and sightseeing.The linked restaurant is very popular and there are many other enjoyable eating opportunities in the vicinity. Very conveniently placedfor Central Park, The Natural History Museum and The Met.

title: You can do better
text: I visited NYC for a weekend to attend a bridal party for my sister.  I picked this hotel because my sister lives on the upper West side and I wanted to be close to her.  The rate for a standard room was better than other surrounding hotels, but as soon as I began the check-in process, I realized that I had made an error.  I arrived before 9 PM on a Friday night and only one person was working the front desk so I had to wait.  The front desk person was pleasant, but slightly difficult to understand as she mumbled a little.  Once I arrived to the 9th floor, I could not find my room due to lack of clear signs and I returned to the lobby for more info.  They provided me an escort and once I got into my standard room, I was shocked that my own personal bedroom at home is much larger than this tiny room, occupied mostly by a bed.  Only about 1 ft. around the bed and no closet.  The next morning, I left before noon to meet my sister for lunch and no one bothered to clean the room.  Upon my return later that day, I notified the front desk and someone then left me clean towels piled on the bed and never cleared the used towels from the bathroom floor.  I actually dumped my own trash then complained again and got a night maintenance worker who took my used towels.  I've stayed in lower rate hotels before, but for $336 per night (standard room rate) this is unacceptable.  The positives were the location near good shopping and close to my family.  The room was also quiet and I slept comfortably in the bed.  The bathroom shower fixtures were new, but the sink is too shallow so all the water splashes out onto the vanity that is very water damaged.  I won't go back there.  Staff was nice and tried to makeup for problems and offered me a discount, but I will not go back.  They have crammed too many rooms into this building creating an uncomfortable stay for anyone not getting the biggest, most expensive room.

title: What a difference a year makes!
text: October 2018, I wrote a very complimentary review of the Belleclaire Hotel. It was the second time my husband and I had stayed there. It was very welcoming and a  good value for a very comfortable room, with a great bed and pillows (always a litmus test of ours). Having just left the hotel after a two night stay, we are hard pressed to say anything nice about it. After checking in and deciding to take a nap, we were grossed out by a significant stain on the bottom sheet - there were also holes in the pillowcases. Two out of the three black out shades did not work (and were not fixed during our stay); the toilet flushed somewhat haphazardly; and the shower door leaked. Now we have been in small bathrooms, but this room brought new meaning to the word SMALL! You could not shut the door & turn around. My husband was also quite disgruntled to find there were no drawers of any kind to use for unpacking. To the hotel’s credit, they did adjust the bill. Yet we were sorely disappointed to discover the Hotel Belleclaire was a far cry from what it had been just a year ago.

title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in my life!
text: This hotel is such a disappointment I don’t even know where to start. For 400$ a night you think you would get something descent. First of all the room was freezing, they still haven’t put the heat in the hotel so they had to give us a portable heater. There was a huge gap between the wall and the ac unit they had to send someone to repair it. The furniture is all scratched and dusty, super gross and disgusting. Tv in room but no remote control or way to turn it on. Try to get another hotel but the one we wanted were sold out. Please do not stay here!!! I would take a motel 6 over this piece of crap anytime! We literally travel every month all over the world and this is literally the worst!!!

title: Loved the hotel
text: This was an amazing stay at a lovely hotel.  The price was right as was the location.  The shops and bars lining the streets of the Upper West Side made for a relaxing and fun filled vacation.  The rooms are small with a window unit AC, but completely lovely. I would totally recommend.

title: Nice building.  Good staff.  Poor breakfast.
text: Built in 1903, this is a substantial property.  Initial impressions good.  Room was fairly basic, with no coffee-making facilities, although the hotel did provide a kettle upon request.  There was no view from the window, and few shelves to store anything.  But it was clean and everything worked.  Breakfast consisted of one croissant, one glass of poor juice and one cup of coffee.  Hard to find anywhere to sit.  Suggest going elsewhere.  Location quite OK, a short subway ride from downtown.  Short walk to River Hudson, in one direction, and central park in the other.  Plenty of shops/supermarkets close by.

title: Do not recommend!
text: The hotel was very dirty and outdated and we had a cockroach stay with us for the week we were there. The elevators were scarily old and one of them did break down while we were there. On the last day my mother accidentally left her shoes in the closet and after a too long conversation the hotel desk finally offered to send them to her however after we arrived home they have been less then helpful and finally when we managed to get an answer from them they told us that shoes were not found which means they were stolen from the hotel closet.

title: Friendly and Clean!
text: The room is NY small but one of the cleanest rooms I've ever had in NYC. Everything was done by the staff to accommodate us. We asked for a refrigerator and one arrived in about 20 minutes! My friend told the front desk I was receiving an award for lifetime achievement and they gave us a bottle of champagne and sent up two champagne glasses. They helped us flag down cabs and carried our luggage. The staff from front desk to cleaning all had a friendly word. I would stay here again in a minute.

title: Hotel Belleclaire has it all!
text:
Just got home after a wonderful week at Hotel Belleclaire! I can’t say enough about how much we enjoy staying here! The location is perfect, close to subway. The building is beautiful, immaculately clean, and so comfortable! Best of all is the incredible staff, who greet us with a big smile and take care of any request we may have. 
Already planning our stay at Belleclaire for 2020!

title: Great location
text: Spent a great week here. Breakfast in patisserie next door always good and open early for those with jet-lag!  Fabulous location, two blocks up to subway and three blocks across from Central Park. Staff always friendly and helpful, battery went in our doorkey entry and was replaced in five minutes. Thanks. Showers nice and hot. Safe in room. Kelvin, the doorman, was great, storing our cases before we left and organising taxi to airport. Always smiling. Thanks to all the team.

title: Nice boutique hotel, small rooms
text: Very friendly guest service staff, very small elevators, room and bathroom are small but serviceable; has Mille-feuille bakery right outside; here for Jerry Seinfeld show (Beacon Theater) so it was only 2 blocks away and convenient; don’t usually stay in UWS but would come back if needed to be in this area

title: Great service!
text:
We arrived to be greeted by the fantastic reception team. They explained the features of the hotel and provided assistance and guidance where we needed. 

Our room was 111 and had two double beds. This was fine for the time we spent in it (not a great deal) as we were out all day looking at the sites of New York. 

The room has a mini fridge, and a safe deposit box, along with a hair dryer, dressing table and a bath / shower. The mini fridge was just stood alone and not in a cupboard as such. Ice was available and a bucket was provided. 

The breakfast was a voucher to the bakery next door and consists of one tea or coffee, one orange juice and one croissant. 

Overall the hotel is great and the service is fantastic, the breakfast may not fill you but it’s still something to start your day!

title: Yankee game
text:
Always great time in NYC  but we always enjoy our stay at the Belclaire!!!
Maria at the front desk greeted me with her pretty smile and was very helpful with all of our needs. Can’t wait to visit again soon!

title: Week in new york
text: Fabulous place, if small, but it's close to everything you could want. The subway is close by. The staff are fabulous, sorting out cabs to the airport etc. Defo stay there again. One slight issue, trip was not long enough

title: The perfect shower
text: We stayed in hotel Belle Claire in sept 2019. It was  hotel number 10 during our road trip in north east USA. I am 196 cm tall. In Bell Clair I could really stand up right under the shower for the first time. The rooms of Belle Claire are renovated and they have a modern look, good airco  and a beautifull bathroom. The employees are very friendly and help-full. We had a very pleasant stay!

title: Je recommande!
text:
Hôtel très bien situé.
(Proche métro { direct sur Times Square}, boulangerie française, supermarché, proche de Central Park...) 
Personnel sympathique et accueillant 
Bel hôtel bien décoré.
Chambre simple, grande douche. Propre. Literie très confortable. 
Climatisation incluse. Bonne connection Wifi
Ma chambre ne donnant pas sur la rue mais sur une cours intérieur, aucune visibilité et sombre mais gros avantage:aucun bruit, donc sommeil non perturbé.

En tout cas je reviendrai sans hésiter !

title: Great Service
text: The people that work there are great and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The hotel is clean with a great coffee boutique attached. The rooms are clean and comfortable and within easy walking distance of several subway stations.

title: Excellent choice to experience a charming area of NYC
text:
Nice building and the Broadway studios are wide and cozy options, it is worth spending an additional bunch of money to get it.
Fitness room needs improvements.
I will definitely consider The Belleclaire again in our future stay.

title: Hyggelig betjening
text: Hotellet ligger sentralt til, 200 m fra nærmeste Subway. Vi fikk et rom i 2 etg ut mot Broadway, der var det ikke mulig for oss å få sove. Resepsjonisten ordnet umiddelbart et nytt rom til oss. Stille og rolig, gode senger. Noe slitt, ikke kjøleskap på rommet. Men det som var negativt ved rommet, ble oppveid av hyggelige og serviceinnstilte medarbeidere. Vi anbefaler hotellet!!

title: Tremendous Hotel
text: The place oozes class. Full of character. Perfect location in the UWS. Close to Central Park. Comfortable and spacious room. Staff very helpful. Near 79th Street Subway. Good vibe in neighbourhood. Safe area. A wonderful place.

title: C'è di meglio
text:
La mia esperienza in questo Hotel non è stata all'altezza delle promesse, per la cifra spesa non mi sarei mai aspettato wi-fi a pagamento dopo tre giorni, assoluta mancanza di armadi, (per una settimana ho dovuto tenere tutto in valigia ), c'è solo un rientro in muratura con un asta porta grucce, due cavalletti per posare le valigie e la cassaforte.
Serramenti tipicamente "americani" (sfido chiunque ad aprirli senza lasciarci le unghie) con insonorizzazione nulla e per finire occorre un corso per capire come usare il miscelatore della doccia.
A favore ha la posizione vicina a Central Park e alla metro A, ma nel complesso è migliorabile

title: My first trip to NYC at age 60
text: I was a little nervous on my first trip to New York City but found a home away from home at the Hotel Belle Claire. The staff was awesome, the room was clean and cozy and I had that big flatscreen TV :-) I felt safe and welcomed. Henry at the front desk was awesome and the whole staff was terrific. If you are going to New York City, especially as a newbie, you need to stay at this hotel!

title: Fantastic stay
text: Stayed here in march, loved it! Room was clean and comfortable. In a great location not far from central park. The staff were lovely and very helpful. Had a problem with our safe not opening within 5 minutes of us telling reception we had someone fixing it. Great service. Will definitely be back.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: What a beautiful find in the Upper West Side. Historic building and clean top to bottom. Staff was extremely nice and helpful, couldn't ask for anything more. Workout space was just right for a good cardio and physical workout. Location was ideal, transportation all conveniently near. We come up here bi-yearly and will make this our go to place. No complaints whatsoever.

title: Beautiful, historic hotel
text: We had been in NY for a concert and stayed at an Airbnb for the first part of our trip. We got stranded due to Hurricane Dorian and needed another place to stay. I am so happy I picked Hotel Belleclaire. The staff allowed us to check in early since we had all of our luggage and didn't even charge us for that. They were all friendly, helpful and courteous the entire stay. I'm a huge fan of historic buildings and architecture so this place had it all. The room was very quiet and clean. My daughter who is 14 absolutely loved it too. I will definitely stay there again the next time I'm in New York City!

title: missleaded by the photos...
text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Starting from the entrance it has a poor sad look - too classic and I'd say a bit depressing....no decorations, low light,  just wood.... The stuff, although nice, was looking sad (or depressed also because of the surroundings..). The halls and elevators were also terribly used. The room was awfully small, barelly could go around the bed. The thing that frightened me the most was the window. It was not well isolated (lucky us it was not December :))), could not open it -we could only use the air co to air the room. While we were in NY it was not hot at all so we did not use it for its purpose. Worth mentioning it was noisy too?. The hotel otherwise has a good location and....very nice towels :)

title: Lovely traditional Newyork  hotel
text:
I have stayed here December 2016 and march 2019.
I love the location its easy to walk central park from the hotel and right by the subway aswell.
Our stay in December was much more magical as we had a larger more comfortable room and spacious modern ensuite and nice view of the strand from our window,and hotel lobby was Christmas themed.
Our second visit was not as magical as we had no view from our room other than a pigeon poo all over a flat roof direct outside our window and a brickwall, which felt claustrophobic!  The radiators are very noisy aswell because it is the original central heating system.
The cafe downstairs is lovely,but no hotel guest discounts are given.
There are no tea making facilities in the room aswell but there is a fridge.
We got charged on our account for items that we had not used from the minifridge which we noticed when we got home,which i was not impressed about.
I wouldn’t stay here again due to our last visit,as it was nowhere near as good as the first time,rooms and bathroom far too cramped.

title: Good
text: Ótima localização, tamanho do quarto razoável, limpeza ruim. Bom custo beneficio! Bairro com muitas felicidades como farmacia 24horas e cafés! Senti falta de um bar no proprio hotel. Intalacoes antigas mas honestas.

title: Love this Place
text: Stayed here twice now and can’t say enough about the friendly  staff, who will take care of your every need. Great neighborhood easy walking to museums, Central Park , Riverside Park , bars , restaurants etc. A French bakery attached to the lobby is a convenient treat and the hotel vibe is perfect. The building is historic and going through upgrades so an occasional hiccup may occur but the staff is always there to make things right. The management is doing things right at the Belleclaire so I wouldn’t hesitate to check out their other properties as well.

title: Perfect
text:
My family & I travelled to NY for personal reasons, but decided to make a trip of it.
Having 4 kids, not a lot of hotels can accommodate a family of our size.
However, the Belleclaire were happy to assist us.
It is the only place in NY that we started, but is located straight down the road from the Museum of Natural History & Central Park beyond that (walking distance)
Time Square, the MET & most other big attractions only a $7-$10 taxi ride away.
Style wise, I ask my friends “have you seen Seinfeld?”
Then you get the idea of the room style.
All the staff were friendly and went over and beyond expectations to help us.
Fully recommend.

title: The hotel is an upper west side treasure. Prewar building with a lot of charm and character. Ideal location.
text: The staff is amazing! Everyone is so warm and makes you feel like family. they took care of all my needs and wants. Ideal location near a lot of New York landmarks. I want to give props to all of the hard working and accomodating people at the front desk: Rebekah, Henry, Shanies, Jasmin, Christopher, Kris, Maria, Altynai and Jonathan. I also want to mention the very friendly and helpful bellmen: Richard, David, Kelvin, Sare and John. Last but not least I want to express my gratitude and deepest thanks to Carlos who swapped out a dying fridge with a new one that was even better than the fridge that died on me!

title: Amazing Hotel - Great Location!
text: This hotel is located in the upper West Side, away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Manhattan but near to all the requisite amenities like shopping and restaurants. Marshall, CVS and Sephora  are all within the same block. My daughter attends Columbia Univ. so we wanted to stay midway  between the school and down town.  Amazingly, we were able to take a slow stroll to the university and Time Square from the Hotel. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and and the continental breakfast downstairs at the french bakery was too die for.

title: Hotel Belleclaire Is a Gem
text: The Hotel Belleclaire is located in the Upoer West Side of Manhattan, NYC. The location is like living like a true New Yorker, but is close to Central Park, Museum Mile, and a quick cab ride to midtown. The architecture of the building is exquisite. The hotel is in a wonderful neighborhood. Excellent French Bakery adjacent to the lobby. 24 Hour CVS across the street. Lots of restaurants, markets and shoppes.  The rooms are spacious and always extremely clean. What makes the Hotel Belleclaire special is their amazing staff. Maria and Kris at the front desk are always friendly, professional, fast and accommodating. Kelvin, David, Sari, Hector and Jake are the Bellmen. They are always friendly, efficient and go above and beyond to make your stay comfortable. They are the best staff of any hotel I’ve stayed at. The Bellmen (all of them) have been there the past 5 years I’ve been frequenting the hotel. I stay at Hotel Belleclaire about 10 times a year.

title: Nice Hotel....Great Location
text:
Traveled here and wanted to stay in the Upper West Side to stay away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.  Our search brought us to Hotel Belleclaire.  It was a nice hotel.  Staff was friendly and helpful during check in and check out.  The room was an average size NYC hotel room.  It was clean and housekeeping was quick on their daily visit.  It is in a great location since it is in the middle of a fantastic 
neighborhood.  A lot of restaurants, shopping and bars are close.   It is also very easy to get on and off several subway stops.  The best part of it was it is a very short walk to Central Park!!!

The elevator is very small (since it is an older building).  So with that said, you may be better taking the steps.  This is what we did most of the time and it was not all that bad.

If this is the area that you would like to experience, do not hesitate to book a room here.

title: Best NYC Hotel sonfar
text: The hotel Belleclaire is located on the Broadway at upper West Side, 2 block from Line 1 of the Subway. Neighborhood is one of the best location in Manhattan. Plenty of shops in the area some of them opened 24h. If you wish having a dinners or a drink in the night there are thousands of options nearby and also at very close Columbus Avenue. Like all others NY hotel rooms are small, but very clean and cozy. No carpet in the room, and the bathroom was spotless every day. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, they help my family dealing with airport to resolve the delay with some of the languages. Someone was complaining about the noise during the night, which is true as is not a quite area.. but c’mmon is New York City ... expecting no noise is definitely a wrong expectation do r NYC. Definitely I’ll come back.. thanks hotel Belleclaire

title: Best asset: Great location.  Not for fussy people.
text:
The good:
Great location.  Close to local and express subway stops.  Close to kosher restaurants, Central Park, Riverside Park, Natural History Museum.  Good choices for grocery stores nearby.  
We had two rooms, which were on the same floor, as we requested.  We had refrigerators, as requested.  One room had sufficient space to access open luggage.  O
We had no problems with noise from adjacent rooms.
The staff is friendly and very responsive.  

The not so good:
We stayed at the hotel for eight nights.  
This is an old hotel with window air conditioners (ours were noisy), although they’re In the process of installing central air - slowly.  
- There is little cabinet/drawer space for clothes.  Not a problem if you're living out of your bag.  
- The furniture in our rooms was old and worn.  The knob on one of our cabinets kept falling off. The toilet paper holder kept falling off.  Hot water to the shower in one of our rooms took about five minutes to heat up.  The shower control in one of our rooms didn’t blend hot/cold water well.  The sink drain was slow and needed to be fixed.
- The housekeeping staff is undermanned.  On two days, they skipped emptying trash, cleaning the sinks, and vacuuming the wood floors.  We had to call them to clean our room on Sunday afternoon.   
- The radio on the clock radio didn’t work.
- About seven channels on the live tv selection kept losing signal. The TV selection screens have poor signal quality.
- The wireless is slow and unreliable.  The signal drops frequently;  you have to constantly login.  The wireless system does not support VPN, so if you need VPN to access work, you’re out-of-luck here.

title: アッパーウエストにあり立地抜群。部屋、フロントともに清潔感あり。
text:
マンハッタン在住の知人に勧められ、宿泊。初めてのNY観光だったが、結果、正解。

＜よかった点＞
アッパーウエストにあり、雰囲気もよく、また、近くにドラッグストアやスーパーもあり、便利。部屋、フロントともに清潔感あり。スタッフも親切。つたない私の英語に付き合ってくれた。

＜悪かった点＞
他の方も書かれているように、スリッパがなかったのが残念。また、髭剃りもおいてなかった。朝食付きプランを選択し、多少は期待していたが、１階のカフェのvoucherがもらえるだけ。（内容は、コーヒーもしくは紅茶、パン１種類（クロワッサンなど）、オレンジジュース。）これが最初からわかっていれば、朝食プランを選択しなかった。wi-fiの接続はとにかく悪かった。

＜総合的に＞
いくつか悪かった点もあるが、立地の良さで☆４～４．５という感じか。

title: esperienza negativa
text:
Ho soggiornato insieme a mia moglie in questo albergo per 5 notti nel mese di agosto 2019.
La stanza piccolissima aveva un letto matrimoniale con una larghezza poco di più di 1 piazza e mezza. Un lato del letto era attaccato alla parete così da impedire la salita sul letto stesso e, di conseguenza, non aveva il comodino o uno spazio per una bottiglia d'acqua o altro. Per scendere dal letto, o uscivi dal fondo o dovevo far scendere anche mia moglie. Il condizionatore non si poteva usare perchè faceva un rumore assordante pari a un gruppo elettrogeno e tale da non poter dormire (non lo abbiamo potuto usare). Il letto stava di fronte alla porta di entrata che, non chiudendo bene lascava  filtrare la luce del corridoio esterno su tutti i 3 lati, luce, ovviamente sempre accesa. La finestra della camera aveva il bordo con una notevole quantità di scotch e nastro adesivo per sigillare le fessure. La finestra del bagno era fissata con delle squadrette a "L" e si muoveva con grande difficoltà. Al posto dell'armadio c'era un microscopico sgabuzzino con un bastone e 4 stampelle. Infine i corridoi per accedere alle stanze (piano 7°) stretti e angusti avevano una moquette datata e con un odore di "vecchio". Assolutamente non adeguato al prezzo richiesto, l'unico lato positivo la vicinanza con la metro.

title: Chic hotel, small NYC rooms
text: The lobby and cafe were really nice. The room was pretty tight (but it’s NYC), but clean. It looks like they’re renovating, so the rooms might be more updated now. They gave us a late check out (3pm) which was really good because we were at an event nearby and didn’t have to rush.

title: Great Hotel Near Central Park
text:
Great hotel near Central Park. I was speaking at an event on 79th street, so it was very quick to get to. Walking distance from the park so we had a short family stroll in the morning.

Their is a parking garage across the street it was $60 overnight, but that price is to be expected in this part of the city. Provided a crib for my daughter, which was much appreciated.

Room was small, but it’s New York City, so nothing is big here. Very clean! 

We asked for late check out and they very easily extended it to 2pm which was very much appreciated as it gave my wife an easy place to hang out with our 7 month old (at the time, she’s 10 months now).

title: From a repeat customer
text: I was returning to Hotel Belleclaire for the 4th time when one of the 4 nights I needed to be in NYC was completely booked. A manager offered great assistance and I was waitlisted for a room with assurance that I would be able to stay all 4 nights there. The reception desk was very helpful as always. Management made things work and got the reservation completed. If you have a need to be on the upper west side, this hotel can be a great choice for you.

title: City stay - just the job
text:
My family stayed at the Belleclaire for two nights late July. The two bed suite was just the ticket. Some previous reviews point out some challenges with air con being a loud, corridors being thin, and rooms being small. In all honnesty they are probably right, but considering this is a city hotel it does not detract from the enjoyment. Some guests have also commented on the elevator / lifts. The hotel has three lifts in total and we never had to wait more than 1 minutes for one.

The staff are extremely helpful, the location perfect with it being close to metro stops and under 10 minute walk to central park. As others mention, the bakery next door serves some tasty treats and we particularly enjoyed the hot chocoloate.

Overall I would highly recommend the hotel. Just consider it is a city hotel.

title: Second stay
text:
This was our second stay at the Belleclaire. We chose it again as we love the area and as we drove into the city it is easy to get to from the Henry Hudson parkway and there are lots of parking options nearby. 
We had a deluxe king room which was a good size with a comfortable bed and super clean white bedding. There was ample hanging and storage space for two people for a three night stay. Room had a small fridge, safe and iron. Bathroom wasn’t huge and it lacked a shelf for our toiletries but the shower was large and had good water pressure. Towels were good quality and replaced daily. Apart from a desk chair there was no other seating in the room even though it was large enough to have some, that would be something to add, there is also no coffee maker however there is good coffee available downstairs so it isn’t something we missed. The staff we encountered were all very pleasant and the maid had someone come to retrieve my earring which had gone into the sink drain! There are some renovations going on in the hotel but nothing that bothered us in any way. We have booked again for a stay in March with family from overseas.

title: לא!!!!!
text:
מלון מיושן בלשון המעטה!!!!
חלקו של המלון בשיפוצים. מה שהמלון מראה בתמונות זה לא מה שמקבלים!!!! חדרים חשוכים, טחובים, רועשים. המסדרונות שבין החדרים מעופשים. ריח רע. כל המסדרונות מצופים בשטיחים ישנים המפיצים ריע נוראי. שילמתי על חדר ״דלקס״ קיבלתי חדרון חשוך שפונה לנוף מרהיב של קיר אטום!!
בקיצור. אני ממליץ בחום לחפש מלון אחר!

title: A good time
text: Quiet location, close to metro train and bus and only short walk to central park. Selection of restaurants close by. Staff all very cheerful and helpful. Disappointed on our room allocation on arrival but this was sorted for the next day and we were happy with the rest of our stay. Would stay again.

title: Great hotel in a fantastic location!
text: My son and I had a quick, 2-night stay at the Hotel Belleclaire and it was fabulous. The staff is incredibly friendly, the room was spacious, and the price was very reasonable! Located on the upper west side, the hotel is ideally situated near countless restaurants, the subway (1,2,3) and Central Park. My son had a program at Columbia University and we were at the school in just minutes. Highly recommend!

title: Very low quality hotel in NYC
text:
We stayed for six nights, two rooms, celebrating my mom's 60th birthday.
From check in time till check out we had issues with the rooms and the bill.
A/C bad notice, full of dust in one of the room,
Smell of sweat in the other room.
Very tiny rooms, not for double, only single.
We haven't been in the rooms all day and when we came only  for sleeping  and take a shower,
But every time we came back we issued another problem.
The worst problem that we could have Mr to trouble with was the bill issue.
We want to pay in cash and C/C devided to 4 people. It was impossible mission as the hotel staff didn't know how to handle it. Two of us paid more then the other two because of the low system at check out.
The only thing we liked is the location, upper west side, close to all the best museums, the Met, the natural museum history, time Square and more...
I'll definitely won't go back their.
Very unsatisfied with the hotel in general and rooms.

title: My NYC home
text: I travel to NYC a lot for work. Location on Upper West side perfect. Although the hotel has no restaurant, there are plenty within walking distance. Breakfast no issue as great bakery/coffeeshop attached. Rooms are clean, air conditioned and as luxurious as hotels in NYC that cost 3 times more. Believe me, been there. Staff are very friendly and always there to help.  I’ll only ever stay here when in town.

title: Just Ok
text:
Staff is very polite and gentle .
This place needs to be renovated. 
Carpet in the room and hall way.  Strange smell....
Noisy room, right next to the elevator 
Noisy air conditioning 
60$ a day for parking, and be prepare to wait 1/2 hour to get your car 

Overpriced 

Well located in upper west side

title: Great boutique hotel with great staff
text:
We stayed at the Belleclaire for 6 nights in July 19. 

We specifically asked for a room on the upper floors and we were given a room on the 8th floor. There was ample space for all 4 of us (2 adults, 2 teenagers). The hotel provided a roll-up bed so both teenagers were both accommodated.

The room was clean, well furnished. The bed was extremely comfortable and the air-con was cold, just right as it was hot and humid outside.

Location - it is near the subway, so no problem for travelling to all the major attractions. It's a short walk from Central Park and the Natural History museum. There are lots of good cafe's/restaurants nearby.

Staff - a full 10/10 for everyone, they couldn't be more helpful - especially the concierge guys (Brian and Robert) who helped us repatriate some items we left behind.

Would I stay again - Yes.

title: Luxury and comfort on the Upper West Side
text: This is a wonderful hotel with AMAZING customer service! Both Kelli and Chris make you feel like the only guest in the hotel. We had a clean, super comfortable room (with a view)! And their bathrooms & bath products alone are enough to keep us coming back. We love Hotel Belleclaire!

title: My new go to hotel in the City
text: Hotel Belleclaire is in an excellent location for Upper West Side neighborhood needs.  The staff was courteous and efficient on both check-in and check-out and the room was delightfully large for an older hotel in the city.  We had 4 guests in a double double room and there was plenty of room.  It was very quiet and a good night's sleep.  The bathroom was spacious and the room clean.  We had added some notes to our reservation about the purpose of our 2-day stay and were pleasantly surprised to find a vase of flowers welcoming us to congratulate our daughter who will be attending a conservatory near Lincoln Center in the fall.  We were just SO not expected that and it was a delightful touch with a personal note from the General Manager.  So, A+ for customer service! The French bakery next door accessed via the hotel lobby was also a nice treat each morning for breakfast.  The summer hotel rates made this stay very affordable for 4 people, including 2 teenage children, which is very difficult to find.  Thank you and we've already book our next stay in October!

title: Niet naar verwachting
text:
Gezien de foto's in de brochure en de website hadden wij wat meer verwacht van dit hotel. Het pand zelf ziet er prachtig uit, de lobby past bij dit uiterlijk met een luxe uitstraling.

Echter boven op de verdieping aangekomen komt dit beeld al niet overeen. Doet wat gedateerd aan en eenmaal in de kamer aangekomen zijn de slijtages zeer duidelijk zichtbaar. Smalle kamer waar de koffers lastig op te bergen zijn. De airco maakt ontzettend veel lawaai als deze is ingeschakeld. En dat is echt nodig met deze zomerse temperaturen. Slapen is bijna niet te doen met de airco aan, dus hebben we deze maar uitgezet. De bromtoon van de overige airco's zijn dan nog goed te horen, maar dit is, los van de warmte, goed te doen.

De badkamer is, eigenlijk net als de hotelkamers, aan vervanging toe. In de toiletpot lijkt verf te zijn aangebracht over kalk? Ik weet het niet maar het ziet er niet echt fris uit. Ook rondom de toiletpot zijn schimmels en roestplekken goed zichtbaar. Bij het doortrekken rammelt de pot aan alle kanten. Jammer dit.

Wanneer de buren de deuren sluiten hoor je een enorme dreun. Niet zo gek eigenlijk want hoe zacht je de deur ook dichttrekt, het maakt aardig wat lawaai.

De locatie van het hotel is het positieve waar ik het graag bij wil houden. Op loopafstand van Central Park en de metro (79st street) is ook snel bereikbaar.

title: Review about Jasmin
text:
I wanted to write a review because Jasmin is really something else.
I travel a lot for work and stay in loads of hotels but I've never met such a kind and helpful person on the front desk. Everything I needed was taking care of by her and she made this trip that was a little insane for me to be much more comfortable and nice. Always has a smile on her face, says hey to everyone and really knows how to make a person feel welcome. She made my trip a lot easier and I wish she gets the gratitude from managment that she deserves.
Another person that stood up helping people all around the hotel going up and down carrying bags always with a smile on his face is Richard. Hopefully all they're hard work pays off for them. 
Thank you for having me.
Dean Zylberstein

title: Charm on 77th
text: Great location and a well kept classic building are the benefits of staying at the Belleclaire. The staff is friendly and professional. The rooms are comfortable and well maintained. Two blocks to the red line, a few more to Central Park, and great restaurants and bars right out the door.  Will stay here again on our next trip to NYC.

title: Visit to NYC for a conference
text: Hotel Belleclaire was all around amazing. The accomodations were perfect and the customer relations staff were courteous and extremely helpful. Thank you to Shanies Hunte for your hospitatlity and for making me feel welomed. Ms. Hunte was super helpful, patient, and kind. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay!!

title: Superbes vacances
text:
L hôtel Belleclaire est un établissement extrêmement bien situé, proche métro et central Park, et dans un quartier très calme. Il y a des commerces à proximité, ce qui est fort appréciable pour faire quelques petites courses. 
L hotel est calme malgré les travaux de restauration extérieure, et le personnel est charmant, toujours disponible et très souriant.
La déco est sympa, peut être à rafraîchir un peu, et la literie vraiment très, très confortable. La chambre était climatisée, ce qui était fort agréable vu les températures caniculaires que nous avons eues durant notre sejour. 
Un très gros atout concernant cet hôtel C est que vous avez des "fees" de 50 dollars en arrivant et c est tout, pas de supplements cachés.
Le seul bémol si tant est qu il y en ait un, est le manque de netteté au niveau de la propreté de la salle de bains.
J aurais apprécié un système de petit déjeuner fourni par l hôtel également. Il y a bien un un salon de thé au rez de chaussée permettant de prendre un petit déjeuner mais c est très cher. 

Mais nous n avons rien à redire et reviendrons dans cet établissement avec grand plaisir.

title: Retro Charm at its finest !
text: From the moment we walked in the lobby, the charm of the place and the friendly service captured our hearts. Loved the room, great place for the Upper West Side, so much within walking distance, even in 100+° heat. Good coffee & croissants next to the lobby, subway is close by.

title: Sconsigliato a chi ha il sonno leggero
text: L’hotel si trova a Manhattan sulla Broadway. Per questo, relativamente vicino alle principali attrazioni. Tutte raggiungibili a 20 minuti di metropolitana (in media). È un tre stelle, con interni un pò vecchiotti. Ma, considerando la città, costa quanto un quattro stelle italiano. Le camere sono essenziali, piuttosto piccole e soprattutto rumorose. Le finestre sono vecchie, del classico tipo a ghigliottina e nient’affatto insonorizzate. Se a questo aggiungete che nella via di fronte c’è una stazione dei mitici pompieri di New York, capirete il titolo della recensione. All’alba sarete svegliati dall’inconfondibile sirena, con aggiunta di tromba (tipo corno della foresta) Qualcuno dice che “fa tanto New York”. Bah! Sarà. Per me non è stato un dramma. Ma siete avvisati. Un altro inconveniente riguarda le serrature delle porte delle camere. Del tipo a scheda, ma “prima maniera”. Per chiudere dovete sbattere la porta (altro motivo di fastidio) o fare come me che mi preoccupavo di sbloccare la maniglia inserendo la scheda, per accompagnare la porta alla chiusura, per non sbatterla. Ma in quanti lo fanno? I condizionatori nelle camere sono efficienti, ma “tipo anni 80”. Di quelli con buco nella finestra. La sensazione, sempre riferita al titolo, è quella di dormire con la finestra aperta. Ma per il rumore, non per il clima. Anche qui è avvantaggiato chi è abituato alle grandi città. Per il resto il giudizio è positivo (occhio però alla tv con addebiti dei canali on demand che non sono chiaramente indicati) e anche all’app per pilotare la tv da scaricare sul telefono, che diventa a pagamento. Se la colazione non è compresa nel vostro soggiorno, al piano terra c’è anche una boulangerie dove poter fare colazione. Personale efficiente, soprattutto ai piani (troverete sempre i letti fatti) e soddisfacente anche la reception.

title: Explore the City
text: Very comfortable bed, air conditioner worked great and very quiet New York City.  Great location with stores, a bank and CVS across the street.  Walking distance to Central Park.  Wonderful French bakery connected for a wonderful start to the day

title: After all these years, I finally stayed at Hotel Belleclaire!
text:
Every time we go to New York, we like to stay in the Upper West Side. Every time for the last 10 years, we would park the car not far from the Belleclaire and I would say "one day, we'll stay here"...and it happened this year! I was able to get an amazing deal for the weekend of June 22-23! 

What an amazing place! The location, we knew, was as perfect as every other time. The hotel is nice, clean and employees are smiling and very helpful!

When we entered the room, we were surprised as the ceiling were very high so even if the room was not the biggest one, we did not feel squeezed in!

The only thing that was bugging me a bit was the AC unit in the window... but that will be fixed next time we go as they were putting central AC throughout the hotel!!!

I would recommend this hotel to everybody! It is at the corner of Broadway and 77th. There is a subway station at 79th and one at 72nd. This is a very quiet neighborhood, we love it!!! There is a very good family restaurant not far called Utopia... perfect joint for breakfast! And if you are like us and like to have fresh fruits and veggies for the end of the evening, the Fairway Market is a couple of blocks away!

Already thinking about our next trip to NYC!

title: A bit disappointing...
text:
We stayed here for 7 nights in a family suite (room 316) meant for six people. There were 5 of us and we really struggled for space. There is hardly any storage space, only one small closet for hanging clothes and a few drawers, certainly not enough space for a family of 5 and all their clothes. Then there was the bathroom, it was by far the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel. The bathroom in my son's student flat is larger.For 5 or 6 people there should be two bathrooms. The shower was so weak and so noisy, it sounded like there was an air lock in the pipes.
The room, especially the wooden blinds were really dusty and the windows were filthy, one was so bad you could hardly see out of it. I appreciate that they are having building work done (the building was covered in scaffolding) but it didn't make for a pleasant view. 
There is a fridge in the room but it is so full of minibar items we struggled to put anything in it. The air conditioning is unbelievably noisy, we struggled to sleep with it on but then couldn't sleep without it on due to the heat!
Found the staff to be a bit ignorant, we weren't told where the gym or any other facilities were located on checking in and when we checked out they didn't even bother to ask if we had enjoyed ourselves or had any issues.
On the plus side the location was excellent, close to subway and plenty of bars and restaurants close by. Unfortunately we won't be returning on our next trip of NYC.

title: UWS prime spot
text: Stayed here 2-5 July 2019. Great stay due to the cleanliness of an older hotel. Elevators cold be updated. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Best value with sale price for the size of the room, having stayed other places. And the "Mille feulles" French bakery/café connected to the lobby is unsurpassed in NYC.

title: Un buen Hotel en el Upper West Side.
text:
Nos hospedados entre el 6 al 10 de Julio. Desde que llegamos el check in en recepción fue rápido y eficiente. En general el trabajo en carpeta fue muy bueno y amable, en especial las señoritas María y Yasmin.

Es un Hotel muy antiguo, de principios del siglo pasado y ahora mismo está en reparaciones.

Las habitaciones estan bien, algo pequeñas pero es suficiente, las camas son cómodas y el baño muy bueno. Los productos de aseo del baño de buena calidad.

Para mejorar dos cosas: la primera los elevadores son pequeños y por momentos se produce embotellamiento y segundo, aunque el aire acondicionado funcionó bien, tenía un poco de ruido.

Por lo demás está bien y es altamente recomendable. En el mismo Hotel hay una cafetería donde se puede desayunar o tomarse un buen café y una muy buena pastelería francesa y sandwich.

title: Hotel Belleclaire -A Great Hotel
text:
I recently stood with family at the Hotel Belleclaire. The staff are very courteous, professional, and most accommodating.  The location is exellent since it is near the theater, Lincoln Center,  Central Park, fabulous eateries,  and magnificent museums. The room was exceptionally clean, very comfortable
and extremely affordable.
Thank you, Hotel Belleclaire for making our stay so rewarding. 
Antoinette

title: Avoid at all costs
text: We had booked via booking.com. My card registered with account had unknowingly expired when the hotel attempted to take the funds. I received an email informing to update within 24 hours otherwise the booking may be cancelled. The card was updated within 12 hours of receiving the email and the booking was showing live when we arrived at the hotel, however upon arriving we were informed we were told we had had NO reservation and as if had been cancelled! I informed the guy on reception it was still showing live on booking.com and I had received NO email to inform me otherwise and it had been updated within the 24 hours as requested (showed them proof). The attitude of the staff was shocking with him informing me that booking.com had been informed re this. Myself and my husband and my husband were left with 3 children in NY whilst world pride was on which meant most hotels were fully booked. I have since spoken to booking.com who informed me that they were not informed of a cancellation and were shocked at the hotels response as they wer apparently obliged to accommodate us. If thinking of booking of booking I would advise use another hotel, as this hotel is not at all reputable and seemed very dated and poorly managed.

title: Great part of NYC, quiet area near Central Park
text: Great place to stay, nice fitness room, close to Beacon Theater and Central Park.  Convenient to great restaurants.  A quieter part of the city.  Clean room that lacked an outlet in the bathroom, my only complaint.

title: Great location and attentive staff
text: We upgraded to a king room because our prior experience at the Belleclaire suggested the regular rooms are very small.  The room was clean, comfortable and well maintained.  The staff, including the manager, were all very responsive and helpful.  They really seemed to care that we were content.  The building is older but generally well kept up, and the room was remarkably quiet for one in a century-old building.  We had a nice view of a beautiful church on a side street.  The attached French cafe was excellent, and the neighborhood has a great deal to offer.  The hotel is also well located for all kinds of public transportation.  Although we missed the hotel’s neighborhood walking tour, we went on the walking tour at one of the partner hotels and found it to be excellent.  It isn’t a luxury hotel, but it provided a cozy and comfortable room in our favorite neighborhood at a fair price.

title: Celebrating our anniversary
text:
We love the Hotel Bellclaire.   The location on the Upper West Side is perfect.   The rooms are small but comfortable.
