When we checked in this time, I mentioned to the desk person Shanice that it was our 20th anniversary.   When we came back to the room, there was wine and chocolate waiting for us.   

We will definetly be back!

title: Great place to stay
text:
I really enjoyed staying at this historic hotel with lots of charm! The Mille-feuille bakery on the ground floor is amazing! The staff was nice, the rooms were clean, the toiletries provided were nice quality and sufficient for really long hair.  The gym in the hotel was 24 hours and very good. The elevators were small and we used the stairs most of our 2 night stay. 
1 block walk to the stand up NY comedy club and 2blocks to the subway.  Easy 10-15min walk to Central Park.  I would stay here again!

title: Could be 5 stars IF...
text: This hotel has a lot of charm. I stayed 5 nights during my first visit to NYC. It has beautiful architecture, and interesting history. I’m only giving it 3 stars for a few reasons. First, I think free coffee should be a given at any hotel. Belleclaire doesn’t offer coffee, however there’s a very sweet coffee and pastry shop next door (a lovely break from Starbucks!) Second, my room had fluorescent lighting.  Why would such a quaint place use horrible fluorescent bulbs in its hallways and rooms? Warm light bulbs would be a nice improvement. I didn’t like being in my room because of the harsh and creepy lighting.  Finally, the housekeeping effort needs improvement. Outside my room, on the hallway floor was debris (nothing terrible - lint, threads, tiny bits.)  But it was there for several days, signaling no vacuuming was being done during that time.  The 4th day, it was clear the hall was vacuumed. In addition, the bed skirt on my bed was significantly torn. When housekeeping made the bed, the skirt was awkwardly tucked up into the mattress in an attempt to hide it. Hotel Belleclaire, you’re better than this. Take a few steps that would make a big difference.  Otherwise, the bed was comfortable, the service friendly, and I appreciated being able to store my luggage after check out, but before I left town. The location was perfect for my trips uptown to Columbia, downtown to Times Square, and everywhere in between.

title: Friendly Front Desk in a historic setting
text: This is a nice hotel in a great part of the city. Easily walkable to subway stations only a few blocks away. Museums, Central Park, Beacon Theater, all right within a block or so. The front desk team was very helpful in pointing us in the right direction. The hotel is small, older, but neat and well kept. The rooms can be small, even for NYC standards, and the elevators were even smaller. The building itself has a lot of history! The negatives were small, there was no complimentary coffee nor was there a machine in the room. The beds were just okay. There are still some rented apartments in the building, which didn't bother us but was somewhat of a shocker to other guests.t Alll in all, it was a good experience.

title: I would stay here again
text: Traveling for one night with my 2 adult daughters. Had booked a room with 2 queen beds. Offered an upgrade to a family room with 3 queen beds on arrival for $20! Made our stay an absolute pleasure! Everyone we met went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable for our little one night stay! VERY comfortable room and awesome bed! Beautiful old bldg with so much charm and all the modern conveniences. So quiet for 76th and broadway! Highly recommend!

title: "Hotel Belleclaire is a brilliant hotel…"
text:
Picking accommodation was difficult. Yes, NYC being one of the best cities in the World, there was much to choose from, but what made it difficult was trying to find ADEQUATE accommodation. 
I’ve read reviews after reviews of different hotels, telling me how bad they were. This kinda shocked me since it’s NYC, you know? 

So I crossed off Times Square and much of Midtown centre from my list and found a  hotel called ‘Hotel Belleclaire’.

Situated in the Upper West Side district on Broadway, I thought “why not?” 
Why not indeed, as there are 2 subway stations (79 st & 72 st) very close. 

Staff were very kind to me, always answered my queries. 
I got a standard room - which was great, the size and the bed itself was 5/5. 

Hotel Belleclaire is a brilliant hotel and can’t recommend this enough as I will be back! 

9/10

title: Location, Service, and Ambience
text: Staff couldn't have been nicer helping with check in and finding a room available earlier than my planned arrival.  The room was small but the bathroom was substantial.  Products were very high quality, good shower.  Valet parking was worth the money.  Great location to walk to restaurants and enjoy the area.  Loved the history of the building.  Coffee shop was great but not open til 630 AM.

title: Ótima localização
text:
Localizado na Broadway e bem perto do Central Park e do Museu de Historia Natural.
Tem quartos pequenos, ideal para apenas dormir! Mas você vai voltar só para dormir mesmo!
Quando pesquisei havia alguns comentários de ser barulhento, porém quando fiz a reserva pedi um quarto silencioso e fui atendida. 
Pela localização vale o custo beneficio. No térreo tem um café francês que é sensacional.

title: Excellent facility
text: Five stars for a hotel in this price range, this location. Immaculate cleanliness and maintenance. Very responsive staff. Facility had minor issues because of layout, but have stayed in five hotels in NYC in the past five years, and this is the one we will return to. Believe me, you need look nowhere else.

title: Not impressed
text: Hotel is extremely old, imagine Pre-War historic charm.  The hotel entrance doors aren't automated and no doorman to assist with opening the door or with bags.  Imagine the fun we had entering with 6 bags and 2 bookbags.  The elevators are so small, like size of tiny coat closet.  Lucky to fit 2 or 3 people comfortably.  Room wasnt bad size for a NYC hotel.  Good location.  No free breakfast offered.  Elevators are extremely slow.  Saw pink mold in tile below sink in bathroom.  No central air in the hotel,  there are boxed AC units in the room which is different.  Not a fan overall of this hotel

title: Come trasformare una camera singola in una doppia
text:
La camera standard prenotata attraverso Booking, che ci è stata assegnata era minuscola, con letto matrimoniale avente un lato a 10cm dal muro, per cui per entrare e uscire dal letto dovevo salire e scendere dal fondo dello stesso. Ovviamente, da quel lato, nessun comodino nè abat-jour, tanto scarso era lo spazio disponibile 
Una delle 2 valigie la abbiamo dovuta appoggiare sul mobiletto bar, in quanto non c'era altro spazio disponibile.
Chiesto cambio camera, che ci è stato proposto con sovrapprezzo:abbiamo rifiutato.
Impianto A/C fatiscente, non centralizzato, rumoroso al limite del sopportabile, sembrava di avere in camera un generatore diesel...
Armadio a un'anta a disposizione con poche grucce e cassaforte appoggiata per terra, scomodissima per accedervi
Finestra con vista sul cortile per metà su un muro; vetro sporco con scotch in alcuni tratti, gancio laterale dx rotto che impediva l'apertura, cassa esterna condizionatore ricoperta da guano di uccelli
Mobiletto condizionatore sotto la finestra datato forse anni 70, in più punti tenuto insieme da nastro isolante
Bagno piccolo, ma dotato di ampia doccia. Scarico water non sempre funzionante, con immaginabili conseguenze
Wi-fi accettabile. Business Center con 3 PC e una stampante laser, ma con tre sedie in condizioni vergognose, con similpelle stracciata in più punti.
Lobbie anonima, con arredamento dozzinale. Personale gentile
Location buona, vicina a metro e Central Park
Tutto questo per la "miseria" di 257 $ a notte.

title: Perfect location for exploring Central Park and the Upper West Side!
text: After visiting NYC several times in the past 10 years, we decided to stay in the Upper West Side to explore Central Park and visit several museums.  The Hotel Belleclaire was perfectly situated for this purpose.  The subway is 2 blocks away, and there are several bus stops that are conveniently located near the hotel.  There is a shop off of the lobby that sells pastries, croissants, quiche, and hot drinks. So convenient!  The staff was extremely friendly and professional.  We had a deluxe king room that was roomy and very clean.  The shower was one of the best hotel showers I've ever had!  Because we chose a lower priced room, our window had no view, just a brick wall.  But it's New York!  We were only in the room to sleep and shower, so it worked perfectly for us.  I highly recommend this hotel, and will absolutely stay here again.  Not only was it convenient to plenty of restaurants, the subway and buses made it quick and easy to get into Midtown and the Theater District.

title: Nice but Smaller Than Expected
text:
We stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire for a brief visit recently, and overall, it was nice, but as noted by other reviews, it was much smaller than expected.

LOCATION:  Good.  It was located across the street from a CVS in case you forget anything and is a few blocks from two subway stations, which was nice.

CLEANLINESS:  The hotel appeared to be very clean, so we don’t have any complaints there.

AMENITIES: The hotel has easily accessible wifi.  It also has a fitness center, which we meant to check out but didn’t end up doing.  They have a mini fridge in the room and 2 complimentary waters, which was nice.  They also offer a flat rate fare to/from JFK International Airport for approximately $80.00, including tip.

SIZE: Our hotel room as well as the hallways of the hotel were much smaller than expected.  For example, at a certain point in the hallway of the floor we were on, most suitcases would not even be able to be pulled normally and would have to be turned to fit through the hallway.

CRITICISMS:  Our criticisms would be that (1) compared with other hotels, the TV was on the smaller end; (2) we had a view of someone else’s balcony and a bunch of brick walls, which was not super attractive; (3) there are no bureaus/drawers to store your clothes; (4) although we compared a lot of hotels and looked at a lot of pictures of this hotel, the hotel was much smaller and not quite as nice as the; and (5) our room keys stopped working on the second day of our stay out of nowhere so we had to go get new room keys.

title: Nice Hotel but could be better
text:
We were there for 3 nights and got the Queen Studio expecting it to be a bit larger. It is a bit larger but the "extra" size is taken by the kitchenette (no table). The problem is that the kitchen had utensils but no coffee at all, the coffee bar was closed. The kitchen was a waste of space and money since we did not cook at all.

The bedroom was fairly small and with a "grand" view of the brick wall of the next building. There is very, very limited space to put away your clothes, basically we lived out of the suitcases. The room was nice and the bed was great.

There is no instructions for the Media center and for the AC unit (the remote was useless). It would have been nice to program it to raise the temperature as the outside ambient temperature cooled down.

The Bathroom was very large with a large shower area, two problems we noticed. The Toilet Paper dispenser was too far from the Toilet, unless you have extensible arms, there is no way to reach it, we ended up taking the TP out of the holder and put it in the floor next to the toilet.

The other problem was the shower door, it would not close flush as the bottom was scraping the tile protector. We were worried that the glass could break if we forced shut. Luckily due to the shower stall design, not much water leaked out of the door. The problem was reported but the fix was not complete, you still need to apply a bit of force to shut it down (it made a awful screeching sound) and there was always the worry of cracking or completely breaking the glass.

Overall is an ok place with a nice location and close to the subway and restaurant and grocery shops. With some changes it could be an much better lodging.

title: Nice hotel in a calm area of Manhattan
text:
Found  hotel belleclaire via a targeted add of Facebook and price seemed bit to good to be true for our expectations.

As we stayed for almost a week, the hotel was kind enough to upgrade us to a slightly bigger room. Being Manhattan rooms aren't that big anyway but it was a cute room that, considering the price we payed, exceeded our expectations.

Only issue to me is the typical air conditioning units placed in the windows, that blew toward the bed and got bit to chilly to keep it on being in the stream of air, but to warm to keep it off. All in all, not the kind of air conditioning I'm used to in hotels in Europe but contributed to the new york experience.

Hotel staff was very helpful and pleasent, arranged a car to the airport without any hustle and were able to give advices for restaurants and things to do.

Would consider going back next time in New york, as I prefer to stay off the central parts of Manhattan that are too crowded.

title: Mrs. Phyllis Polster
text:
This was our fifth straight year at the Belleclaire. 
Wonderful service. Awesome manager. Robert. Great front desk. We felt very welcome. Room was large. Linens were top of the line. Toiletries are amazing. VERY CLEAN. Love the location. 
See you in 2020😊

title: Excellent localization
text:
The hotel has been renovated. The rooms are not very large and for a family of three adults, as was our case, there was no room baggage storage. Service is kind, and we had to call it a few times for problems with the TV. 
Overall, it was not bad, but no more than average.

title: Fantastic Hotel with Wonderful Staff
text: Great weekend stay with my wife. Terrific staff, wonderful charm, beautiful neighborhood. We can't wait to return.  First time on the UWS and it was great. We found great restaurants and bars. Only steps from the Beacon Theater.

title: Excellent value and great location
text:
Old hotel in which the rooms are very well maintained.  Updated bathroom.  We were upgraded to a large room with no extra charge.  Very clean.
Staff extremely friendly and responsive.  Convenient to subway and buses. Definitely will stay here again!

title: First time, won’t be the last!
text:
After living in manhattan for nearly two decades and spending most of my time on the UWS, I’ve walked past this building many times. But this is my first visit! I was surprised and happy with the service from the front desk most of all— I was upgraded upon arrival and most importantly when pos Delta texted me late afternoon to say they cancelled my flight home tonight leaving me stranded, Hotel Belleclaire came to the rescue even though they were “completely booked!” Thank you to the compassionate SHANIES and her equally compassionate front office manager JONATHAN for somehow finding me a bed. 

Now to the bed. (Isn’t that and the rooms cleanliness two of most important things?) loved my bed! Great mattress and of course the location is utterly perfect!

This will be my go to whenever I make a quick visit. Thank you Hotel Belleclaire for everything positive that you do!

title: Just OK
text: Good location and clean hotel.  Service was alright although not particularly pleasant or efficient. Hotel is in a good location on west side of Central Park, close to metro stop.  We paid for a Broadway King room.  The room was pretty large although not a very efficient use of the space, given the shape was round.  Closet was very small.  Bathroom sink tiny - no vanity at all.  Bathroom was quite small.  Bed and other furniture are showing their age and need to be updated. Window air conditioning unit - worked but was noisy. Would not stay again.

title: Nice Little Hotel
text: Smaller & older hotel but up & coming. Doing lot of beautiful renovations. For price it’s perfect. Small rooms. Old world charm. Great staff works hard to please. Chris front desk helped me with his personal charger when my phone died. Terrific service. Quick with requests. Would absolutely stay again. My kid said “daddy can we come again.”

title: It Is What It Is And That’s Fine
text:
Lemme get this off my chest: sold out city means stratospheric nosebleed hotel rates that do not even remotely relate to the underlying quality of the property. So, a typical rack rate of $250 can become $600 just by saying voilà! or presto chango! And so I compromise to availability and swallow my pride and, well, I got a room at the Belleclaire.

Having said all that, I will ignore the notion of value proposition and just deal with the hotel straight up. I liked it. A kind of Parisian Art Nouveau entrance, lobby floor a mass of tiny tiles that lost their linearity ages ago. It has a coffee-bakery operation attached to it that I didn’t experience. It has grand thoughts for a lobby bar in its future. Reception was welcoming, kind and chit-chatty in a good way...I felt connected. I paid an extra $20 bucks to upgrade to a large King on the 8th floor. 

Wished up on little elevator to a narrow hallway and rabbit warren of rooms. Opened my door to a quite large room with nice creaky wood floor (I like the romance of a wood floor). A very attractive room that some might call dated or worn but it just felt well-lived-in to me. A small empty square fridge on the floor with a cord to the nearby wall receptacle. Seemed lost. Soft mattress tightly made up on an oversized platform...perfectly sleepworthy. And the pièce de resistance - a teeny tiny bathroom so redolent of old buildings. How small? You can sit on the toilet to brush your teeth at the sink. Shower-tub. Nice amenities. I travel solo so just need a bathroom to function not to impress.

All in all, I would happily go back to Bellclaire when the rate aligns to the property instead of city vacancy rates. It was a very pleasant stay in a very pleasant, very clean, old-world charm room and lobby.  When it realized its lobby ambitions I will for sure return.

title: Great deal and in the middle of things in NYC
text: Great location. Friendly (seriously) staff. Immaculate room and furnishings. Excellent wi-fi service. No issues at all. Zero. I highly recommend for anyone traveling to NYC. Could not have been more pleased with every aspect of my stay.

title: Great Location & Service
text: Right on the metro line 1, the location is very convenient to access the entire metropolis. Plenty of restaurants to choose within walking distance and a department store. I enjoyed the quiet sleep and the attentive service during check in, check out and solving internet access problem.

title: Pretty disappointing
text:
For the last few years we've been trying smaller boutique hotels on the Upper West Side since it's closer to my son's campus when we visit him.  This was our first visit to the Belleclaire and probably our last. Its location is quite good, I will give it that.  And the staff was polite and efficient. But it was one of the least enjoyable nights we've spent in NY.  

The rooms are generally fine, and typical of that price point in smaller hotels.  But the details were rough.  The in-window a/c unit was loud.  Really loud.  Like you're not going to sleep tonight loud.  The bathroom is pretty vintage and the shower didn't drain properly.  There was no coffee in the room, which isn't per se a problem, but neither was there a complimentary coffee cart in the lobby like many of the Belleclaire's competitors provide.  There was however a $3 tall coffee for sale in the lobby.  The two elevators are also vintage, and every ride we took seemed like it might be our last elevator ride--ever.  There's also no bar in the hotel if that matters to you.  It matters to us.  

At the end of the day, there are a fair number of boutique choices in that neighborhood or a little bit south towards Times Square that are much preferable.  The Belleclaire can't really compete.  Not on price, and not on amenities.

title: Overrated,  Overpriced, Poor Quality
text:
This hotel is overrated and expensive for a 3 star - more like 1-2 star and even then I would not stay there unless the price is less than USD 100 per night.  Very bad quality finishes in lobby and rooms.  Horrible smells coming from bathroom and air-condition.  No ambiance in the lobby, no decent breakfast area, very sparse and low quality furniture - even the night reception turns on his mobile TV much like what you see on TV when one goes to a cheap highway motel inn!!!  

Housekeeping is particularly poor where cleaning of the rooms don’t seem to be top priority.  Rooms don’t get cleaned daily.  Hairs still in drainage post cleaning.  Towels and toilet rolls don’t get replenished unless one asks.   Bed covers are not folded and just thrown below the luggage rack in the main room.  The toilet odors are not pleasant and even when one complaints - there is no response to fix it.   Even when one runs into a housekeeping staff,  they said please speak to reception for service ! 

Usually when one complaints, these complaints are escalated via guest services.   This didn’t work as well as I have never seen day reception deliberately misleading and ineffective. When I asked to speak to the duty manager after repeatedly asking for housekeeping service for almost an hour, the two receptionists could not agree whether the duty manager was a male or female!!  When I challenged the male receptionist (who seemed to be the more senior), he told me that the duty manager was female and that the female receptionist I spoke to on phone was mistaken.  Turned out that I was introduced to the female housekeeping manager who did not introduce herself as housekeeping,  did not have a business card claiming she was new.  She never introduced herself as the housekeeping manager and seemingly positioned herself as the manager on duty and not once correcting my assumption that she was only the housekeeping manager.   She  also took 15 minutes to see me after I stood at reception having given up waiting on the phone for another 15 minutes to speak to the manager!!  I have never seen such poor response at so many levels for a hotel claiming to the caliber of Belleclaire.  The whole thing just felt like the front desk guest service staff and housekeeping colluding together to not escalate issues when customers are unhappy!  

To really hit the point home on lack of cleaning standards by housekeeping there was also a cockroach in the shower !!!  

There is one exception to the poor service standards - which is the bell service who were all very helpful.  

The best thing about the hotel is the French cafe Mille Feuille (excellent coffee, pastries, ambiance and service) which one can access if one stayed at the Arthouse Hotel across the street where I spent a fair amount of time in their library bar and incredibly warm reception lobby area.  Arthouse Hotel seems new, trendy and has nice buzz about it.  It also has two very good restaurants, Serafina and Red Farm.  To add salt to injury, on booking.com the rooms are also considerably cheaper than what Belleclaire is charging.  

Bottom line - avoid Belleclaire at all costs.  stay at Arthouse Hotel instead (also on 77th and Broadway) if you want to be in that area.  As Arthouse Hotel faces 77th whilst many of the rooms for Belleclaire faces Broadway,  their rooms may be quieter.  The noise pollution factor for Belleclaire was very very bad!!!

title: Belleclaire is the Best!
text: We think the Hotel Belleclaire is the top of the heap, given the relative room prices and the amazing neighborhood.The Upper West Side is quiet and tree-lined (compared to mid town) and far less noisy and commercial. Feels like a true village enclave, which it is. The Belleclaire has amazing 100+ year history, and has been renovated to match today's sophisticated travelers' expectations. For us, it is our 'home away from home'. You can't beat this hotel for price, old world sophistication, and atmosphere.

title: The perfect place to stay on the Upper Westside!
text:
What a great location!
We were able to get to Central Park and the museums by foot. There were plenty of restaurants –– and sidewalk food stands –– all over Broadway and various side streets. 
We really enjoyed our stay with Hotel Belleclaire. All of the front desk folks and other employees we encountered were helpful and friendly. Our room was perfect –– small (which we love) and the bed was comfy (just like home). We have zero complaints –– just lotsa love for the Hotel Belleclaire.
We'll be back again!

title: Hospitality Beyond Expectations!
text: I  booked the Hotel Bellclaire last minute. The day before, I had orchestrated the memorial for my mother in Brooklyn and needed a place to relax, for a few days, before flying home to CA. The woman at the front desk sensed my emotional state and went beyond normal hospitality to ensure my stay was comfortable. She took it upon herself and transferred us to a larger room, knowing family would stop by to visit. I felt incredibly taken care of by Shanee,  She treated me more as a family member then a hotel guest. I was able to relax and explore the wonderful neighborhood. Zabars and Fairway both within walking distance, as is the Hudson River. I am so grateful for my experience at Hotel Bellclaire. Next time I first NYC I know where to stay.

title: Hotel Belleclaire: An Amazing Hotel that Just Keeps Getting Better
text:
Whenever I visit New York city, I always stay at the Hotel Belleclaire. It’s European charm, great rooms, amenities, location, and amazing staff has made it my hotel of choice for the past 6 years. On my most recent stay April 14-15th, I was amazed at how beautiful and luxurious the hotel looks after recent renovations. The hotel has maintained it’s classic historic charm while adding a modern flair. With that being said, the constant that is true of my stays at the Hotel Belleclaire is that the staff makes you feel like you’re coming home. They make sure that your needs are met. They greet you with a smile, and when they ask you, “is there anything else you need?’ they mean it! The rooms are stylishly appointed. I always get a great nights sleep on there super comfortable beds.

I love the accessibility to great restaurants on Amsterdam Avenue which is a two block walk; Central Park West which is a three block walk, and if I want to go downtown the 1/9 subway line is one block away.  You can’t ask for more. Oh, and to add icing on the cake, the room rates can’t be beat. What a value for all that Hotel Belleclaire has to offer. Can’t wait till my next visit to the city in July!!!

title: Praising Maria Peguero
text: We come back to the Belleclaire hotel again and again, and Maria always takes great care of us.  Her customer service is exceptional. She thinks first about the guest and how to make his/her stay a success.  Every hotel in NYC should have at least one Maria.

title: Great disappointment
text: The only positive aspect of this Hotel is its position, very close to Central Park, 5th Av., .... but the rooms are really very very old, dirty and dusty, the windows were broken and the bathroom was claustrophobic. Absolutely too EXPENSIVE compared to the real aspect of the hotel and the photo in Tripadvisor and Booking are really far from reality!

title: スーツケースが2個広げられる、アッパーウエストの雰囲気を堪能できるリーズナブルなホテル
text:
ニューヨークのマンハッタンなら、普通のホテルで素泊まり1泊3〜4万は普通だが、それでもスーツケースを広げられないホテルも多い中で、ここは3泊9万（素泊まり）でスーツケースが2個広げられる広さがあり、驚いた。
古さだの、あちこち軋むだのは、これもニューヨークなら当たり前で、それでもちゃんとメンテナンスされていたので快適に泊まれた。
場所も、地下鉄79丁目駅やゼイバーズなどのスーパーやCVSが近く、また高級住宅街なのでおしゃれなレストランも多く、観光客がどっと押し寄せる場所ではないので、ニューヨークのアッパーな雰囲気を歩いて楽しむことができる。朝食も、ホテルなんかで取る必要はなく、ルヴァンベーカリー（チョコチップクッキーが有名）、ブルーストーン・レーン（アボガドトーストなどが有名な、オーストラリア系カフェ）、ゼイバーズのテイクアウト、グレイズパパヤ（言わずと知れた立ち食いホットドッグ屋）など、選択肢満載。自然史博物館やセントラルパーク、ハドソン川沿いの公園も徒歩圏。
泊まった部屋は恐らく最低ランクの部屋だったと思うが、ウォークインクロゼット、冷蔵庫、金庫（固定されていなかったが・・・）、シャワーなどが備えられていた。反面、スリッパがなく、これだけは持って来ればよかったと後悔した（ニューヨークには100円ショップなどという気の利いたものがなく、室内用に娘のサンダルを買っただけで1000円を超えた・・・）
ホテルにコインランドリーはないが、歩いて10分くらいのところ（80丁目の、ブロードウェイとアムステルダムアベニューの間）に、重さで値段を決める洗濯屋（S&D LAUNDROMATという中国人らしき人が経営する店。10年以上前からある）があって、午前に出せば夕方には洗濯物を乾かして四角く畳んでおいてくれる。値段もそれほど高くなく、自分で洗濯機を見張る必要もないので便利。
アッパーウエストを楽しみたい人にオススメのホテル。

title: Friendly hotel in the best location
text:
I stay at this hotel frequently when I visit New York. Christopher Riggs is especially accommodating and always is available to help without hesitation. He is incredibly thoughtful and even sent up champagne when we told him we were celebrating my sisters birthday. He makes us feel at home! 

The location is also phenomenal, being in the middle of The Upper West Side, it’s so easy to get anywhere in the city!

title: Great service !
text: We had a great stay at this hotel! Brian at the front desk was so welcoming and helpful and did everything to ensure our stay was exceptional! His customer service was amazing! The rooms are very clean and the hotel has a vintage classic feel. We will definitely be staying here again! Thanks again to Brian for making our stay even better than we expected !

title: Good location, noisy building works
text:
Stayed for 7 nights in late April/May. Good location in terms of Upper West Side and subway stations for midtown and other areas of NYC. Nice spacious lobby and helpful reception staff.

Room a bit small and a bit basic in terms of furniture, but not unexpected for a standard double in NYC. Room at back of hotel away from Broadway and 77th Street. Nice sized bathroom and shower. Very good housekeeping and restocking of room amenities.

Building works were carried out in a nearby room and outside our window during stay, intermittent at first and then serious noise last two days. Engineering staff shouting to each other in hallways, banging, drilling, vacuuming, welding outside window, playing radios very loud.

Admin staff were helpful in resolving radio noise on second-last day and provided breakfast vouchers on last day to compensate for disruption. We were told we could have moved rooms, but noise was manageable early in stay and wasn’t clear how long works would last. It didn’t seem worth moving towards the end of our stay, after settling in room. Anyway, irritating to be placed in a room beside building works in the first place, without being warned of potential noise, especially given we were staying for 7 nights. Admin/reception staff not aware of timing of building works? Also the attitude of the engineering staff seems unacceptable anyway, seem completely unaware of disruption created by their shouting and radios when guests are trying to relax or sleep, aside from the actual building work noise.

Would most suit those on a first visit to NYC who would be leaving room early and returning late, i.e. just somewhere to sleep. Larger rooms would probably be preferable for return NYC visits, if wishing to crash in room for longer periods. And bear in mind to inform admin staff of noise problems early in stay, as they seem happy to help resolve issues.

title: Good stay at the Belleclaire
text: Good value for the neighborhood. Great location, impressive lobby. Small-ish room, with furniture that has some scratches and scrapes. Clean bed and newly tiled bathroom. French bakery accessible from the lobby is a bonus.

title: The location is excellent, the services poor and the rooms clean almost non-existent
text:
I don't understand how it can be certified as excellent. Only on this channel is it certified. In my opinion, he deserves no excellence except for the position.

The bed and the bathroom. The bathroom was very large and very nice. The position was the maximum point. Close to everything, and especially near the subway.

the wifi service does not work well, the room was not heated but only had a small, noisy electric convector. My room looked out on an internal skylight with all the air conditioning engines or perhaps kitchens, very noisy and poorly cleaned. Non-existent breakfast at an absurd price. The cleaners only cleaned in the middle and not on the shelves.

title: Great Stay Overall
text: The hotel is a lovely building, nicely decorated on the inside. Great value for money, many many bars and restaurants all within walking distance. The 79th subway is closest, a few minutes walk. Or get the 72nd street subway for express trains, 5-10 minute walk. We had a standard room, and it was enough space for the two of us for 7 nights. Lovely big modern shower, air con, mini fridge, ironing board etc. The air con is extremely loud, as is the fridge, had to turn them both off to sleep. The staff working here are really nice, helpful and polite. We got some great advice on travelling around and they helped us with some info about a Mets game. When checking out there was a charge to our room for a phone call to a local NY number. We didn’t even touch the phone at all to call anybody, and the staff member seemed to not believe us. So either there is a problem with their phone system, or the housekeeping have used our room phone themselves, kind of annoying, but they did reverse the charge for us. Overall it was a a lovely stay.

title: A perfect location for our girls trip to NYC.... only 2 blocks from a major subway....
text: We enjoyed our room on the Upper West Side.... when we had to switch our prearranged room to accommodate an additional traveler they worked it out well for us.... the staff was always friendly... the room was clean and spacious.... something you don't always read about it NYC hotels..... the extra bonus was that while there we were able to take a tour of the Upper West Side with a walking tour company for FREE... provided by the hotel.... well done tour and offering it for free is amazing.... NO coffee in the room and no FREE coffee in the lobby either.... it was delicious and offered by the EXCELLENT pastry shop... not expensive, but it seems as if a cup of coffee in the morning ought to come with a room!

title: A éviter !!!
text:
Rapport qualité/ prix de cet hôtel catastrophique. Chambre extrêmement bruyante, mobilier obsolète,  propreté plus que limite, salle de bain minuscule.
Hormis l'emplacement central à Manhattan, rien de bon dans cet établissement. A éviter !!!

title: Arty, Charming, Convenient, Clean, & Close....
text:
...to everything in the Upper West Side. Spacious room with nice decorative touches in keeping with the artistic style of the place. Comfortable bed and pillows. The bathroom could have been a bit roomier by taking some of the room space. Good WiFi signal. Great staff. The cafe in the lobby for breakfast was affordable and delicious with French pastries and good coffee. 

Room for improvement in instructions for the window AC unit. Our room was also near a stairwell and we heard the door swinging to the hall all night. But the location can’t be beat with proximity to trains, Parks, and restaurants.

title: Great place to stay on the upper west site
text:
Great place on the upper west site
We usually stay at the Belleclaire when we go to the opera. It's friendly and comfortable. The elevator makes us a bit anxious, but it has never failed to get us to our floor.

title: Charming but beware: basic room very very small
text:
This is a charming old but restored hotel on upper West Side, one of my favorite parts of NYC. It's just a few blocks to subway (1,2 or 3 line) and near nice shops and restaurants modest and classy. Staff is very friendly and helpful as well.
     Knowing NY hotels have small rooms, we deliberately booked a larger room when we made our reservation--going up from the basic to the queen deluxe. So we were stunned when we entered our queen deluxe room to find it smaller than the smallest room we've encountered in Manhattan. The desk was gracious enough to move us up (at an extra charge of course) to the Broadway King which was large and had great street views (although a very tiny bathroom). Even so, the upgrade cost far less than many other basic hotel rooms in NYC. 
     We would definitely stay there again--but make sure to book a large room.

title: Bien situé, propre et professionnel
text:
Voilà un hôtel. 
Accueil chaleureux et professionnel,
Chambre propre, service impeccable, 
Un peu bruyant sur la rue mais new-york is new-york. 
Bref je recommande cet hôtel. 

This is a hotel. Warm and professional welcome, Clean room, impeccable service, A bit noisy on the street but new york is new york. In short I recommend this hotel.

title: Nice stay
text:
Nice hotel on Upper West Side. Staff is gentle, the building is antique but nice. Standard room is very small, but enough space. Bed is comfy and shower is very good. No breakfast included, but there's a boulangerie next door, the Mille Feuille, that is very good. Room cleaning is not very good. My hair falls a lot, and there were days when I left the room and when I came back I found them still on the floor of the bathroom...oh and they don't replace amenities. Shower gel finished wasn't replaced.
location is good. two subway stations very close, supermarkets, banks and restaurants.
All in all, except for the cleaning issue, was a very nice stay. I loved the location. Oh, forgot to mention, it's very close to Central Park and National History Museum.

title: Very French! Very lovely.
text: I only spent one night but it was an excellent choice. The hotel building itself is one of the most elegant on the UWS. The staff was very accommodating and already knew I requested a high floor quiet away from the elevator. That's what I got. My room was very small but perfect for me. It was immaculate and the bathroom was modern and also immaculate with cool soap, shampoo creme rinse and lotions.  Everything worked perfectly. There essentially was no view from my window but in my case, I was fine w that because I knew I was only going to be in the room for sleep and to do some work. In the morning a wonderful French cafe opens up i the lobby with authentic cappuccino and espresso and pastries. The UWS is the perfect location for just about everything, best restaurants and cafes, shopping, Central Park, public transportation ( in my case, i had to travel down to the tip of Battery Park and it was an easy subway ride ). I will say perhaps they could make sure their elevators are sound as they did seem a little bit shaky. I would highly recommend this hotel. Many choices but this is one of the loveliest in upper west side NYC.

title: Great Upper West Side hotel
text: We were looking for a reasonable, clean and interesting hotel in a convenient location.  This hotel exceeded our expectations in all categories.  It has the charm of an older building with modern touches that make for a very comfortable stay.  The staff was welcoming and accommodating, especially Bryan D. who went out of his way to help us anytime an issue arose.  Great neighborhood, two blocks from Central Park.

title: Great location and good amenities
text: I visited the hotel with a family group (six of us across three rooms) for a five day leisure break to see the sights of NYC. The hotel was easy to find as it is near subway stations and we had a really warm welcome from Rebekah on the front desk. Check in was easy and painless although we were spread across three floors (might be worth asking ahead if you want to be located near to people in other rooms). The standard of the accommodation was fine - the rooms were a good size, our bathrooms were great and there was a really spacious closet which was helpful (we did have deluxe rooms). The fitness centre was a good addition and there are many bars, restaurants and breakfast places within close proximity. Things to note - the lifts are small and clunky (to be expected in an older building), we had no view at all out of our windows, the heating is a bit hit and miss, the free WIFI works but can be a pain to keep logging into and we encountered numerous problems with our key cards stopping working. That said, this is a great hotel in the context on NYC and I would stay here again.

title: Great hotel for the price
text: We chose this hotel for it's location (close to Central Park) and it's history. And it was perfect! It's a beautiful old hotel with modern amenities. The rooms were very clean if a little small, but that's what we expected. The bathroom was really well done. The French bakery off the lobby was a favorite with all of us. The staff is very helpful and friendly. If you're looking for a modern (bland) chain hotel, this isn't the place for you. But if you want something with history that's a little quirky at an affordable price, this is the place.

title: Sopravvalutato
text: Questo albergo premette bene nel proprio sito ma la realtà è un po' diversa. La cosa più positiva è la posizione, e questo dice molto. Attaccato al central park e metro molto vicino.  La stanza invece è misera, con una finestra che malapena si apre, e  troppo piccola per poter tenere la valigia aperta, sennò sul letto. Bagno piccolo ma pulito. Dei 3 ascensori 1 era sempre rotto mentre gli altri 2 facevano dei strani rumori. Non ha un ristorante mentre la colazione si può fare dentro un bar di mille feuille all'interno dello stabile. La reception era ok, anche il personale era gentile e servizevole. Pessimo rapporto qualità-prezzo.

title: Overnight to see a musical at Lincoln Center
text: Good rate for the local but tiny room and no storage place! Some hangers but not many! Our sink had large cracks! Shower huge! Staff great! Lots of restaurants in the area and close to Central Park.  Will use Marriott next time!

title: Early Spring Visit
text:
My husband and I were in NYC for the NIT Basketball Tournament at Madison Square Garden. Even though Hotel Belleclaire isn’t near the venue, we chose it because of the quieter,  Upper West Side location. There are two subway stations within easy walking distance (one at 72nd St and the other at 79th St), which makes going uptown or downtown very easy.  We went Uptown as far as 125th Street and Downtown to ride the Staten Island Ferry this trip, both of which were very easy. The short walk to the American Museum of Natural History and Central Park was perfect too!! 

Although our room at the Hotel Belleclaire was a little on the small side, it was meticulously clean and everything worked well....A/C, refrigerator, TV, etc.  We upgraded to a room on a higher floor with a fridge and a view, both of which added to the pleasure of our stay. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the bath linens were really nice. 

All of the staff at the hotel were pleasant and helpful. Upon checking out of the hotel, we asked if they could call a taxi for our ride to the airport. While they were willing to do so, they asked if we would like to use their car service. The $55 fee, including tip, was reasonable and convenient.....didn’t have to watch the taxi meter the whole ride. :)

title: Not bad
text:
I felt the location was good and pretty central. We used subway to get around so it wasn’t so bad. The room was small and so was the bathroom-felt a little tricked since the photos on the website where we booked didn’t make it seem that way. We were planning on taking my newphew and if we asked for the crib there would have been no space for all of us! 
The elevator also was pretty sketchy-small and creaky and it definitely felt like it was going to break. 

Overall, not bad for location and price-good walking distance to Central Park which was pretty nice.

title: Great place to stay on upper West Side.
text: This was our 2nd time staying here in the last 7 months. Hotel Belleclaire is quiet, clean and conveniently located for those wanting to be in that area of Manhattan. Close to River View Park  and has great subway access. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are spotless - which has not always been my experience in NYC!  I’m glad Columbia U Med Campus recommended Hotel Belleclaire to us! We will stay there again.👍👍

title: Nice hotel, good quality
text:
We were really happy with our stay at the Hotel Belleclaire. The King Duplex room was very spacious, the bed very comfy, and everything was really clean. On the downside, the bathroom is a bit small (but super clean and efficient so not a red flag) and there's street noise at night but it's New York so we were expecting that.
The hotel has a very good situation, 3 blocks from central park and 10-15 minutes walking distance to Times Square.
The staff was friendly and helpful.
We enjoyed our stay very much!

title: Wonderful Spot!
text:
My sister and I come to New York twice a year to shop see as many shows as possible.  We have returned to Hotel Belleclaire twice and plan to stay again in the summer.
We love the UWS and find this hotel perfectly located to escape the madness of midtown.  I found the staff very courteous and attentive.  
The general manager Robert Holmes is extremely professional and was so helpful.  Our flight was delayed and he made extending our stay as painless as possible.
For female travellers- it felt very safe.  There were always doormen and plenty of front desk people around at all hours.  We always felt very comfortable.

title: A Decent Property in a good location
text: The Belleclaire is centrally located on the upper west side in manhattan, which is mostly a residential neighborhood. It is a short subway ride to Times Square and short walk to Central Park. Check in process was good. Lobby is great. We had a small room with a king size bed overlooking Broadway, which can be a little noisy. The furniture was a little beat up, but the bed was mostly comfortable. There was not a lot of natural light as the window was quite small. There is a window AC unit in the window so we couldn't open the window. One issue not the hotel's fault was that the person next to us had the TV blaring at 230AM on Friday night. I knocked on the door myself and asked nicely for them to lower it. Did not have to go to the front desk. That being said, i think the wall are pretty thin. In summary, for the price/location, it's a decent option.

title: Hotel Belleclaire staff
text:
Rebecca is friendly and welcoming. Even before we reached the reception, she already had a smile on her face. The check in was done smoothly and efficiently. She engages with you all the time, asking questions and she really seem to be interested. 
During our stay, I was surprised that she remembered and called me by name. This was 2 (or was it 3?) days after we checked in.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
Stayed at Hotel Belleclaire with my husband and daughter while visiting colleges in New York.  Reasonable rate, great location, excellent service, and wonderful room. Decent fitness center. Bakery next door great for breakfast.

Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay on Upper West Side!
text: We stayed here just for one night with 2 other couples.  Everyone enjoyed their experience!  We were able to check in early and the location is perfect.  Yes it's NYC so the street traffic is loud but that's NYC! The rooms are not huge but we all felt they were nicely decorated and very comfortable! We did not take advantage of the "breakfast" because it's NYC and there are 50 million places to go but there is a fabulous bakery right off of the lobby. I wouldn't say that this hotel is luxurious but it was very comfortable for our stay and the staff was great! There is valet parking too although we didn't use it because if you drive around a bit you usually can get lucky with finding a spot on the street.

title: Not bad, not great but that's NYC
text:
My girlfriend and I booked a room for a week in NYC. We chose this hotel because of the consistently strong reviews on this website. The hotel is in a good location - a short walk to 79th St and 72nd St subway stations. It is also very close to Central Park. We even walked to Times Square a few times (30 mins). 
The hotel room was nice but the shower was terrible - very old and was either cold or boiling hot. I was also disappointed to see the hotel was not environmentally conscious - plastic cups wrapped in plastic were available in the rooms rather than drinking glasses. The toilets also use 6 litres of water per flush.
The hotel rooms block out absolutely NO sound from the streets. We were on the third floor and were frequently disturbed overnight by people speaking, cars honking, garbage trucks and construction across the road. If you are a light sleeper, avoid this hotel! 
The breakfast consists of one croissant, a glass of OJ and a coffee, which is not worth it! 
We were disappointed because we were really looking forward to our holiday and wanted to experience a classic NYC hotel - we certainly paid for one but we did not experience one. The rest of our trip outside of the hotel was fantastic though, New York is amazing.

title: Excelente hotel!
text: Nos hospedamos por 20 dias no Hotel Belleclaire e valeu cada centavo! Hotel limpo, bem localizado, com metrô próximo, varias lojas legais nos arredores e mercado próximo também. Ficamos no quarto 232, que tinha cozinha! Isso nos ajudou bastante a economizar dinheiro, pois comprávamos algumas coisas no mercado e tomávamos café da manhã no quarto mesmo! Eles possuem serviço para armazenar malas tanto na chegada quanto na saída. Nossa experiência foi muito boa! Não tenho do que reclamar. Recomendo de olhos fechados!

title: NYE Visit
text:
First, I should note this review is for my stay which took place over New Year's Eve (so three months ago). Still, I feel I have valid feedback that will help readers make a choice in hotels on the Upper West Side.

As someone who has been visiting the neighborhood and staying in its hotels regularly since 1995, I know no property is perfect. They can be expensive, noisy, etc. I get that, and expect it going in. But some of what I encountered -- in my first stay at the Belleclaire -- I feel should be shared with others.

When I first got to my room to start my three-night stay, I immediately looked out the window. And looked smack dab onto an empty construction scaffolding. It was set at a height just below my second-floor window, and gave the appearance that it was in use...but perhaps not that day, given that it was the weekend. Still, I know crews work on weekends, so I asked one of the cleaning crew if there was "action" on that scaffolding, and I was assured no one uses it or had done so "in a long time."

Hmm, well, ok. They wouldn't lie to me.

Wrong.

At 9 am the next morning, I was awakened by the sound of three construction workers doing their thing. Electric saws, drills, the works. Merely being separately by a thin pane of glass -- and a window air conditioner that wasn't completely sealed -- made it feel like I was out on the scaffolding with them!

I couldn't believe it, especially as I had spent the evening at a concert and was looking forward to sleeping in.

I attempted to call the front desk -- which, in a haze,  I recalled being told upon check in I couldn't do via the "Front Desk" button on the phone -- and the cord slipped out of the handset. To make the call, I had to hold the cord and make sure it stayed in the phone jack.

Eventually I was able to connect with the front desk, who apologized for my plight and connected me to the manager...who was, shall we say, slightly less hospitable.

Perhaps I came off a bit brusk, but I was also going deaf from the noise as I explained the situation.

"So what do you want me to do, ask them to stop? Absolutely not!"

I was more than a bit horrified by his response, and countered that I needed another room, especially since I was already deceived about the situation by one of his staff. He had me recontact the front desk, and I did so in person, at which time I showed them the pictures I am including here. They cringed, but cheerfully switched my room to one far away from the noise, and I was satisfied. I didn't even mind half the TV channels didn't work, or that the thin walls made me feel as though I was actually invited to the sex party across the hall (how loud can sex get?!?  Clearly I'm doing something wrong...but I digress).

All in all, the hotel was fine and had definite upside. Would I stay there again? Maybe, but I am much better prepared now. 

Most importantly, the hotel needs to warn guests about possible noise from construction, or not put guests in rooms located near "ground zero." And if and when someone complains, the manager, of all people, shouldn't be obnoxious about it.

title: Watch out for charging you for the mini bar
text:
While I don't have any terrible things to say about the actual room, I was charged $27.20 for supposedly eating and drinking things from the mini bar. It did not appear on our bill when we checked out, but appeared at our credit card website. I called 3 times to ask them to take it off our charge, and each time they claimed they had done it; they were rude each time, hardly even letting me speak. I find this overall fraud, knowing they are just hoping that people don't check their bills and pay without realizing it. Watch out. 

Don't believe the pictures on the website. The furniture is a mess, but overall it was very clean. I was glad we did not have to use the air conditioner, as it was filled with mold.

title: Lovely UWS boutique hotel
text: If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable stay, look no further than the Hotel Belleclaire. The room is spacious, the bathroom is lovely (all marble and much bigger than it should be for NYC) and the beds are comfortable. The only minor complaint is that the coffee in the lobby in the morning is not free and there’s no coffee in the room. All in all a lovely stay and we will be back. Location is terrific and very convenient to the subway.

title: Bien situé
text:
J'ai réservé cet hôtel à la dernière minute car mon logement AirBnb a été annulé 3 jours avant de partir! Je n'ai donc pas eu beaucoup le choix. 
L'hôtel est localisé dans l'upper west side. Le logement est extrêmement bien situé sur Broadway même et la 77st. Il y a 2 stations de métro à 5 minutes à pied (la 79 st et la 72 st). Nous prenions toujours le métro à la 72 st, ce qui nous permettait de passer par 2 grands magasins (trader Joe's et l'autre je ne sais plus) pour faire quelques courses. 
Plus loin sur Broadway (71st), il y a un macdonald, une pizzeria et un Starbuck.
L'hôtel est également proche de central Park et du musée d'histoire naturel.
Notre chambre disposait d'une kitchenette (Un grand frigo pour refroidir nos bouteilles d'eau, une cuisinière, un micro ondes, bouilloire et de la vaisselle).
Il y a juste un jour ou j'ai trouvé un cafard dans la salle de bain. 
Ce que j'ai trouvé bizarre c'est que les essuies n'étaient pas changés systématiquement tous les jours (à 1300 euros pour une semaine!). Une petite pancarte indiquait que nous devions laissé les essuies par terre si nous souhaitions qu'ils soient changés.

title: Perfect!
text: I searched for the perfect hotel for a 3 generation mother-daughter mini vacation. This hotel was perfect. Beautiful combination of modern amenities and old world charm. The hotel staff were all very accommodating no matter what the question or time of day/night. The French bakery next door was a very tasty touch. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

title: A two day mini-vacation
text: We have stayed at the Belleclaire for quick Manhattan get-aways now for four or five years.  My wife and I met (many years ago!) on the upper West Side, so it always feels like home.   The Belleclaire has a great location in every respect and lots of easily walkable destinations nearby and it is two blocks from the subway.  They offer valet parking, although sometimes we get lucky with on-street parking - this time, I pulled up in front of the 77th Street door and the doorman got a commercial car to move a bit and we wound up with a free parking spot right outside the hotel door!  The in-house coffee shop is really nice for light breakfast, the rooms are comfortable, quiet and large enough for a place in Manhattan that doesn't break the bank.   Although good coffee is available in the lobby, it would be nice if they provided a Keurig machine or similar in the rooms.  The staff is uniformly friendly and helpful.

title: My spot!
text: I've stayed at this hotel probably 4 times. I love that the 1 train is one block away. I love that you can walk to Central Park. There's a 24 hour CVS across the street. There are restaurants all around for the foodie in you. Shopping..on and on.. What a great spot in the city. I always feel at home and the rooms are always nice and clean. Long time ago hotel was under construction. Very nice upgrades. I will always stay here when I visit the City. Thank you Hotel Belleclaire!

title: Location, location, location is great and so is the hotel!
text:
I highly recommend this hotel.  Staff is friendly, efficient and courteous.  My room and all public areas of the hotel were immaculate.  I had a room not on the street side so the room was dead quiet at night.  Despite being an old building (1903), my room was well appointed in a modern style that blended perfectly with the original architectural features.  The hotel has been modernized but not by destroying elegance.

Coffee shop in lobby, Mille-feuille Patisserie, has wonderful pastry and excellent latte.

Location, location, location is great!  Two blocks south from the #1 subway and also the crosstown bus that gets you to 5th Avenue in about 10 minutes.  Amsterdam Avenue is one short block over from the hotel and offers plenty of places to eat.  Try Insomnia Cookies at 405 Amsterdam (between 79th and 80th) for a great made to order ice cream sandwich.

I would definitely stay at this hotel again and hope to soon!

PS  The in-room hair dryers are great!  Not the wimpy tiny kind you usually find in a hotel.

title: Well maintained, and cozy boutique types of hotel in the heart of UWS
text:
Stayed two nights in contemporary double(Queen size bed) room. While the pre-war boutique type hotel around this price range can be hit or miss, this hotel was certainly more than a hit.
Very well maintained room just big enough to open the small luggage, neatly organized renovated bathroom, properly maintained A/C (you can control) and steam heater (central heating). Umbrella set in the room was nice as well. 
Hotel staff member was relaxed, welcoming, and very professional. 
I personally like this hotel for all of the above reasons, and probably come back even without disciunted price.
Only con is the two elevators which are very small in a crustsphobic-inducing way, and that it could take a while to catch a elevator because it can be filled with average 3-5 people (depending on the size). 
But the bright side of this hotel definitely outweighs this cons so make sure to consider extra time taking elevator and everything will be good.

title: AMAZING
text: A lovely warm welcoming hotel. All the staff are lovely, bed big and comfortable. Suited in the upperside of the city. Easy to get around. Supermarket across the street. Definitely going to be going back

title: Best place to stay on the Upper West side!
text: My wife and I just stayed overnight, last night, at the Hotel Belleclaire. This hotel is beautiful. Modern feel, also with an upscale historic touch. Wonderful staff from the front desk, to valet and bellhop. Perfect location to see a show at the Beacon Theatre. This hotel is top notch, we even passed a rock ‘n roll icon in the lobby!

title: Clasic with a Modern update
text: I dealt several times with the front desk and one of the managers. My plans had changed and instead of treating me like a number, Manager Chris, he made me feel like I was more then that. The staff here at this hotel go above and beyond to make you feel welcome and take top notch care of their guest. They greet you with a warm and friendly smile with all encounters. Maria, I will have to give a shout out to at the front desk cause she really made the trip fun, had an outgoing personality and has knowledge of the area. The hotel is located in the an area with many restaurants and things to do. Its just a few blocks from Central Park and not far from subway off/on. The hotel has a small café that is located downstairs but I don't believe it's theirs and they offer coffee, treats and much more. We stayed on the backside of the hotel and it was quiet and I heard no noise. The elevator was small, they have two. I used the stairs a lot since I was only three floors up. The ice machine and soda machine are located on the first floor inside the stairwell, next to elevator. The room was clean and spacious. The small fridge was on the floor so you have to bend down to put anything in there or take out. The closet had a small safe and even had an umbrella, if you need it. The phone/clock combo had cords attached so you can plug your phone in, many different cords for different phones. The Wi-Fi is free but if you want to up grade and go faster they do offer a package you can purchase. I found the free Wi-Fi to be good and didn't need to upgrade. Many channels on the TV to choose from. This hotel is just a "Gem". My stay was perfect and I couldn't ask for anything more. I would like to say Thank you to Carlos and the other Maintenance staff who helped me with the a/c and helped with getting my friends earrings out of the sink drain. Before I end I would like you to know that the beds were some of the best I have slept on. Amazing slumber and I did think about how to get them outta the room without getting in trouble. The beds were perfect!!!!!! If you are in the area I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

title: Great visit
text: Hotel Belleclaire was perfect for our quick trip to Manhattan. The location is great. Close to transportation and out of the midtown madness! I loved the charm of the Hotel. The staff was pleasant and courteous. We will definitely stay again!

title: Great location, excellent front desk staff
text: This is one of my favorite hotels in New York, reason number 1, location. Is close enough to the subway, and if you are willing to walk you can reach midtown in 20/25 minutes walking. So you are in a neighborhood where you don't need to deal with the crowd of tourist all around you, that's what I love about it. There is a great french coffee adjacent to the hotel, a must go. The front desk is just amazing, Maria is the person to talk to if you need anything. The only downside I saw this time was the cleaning and maintenance of the room. I spent more than a week and for several days the the floor was not cleaned, the towels were changed, the bathroom too, but not the floor in the room...but other than that I truly recommend this hotel.

title: Nice
text: Great hotel that’s situated in a great location not far from Central Park. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. Would stay there again. The only downside is it’s not got breakfast otherwise would get top marks.

title: Wonderful experience at Hotel Belleclaire
text: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Belleclaire and were very happy with the hotel and the services offered. The room was spacious, clean and quiet, and the hotel in a great location, with easy access to the subway. The staff at the Belleclaire also helped make a special occasion extra memorable and we would strongly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in Manhattan.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
This is a brilliant hotel for returning visited to New York. Because the hotel is upper West side and slightly out of the main tourist area of times Square you get more for your money. The rooms are bigger and most have a great view. They are well equipped and very clean and tidy.
I love this hotel and it's location would definitely stay again.

title: I Like This Place Less and Less
text:
We’ve been coming here for a few years now and everytime I like it less. My partner loves it so we just keep coming. 
 I went to be at midnight and it’s now six in the morning. I’ve been woken up three times already. A fire truck, a garbage truck, and a can collector. The windows here barely do anything. They are just physically there. The noise and cold come right through with barely an impediment. 
 The walls are paper thin and the doors are worse. Definitely doesn’t make for a romantic getaway. There really aren’t any great views outside the windows so if you do stay here, do yourself a favor and get any interior room. You won’t have to hear all the madness goin on outside.

title: Lovely hotel and stay
text: We stayed at the belle Claire on the 7th floor, lifts are good and hardly any wait but they are snug. Took the stairs a few times too. Clean, tidy and spacious room, comfy beds, my teenage daughter loved her bed and spent a whole day in it. Staff are polite and friendly, we had a city view. We were close to Central Park and a short walk from Times Square, my daughter didn’t want to stay in the busy city so belle Claire was perfect. Very happy

title: 1st time NYC trip
text: Beautiful hotel and great service. My wife and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary and were greeted with a bottle of champagne in our room. Convenient location to subway and dining. Definitely recommend.

title: Great hotel!
text: I loved the location of the hotel. It was clean, friendly staff, updated, and I enjoyed my stay.Close proximity to the subway and lots of restaurants/shopping. Easy check-in.  I would definitely stay there again!

title: Superb in Every Way
text:
For 25 years, as a married woman, whenever we visited the city, we stayed at The Waldorf Astoria. The Waldorf closed the month before my divorce was final. Coincidence?
Enter The Belleclaire into my newly single life. About a month after my duvirce was final, the Belleclaire completed its stunning lobby renovation. Coincidence?
The Belleclaire is cozy, perfectly located and above all has immovable service— much better than we ever received at The Waldorf.  Henry and Namaah and Sare know me by name which I love. There are five or six copies of the Times in the lobby. Mille has opened inside. CVS is directly cater corner for that midnight ice cream run.  Good strong hot showers.
Fabulous hotel.  I’ll never stay anywhere else.

title: Lovely stay
text:
Stayed for 5 nights last year (just realised I didn’t write a review!). Reception was quite busy when we arrived but we were seen quite quickly.
We had a lovely twin room, plenty of wardrobe space & a safe. Very clean. Ours was near the corner & could be quite noisy, but it’s New York!! 
No bar or restaurant but this wasn’t a problem as plenty in the area.
Staff always helpful when we needed something.
Very nice stay

title: One of the few remaining good hotels that offers personal service with a friendly smile
text: I recently spent 3 days in NYC helping a relative to clean up his apartment.  As such I checked into the Belleclaire with both a suitcase and a vacuum cleaner.  After apologizing for my less than glamorous entrance several staff members just smiled and said they had seen all sorts of things over the years.  The room was spacious and as clean as could be.  Perhaps the furniture could use a facelift, but honestly it doesn't really matter because the Belleclair excels in all the things that do matter such as cleanliness, amenities, comfortable beds and outstanding service.  I'll be back in two weeks and hopefully never have to search for another hotel in NYC again.  Thanks, Belleclaire!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Very accommodating and polite staff made a very good impression, very nice and clean rooms, well stocked mini bar, great location and would highly recommend this hotel in the future.Truly a great experience.

title: Character brings loud pipes
text: I spent 3 nights at this charming hotel. I personally loved the location.  Subway station close by. Close to Central Park and a safe feeling neighborhood.  The lobby is clean and comfortable.  The elevators are small as expected for the age of the building.  The hallways are narrow but quaint. The room was adequate size for me. Clean, nice decor but slightly worn furniture.  The pipes were very loud at times. Quit startling.  The walls are thin and city noises are quiet clearly heard. Staff was supper pleasant.  This hotel reminds me of a European hotel. Old, but quaint.

title: Perfect location with fabulous Personnel
text: single room on the 9th floor was very quiet, clean and spacious enough for one. I like the classic decor and the hardwood floors. Perfect location on the UWS, right next to subway. From the moment i booked until I checked out, the customer-service oriented attitiude makes this place stand out from neighboring hotels. Comfortable bed and attached to the lobby is a fine little french cafe/ bistro with great breakfast fare. only negative is the dry heat thermastat, which means you cant control the temps in your room but this is a problem with all old hotels in NYC, but travelers should know that in wintry days the rooms are very warm. So you open the window, and at a high level (9th floor) i heard no noise from Broadway. Most of all, Thanks to all the Staffers at the Belleclaire who were super friendly and willing to help me out with all my queries. Bravo!

title: Birthday Bash
text: We stayed there two nights Friday-Sun. Had a great time. King room which is quite large, but small bathroom. It was winter and the room was warm. You do have control over the heat. Nice bed, towels, robes & toiletries. Hotel is clean and has a nice staff. Only issue is street noise from large vehicles and fire trucks. We didn’t hear the normal street traffic. Close to subway & buses.

title: Clean,comfortable and updated!
text: From check in to departure our stay was great! Our Deluxe King room was spacious,clean and updated. Our bathroom was nicely appointed and brightly lit.Although I did miss a magnifying mirror on the wall. My first shower was taken with lukewarm water, but every shower after there was plenty of hot water. Gym is decent too with all your basic essentials We jumped ship from a nearby hotel and are so glad we did! Hotel Belleclaire we will be back!!!

title: Nice historic hotel in great neighborhood
text:
The basics:  Great Upper West Side location, near subway.  We booked a suite, which was very clean, with a comfortable king sized bed, decent sized bathroom, good shower.  The extra room was a nice luxury (and it helps to book in the dead of winter, when NY hotel prices are a bargain.) Staff is pleasant.
The special:  It's really a cool old building, built in 1905.  Worth looking at the building's exterior.  It has some great details, like the original mosaic tile floor unearthed in the lobby. The lobby is spacious and comfortable, and stocked with several copies of the New York Times.  (thanks!)  Really enjoyed reading the Sunday Times there.  French pastry shop adjoining the lobby is a nice bonus.  Interesting warren of narrow hallways upstairs.  I enjoyed the building's history.
Other comments:  The steam heat is plentiful!  Just be aware that you can adjust the heat    on the radiator.  Check with the desk if you have trouble.

I'd happily stay here again.

title: A wonderful + welcoming stay in a beautiful city!
text:
My boyfriend + I stayed in the city’s for the first time at the Hotel Belleclaire for a weekend and had the best experience because of the wonderful staff. Bryan D helped us at the desk and was immediately welcoming, accommodating + professional. We thank him + all the staff for making our first stay in the Big Apple a memorable one! 
Rooms were very clean + comfortable.
Location was perfect for us! (So close to Central Park, museums, subway, food, etc)
Gorgeous building! 

Highly reccomend to anyone looking to stay in the city! 

-Jamie Brunette

title: Nice Hotel
text:
Just back from a week in the Belleclaire - lovely hotel, friendly, helpful staff. 
Rooms are a nice size and comfortable - my only issue would be the bathrooms weren't cleaned fully and the toiletries were not replaced - only a small issue and wouldn't put me off staying there again.
Close to subway stations and shops nearby - bit of a walk to time square etc but manageable. 
Free tea and hot chocolate available in reception - which is a nice touch, although milk should also be available!

title: Precio, ubicación y amabilidad = Hotel muy recomendable si buscas ahorrar pero moverte por la ciudad
text:
El precio está muy bien, el personal muy agradable (cambia de lo que es el carácter newyorkí) y está relativamente cerca del metro (3 minutos andando) y en una zona con bastantes comercios. El hotel es una muy buena opción para quienes quieren estar en una zona comunicada y buena, sin gastarse millonadas. Es un hotel de principios del siglo 20, con una fachada muy nostálgica, que le da una carácter histórico y de película. Los amenities del baño (jabón, etc...) están genial; huelen muy bien y se agradecen. La tarjeta de bienvenida en el cuarto y esa nevera con miles de snacks disponibles son un plus al servicio. Recomendable principalmente por su personal y por precio/localización.

Los puntos negatuvos son que la habitación es bastante pequeña, así como el baño. No es minúsculo, pero le faltan unos cuantos metros para que sea más confortable. Falta un servicio de habitación, en el que podamos solicitar cucharas, tenedores, vasos o lo que queramos, sin tener que esperar a que lo encuentren en algún lugar del hotel... Pero sinceramente, es recomendable.

title: GREAT WEEKEND GETAWAY
text: Very impressed with this hotel from the beginning with the valet to Bryan at the front desk who is very knowledgeable about great restaurants and Nightlife in the area made for one great weekend. Room was clean and sheik One more thing and amazing French bakery right in the hotel for fantastic coffee and croissants in the morning looking forward to going back.

title: Non come nelle foto
text: Hotel molto più datato di come appare nelle fotografie che si trovano qui o su booking. Non vale assolutamente il prezzo che lo fanno pagare, le stanze sono piccole e non pulitissime, con gli spifferi freddi che entrano dalle finestre. Durante il nostro soggiorno c'erano lavori in corso, sia nei corridoi vicini alla nostra stanza e sia fuori dalla finestra, che dava praticamente su un muro, dove c'erano dei muratori che lavoravano e canticchiavano con la musica ad alto volume. Ma con un buon spirito di adattamento e considerando che stavamo lì solo per dormire poteva anche andare bene, se non fosse per il prezzo. C'è da aggiungere la totale mancanza di professionalità del suo personale, che non ha mai risposto al nostro saluto, e che durante il check out ci ha fatto pagare in contanti la bottiglietta d'acqua che abbiamo consumato nella stanza (5 dollari), senza poi segnare li avessimo pagati, ce li hanno dunque addebitati nuovamente nella carta. Inutile contattarli per chiedere rimborso e fargli notare il loro errore, perché non si sono nemmeno degnati di rispondere. Unico punto positivo la posizione, vicinissimo a Central Park.

title: Great location
text: This hotel was perfect for our recent visit to New York. The room comfortably accommodated our family of four with individual beds for our two older daughters. Location is perfect for restaurants and supermarkets and less than two blocks to the subway with Times Square less than 10 minutes away on the subway. If you don't want the hustle and bustle of Times Square this is a great place to stay and very safe at night. Cafe Viand close by is the perfect place to eat for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

title: Hotel stay
text: Front desk staff were very helpful.  Hotel is clean and well run.  There is a nice bakery off the lobby area.  Room was nice, however, it's an older hotel and the sound travels between rooms.  No thermostat in the room.  Have to work with the steam heat.

title: Perfect Hotel for Us
text: The combination of great price, great location, and being next door with a connection to a great French bakery made this little hotel perfect for us. It is very close to 2 subway stops and in the midst of the wonderful Upper West Side neighborhood. We had a Standard Room, with a comfortable bed and a clean bathroom. The staff were universally warm and welcoming. We would love to repeat this six day adventure again and again!

title: Definitely Returning!!
text:
Beautiful hotel. Staff greets you with inviting smiles and pleasant demeanor.
Beds are comfortable and the walk-in shower was amazing!! Walking distance to a lot of great tourist attractions, i.e. Central Park, The Met, and the Beacon Theatre.

title: Hotel Belleclaire
text: It was ok. my husband had requested a higher level room. It was not ready when we got there. Did not get a higher level . When we requested it again the next day we did get one but was told we had to pay a higher price. would not return. Other hotels that are nicer for that price

title: Per New York ci sta...
text: Hotel datato ma comunque ben tenuto, la posizione è ottima è ci ha permesso di girare tutta Manhattan a piedi. Nota negativa all'insonorizzazione delle camere, che nella città che non dorme mai può essere molto fastidioso. Pulizia non eccellente. Non è economico, ma visti gli standard di New York alla fine siamo stati bene. Consigliato a chi sa adattarsi.

title: Very convenient location! 5 mins to Subway station.
text: The room is not so big but clean and quiet. The location of hotel is very convenient. 5 mins to Subway station. 20 mins to Time square. The price is also reasonable. A bakery is right beside the hotel and provide delicious pie.

title: En familia con niños
text: Reservamos por una semana la habitación familiar, que constaba de 2 habitaciones y un baño. Por las ventanas entraba muchísimo frío porque no se podían cerrar bien, con lo que también había mucho ruido. Tenían que tener algún problema con alguna empresa de mantenimiento, porque todos los días había gente haciendo huelga diciendo que había chinches en el hotel, aunque nosotros no sufrimos ningún problema. En general, un hotel regular.

title: Really nice hotel!
text:
Great location on the upper west side just a minute walk from the 79th street subway station and close to to Central Park.

Plenty is within walking distance and you should try the Europan cafe and Amsterdam ale house which are both nearby!

Rooms are a good size and really clean, and the hotel even left us a bottle of prosecco in an upgraded room due to us recently being married which was a nice touch.

Would definitely come again.

title: Beautiful!
text: We really enjoyed our stay.  Our room was pretty much exactly as pictured online.--The hotel is small & (obviously) very old, so the elevators, the hallways, rooms, and bathrooms are also very small, but we didn't feel particularly crowded at all.  I loved the hardwood (laminate?) floors in the room rather than the carpeting which you typically find in hotel rooms (and always feel gross).  Our only complaint, really was that our room was insanely hot and the heater took quite a while to start cooling off.  It really never got to a comfortable temperature in the room (but I'll admit--it felt nice to wear a tanktop in the middle of January and not be freezing!)

title: Absolutely Wonderful
text: Incredible and perfect place to stay, made my first visit to NYC wonderful. The staff, who greeted us our first time walking in, were just absolutely incredible, professional, and greeted us our first day with a smile and all the help she could give. The Belleclaire's location was incredibly convenient for us, especially for our first time exploring Manhattan.
