The subway which takes you straight to Times Square is a few minutes walk away, not to mention the amazing Museum of Natural History is only a ten minute walk a couple blocks away. This location has everything to make your stay in New York City a perfect one.

title: My stay at Hotel Belleclaire
text: I always stay at Hotel Belleclaire when I'm in NYC because the staff is excellent, all needs are met almost instantaneously, the rooms are clean and it's in a wonderful location!  Just recently we had to wait an extra few minutes to register and because I that they kindly gave us a card for two mornings of free breakfast!

title: We loved staying at this hotel
text: The hotel is an old very grand building. The staff are very well trained polite and professional and want to ensure that your stay is perfect The location is fantastic as you can walk to delightful eating establishments,public transportation, supermarkets, museums, shops, department stores  and Central Park. The area is very safe at all times of  day. The rooms are large  compared to most NYC hotels, very reasonable,immaculate and comfortable. This hotel is perfect for single people, families and seniors.  The area has something for everyone and the Upper West Side is my favorite part of NYC

title: Great Visit
text: We were a family of nine and we stayed in 3 rooms at the hotel. It is in a pleasant location with a 24 hr CVS across the street and a Marshalls and a DSW within walking distance. There is also the bakery downstairs and a gourmet store and a grocery about a 2 minute walk down the street. There are quite a few restaurants right around the area as well. The museum and central park are just about a 15 min walk away.The rooms were clean and by NY standards the bathroom was great. The shower was wonderful with lots of hot water. The lobby area is great to hang out in as well. For me it is good value for money and the close proximity to central park and the museum made it easier to entertain the kids.

title: Loved it!
text:
We stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire for 10 nights in a family room. The hotel was great, it’s in a very safe area and located near 72nd street station for an express train downtown. There are restaurants near by and an excellent bakery with coffee which is on par with Australian coffee!
The staff were fantastic, nothing was ever a problem, always giving local advice when we needed it.
We had plenty of room for the 5 of us, the only issue was that we had to share one bathroom between the 5 us and it was in our room which meant traffic through our room during the night.
I would 100% stay there again.

title: 27 hours in NYC!
text: i have a favorite room at the Belleclaire and I try to ask for it each time I stay. it's spacious with great work space and enough plugs. it's on the first floor so I don't have to wait for the elevator and right near the gym. i don't look for any other hotels when I book!

title: Vicino all'arrivo della maratona
text: Hotel prenotato del gruppo running che ha organizzato la maratona. La camera era al settimo piano, abbastanza silenziosa, non tanto grande, con 2 letti da una piazza e mezza, molto comodi. Il bagno abbastanza spazioso con doccia grande. Nelle vicinanze, all'angolo, si può fare colazione da maison kayser, veramente ottimo.

title: Ruined my 22nd Birthday!!!!!!!!
text: If I could rate this hotel 0/5 Stars I would! This hotel was the most misleading hotel I’ve ever been to. I booked online for a weekend out for my 22nd birthday. And expected exactly what the room described. IT DID NOT HAVE WHAT WAS LISTED! Our “River View” was another freaking building! ABSOLUTELY NO RIVER!!!!!!!!!! I looked straight into somebodies window. I didn’t even feel comfortable changing because guess what! In the bathroom was another freaking window where people can see into and it doesn’t even lock! Not to mention the description said I would have a bath tub and to my utter most surprise there wasn’t one! TINEST ROOM, NO BATHTUB, NO PRIVACY! Ruined my birthday. When we called to get my car back I had to wait for 20 minutes on hold and then another 30 minutes for my car. We spent 1 hour in the hotel total. When we came downstairs the desk was surprised by our early check out, they asked why and did not even have anything to say. Then gentleman stare at us like we had five heads. Did not even come up with a solution. Biggest waste of my $157. THANKS HOTEL BELLECLAIRE FOR RUINING MY BIRTHDAY!!!!!!!!

title: Large quiet room
text: It's hard to gather a useful impression of a hotel when you stay just one night (and have to leave very early in the morning).  Still, the Belleclaire offered us a large room by NYC standards, with a king bed, good bedding, good pillows, and even though it was across from the elevator, we were not bothered by noise from the hallway.  Or from outside.  The front desk staff was friendly.  The car service they arranged to the airport was professional and on time.  It seems strange that there's nowhere in the hotel to get coffee before the attached bakery opens--an early coffee-seeker must walk a marginal block to a so-so deli.  Still, we'd return.

title: Character, Charm, but 2 star Quality
text:
I compare this hotel to a typical 2 star establishment in Paris. 

We would go back if the price was right (We made last-minute plans around the holiday so the tab of about $330 per night plus $60 per night for valet parking was understandable, but awfully steep for what we got.)

Housekeeping system there, for example, seemed quirky. I hate to slam housekeepers  and the individual staff members in that department were OK, but a 3 hour wait to get room made up AFTER you put up the "Please make up the room" sign and AFTER reminding the front desk twice, seems excessive. It's true that in the early morning, we briefly had a "Do not disturb" sign up and according to one housekeeper, that did divert staff from a quicker response. 

Also, a housekeeper said it is futile to ask housekeepers on the floor to get to the room more promptly, no matter what signage is displayed. You must always ask the front desk to give the order to clean if you are in a hurry to get back. To us, those pyrotechnics speak to the need for a larger housekeeping staff. 

OK...don't want a totally negative message here...experience was actually somewhat positive. The architecture of the hotel is awesome. Designed in 1903 by iconic Emery Roth in Art Nouveau style. Roth went on later to gain even greater fame with his Art Deco and Beaux Arts wonders that also grace the upper west side of Manhattan. 

Front desk people were  knowledgeable and helpful and valet parking staff were terrific and competent.  Nice small view of the street from side window and also view of other parts of the finely designed building. Lobby is large for a "boutique" hotel and it is easy to work at the tables. Guests are gracious and largely European. Lobby is also enhanced by the presence of the wonderful Mille Feuille bakery/cafe. 

This is a mixed use building with permanent hotel tenants and rooms set aside for overnight guests like us. The resident apartments are not huge by New York standards and the overnight rooms are about half the size, so you should understand that you are getting a very small room. The in-room bathroom is especially a joke as you can barely wedge yourself in that narrow space between the toilet and sink. 

The shower is...well iffy... but if you are sufficiently patient, you are likely to get enough hot water. The bed is kind of soft and cushiony which makes maneuvering around in bed difficult and my wife wants me to say that the backboard is unattractive! 

But, here on the upper west side, it is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Wonderful shops, health clubs, restaurants, cafes, bars, gourmet supermarkets, arts and more! I grew up about 5 blocks from here and have re-visited the area periodically, so for me this was not only a location treat, but a kind of trip in a time machine.  

As I said, we would return under the right circumstances and for the right price and will recommend this venue to friends. We don't like to take a negative tone, but the quirks mean we need to be fair and accurate.

title: Great hotel....quiet location
text: Our party stayed here between Christmas and New years. We loved the hotel...highly recommend a parlor suite as some rooms tend to small due to the age of the building. Beautiful architecture. We loved staying on the upper west side. Very close to museums & Central Park. Quick Uber ride or subway to any location. It was nice to go exploring during the day and come back to a quiet area. Great restaurants close by. Try Raku for sushi or the Amsterdam Ale House. The staff at Belleclaire were awesome. I would stay here again definitely.

title: Tanto fumo e poco arrosto
text:
L'ho scelto perché sembrava un hotel old ny, e le recensioni non erano male.
Invece, nonostante la mia scelta sia andata su una camera di livello medio alto, mi sono trovata in una stanza minuscola, lenzuola rotte, bagno che per chiudere la porta bisogna mettersi a cavallo del wc.
Wifi gratuito? Solo per tre giorni. Se la vs vacanza è più lunga diventa $10 al giorno, baipassabile registrando una seconda mail.
Per dormire obbligo di tappi per le orecchie. 
Nota positiva: è pulito

title: SUPER CREEPY Experience- Very Dangerous Hotel
text: This hotel used to be a dive SRO (“Single Room Occupancy”) rental for poor people, mostly drug addicts and prostitutes in the ‘60’s- 1980’s.  It’s been overhauled and labeld as “historic”.  I stayed there in 2018 , in several rooms, and I can tell you I would NEVER return.  The ‘regular’ Queen rooms are VERY expensive, tiny spaces with remodeled, OK bathrooms. I appreciate that these bathrooms have been completely redone, even took a photo.  The windows have bars, like a prison.  If you are clastrophobic, this is not the hotel for you!  The expensive King bed “suites” facing Broadway are much roomier, with multiple windows BUT, the bathrooms are NOT remodeled AT ALL & are even smaller than you can imagine.  You can barely turn around in there...  I mean, you can brush your teeth while seated on the toilet.  Really.  The service at this hotel is FAR below average, and they do have people living semi permanently in the Belleclaire, so then there’s that.  If you are disabled, believe me, don’t stay here!  You would NOT want to ride up in the claustrophobia-elevators, omg, I would really hate to be stuck in them. Plus, you would be forced to be dependent on the seriously unreliable and sketchy staff, so I do not recommend it.  I doubt a wheelchair could even fit safely in the questionable, tiny elevators.  The  security at this hotel is BEYOND AWFUL. While I was sleeping, they gave a second key to a man, who claimed he was “a relative”.  They never even asked for his I.D., NOR phoned my room to ask my permission!!!   He entered my room with the key card that THEY GAVE HIM.  (I could have been killed, good thing I carry).  Serious warning for all single travelers, ESPECIALLY WOMEN:  If you stay at this hotel, bring a door jam-lock and door alarm with you, SERIOUSLY.  DO NOT TRAVEL ALONE, DO NOT STAY HERE.  This hotel is NOT SAFE. You couldnt pay me to stay at this dump! “Historic” - what a joke! It’s just an old, creepy building where many, MAAANY people died of drug overdoses.  As there are THOUSANDS of hotels, hundreds of GOOD hotels in NYC, I recommend not ever staying at The Belleclaire.  I mean, if you value your safety and life.

title: Great Location and Great Character
text:
Stayed here while visiting NYC and was very happy with the location and character of the hotel being one of the oldest around, also said to be haunted but we didn’t see any ghosts!!

Location wise it’s 30 mins walking distance from 5th Avenue across Central Park and around 40 mins to Times Square.

Obviously close to underground stations if you don’t want to walk.

The hotel was clean and the bed comfy although it does need updating in some areas which I believe is ongoing.  The rooms had mini bars and snacks along with basic bathroom amenities.

The lifts were an experience again old and in need of an update but entertaining to ride!!

The staff were very friendly and helpful and there is a bakery joined to the motel itself.

All in all a good hotel for the price.

title: nice neighborhood, decent enough hotel, spotty service
text:
Generally, this is a nice hotel with decent service.  It is located on Broadway at 77th Street, in the heart of the Upper West Side.  Nice neighborhood!

Service at the hotel was decent, although the desk clerk was sometimes very attentive and helpful and, at other times, forgetful or not paying close attention.

The room was comfortable enough, although we had no option to change the temperature.  It was a little warmer than we would have wanted, but nothing too extreme.  The room is NOT well sound-proofed, though, and outside noises were loud inside of the room.

Would-be guests should note that the hotel offers no parking discounts of any kind, and charges a LOT of money for valet parking.  Be careful to weigh this against the costs of resort fees (not charged at this property) and parking rates at other hotels in the area, because the discounted room rates charged by Belleclaire aren't so discounted once that other expense is factored into the equation.

title: A relaxing holiday stay!
text:
We booked the Hotel Belleclaire for 2 nights, because we were going to a show at the Beacon Theatre.
PROS: The staff was super friendly and welcoming. The hotel is well situated on the Upper West Side,  near the theatre, lots of food, and a quick walk to the subway. Our Broadway King room was surprisingly small but comfortable for 2. The bed was comfortable as well. Lots of places to charge your phone.

CONS: The bathroom was kind of small or weirdly shaped, so you had to maneuver around a bit. We were on the 2nd floor, room 206 and the pipes makes the weirdest sound, that can be very disruptive. The weirdest thing for me was the tv. It seemed very outdated, there was no guide, the volume button didn't work, and u could not scroll up or down through the channels, It did have instructions to use your smartphone as a remote, however by the first morning, that feature stopped working because the TV thought my room was not occupied. 

Overall it was a nice hotel, clean, safe and welcoming. I was not wowed but if you are attending a show at the Beacon, I would recommend this hotel.

title: Costruzione un po’ datata
text: Costruzione un po’ datata ,  ma camere confortevoli letto fantastico ,  non manca nulla help disk tutti gentilissimi , prezzo conveniente,  ho preso una camera King devo dire che ho prenotato a settembre per dicembre prezzo  Ottimo , accanto un bar dell albergo per fare colazione ottimo , di fronte il ristorante Serafina con cucina Italiana , di fronte un market aperto 24 ore ... adoro la west Side molto di più della east troppo caotica tornerò

title: Location and comfort!
text: Classic building, super friendly staff, close to subway, comfortable beds, next door to excellent French pastry shop--what more could you ask for in NYC?  Oh yes and the prices are reasonable, especially compared to other hotels of similar quality.

title: Excellent Value Exceeded Expectations
text: I stayed 2 nights here this past week. For the price, the value was amazing. The staff were friendly, professional, and efficient. The room was attractively decorated and had everything I needed. The list action was convenient and safe. This is a great hotel at this price point.

title: I Cannot Wait To Return.
text: Reviewing the Hotel Belleclaire is a joy. I have stayed in this hotel three times now and each time it gets better and better. The staff greet you with genuine warmth. The hotel entrance has been redone and is gorgeous. Next door is a French bakery that serves a lovely continental breakfast in the lobby. By the end of my  five-night stay I knew all the desk managers by name and with fondness. It is a hotel that welcomes you like family and tends to your every need. They make traveling a pleasure and reach out to help however they can to ensure your stay is enjoyable. I was joking with David at the front desk one night that they “need to have a bar” on those cold winter nights for a nightcap after the theater. He brightened and happily informed me they are working on it and by next year there ought to be a bar on the 9th floor. You see…it’s a perfect hotel! I love the staff, I love the location, and I love the hotel. It’s a joy and I’m already looking forward to booking my stay for next December. Hotel Belleclaire makes New York even more special.

title: terrible experience
text: Tiny room to begin with, two people can't walk at the same time next to each other. The bedspring makes noise when you turn around. During the night, the pipes were making loud noises at night that woke me up multiple times. During the day, the rooms next to me were undergoing renovation starting 7am.

title: Rare Gem in NYC
text:
What a pleasure it is to stay somewhere, where it seems like the staff still really care about doing a good job and where it seems like they really enjoy their work. The location is spot on, if you like the chillness of the upper west side. The amazing front desk personnel hooked us up with a spacious room which is a rarity on the city and so appreciated as we had a toddler AND a 5 week old. They accommodated our every family need (with a refrigerator and crib) and made our stay so relaxing, which in the city that never sleeps, makes all the difference. Also, there’s an amazing French breakfast/lunch patisserie spot which is delicious, not the one that’s in the hotel, though that one isn’t bad, but go down the street for some real croissants and the best eggs. 

We will DEFINITELY be making a repeat visit to the BelleClaire in the coming months.

title: agréable sejour
text:
hôtel idéalement situé sur upper west side
pas de portiers contrairement à d'autres hôtels du quartier malgre le standing de l'hôtel
le lobby est accueillant et bien chauffé
notre chambre au 7ème n'échappait pas au bruit de la 77th et broadway  mais avec des boules kies ça allait
la chambre avait une entrée qui permettait de déposer valises et chaussures, un grand lit et un bureau une chaise de bureau et un fauteuil , un frigidaire; donc très confortable
par contre pas de machine à café. avec le jet lag  difficile de trouver un café ouvert à 5H30 A partir de 6h30 on peut trouver du café dans le lobby mais très cher et pas bon
autre bémol la salle de bain est si petite qu'on peut se cogner l'épaule avec le lavabo quand on utilise les wc! et la douche est très difficile à régler
néanmoins nous avons eu un bon deal avec booking (en anglais) et nous avons passé un agréable séjour

title: Delightful find
text: We had a great stay at the Belleclaire and look forward to returning. Everyone on the staff was lovely and well-trained. Bed was super comfortable; we asked for a quiet room and we heard no street noise. There's a nice bakery attached to the hotel for continental breakfast or snacks -- but this is NY so there's someplace good to eat every five feet.

title: Historic hotel in a great location
text: We stayed here for a conference at Columbia University this week. Overall I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Belleclaire. I love old historic buildings so this place was perfect. The rooms are small, as are the elevators, but it’s clean and comfortable especially for a hotel built in 1903. Aside from the traffic noise it was very quiet. The staff were exceptionally helpful and arranged our taxi to the airport. It’s a block from the 1 Metro line which pretty much takes you anywhere in Manhattan. The Museum of Natural History and Central Park are 3 blocks away. I’d definitely stay here again if I’m ever back in New York.

title: Comfortable hotel, good location
text: Mother and daughter travelling together, we needed a twin-bedded room.  The two beds were both Queen size and very comfortable; the room was bright, clean and a good size.  Decent size shower and hot water!  Only complaint was an almost total lack of drawer space, which seems to be the case in so many hotels these days.  Common parts were attractive and well appointed.  Like many NY hotels they do not provide meals, but there is a very nice little coffee shop attached to the hotel and plenty of local restaurants.  The location is good, close to the subway and with a bus stop outside, within walking distance of the Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle.  Staff were helpful and cheerful.  I would definitely recommend this hotel, and will use it if I return to NY.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text:
“I am planning to stay at Hotel Belleclaire every time I come to NYC in the future. It was a fantastic experience!”                                                                                                      

The front desk was incredibly helpful and the staff looked for ways to help us at every turn.

title: Impeccable
text:
Super chambre 
 Bien isolée 
Spacieuse 
Literie de qualité 
Accueil agréable 
Idéalement situé près de la ligne 1,2 où 3
A trois blocs 
Direct pour accéder à l’ensemble des points d’interêt de Manhattan 
Qualité prix très bon

title: great hotel in fantastic location
text: we stayed in family room on 5th floor 1 room with 2 double beds in and 2nd room 1 double bed lovely and clean and enough space for the 4 of us,staff at hotel really helpful with any questions we had,the hotel is on the upper west side of Manhattan with plenty of places to eat and drink on door step as for getting into the hub of nyc subway stations 79th st seconds away and 72nd st only a few mins walk,or if you want to walk times square about half hour walk,central park only 10 mins walk away to,its room only here but in lobby way on a morning is someone from  Mille-Feuille Bakery which is next door selling tea coffee and a selection of pastries,we payed $3.019 for 7 nights overall i cant say enough about hotel and staff highly recommend  this for your nyc holiday

title: Excellent stay, great location, friendly staff!!
text: We had a wonderful stay recently. Henry was very helpful and provided great customer service. The room was clean and well maintained. We will definitely visit again when in nyc. The location was close to all the city sights and transportation stops.

title: Helpful staff will guide you around town
text: In staying in the upper west side of NYC we have always enjoyed this hotel for its location and reasonable rates. But the icing on the cake has been the helpfulness of the staff in providing service and information about the area. In the evening Christopher and Sophia at the reception desk are able to resolve any little quirks regarding accommodations and can share insights about the city. In the daytime Altynia at the reception desk is very helpful as well. The Beacon theater is located nearby if you are interested in the top notch live entertainment always booked there. The subway and bus stops are only a couple short blocks north convenient to catch rides when headed anywhere in the city. As for the hotel room amenities, an umbrella in the room for rainy days and daily newspapers at the desk are nice extras. Enjoy your stay!

title: Perfect location for Macy's Parade
text: Chose this location based upon its proximity to the start of the Macy's Parade (77th and CPW) and it did not disappoint. It's address is on 77th but it's front door is on Broadway.  A subway stop (the Number 1 train) is a short two blocks north.  That train can take you directly to Times Square and to the WTC site.  The staff were all professional and very helpful.  There's an excellent French cafe and patisserie (Mille Feuille) in the building.  For Macys it was within easy walking distance to watch the balloon inflation on Wednesday and the public viewing area was also an easy walk.  It was horribly cold this year, but that's not the hotel's fault.  The rooms are smaller but not uncomfortably so (but that's what you'll find in many NYC hotels that have been around a long time).  The room was comfortable, and had its own radiator for heat.  Being from the South, this was unusual to me, but it made the room quite warm. It's an ideal place to stay for visitors to the Macy's parade.

title: Quarto sem aquecimento, barulhento e não tão limpo.
text: Ficamos 8 dias hospedados no Hotel Belleclaire. Reservamos um quarto com duas camas. O tamanho do quarto é bom e a localização também é boa. Mas logo na chegada encontramos o quarto não tão limpo (observamos já que nosso filho de 8 meses engatinha por toda a parte) e sentimos que nas arrumações diárias o banheiro não era limpo e o chão também não. O quarto não é novo e não tinha aquecimento. Nos deram um aquecedor portátil que ajudou, mas também não fez muita diferença. Na frente do hotel tinham pessoas entregando panfletos dizendo que o hotel tem bed bugs. Preferimos não ler o papel e acreditar que era mentira já que ficariamos 8 noites hospedados ali e não tinham bedbugs no nosso quarto. Os elevadores são minúsculos e além de tudo tinha um que não estava funcionando. Tivemos que fazer 3 viagens para descer com as malas do quarto para o lobby. Uma coisa boa era que todo dia a partir das 1pm-11pm eles serviam de cortesia chá e chocolate quente. O que ajudava a esquentar depois das caminhadas nos ventos gelados do outono de NY. Achamos que o valor do hotel é muito caro para a qualidade dos quartos e do atendimento, não indicamos e nem voltaremos a nos hospedar lá.

title: Convenient location
text: We booked a room with a city view and imagined we would be high up and could see over many buildings. We were given a street view so assumed a non city view could look across a stairwell. The room was comfortable but if you were unlucky you could wait up to about 5 minutes for hot water. We did however find the location convenient as about 5 minutes from the subway and they supplied a very welcome hot drink in the afternoon until late in the evening. Very welcome on cold November nights.

title: Completamente diverso dalle foto !
text:
Nota positiva ? La posizione.
Tutto il resto è veramente pessimo. Le stanze piccolissime  e completamente diverse da quelle  delle foto . Non avevamo
spazio neanche per aprire le valigie.  Ci era stata assegnata  una stanza con una finestra tenuta in piedi dal nastro adesivo da dove entrava aria fredda(fortunatamente cambiata dopo le mie lamentele). Un solo ascensore funzionante ,piccolo anche quello. 
Questo non è sicuramente un quattro stelle! Non mi sarei lamentate se avessi pagato per un due stelle .

title: Okay but not great
text: Stayed here with family for a week and found the staff to be very nice and approachable but the rooms were not great. The tv in the room is very temperamental and has a lot of static; there’s is no TV guide so it’s a guess of what station is what. The room is very loud at night with fire engines going past at around 4am every morning with sirens blasting and then horns going off throughout the night. Although this can not be helped, you can ask for a ‘quiet’ room but in theory every room should be in a way. The breakfast that is offered is just pastry’s and coffee although they are very nice it’s quite expensive for what it is. The location is good, near subway stations and Central Park so that’s a good thing. The bathroom is very small however and the shower leaks, the hairdryer isn’t very powerful and the shower isn’t either. You can either have it boiling hot or freezing cold, no in between. The room itself is small, they have a mini bar with very expensive prices and it does look like it could do with a redecorate. We only had one tiny bin in the bathroom so we had to try and fit all our rubbish in that. The hotel looks nice, the gym is really nice. Overall it is a nice hotel but I think you can get better for your money.

title: Good value
text: Hotel Belleclaire is a solid option in a great location and is good value for what you pay.  That said, don't expect a five star experience.  The hotel's upper west side location is close to subways and all the amenities that the UWS has to offer.  It was also less expensive than many comparable hotels we searched in the area.  Rooms were what you would expect for a NYC hotel: big enough to hold a queen-sized bed, desk, closet, and decent sized bathroom.  Enough space for what you need.  The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful.  The shower was very nice and had good water pressure.  It is an older building and has some quirks you would expect in an older building: mostly strange noises.  The radiator and the bathroom pipes made strange noises throughout the night that were somewhat disruptive.  The hotel room was clean in the important areas (bathroom, linens) but there was a lack of attention to detail in some spots.  For example, I'm not sure the base of the lamp had been dusted recently nor had the corner of the nightstand.  Overall though, its a solid option and I would recommend it for the value.

title: Niente a che vedere con le foto che vedete sul sito!
text:
Carina la hall, buona la posizione, pessima la stanza! Piccola, buia (ed era un piano alto!), con la finestra chiusa col nastro adesivo, il condizionatore ( in teoria spento ) che la notte faceva rumore all' improvviso, pessimo arredamento....!
In più mi hanno ritirato soldi dalla carta di credito senza avvisarmi e dopo 10 giorni ancora non li hanno rimessi, nonostante ci abbiano assicurati che non li avrebbero trattenuti perché non c erano spese....
Non ci tornerei!

title: Great place to stay in the upper west side.
text:
The Hotel Belleclaire is a mix of vintage and modern features. It’s in a great location as it’s away from the hustle bustle of downtown and in walking distance to Central Park and many coffee shops and restaurants. It still can be noisy at night as there is a fire station nearby but we kind of expected it being in NYC. We were on the 7th floor and it was still really noisy. 

Staff at the front desk and housekeeping are really nice and accommodating. We was always greeted by housekeeping walking the halls. 

One of the elevators was out our entire stay and the once’s in operation were pretty teeny and took a while to get us down the the lobby given they couldn’t hold many people. 

Overall I would recommend this hotel if you’re looking for somewhere to stay in the Upper West Side.

title: A great bargain, but ask for a quiet room
text:
This hotel continues to be one of my favorites.  It has a great location, and nice rooms of a reasonable size, with quirky charm.  Very clean and nicely maintained.

However, the lower-level rooms that face on Broadway are very, very noisy, especially since the hotel has old single-glazed windows with no sound insulating properties (plus the leakage of sound around the window air conditioner makes the situation worse. I am in a second-floor room right now, facing on Broadway, and the noise is intolerable.  I will ask if they can change my room, but somebody is going to get stuck with these noisy rooms when the hotel is full, so buyer beware.

title: Good stay!
text:
Quality service, Great location and my room had a very comfortable bed!

Many nice food shops are nearby and the legendary Beacon Theatre is just a short walk away.

Metro stations close to help you get around the city.

title: Not Planned But Wonderful
text: The Belleclaire has a very nice lobby and check-in area. There is plenty of seating and welcoming. The room was super clean, the bedding comfortable. My original reservation was not for the Belleclaire. After finishing a conference at Columbia University, I wanted to stay one extra night in NYC. The hotel my group had put us up in was booked, so I booked the only thing I could find nearby. Upon arriving I was worried about what the room would be like. Needless to say, it was awful. I checked out and googled "hotel with availability near me" and the Belleclaire came up. It was 10pm on a Friday night. I just wish I had found you before my horrific experience at the other place. Henry and Rebekah at the front desk were great.

title: Ok centralt medelklasshotell
text:
Ok men inte mer. Fräscht och fint badrum.
Små rum, vi hade tydligen bokat en Queen-size bedd, två kompisar. Lite väl tight. Fick be om var sitt täcke. Ganska mycket ljud i rummet från fläktar och annat. 
Bra läge nära central park och nära tunnelbanan. 
Vid receptionen kunde man köpa kaffe och croissant på morgonen, jätte gott kaffe!

title: A wonderful choice on the Upper West Side
text: I was looking for a hotel on the upper west side for a 10 day stay to visit doctors in Manhattan. So glad I decided to go with Hotel Belleclaire. Their staff went out of their way to make some early arrangements for me which was the reason for my decision to stay with them over another nearby hotel. The staff (front and back of house) were professional, friendly and efficient at responding to a few small requests. The room was small but comfortable and clean. Can't beat the great location with shops, grocery stores (evenTrader Joe's), drug stores, cleaners, cafes, bakeries, cinemas and banks as well as the Beacon Theater, Zabar's, Fairway, the Museum of Natural History, Riverside Park and Central Park just a block or two away. The location is perfect to walk just about anywhere or go a block or two to many bus lines and 2 major subway lines.

title: Clean Modern European-Type Hotel on Upper West Side
text: Booked for three nights. Pleasant surprise. Very clean, modern hotel. Rooms, though small, were clean, renovated, hard-wood floors, modern furniture, bright windows. Bathroom, though small too, had modern  Very much like good hotel rooms in good small European hotels.  Lobby was upgraded and large, not really that splendid nor with much furniture, but lots or room, with many European NYC Marathon runners hanging around. We once lived on Upper West Side, but foreigners should be aware that neighbourhood is not that bustling, compared to midtown or lower Manhattan with their crowds, many shops or restaurants, and it is a 30 minute walk to midtown.  But subway is outside hotel, and restaurants and bars can be found on Amsterdam Street, a block away and a Century 21 store is only ten blocks away.   All in all, we would good back there.

title: Not so wonderful
text: Booked for five days. No hot water in shower - so five days of lukewarm or cold showers. 1 of 2 elevators in front worked. Room and halls dirty. Entrance surrounded by picketing workers. Some nice employees struggling with owners who care about real estate play - not about customer or real hotel business.these folks could not survive a month in Zurich.

title: Terrible Hotel
text: Bed sheets weren’t changed after we asked, they were just put back onto the bed after being dirty. Bugs everywhere, kept getting bit. Towels weren’t changed. One of the worst experiences I’ve had with a hotel.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: From the moment I arrived for my 6 night stay at Hotel Belleclaire I noticed the upgraded lobby since my last visit I  felt cared for by the staff. Maria checked me in making sure my needs were met. The first night my room was very hot.( they are in the process of upgrading the air system)  Henry was very helpful moving me to another room. Upon checking out Jelena kindly assisted me in getting a room reduction due to transferring to a smaller room.  The General manager Robert was fantastic in checking up on me after my stay.  This is a first rate boutique hotel! I am definitely coming back!

title: AMAZING
text:
YES YES YES! You have to stay here! It was incredible! My mom and sisters and I stayed here for our first ever New York trip and it exceeded all expectations.Hotel Belleclaire's, staff, location, and room accommodations really was the cherry on top of the trip.
The room was great and the housekeeping staff was always on top of things. Shout out to Helen!! From the moment we got there, we felt so welcomed. Bryan at the front desk was so kind.And, Y'ALL! The management, Mr. Holmes, the GM, and Ms. Shanies in Guest Relations alone would make us all come back! The area was quiet and a nice, quick escape from the city. It was and super convenient to a subway stop, plus there is a CVS across the street for light groceries and forgotten items! Without a doubt, the hotel we will stay in again!!! THANKS!

title: Em casa em NY!
text:
A localização deste hotel para mim é fantástica!
Longe da confusão dos turistas, mas pertinho do metro linha vermelha que corta toda a Nova York.
Os quartos tem tamanhos bastante variados. Esta foi a minha quarta vez neste hotel e já fiquei em quartos grandes e bem pequenos. 
Alguns quartos também podem ser bem barulhentos, mas isso é NY!

title: Excellent
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights and it was brilliant, the staff were very friendly throughout the hotel and the location was excellent. Be prepared for a £50.00 charge on credit card which is refunded. 
The rooms, although a bit on the small side, had everything we needed for our stay. Nearby were several cafe’s and shops/pharmacies (Cafe 82 was particularly nice and well priced). 
A few streets away is Central Park and The Natural History Museum. 
Subway is close by also, the hotel is between 79th Street and 72nd Street stops and is well priced with $3.00 a ticket. 
The hotel itself is very quirky and the rooms are all different sizes and shapes.
Would definitely stay again.

title: NYC 2018
text: Had a fantastic stay. Rooms a bit small but really well kept. The staff really help make this place. Friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. Highly recommended and would definitely go back. Great deli' s near by, subway very handy. Central park and natural history museum 10 minute walk

title: Very Nice!
text: We enjoyed our stay here very much. Front desk staff was friendly and quick. The room was quite large in comparison to most N.Y. hotels. Clean. Possibly haunted, the hallways are a little bit crooked and creepy (the building is 100+ years old), but still a really good choice. I would definitely stay here again. Price was right and a short walk to the Beacon Theater.

title: Our Home away from Home
text: We travel to NYC a couple times a year to see my specialist as there are none for my condition in Michigan. We always stay at the Belle Claire. It's in a great neighborhood, away from the chaos. You get to experience what it feels like to live in NYC! The hotel is always welcoming and lovely and perfect location for what we need to do while in NYC. I want to comment about our most recent visit which was 10/.24-10/27. I had messaged the hotel about recommending something special for this trip because I wanted to surprise my wife because she has been amazing during my illness and because when we go to NYC, we aren't there for the Broadway shows or shopping or sightseeing. We spend the whole time at Dr. appointments and I am usually too sick or tired to do much else. On this trip, we had arranged for early check in because our flight was arriving early in the morning. Not only did Shanies go above and beyond for this trip the kindness and empathy that Rebekah provided (my wife was also very ill when we arrived) made our hearts happy that the Belle Claire team actually cares about it's guests. We can not thank the Belle Claire enough for the caring, kindness, the upgrade and for always making what is a difficult trip less stressful and taxing. As long as we have to continue travelling to NYC for my condition, we will always stay at the Belle Claire and recommend it to others. Thank you Rebekah, Shanies and the entire team at the Belle Claire. Kristina and Angie.

title: New York City -Manhattan
text: I stay in Manhattan annually and rent a room. This year my room was not available for a few days, so I stayed at the BelleClaire on the Upper West Side. It was a great boutique hotel in one of my favorite parts of the City. The service was great and the room very comfortable. The BelleClaire has become number 1 on my list of favorite hotels in New York City.  Thanks BelleClaire!

title: Great location, nice size rooms
text: Great hotel located in busy hub on the upper west side. Many restaurants, cafes and great places for brunch near by. The valet parking is really appreciated. Rooms are a nice size compared to others I have stayed at in NYC. It was clean and nice size fluffy towels. The staff we interacted with were all very pleasant and helpful.Highly recommend the this hotel.

title: Basic and Needs Updating
text:
Pros:
-location is great - lots of nearby shops, restaurants; close to subway
-caring and helpful staff
-outside looks beautiful and historic
-good and roomy shower; nice bath products
-room had a refrigerator

Cons:
-really showing it's age and needs $ put into it to get updated
-elevator is tiny and one of the three elevators was broken my entire stay of 4 days
-dirty socks were left on the radiator in my room upon arrival (was taken care of promptly when I let them know)
-was awoken at 6am the first morning to a loud clanking heater (again taken care of promptly when I let them know but greatly disrupted my sleep)
-tiny room; so small that when in bed you can see the bright hallway light through the crack in the door while you are trying to sleep
-closet had a mildewy smell 
-no dresser
-bedding and design of the room were all very dated; need to be updated

Would not stay here again as the price is not worth it to me for the many cons.

title: WOW!
text:
My daughters and I just got back home after a fabulous 4 day trip in NYC. In a word, Hotel Belleclaire's, staff, location, and room accommodations, just WOWED us and made our time in NYC just PERFECT!
The room was clean and the housekeeping staff attentive (Good job Helen!)! The front desk staff was kind and accommodating--Bryan was great at check in and Maria was patient and thorough each time I called! And the management, Mr. Holmes, the GM, and Ms. Shanies in Guest Relations made our stay over the top! The area was quiet comparatively and super convenient to a subway stop, plus there is a Big chain pharmacy across the street for light groceries and forgotten items! Definitely stay here--we'll be back, most assuredly :)

title: Dobrá lokalita, hlučný ze silnice
text:
Hotel je dobře umístěmý v dobré lokalitě. Dobře přistupný metrem. Náš pokoj byl poměrně malý, odpovídal spíše tří hvězdičkovému hotelu. Vše čisté, ale starší - okna, dveře. Koupelna ok. 
Okna pokoje byla do ulice. Bylo slyšet poměrně hodně hluku z ulice.

title: A real gem!
text:
We had booked two nights at the Hotel Belleclaire because of its location, reasonable price, and the very good reviews we’d seen. We were pleased to discover that everything lived up to or surpassed our expectations.

From the friendly greetings from Rebekah and Maria, to the well-appointed, surprisingly spacious room with its terrific shower, and the helpfulness of Shanies at checkout, we couldn’t have been more pleased. We would gladly stay here again.

title: Good but there are things to improve
text:
We stayed at this hotel for two weeks.

Good :
A great location for those who like to be outside the crowdedness and noise.
Ten minutes from the Hudson River on the one hand and ten minutes from Central Park on the other.
Friendly neighborhood with lots of cafes and restaurants.
Easy access to all parts of the city and convenient public transport.
For me, location is the most important thing in choosing a hotel.

The hotel staff is very courteous and helpful.

Bad :

Elevators are old and spoil a lot.
From time to time we had to use the stairs.

Room cleanliness needs improvement.

A weak Internet that requires reconnecting from time to time.

title: Birthday weekend!
text: We came to atend two nights of the tedeschi trucks residency at the beacon theater and the location of the Belleclaire could not be better! It is right down the street on the opposite side and you can even see the beacon marquee from the street outside the hotel. We loved staying on the Upper West Side and our concierge suggested a place to eat (we were felling something Asian).  It is called Sala Thai. It was a great recommendation! Delicious food. The staff was very accommodating and they even gave me QUITE the birthday surprise when I left! I couldn't have been happier to spend my 30th birthday staying here. Highly recommended. Clean and quaint!

title: Bright and beautiful lobby, Comfortable Stay, Small Room, No Dresser
text: This was our first stay at Hotel Belleclaire.  The floor layout was interesting - a lot of turns and branching off hallways.  The room was had was kind of small, and the way it faced seemed to not let in much natural light.  The room and bathrooms were clean, and the bed was comfortable.  There was no dresser or anywhere to unpack our underwear or clothes that we didn't want to hang up.  We used our suitcases as a dresser.  We will likely stay here again in the future, just realizing there's not a lot of space in the room and we won't unpack fully.

title: Plenty of opportunity to Exercise
text:
The property has three small elevators. One was out the entire time of our three day stay. Another was out Friday morning - it was restored to service by Friday evening when we retunred to the hotel.
The good news it was far quicker to take the steps up and down than to wait for an  elevator.

title: A fine hotel in the Upper West Side
text: The HOTEL BELLECLAIRE in UWS in NYC is a great value.  The staff is very welcoming and helpful, led by the front desk manager, Jelena Dunn.  The beds and pillows are divine (always a litmus test of mine).  Rooms are clean and pretty spacious compared to many NYC hotels. Their lobby is newly redone - a wonderful place for coffee is accessible next to their lobby. It's a great 'find.'

title: Spacious room in the Upper Westside
text: Hotel Belleclaire was the perfect spot for our recent trip to NYC. The hotel is in a lovely neighborhood, two blocks from Central Park to the east and two blocks from Riverside Park to the west. It is two blocks from the number 1 red line that goes the length of Manhattan on the west side and was really convenient for getting to the 9/22 Memorial in the south and The Cloisters in the north. We were a walk to through the park to the MET. The staff was very nice. Our first room, a standard, was small and dark. I asked for a larger room and was given one down the hall. It was absolutely lovely, very quiet, was plenty of light and totally redone. Breakfast can be taken in the lobby or in the adjacent french cafe. Zabars is down the street for great take-out which can be eaten in the spacious dining/rest area of the lobby. I highly recommend this hotel and will certainly stay there again on our next trip to NYC.

title: Intermittent AC, dangerously slippery tub
text: Loved the location but pass on this hotel. The room was clean but the AC kept shutting off. No response from front desk to repair. Paid for a street view which meant we heard the fire engine house run out on call, sirens blaring all night. I actually checked to see if the window was open it was so loud. The tub was extremely slippery with no grab bar or mat. The surly and indifferent front desk team didn’t even bother to shrug when I mentioned at check out.

title: An Upper West Side Classic
text:
I stayed at the Belleclaire for three nights.
It’s a classic Manhattan building. The rooms are small but well appointed. The staff are friendly and helpful. The gym is as good as some of the ones I’ve used at the bigger names and the business/media centre has 3 computers, a printer and telephones. 
It’s a great location. The neighbourhood is great. Perfect for exploring the Upper West Side highlights. Close to Central Park, the MOMA, Guggenheim, the Natural History museum. the 79th Street Metro, on the red line, is very close. 
There is also a great patisserie next door.

title: Lovely home away from home on the Upper West Side
text:
We took a chance on the Belleclaire for a 2 night stay in Manhattan and were delighted to have stayed here. The hotel is a jewel- beautiful and quietly elegant. Our room was spacious and comfortable. We had a window that looked out on the roof of the skylight, but still, it was a window! No noise from the street (or other guests). 
It is an older hotel and one elevator is out of service. From reading other reviews it seems this is an ongoing problem. For us it didn’t matter.
The location is perfect. Front desk very helpful and unfailingly polite. I was impressed with how one of the front desk clerks kept calm while a demanding guest complained endlessly about not getting the exact room she wanted. Embarrassing to watch her. The hotel was fully booked as the staff person kept explaining, but some people deserve the Oscar for rudeness and self absorption. 
Thanks to the hotel staff for making our visit so easy. We will be back!

title: Vecchio e indecoroso
text:
Sono attualmente al Belleclaire, camera piccolissima con uno sgabuzzetto per tre vestiti e un mobile con 3 cassetti e il cano per il frigorifero ( senza il frigorifero) ad uso cassetto ( molto sporco e molto rovinato). 
Assortimento vario di snacks a pagamento e neppure un bollitore per farsi un te o un caffè. Neppure a pagamento😳 ma che america è questa?!?
Ascensore sporco e minuscolo per 2 persone e 1 valigia. 
Atrio sconvolgente nel suo squallore.
Peccato perché è pure caro!!!

title: Definitely not worth the price!
text: Hotel is not very clean in the lobby or stairwells and one of the elevators out of service the 2 days I was there.  Rooms VERY SMALL--I asked for another room which they gave me but it was only SLIGHTLY better.  And they couldn't give me a room with a bathtub which I wanted.  It is a very average hotel with an above average price.  And you hear all the other guests going in and out of their rooms which is loud and not pleasant in the morning.  I had a view of the air shaft--very unattractive.  Air conditioner looked very old.

title: Tolle Lage in schönem alten Gebäude
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist super. Man ist schnell mit der Metro Mid- und Downtown, fußläufig zum Central Park und American Museum of Natural History und es ist sehr viel ruhiger als Midtown. Verbesserungswürdig: man kann kein Fenster im Zimmer öffnen (816, Familiensuite mit zwei Schlafzimmern), hat etwas zu wenig Stauraum und eine Möglichkeit, sich morgens selbst einen Kaffee oder Tee zu machen, wäre schön.
Personal sehr nett und hilfsbereit. Mille feuille Café direkt nebenan macht fantastischen Kaffee. Gute Restaurants fußläufig. (Jing Fong, Amsterdam Av. !!!!!)

title: our Manhattan stay
text: Very helpful & courteous staff!! Love the character of this old but renovated hotel. clean but basic room. Close to the subway to get anywhere pretty quick. If ever in Manhattan again will definitely stay at Hotel Belleclaire again!

title: Great location & perfectly acceptable, if a little tired and jaded - but 5* prices for a 3.5* experience
text:
Stayed here the weekend of Thursday September 20 to Sunday September 23 inclusive as part of a surprise trip to NYC with my wife and two teenaged children (boy and girl) for my wife's significant birthday. It was our first visit to the city.

I wanted to be out of the immediate chaos of downtown but in a hotel conveniently located to be able to get everywhere reasonably easily. To be completely up front, there were other hotels in the city I would have preferred but for budget reasons I wanted a family room rather than two separate rooms - and they are in remarkably short supply here.

So, after weeks of searching and for that reason alone, the Belleclaire swung it. The $1,632 (£1,250) cost was a little eyewatering - putting it within striking distance of a very upmarket hotel in the UK - but I learned NY is busy in September and I also knew it's one of, if not the, most expensive cities in the USA. And at £100 a night per person, I convinced myself it wasn't a bad deal. And maybe it wasn't.

The good things:

CUSTOMER SERVICE: The staff are amazingly helpful and friendly, and to be honest and in my experience that mitigates an awful lot of the not-so-good things in life. This is its absolute saving grace and a credit to the management - because not all about the Belleclaire is faultless by any stretch ...

LOCATION: Two blocks from the park, a comfortable 20 minute stroll from Lincoln Center and the start of the fun, there's little to complain about here.

COMFORT: The beds were among the most comfortable I've ever experienced in a hotel

CLEANLINESS: Contrary to some reviews of the hotel that I'd seen on Tripadvisor, the rooms were clean and presentable.

In the end, the hotel was there for us to sleep in and nothing more. It doesn't have dining in the traditional sense, but we didn't need or want that, so it wasn't a consideration and that doesn't factor into this review at all for that reason (though obviously if you're looking to dine in your hotel, this isn't the place for you). There is a small cafe, run independently of the hotel but accessible through a connecting entrance, where you can grab coffee and pastries and it looked rather good, though we opted to breakfast at the Manhattan Diner on 95th and, for our last two mornings, directly across the road at Serafina.

So in short, it met most of our requirements.

The not so good things:

BUILDING WORK: The biggest issue for us was that there is building work going on at the building adjacent to the hotel (on the other side of W77th). Raw materials, including scaffolding, were delivered to the site in the early hours of both Friday and Saturday mornings (around 1.30am), with the noise of lorries and the clatter of steel extremely loud. On Friday morning, work began on the site just before 8am - and okay, it was a weekday and maybe that's to be expected. This was work that had clearly been in progress for quite some time, not something that had started within the previous week or so.

For all sorts of reasons, I looked at the hotel website several times prior to travelling and nowhere was there a warning (at least that was obvious - I haven't checked since we returned) of building work in progress within the immediate environment of the hotel. That's a mistake, in my view, because it makes me feel like it was deliberately hidden from me.

SOUNDPROOFING: The noise in itself wouldn't have been too much of an issue if the sound insulation at the hotel had been effective, but because the building is old, the double glazing is secondary - and rather flimsy at that. In fact, the noise was so intrusive that both my wife and I, unknown to the other, got up during the night to check that one of us hadn't left a window open. Apart from the building work, NY really is a city that never sleeps and so there was noise (mainly fire truck sirens) on and off all night. 

That's to be expected, of course - but at £400 ($525) a night, I'd have expected more obvious investment in measures that offered the chance of a decent night's sleep.

BATHROOM - given this was servicing four people, the bathroom was very small (as in tiny) and very outdated. Again, if I'd been paying 3* prices, not an issue - at 4-5* prices, it created a sense of genuine disappointment. Gravity fed shower, combo faucet ...

WEARY DECOR - the hotel management/owners have obviously gone to some effort to create a contemporary feel. But wooden floors magnify sound issues and the finishing is jaded and tired. I can only speak for the room we were in, but as examples, the (faux?) leather material on the headboard in the double room area was worn and scuffed (God alone knows why - it was quite a way above the head height of a prone adult!), the bathroom door was cheap and the finish at the bottom of it was chipped and scuffed (with obvious signs of having been repainted but, sadly, not filled), the door from the hallway to the suite itself was old-fashioned, with very dated door furniture, there were too few power points (especially near the dfressing table and mirrors).

ELEVATORS

For a building of this size and capacity, the elevators were tiny (not more than 6 to a ride and on several occasions, I saw guests resorting to sending their luggage down on its own whilst they took the stairs. The situation wasn't helped by the fact one elevator was out of order, which extended wait times (and exacerbated frustration when the car eventually did stop at your floor, only to open reveal a full car or one crammed with luggage).

Finally, MINIBAR. In this day and age and for the love of God, why provide a minibar? My 16-year-old son helped himself to a bottle of mineral water (before I'd managed to have the 'don't touch the stuff in the minibar!' chat with him and his sister. The charge? 10 dollars. That's just greedy and obscene - particularly given the room rate - as is the commercial motivation for all hotel minibars. The prices may be high, but the message it sends out is really cheap.

In the end, this is all about price and expectation. Would I stay there again? Yes, probably - assuming there was no ongoing building work and I had a room that didn't overlook the front of the hotel - because it's a perfectly comfortable experience in many ways and the hotel manager has obviously gone to a lot of lengths to make good customer service a priority ... as I say, that forgives a lot.

Ifmy bill had been, say, $250/$300 a night, I'd be sitting here talking about what wonderful vaue for money it was. But it isn't $300 a night, and so it isn't wonderful value for money. It's a perfectly decent but expensive 3.5* hotel - the customer service alone is why I rated it 4 rather than 3.

title: The hotel is charming but the rooms are really small even for europeam stamdards
text:
Stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. Let's start with the GOOD: 1) hotel staff is really friendly. Always ready to help out. 2) Location really convenient. It's in Broadway and just 5 minutes walk from a metro station. Around the hotel, in walking distance there are several eating places, for breakfast and lunch/dinner. Recommend "Zabars" (West 80th street), it's a supermarket but they have also a cafe' where you can eat breakfast (from pastries/danishes to cereals, fruits, etc.). Not famcy, no frills, lots of locals go there and therefore it's very cheap for Manhattan standards. Their coffee is good, and this is coming from an Italian used to drink at least 3 espresso coffees a day.
Now let's look at the "Less GOOD": the hotel is basically a very old building, and it has the limitation that comes with it. In order to fit as many rooms as possible (sure they are within requirements in terms of minimum floor space) it turns out that the rooms, at least the one I had, are really small. I had a double queen room (3 occupants) and with 3 suitcases (traveling from Europe) we had difficulties in moving around. Also the airco is system is quite dated. It works but it's noisy and by today's standards it looks like something that should be in a museum. I would recommend this hotel to parties of 2 maximum and suggest them to take the double bed rooms, at least they can use the extra bed to put the luggage on it.

title: NYC babysitting
text: Room clean and fairly large by nyc standards.   Elevator rather tiny and only one operating.  Hotel staff efficient and knowledgeable.   Hotel location in upper west side convenient to subway.   Stores and restaurants nearby

title: vacances
text: hôtel bien situé sur New York avec accès de métro à proximité, par contre la première chambre que nous avons eu la chambre 111 elle est à éviter, à notre arrivée dans cette chambre il y avait un déshumidificateur qui tournait et effectivement quand nous l'avons coupé à notre arrivée car très bruyant les draps étaient humide, il y avait une fuite dans la salle de bain, la fenêtre était condamnée, les rideau cassés et zéro vue sur l'extérieur vraiment l'impression d'être dans une cave!! Après s'être plaint de cette situation l'hôtel nous a proposé une autre chambre qui était bien mieux avec fenêtre sans fuite et sèche plutôt spacieuse pour 3 personnes.Il n'y a pas de restaurant à l'hôtel, mais il y a des restaurant ainsi que de très bonne boulangerie à proximité de l'hôtel. L'hôtel vous propose des taxi pour l'aéroport JFK à 52 dollars ce qui est totalement faux nous avons payé 81 dollars avec les TIPS.

title: ロケーション的に便利
text:
2度目の宿泊です。3年前に一人旅で利用。
今回もメトロポリタンオペラのために、歩いて行けるホテルという名目で利用したのですが、周辺環境の良さが思いのほか重宝します。スーパーやレストランにも困らず、夜もブロードウェイ沿いのため比較的安全だと思います。ホテル代の高いニューヨークにしては、バランスのとれた価格と利便性といったところでしょうか。決して五つ星のホテルとは違いますが、寝るだけであれば利便性がカバーしてくれます。オススメです。

title: A Real Find Among NY Hotels
text: I almost hesitate writing e a glowing report for fear that this hotel will become too popular and over run!  I traveled alone, and so the "standard double"  was adequate but would have been too tight for a couple, in my opinion.  I find that to be true for most moderately priced NY hotels. When  I found fault with my corner room, the staff were gracious and moved me to a larger version in that category.  The room was well-appointed with a modern bath, all amenities and comforts. Lovely, quiet neighborhood. The location was ideal for me since I was most interested in visiting museums along 5th Avenue and going to the theatre in the evening.  The crosstown bus at 79th was just 2 blocks away; the downtown bus just a block away. It's a neighborhood of patisseries, the best one on the hotel's ground floor where you can have a very French breakfast or lunch.  Highly recommended.

title: Warm staff, great place
text: I must emphasize overall great approach by the staff as we were contacted in advance via e-mail whether we have any special requests or needs and we could be provided assistance with transport to and from the hotel. Based on our communication, we got upgraded and we also got a little present in the room. The room was well equipped also with an iron and an iron board, the bed was comfortable and overall it was a pleasant stay. The location of the hotel is great as there are many places around for shopping (DSW, Century21, Fairway) and food (Zabar's, again Fairway Cafe and Mille-feuille) and Central Park is just three blocks away.

title: Bello
text: L'hotel è a 5 minuti a piedi da Central Park e si trova in una delle zone più pulite della città.Qualche minuto e sei anche a Riverside Park dove la natura la fa da padrone,parchi per i più piccoli e scoiattoli dappertutto.A 100 metri sono presenti 2 supermercati per ogni necessità e le fermate della metropolitana dove puoi raggiungere ogni angolo della città.

title: This was an Unexpected Surprise
text:
The location on the upper West Side was just right for me. 3 Blocks from Central Park, 3 Blocks from Riverside, 2 blocks from the subway which took me directly to Columbus Circle or later, to Penn Station for a connection to the airport. Starbucks was near, a diversity of restaurants, bakeries, delis, and shops. It was the right place.
The hotel itself was clean and quiet. The front desk people were helpful and warm. The room was small, but not as small as a few I have been in. It had been updated and was very nice. The bathroom was clean and bright. The closet was small and fine. 
The air conditioner worked fine, and not too loud, which was appreciated. 

The only hiccups were one of the 2 elevators not working and the issues i had logging in to the wi-fi portal. 

I would stay here again, easily.

title: hotel belleclaire
text: room had a nice size and everything I needed including slippers. nice sized fridge, snacks and was right by the elevator. hotel now has main avenue entrance which makes it easier to find your uber. would stay again for sure!

title: Very average
text:
The hotel is in need of some TLC. Only 1 out of 2 tiny lifts (we could only just fit the 4 of us in) were working when we stayed. We were on the 9th floor to try to avoid some of the noise from the streets below....     ...there was a fire station just across Broadway! 
On the plus side; the staff were very friendly and amenable, the room was clean and the water pressure (for the shower) was good. 
We paid just over $600 for 2 nights, for a family room, which just didn’t feel like value for money.

title: Great Upper West Side Location, Reasonable Price
text: This somewhat faded but likable hotel is in a great location with easy access to buses and subways.  Our room, designated a deluxe queen, was small but adequate.  It did not seem deluxe.  Overall it was quiet except for the air conditioner and clean with plenty of hot water for showering.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Small annoyances such as one elevator being out of service for four days were weighed against a comparatively reasonable price.

title: Perfect!
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights with my 3 daughters (late teens, early 20s) in July.  It was exactly what we were hoping for.  The room was clean with a beautiful marble & glass shower.  The beds were comfortable and the air-conditioning worked very well.

The hotel has been renovated since I was here over 15 years ago.  It was a totally different experience this time...and for the better!

The hotel lobby is spacious, bright and inviting.  The staff is friendly and helpful.

I used the 'media lounge' to search and print driving directions for free.

The hotel is close to subways, restaurants and there was a Trader Joe's a couple of blocks away to grab food for the mini fridge.  

Enjoyed our stay very much!

title: Tired and unengaging
text:
We initially booked a family room via the website which was so small it barely fit the two beds, with no room for luggage so we were compelled to upgrade to a junior suite just to be comfortable. There was no cupboard/drawer space. Our WC had serious plumbing issues and flooded the bathroom and bedroom. Even after the engineer visit we had to remove the cistern lid and manually adjust the flapper to stop the toilet constantly running. We had to call down for a stopper for the bath, despite tipping we were left without toilet paper and had to use tissues, the basin taps were on the wrong way and dripped constantly, the caulk around the sink and bath looked like it had been reapplied weekly with a spade,
the mixer tap in the bathroom slipped and didn’t hold temperature, there’s no coffee making facilities, one of the lifts was constantly out of order, the desk staff were disengaged... I could go on but I’m sure you get the picture. I know this is nyc... but I would have expected more!

title: Great place to stay!
text: The hotel is in a great area. There are several lovely restaurants quite nearby at a variety of price ranges. The subway stops are just two blocks "up" or a few more "down" Broadway. This was my first trip to NYC, and the area felt safe. The room was very quiet and clean with a comfortable bed. I would definitely return. As a bonus, Hotel Belle Claire has car service to the airport for a fee that was less than I was quoted for Uber.

title: アッパーウェスト地区で交通の便が良い
text: セントラルパークの西側で地下鉄レッドラインからもすぐなので交通の便が良いです。やや古さは感じましたが、NYCの典型例な中クラスホテルだと思います。フロントの対応も問題なしでした。ただ部屋のコンセントがベッド近くに無く、壁側なので、寝ながらスマホを充電して使うには、ベッドの端に行かないければいけませんでした。延長ケーブルを持っていれば問題なしです。部屋は冷蔵庫あり、アメニティー類も一通りありました。wifiも問題なかったです。スーパー、レストラン、ファストフード、ドラックストアなど一通りあります。ディスカウントストアのMarshallsもありました。

title: Just what I needed!
text: The staff are outstanding, kind, helpful and engaging, especially Maria and Hector!  The rooms are clean and well - organized. The location is close to the American history museum, soul cycle, shake shack, central park, Columbia U, what more do you need?

title: Godkänt och prisvärt
text: Rummet hade allt vi behövde, sköna sängar, kylskåp (halvfull minibar), TV och fräscht badrum. Det går att köpa frukost på hotellet,men bord och sittplatser är i foajén, så vi valde att äta frukost ute istället. Hotellets läge är ganska bra på en lugnare gata och nära tunnelbanan.
